jobTitle: Outreach Specialist (Lead Generation) Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50622785.txt	§Outreach Specialist (Lead Generation)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Outreach Specialist (Lead Generation)§§Advertiser: §Orangetheory Fitness Mosman§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §North Shore & Northern Beaches§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§ §Be a part of Orangetheory's Top Performing Studio Internationally!§ §Fun, Energetic & Motivating Culture!§ §Consistent hours, growth opportunities & on the job training!§ § § §Orangetheory is a global leader in the fitness industry, and with over 1,000 studios across 18 different countries, we set the bar in innovation, tech & delivering results that last. §Our Mosman studio is the top performing studio internationally§ and we are looking to expand our team with career opportunities as we continue to grow!§ § § §About the job:§ §You’ll drive community events with our sponsors, engage with locals in the Mosman area & paint the town Orange! We work weekends so you can look forward to a Saturday/Sunday morning spent in the local Mosman area – including Balmoral Beach (it doesn’t get much better than that!). You will learn the ins and outs of the workout and become an expert on all things Orangetheory.§ § § §About you:§ §You have big energy and a big personality that you love to let shine! Your natural ability to connect with people and strike up conversation makes you perfect for building relationships, generating leads, and growing a community. You love being out and about and are driven by reaching targets and feeling that satisfaction you get from helping somebody take the first step to start their fitness journey! You are prepared to learn, open to feedback and ready to show off your enthusiasm for health & fitness.§ § § §What’s in it for you:§ § §Join a team of industry leaders – We are the Top Performing Studio Internationally!!§ §A culture built around opportunity, growth & community§ §Access to train with us for free and enjoy the Worlds #1 Workout anytime you want§ §Paid training and regular personal and professional development§ §Growth opportunities to take you all the way to the top!§ § § §Opportunities like this don’t come around often. Don’t miss your chance to join our high performing team and start your career in the fitness industry now!§ § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50694383.txt	§Triathlon Coach / Club Membership Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Triathlon Coach / Club Membership Manager§§Advertiser: §Onebody§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §North West & Hills District§§Salary§§$50,000 base plus performance bonuses§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§ §About us§ §Onebody is Australia's leading triathlon and cycle training and coaching centre. We are looking for a passionate triathlon coach / membership manager to join our team. The role needs someone who is passionate about providing our memberships with a great experience and can work closely with all members of a team. The goal of the role is to improve and increase membership acquisition and maintain membership retention through quality sessions and positive experiences. § § § §Qualifications & experience§ §Ability to work with both Adults and Junior athletes of all abilities§Ability to work independantly towards building the membership base through promotional activities§Ability to act as a leader and set a positive culture amongst the members§Ability to work flexible hours that (primarily) includes evening and weekend work §Experience in Triathlon and Cycling§Experience preparing and implementing group sessions and planning training structures for a squad environment§Desireable - Cert III or IV in Fitness§Desireable - Triathlon Australia coaching accreditation (or willing to obtain)§Ability to obtain Working with Children Check§ § § §Tasks & responsibilities§ §Coaching & leading training sessions including Swim / Bike / Run Sessions§Coaching junior athletes§You will be the main point of contact for all members to ensure their membership and experience with us is outstanding at all times§Driving the entire sales process with our staff, coaches and our digital marketing manager to manage lead generation and conversion to memberships§Performing administrative duties, maintaining accurate customer information on membership database, and using all technology and systems to its full extent.§Running promotional clinics and events to increase memberships and provide membership value§Work closely with all coaches and staff to assist with membership acquisition and retention§Managing the session timetable to ensure our members recieve an outstanding experience every time§ § § §Benefits§ §Flexible working hours for people that love to train and race§Full access to our training centre§Large discounts off all retail (including bikes)§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have customer service experience?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§How many years' experience do you have in the sports & fitness industry?§§§

Located only 4kms from the Perth CBD, the City borders the stunning Swan River on its Northern and Western boundaries, and boasts excellent access to important social, commercial and leisure infrastructure.§        §The successful candidate will be responsible for developing the organisational capacity of local sporting clubs and community groups to assist them to deliver quality programs, services and activities to the community as well as support local sporting clubs and community groups to address their organisational issues to ensure they manage risks appropriately; understand their social responsibilities; and become sustainable so that the clubs are in a position to provide a high level of service provision.§        §To be successful in this position you need to demonstrate;§        §          §Relevant tertiary qualifications in Recreation, Business Administration or related field; or equivalent working experience§          §Experience working on projects and obtaining grant funding§          §Substantial experience in a similar role§          §Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of issues relating to the recreation/community industry Clubs or similar§          §Demonstrated ability to manage project budgets§          §Demonstrated ability to participate effectively as a team member, and work autonomously§          §Persuasive written and verbal communication skills§          §Well-developed consultation, negotiation and facilitation skills§          §Well-developed problem solving and time management skills§          §Intermediate computer skills, and associated software§          §Current "C" Class WA Driver's License§        §        §This permanent full time position is a level 5 which attracts a salary range of $72,314 - $83,239 gross per annum plus superannuation. As part of your online application form you will be prompted to complete relevant personal information and respond to online application questions. jobText: TXT/50705019.txt	§Talent Pool - Fitness Leaders§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Talent Pool - Fitness Leaders§§Advertiser: §City of Gold Coast§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Gold Coast§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Talent Pool - Fitness Leaders §      §If you are passionate, enjoy a challenge and want to work for one of the fastest developing cities in Australia, if excellent working conditions are something you find attractive then we have an opportunity for you.§      § We are working hard to build a vibrant city, maintain our enviable Gold Coast lifestyle and ensure our city will be thriving, sustainable and attractive into the future.§      § The lifestyle opportunities, weather, career development and growth are some reasons why working for City of Gold Coast may be the best decision you've made.§      §We're making our mark on South-East Queensland... come and make your mark with us.§      §Reference No:  29561 §      §Salary Range:  $25.41 to $25.41 §      §        §§        §The Gold Coast is an outstanding global city proudly looking towards its future. We are inspired by lifestyle and driven by opportunity.§        §Here at City of Gold Coast, our commitment to a shared set of values shapes our decisions, actions and behaviours towards achieving the City Vision and our many city priorities.§        §          §We aim high –§ we are passionate about delivering the best for our city§          §We add value –§ we are innovative and make the most of every opportunity§          §We work as a team –§ our people are great individually, but unstoppable together§          §We take responsibility –§ we are committed to working safely, being trustworthy and owning our actions§        §        §About the Position§        §We are looking for high performing and well experienced Fitness Leaders to join our team at our Aquatics Centres across the City of Gold Coast to provide an excellent level of service to all aquatic centre patrons.§        §We have casual and fixed term positions available. You may be required to work up to 38 hours per week, and will be expected to have maximum availability, allowing you to be rostered across our venue's operating hours, which are from 4:45am to 8.00pm, 7 days a week. §        §These roles are responsible for:§        §          §Supervision of the fitness centre, ensuring that members conduct themselves in accordance with conditions of entry;§          §Providing an exceptional level of service to all members and patrons;§          §Ensuring that safety of all patrons is prioritised;§          §Providing members with assessments of fitness, personalised programs and inductions;§          §Conducting group fitness classes as required. Classes include appropriate warm up, class structure and cool down to specific group fitness classes;§          §Performing operational procedures including opening and closing of fitness centre, set up for classes and reporting of maintenance concerns;§          §Participating in relevant training activities, and maintaining fitness levels and knowledge as appropriate for the position;§          §Actively promoting and adhering to our City values;§          §Adhering to all City policies and procedures;§          §Undertaking other duties as required, relevant to the position;§          §Ensuring the gym floor is monitored regularly and equipment is clean and maintained.§        §        §About You§        §You are highly motivated with a demonstrated fitness industry background, preferably within a fitness centre environment. You §must have a minimum 2 years group fitness§ §and personal training experience§.§        §You have proven experience in face to face customer service, with a high level of interpersonal and communication skills. You have the ability to work productively in a team environment, and can plan and organise yourself and others to ensure the timely completion of tasks. You are proactive and take initiative when working autonomously.§        §You have experience in taking a wide variety of group fitness classes and confidently adapt the class structure to suit a wide range of abilities when required. You are trained and able to conduct classes ranging from barbell and HIIT right through to Pilates and Yoga (plus much, much more).§        §Your qualifications in specialised areas of training or group fitness will be highly regarded, as well as your experience in program development.§        §You're flexible with work hours, and understand that weekend work, early mornings and late evenings, are all part of the service we provide to the community.§        §What We Offer§        §Working for the City of Gold Coast is both challenging and rewarding. jobText: TXT/50688527.txt	§Physical Training Instructor (Female Opportunity)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Physical Training Instructor (Female Opportunity)§§Advertiser: §Defence Force Recruiting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Gold Coast§§Salary§§$65,000 - $69,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Physical Training Instructor (Female Opportunity) §      §        §Your role: §        §We’re on the lookout for people who are at the peak of their physical fitness—those who want to have a positive influence on Air Force personnel to ensure they are  physically and mentally prepared at all times  in the defence of our country. PTIs are the Air Force's specialists when it comes to exploiting the full human potential of its workforce. If you have a degree qualification, industry experience and a passion for developing higher level human performance, then the Physical Training Instructor role might be for you.§        §Being a PTI is one of the more physically demanding and rewarding roles of the military—ideal for those who are already involved in high performance strength and  conditioning training, elite sports, or high level human performance coaching.§        §An Air Force PTI is more than just a job, it’s a vocation and a way of life. Some typical tasks you can expect as part of your PTI duties include:§        §•           Rehabilitation and injury prevention programs§        §•           High-performance physical strength, conditioning and fitness assessments§        §•           Physical wellness, mental wellness and resilience education§        §•           Development and delivery of physical training, recreational and sporting activities§        §•           Adventurous training (abseiling, climbing etc) activities§        §•           Delivery of non-lethal use of force training (unarmed combat)§        § §        §Life in the Air Force: §        §There’s no career that compares to one in the Air Force. Become a part of a world-class military force that operates some of the most advanced aircraft and defence technology in the world. You can expect to work in a uniquely challenging yet highly rewarding working environment that comes with good work/life balance, competitive salary and skills for life. There’s also a sense of accomplishment and pride from serving your country and helping to keep our airspace safe.§        §Life in the Air Force is anything but mundane. You’ll enjoy an exciting lifestyle, rewarding career, opportunities to travel, excellent social and fitness facilities, and free medical and dental; all in a dynamic and fulfilling working environment.§        § §        §Salary: §        §Get paid while you contextualise and further develop your current knowledge, skills and experiences in becoming a fully qualified Physical Training Instructor. Upon completion of a workplace training and assessment journal, you’ll enjoy a competitive starting salary package of: $68,626 plus generous super (salaries correct as of 01/08/2019).§        § §        §Apply Now: §        §For this role, you must be over 17 at time of enlistment, an Australian Citizen and have passed Year 10 English and Maths You must also have completed a Bachelor’s Degree in Health Science (Fitness or Exercise), Sport Science/Coaching (Strength and Conditioning) or similar. Refer to the link below for more information on accepted degrees. You will also need two years relevant industry experience within the last five years.§        §Click the APPLY button if you think you have what it takes to become an Air Force Physical Training Instructor and we’ll get in contact with you shortly.§        §You can also visit the link below to view the full position description and learn more about life in the Air Force.§        §https://www.defencejobs.gov.au/jobs/air-force/physical-training-instructor§        § §        §The Australian Defence Force is an equal opportunity employer. This advertisement is to ensure women are aware of the rewarding and fulfilling careers available in the Navy, Army and Air Force. jobText: TXT/50695312.txt	§Sports Coach§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Sports Coach§§Advertiser: §kelly sports§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Salary§§$20 - $29.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§Kelly Sports purpose and passion is to give children of every ability a lifelong love of sport.§ §We do this through offering a wide range of physical and sporting skills programs to children wherever they are, in kinders, at schools, in sporting clubs, sports days, at fetes and events, before during and after school in term time and the holidays.  We want to be wherever children can play, providing a fun, safe environment for developing life skills in team play, sportsmanship and the rewards of enjoying physical activity.  Our professional programs provide fun sports activities for 4 to 15 year old's teaching children the specific skills, rules and games for different sports.§ §Kelly Sports is a ChildSafe organisation and the largest provider of Sports Programs and Clinics for primary school aged children in Australia. Kelly Sports goal is to enhance each child’s physical education and well-being by providing expert coaching over a wide range of sports.§ §Kelly Sports is currently looking for enthusiastic, active and committed §basketball, cricket, softball, tennis and volleyball coaches.§ §Applicants must be outgoing, friendly and sports minded people who are passionate about working with children and capable of coaching groups with an emphasis on control and skill development. The roles involve casual hours rewarded with good remuneration. Training sessions will be after school with games played on week days after school or on Saturday mornings. The role will commence from Term 4.§ §Kelly Sports promotes the safety, well-being and inclusion of all children through rigorous reference and background checking and our staff are responsible for promoting the safety and well-being of children and young people by adhering to our child safe policy, codes of conduct and other policies.§ §Requirements include:§ §•  Child Related Employment Screening Clearance  - DCSI or Working with Children Check - DHS ( mandatory)§ §•   Child Safe Environments Training – Responding to Neglect & Abuse -RAN (mandatory)§ §•   First Aid § §•  Experience working with primary and or secondary aged children§ §•   Must be able to demonstrate an understanding of appropriate behaviours when engaging with children§ §•  Community Coach and/or coaching accreditation (desirable)§ §•             Be punctual and reliable§ §•             Your own car§ §•             Good communication skills§ §•             Flexible working hours§ §Applications can be sent to Michael Adams Kelly Sports Adelaide Metro Coaches Co-ordinator   PO BOX 91 Brighton SA 5048§ §Mobile §0425301666§        § §Emai§l §michaeladams@kellysports.com.au§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§Do you own or have regular access to a car?§§§

jobText: TXT/50695221.txt	§Health & Wellness Senior Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health & Wellness Senior Coordinator§§Advertiser: §YMCA Victoria§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §Northern Suburbs§§Salary§§S/S Grade 6: $32.41 per hour + super§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Health & Wellness Senior Coordinator §      §      §      §        §At the Y, we believe in the power of inspired young people. A community not-for-profit organisation with 17 million participations annually across Australia. 8,000 staff and volunteers serve at more than 150 locations every day. We partner with government and private capital to deliver programs and services that include community recreation, adventure and stadium sports, camping, learn to swim, children's programs, early learning, youth services, retirement living, disability services and social enterprises.§        §About Active Moreland§        §The YMCA has been engaged by Moreland City Council to work together to deliver the vision of an Active Moreland for the entire Moreland community.§        §The YMCA's work in partnership with Council extends to all corners of Moreland however is based at the six Aquatic and Leisure Facilities in Brunswick City Baths, Coburg Leisure Centre, Coburg Outdoor Pool, Fawkner Leisure Centre, Pascoe Vale Outdoor Pool and Oak Park Aquatic Centre.§        §The main goal within Moreland is to create more opportunities for more people to be more active, more often, especially those who are least likely to participate in healthy and active lifestyles.§        §Key Elements of the Role§        §The H&W Senior Coordinator will ensure all members are gaining maximum benefit and enjoyment from the services provided whilst delivering the highest possible level member experience. The H&W Senior Coordinator will possess strong communications skills, will continue to strive for implementing innovative unique programs, systems and technology into the health club and be responsible for achieving department targets.§        §The H&W Senior Coordinator is responsible for driving the H&W strategic direction across the Active Moreland contract; and the following business areas at 1-2 Moreland facilities:§        §          §Health Club§          §Personal Training & Small Group Training§          §Group Fitness§          §Other internal and external programming§        §        §Selection Criteria§        §          §Demonstrates YMCA Victoria values, Honesty, Caring, Respect and Responsibility§          §Accepts personal accountability for workplace actions and consequences to better influence§          §Accepts and applies instruction and direction from supervisors§          §People Leadership§          §Health Club Operations§          §Health Club Presentation§          §Programs (Personal Training & Group Fitness)§          §Demonstrated track record in managing and leading teams§          §Experience in a variety of health and wellness program§          §Demonstrated track record in implementation and continuous improvement of Health and Wellness program§          §Innovation of new programs and community engagement§          §Strong administration and computer skills including Microsoft Office, GreeneDesk and Links systems§          §Demonstrated understanding of membership processes that achieves targets§          §Model's, demonstrates and teaches positive values like caring, honesty, respect, and responsibility§          §Recognises and acts on the need for support and will accept and delegate responsibility when required§          §Creates a welcoming atmosphere by engaging all people in a friendly and approachable manner§        §        §Qualifications§        §YMCA, including Boards of Directors, is committed to the safety and wellbeing of children and young people in accordance with our Safeguarding Children and Young People framework. YMCA requires that all applicants undergo satisfactory screening prior to commencement, including but not limited to:§        §          §a national criminal history check§          §an international criminal history check where applicants have worked overseas§          §holding or obtaining a Working with Children Clearance/ equivalent in accordance with state/ territory laws§          §ACF Safeguarding Children and Young People Certificate (completion online prior to commencement)§          §Two reference checks.§        §        §Any successfully appointed applicant will be required to adhere to the Safeguarding Children and Young People framework, which includes a thorough safeguarding children and young people induction and committing to upholding the safety and wellbeing of children and young people throughout their engagement with YMCA.§        §§      §      §Please apply with your resume and cover letter.§Applications close - 25 October 2020§Cameron Giles§0405365949§cameron.giles@ymca.org.au§ §    §    §  §§§At the Y, we believe in the power of inspired young people. A community not-for-profit organisation with 17 million participations annually across Australia. 8,000 staff and volunteers serve at more than 150 locations every day. We partner with government and private capital to deliver programs and services that include community recreation, adventure and stadium sports, camping, learn to swim, children's programs, early learning, youth services, retirement living, disability services and social enterprises.§  §About Active Moreland§  §The YMCA has been engaged by Moreland City Council to work together to deliver the vision of an Active Moreland for the entire Moreland community.§  §The YMCA's work in partnership with Council extends to all corners of Moreland however is based at the six Aquatic and Leisure Facilities in Brunswick City Baths, Coburg Leisure Centre, Coburg Outdoor Pool, Fawkner Leisure Centre, Pascoe Vale Outdoor Pool and Oak Park Aquatic Centre.§  §The main goal within Moreland is to create more opportunities for more people to be more active, more often, especially those who are least likely to participate in healthy and active lifestyles.§  §Key Elements of the Role§  §The H&W Senior Coordinator will ensure all members are gaining maximum benefit and enjoyment from the services provided whilst delivering the highest possible level member experience. The H&W Senior Coordinator will possess strong communications skills, will continue to strive for implementing innovative unique programs, systems and technology into the health club and be responsible for achieving department targets.§  §The H&W Senior Coordinator is responsible for driving the H&W strategic direction across the Active Moreland contract; and the following business areas at 1-2 Moreland facilities:§ § §Health Club§ §Personal Training & Small Group Training§ §Group Fitness§ §Other internal and external programming§ §Selection Criteria§ § §Demonstrates YMCA Victoria values, Honesty, Caring, Respect and Responsibility§ §Accepts personal accountability for workplace actions and consequences to better influence§ §Accepts and applies instruction and direction from supervisors§ §People Leadership§ §Health Club Operations§ §Health Club Presentation§ §Programs (Personal Training & Group Fitness)§ §Demonstrated track record in managing and leading teams§ §Experience in a variety of health and wellness program§ §Demonstrated track record in implementation and continuous improvement of Health and Wellness program§ §Innovation of new programs and community engagement§ §Strong administration and computer skills including Microsoft Office, GreeneDesk and Links systems§ §Demonstrated understanding of membership processes that achieves targets§ §Model's, demonstrates and teaches positive values like caring, honesty, respect, and responsibility§ §Recognises and acts on the need for support and will accept and delegate responsibility when required§ §Creates a welcoming atmosphere by engaging all people in a friendly and approachable manner§ §Qualifications§  §YMCA, including Boards of Directors, is committed to the safety and wellbeing of children and young people in accordance with our Safeguarding Children and Young People framework. YMCA requires that all applicants undergo satisfactory screening prior to commencement, including but not limited to:§ § §a national criminal history check§ §an international criminal history check where applicants have worked overseas§ §holding or obtaining a Working with Children Clearance/ equivalent in accordance with state/ territory laws§ §ACF Safeguarding Children and Young People Certificate (completion online prior to commencement)§ §Two reference checks.§ §Any successfully appointed applicant will be required to adhere to the Safeguarding Children and Young People framework, which includes a thorough safeguarding children and young people induction and committing to upholding the safety and wellbeing of children and young people throughout their engagement with YMCA.§§§§§

You could be our next Aquatics Program Officer! §      §        §The Opportunity§        §Maitland City Council's aquatic centres play an integral role in the LGA’s leisure and recreation service offering with over 185,000 visits to Council's centres each year. jobText: TXT/50681661.txt	§Teacher - Melbourne United Sport & Business Program§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Teacher - Melbourne United Sport & Business Program§§Advertiser: §SEDA§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Teacher - Melbourne United Sport & Business Program §      §        §SEDA Group (SEDA) is an applied learning education provider. We are a leader in our industry with a respected reputation for successfully developing a model of Senior Secondary School and Vocational Education and Training both inside and outside the classroom. We are a national organisation with a hands-on learning environment that is unrivalled by any other education provider. Together with our peak industry partnerships, we provide unique opportunities and experiences that focus on individual learning which enables our students to become confident young adults. We change people’s lives through individual learning to develop real skills and prepare students for a successful future.§        §The strength and success of SEDA Group is built on our people and their passion for education. Administrator§  §Elanora Country Club is an exclusive club in Sydney’s Northern Beaches.  We pride ourselves on providing exceptional member experiences in all areas of our business.  The club has a number of sports including Golf, Tennis, Croquet and Lawn Bowls.     §  §The position of Sports Administrator is an opportunity to join the team at one of Sydney’s most exclusive clubs, with fantastic opportunities for career progression and personal development.  This position is 3-4 days a week administration, retail shifts could be added to make the role full time for the right candidate. The Golf Shop is the primary contact point for members and guests and the successful applicant will possess an excellent customer service attitude and personal approach to ensure an outstanding experience.§  §Reporting to Sports & Operations Manager, responsibilities include:§ § §Assist Sports & Operations Manager and Sport Sub-Committees with the management and coordination of sporting events and general administration duties.§ §Responsible for administration of timesheets, draws, handicaps, results, prize allocation, and communication to members and relevant staff regarding all sporting events.§ §Responsible for updating trophy winners, conditions of play & honour boards for all sports.§ §Responsible for assisting the Sports & Operations Manager with the annual review of the Club’s Programme Book.§ §Responsible for coordinating major sport events and ensuring that all aspects of the event, including competition management are successfully executed and be available to oversee these events on the day.§ §Responsible for the Men’s Interclub team and all Ladies Grade and Pennants team events and liaising with team captains.§ §Create, review and update Sport Administration procedures, Sporting Guidelines, Sports Manuals and Conditions of Play for all sports to ensure that the ‘knowledge management’ of Sport at the Club is captured accordingly.§ §Responsible for reviewing and updating sport-related sections of the website regularly to ensure they remain up-to-date and relevant.§ §Attend weekly Operations Meetings to facilitate effective communication and promotion of events.§ §Liaise with external bodies such as Golf NSW, GOLF Link, Golf Australia, MiClub, JNJGF and other Clubs.§ §Assist with other duties & projects as directed by the General Manager, Sports & Operations Manager, and other department Managers as required (including phone bookings and sport operations).§ §Attend monthly Associates Committee meetings and be responsible for minutes and agendas. Attend other Sub-Committee meetings as required (i.e. Bowls, Bridge, Tennis, Croquet).§ §Drive coordination of weekly Work in Progress (WIP) meetings with Sports & Operations Manager, including reporting and follow up.§ §Responsible for operating within the set budgets of the Sport Department.§ §Responsible for providing a high level of service for Members, guests and visitors.§ §Ensure adherence to all Club policies and procedures.§ §Responsible for ensuring that members and guests adhere to dress code, mobile phone usage and guest sign-in policies.§ §Ensure that a standard of excellence is maintained in the quality and presentation of sport events.§ §Carry out all duties in a manner that promotes and encourages an environment of health and safety in all aspects of work.§ § §  §The successful candidate will have the following skills:§ § §Ability to identify and assess potential and existing problems, and to provide appropriate solutions and outcomes.§ §Very high Competency in computer, word processing skills & excel spreadsheets, knowledge of golf related systems would be an advantage.§ §Achieving and maintaining the highest standard of work performance in order to set an example for the Club’s staff.§ §Ensuring the confidence of Club Members by setting and maintaining high service standards and displaying individual professionalism.  Must be approachable and receptive.§ §Adaptable and flexible to meet and deal with changes then provide a responsive service for the needs of Members and guests.§ §Prepared to quickly learn and develop new skills.§ §Performing all functions and responsibilities with professionalism and integrity.§ §Communicating operational information in a timely manner.§ §Display a calm, productive, solution focussed approach in a fast paced environment, identifying and effectively resolving any member concerns or staff enquiries.§ § §  §An attractive Salary Package and working hours will be negotiated with the successful applicant. With a strong focus on career progression.§  §Commencement date will be negotiated with the successful candidate.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§§§

jobText: TXT/50702534.txt	§Activities Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Activities Officer§§Advertiser: §Fortem Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§West Gippsland & Latrobe Valley§§Salary§§$70,000 - $74,999 plus super pro rata per annum§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§Do you want to be part of an exciting not-for-profit committed to making a difference in the community?§ §As an evidence-based community support organisation, Fortem Australia (Fortem) provides Australia’s emergency service and national security families (working as employees or volunteers) with comprehensive and integrated wellbeing support. In short, our mission is to improve and protect the health and wellbeing of the people who keep our communities safe.§ §Who we are and what we believe§ §Collective impact§ – We empower our employees to deliver services that achieve measurable and positive outcomes for those we support, while ensuring collective advocacy and collaboration towards our mission.§ §Courage§ – Our can-do mindset, resiliency, and emphasis on simple but effective methods, encourages and enables us to be focused on our delivery of impactful change.§ §Forward leaning§ – Our open-mindedness to different ideas, best practice solutions, and drive to hire the best people, ensures we can be adaptable yet united towards our purpose to provide the best outcomes for each other and for those we support.§ §A role that makes a difference in people’s lives§ §A §fixed term, part time§ role (22.8 hours per week/3 days per week) with a contract end date of 30 June 2021 with the potential for extension.§ §In this role, you will support the success of Fortem through the coordination, design, and delivery of evidence-based social connection activities and wellness support programs to Australia’s emergency service and national security families. This includes engaging with Fortem Australia stakeholders and being the subject matter expert and point of contact for the relevant geographical area regarding the local community, and service providers.§ §What you will be doing:§ § §Participate in regular meetings with internal stakeholders to ensure all our activities are planned, coordinated, and delivered in a timely and professional manner. This includes ensuring all the desired outcomes are met.§ §Understand agency and participant needs, current programs, and strategic direction through liaising with the Community Engagement Coordinator(s) (CEC’s), Care Coordinators and Psychologists.§ §Assist with the design, implementation, and monitoring of social connection activities and wellness support programs in the relevant geographic area.§ §Contribute to the design, implementation, and monitoring of the activities strategy and framework. This includes ensuring the strategy and framework is designed to build protective factors around mental health and overall wellness.§ §Ensure consistent delivery of activities within the relevant geographic area, whilst ensuring all outcomes are delivered and measured.§ §Travel interstate as required to support Fortem initiatives (plenty of notice will be provided regarding travel requirements)§ §What the role requires:§ § §Significant experience in the delivery of community engagement and/or wellness services, and/or the areas of relevant research or preventative wellness programs.§ §Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate with individuals and groups from a variety of backgrounds§ §Excellent organisational skills such as attention to detail, administration skills, and ability to work independently and as part of a team§ §Ability to travel with own vehicle as required§ §Intermediate or above level of competency with Microsoft Office programs§ §Holistic knowledge of the national security and first responder sector and other related stakeholders§ §Ability to work after hours and weekends as required§ §Current working with vulnerable people card/working with children check§ §What can we offer you?§ § §Supportive and challenging work environment in an exciting community support organisation§ §Opportunity to work in a diverse role with considerable autonomy§ §Flexible working arrangements§ §Generous salary packaging benefits§ §Additional annual leave which includes birthday leave and Christmas shutdown period§ §Are you ready to make a difference?§ §To apply to this exciting opportunity, please select “§Apply for this job§.” Applications must include a §resume§ and a §cover letter§ which outlines your suitability for the role.§ §Applications close Friday 30 October 2020 at 4pm AEST§ §If you have any questions, please email our recruitment team: careers@fortemaustralia.org.au§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§Do you own or have regular access to a car?§§§

We offer our clients a range of services giving them everything that they need to keep them on track with their health and fitness. We also offer Remedial Massage in house so it gives our clients the full experience here at Taps Fitness. Our goal to help clients enjoy their daily lives with the help of keeping them fit and healthy. § § § §About the role§ § § §We are looking for motivated Personal Trainers who want to make changes in people's lives. We offer all our Trainers the support and personal development so that they feel confident in building their PT business. § §We offer various options for our trainers so that you can either build your business with no added pressure of rent upfront. Right now we are looking for more trainers as we have an overflow of clients so we would with the right candidate, this is a great opportunity to kick start your business with existing clients. § §Our Trainers also have the opportunity to work in our Group Training facility to earn extra revenue whilst building your business. § §Our module to help our Trainers to start in the industry on the right foot. § § § §Please email your resume to : §Admin@tapsfitness.com§ § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §Build your business in the Brisbane CBD§Start your business with an existing client base. §Start earning straight away with our Group Classes§Ongoing support and Personal Development. § § § §Skills and experience§ § § §Have a positive and great attitude.§Work well with people and get along with them. §Understand basic programming for clients. § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Which of the following First Aid accreditations do you currently hold?§Have you completed a qualification in fitness?§Do you have an Australian Business Number (ABN)?§How many years' experience do you have as a personal trainer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50623269.txt	§Assistant Club Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Assistant Club Manager§§Advertiser: §Fairbairn Golf Club§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§Assistant Manager - Fairbairn Golf Club§Fairbairn Golf Club is situated on the Fairbairn precinct, located at the north-east corner of the Canberra International Airport. It is a full, well maintained 18-hole par 70 course. As a Golf Club, we aim to create a friendly and relaxing environment for our members, guest and visitors.   §About the role:§Fairbairn Golf Club seeks the employment of an Assistant Club Manager who has experience in sports management and hospitality and thrives on achieving quality customer service.  This role provides an excellent opportunity for someone to be intimately involved in further developing and growing our business.§The Assistant Manager will assist the Club Manager to ensure that members are happy and satisfied with the quality of service they are receiving with respect to clubhouse and golf events. §Key Responsibilities:§Supporting the Club Manager implementing the directions set by the Board/Club Sub‐ Committees and prompt implementation of the club’s policies and decisions.§Assisting with the implementing and management of a new Fairbairn Golf Club Website.§Assist with managing, including development and optimisation, of the golf administration processes and procedures including:§general clubhouse management activities§golf events and tournaments held at the club§prizes and awards §club booking system§communications with members§Managing and maintaining all bar stock as well as maintain a clean, tidy and functional storeroom.§Managing the bar staff roster as well as ensuring bar staff act in accordance with the directions specified by the Club Manager.§Supporting the Club Manager reporting in accordance with Club Board requirements on matters affecting it, whether or not specifically requested.§Acting as the Club Manager from time to time in their absence.§Skills and Experience - Selection Criteria§Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to liaise with members and visitors so they have a positive experience while enjoying our club's facilities.§Demonstrated ability to be able to work independently and within a team environment.§Proven strong interpersonal skills.§Possess good time management and organization skills.§Demonstrated effective written and verbal communication skills.§Relative experience in the use of ICT, preferably in a golf management setting.§Experience in Business / Hospitality / Sports Development or Management, including Financial Management.§Compensation and Benefits:§A competitive salary package will be negotiated with the successful applicant.§Applicants must be a permanent Australian resident.§Job Type:§ Permanent Part-time (up to 24 hours per week)§Contact:§  Mick Hoare §0407 084823§Applications addressing the criterion should be succinct and no more than two (2) pages.  Applications must also include a brief (2 Page) CV.§Applications to be submitted via email to §manager@fairbairngolfclub.com.au§ on or before 5pm Monday 12 October 2020.§§§§

jobTitle: Basketball Development Coordinator Job in Perth - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50627904.txt	§Basketball Development Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Basketball Development Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Wanneroo Basketball Association§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §Northern Suburbs & Joondalup§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§To assist the Association’s Basketball Operations Coordinator in the delivery of basketball programs and activities from a participation basis, with a view to growing participation rates and delivering accessible basketball development programs both internally and across the northern coastal community. Lead the on-court development of the associations Aussie Hoops and Sporting Schools programs and deliver coaching and player introduction courses in the Association’s northern-most operational priority areas.§ §Key Responsibilities:§ §Take directions from the CEO as applicable.§ §Promote participation and growth in all WBA competitions, programs and activities such as:§ §Player Development§ § §Assist with WABL try outs, training curriculum, session plans and game day feedback§ §Deliver the ‘Wolfpack Way’ philosophy and curriculum in all on court sessions as required§ §Assist with the delivery of the ‘Wolfpack Futures’ program and ‘WABL Skills Sessions’§ §Coach Education & Development§ § §Assist the BOC in coach development activities§ §Undertake coach mentoring, with a focus on the club’s Domestic Coaches§ §Develop domestic level coaching manuals and philosophies: § §Provide practical coach curriculum and learning tools, with a digital focus§ §Provide accessible and practical coaching resources, to assist and educate club coaches§ § § §Participation & Community Development Settings§ § §Deliver the on-court components of the Aussie Hoops program and manage casual coaches as required§ §Further grow and improve the club’s junior competitions; focusing upon fundamental skill development§ §Wolves School Holiday Camps:§ § §Deliver a series of School Holiday Camps that cater for various levels of player development and that grow the Association’s position as a destination for inclusive, innovative basketball experiences§ §School Development Sessions:§ § §Deliver a series of Workshops/Clinics at schools within the northern region that cater for various levels of player development;§ §Development Programs§ § §Deliver all WBA player development programs: § §Domestic Development (DDP)§ §Hoops Academy§ §Female Fundamentals§ §WABL Camps & Clinics§ §Futures Program§ § § §In addition to the duties specified above, the Employer is entitled to request the Employee to perform such other duties as are within the Employee’s skill, competence or training and are reasonably requested in order to meet the requirements of the company.§ §This is initially a part time role with a view to the position becoming full time based on growth and delivery targets being met and to cater to the increased requirements of the business.§ §Essential Requirements:§ § §Level 1 Coaching Accreditation§ §Working with children check§ §Drivers Licence§ §Basketball Coaching or Playing Experience§ §Desirable Criteria:§ § §Relevant Tertiary Qualification§ §Sports Management / Business Degree§ §Level 2 Coaching Accreditation§ §First Aid Certificate§ §Human Movement/Exercise/Sports Science Degree§ §Physical Education Degree§ §Certificate III in Sport Coaching§ § § §Applications close 5pm on Friday October 9.§ §Applicants are required to submit a current CV along with a cover letter which directly addresses the 'Essential Experience & Qualifications' for the role as outlined above. §§Applications that do not address the criteria will unfortunately not be considered. § §If you have a passion for Basketball and possess a desire to work within a supportive, fast-paced and high-performing environment, this role is designed for you.§ §Due to the nature of the sport, weekend and out of hours’ work is a principal requirement and expectation of the role.§ §* Due to the potential for a conflict of interest, to be considered for this role successful candidates must not hold a position with any other basketball entity.§ §Wanneroo Basketball Association may seek to progress to interview following receipt of application - prospective applicants are encouraged to apply promptly.§Please send applications including cover letter and resume directly to §recruitment@wolves.asn.au§§§§

There is also the opportunity to undertake personal training in addition to base hours and for the right staff member, the chance to take classes on our group fitness timetable casually or an ongoing basis, or create new program opportunities for members.§        §Responsibilities§        §          §Undertaking fitness assessments and encouraging members to meet set goals throughout their membership;§          §Be able to produce great gym programs to ensure members have the freshness, motivation and direction to keep them hitting their goals;§          §Delivering inductions, sale tours and the occasional sign up of new members;§          §Undertaking follow up calls with members, checking how they are tracking and providing ideas to help members with their workouts and goals;§          §Providing gym floor supervision, demonstrating proper exercise instruction and coaching, correcting technique and motivating during a training session;§          §Undertaking small group training programs and personal training;§          §Taking pride in gym cleaning and minor maintenance tasks to ensure the gym presentation is tidy and hygienic; There is also the opportunity to undertake personal training in addition to base hours and for the right staff member, the chance to take classes on our group fitness timetable casually or an ongoing basis, or create new program opportunities for members.§ §Responsibilities§ § §Undertaking fitness assessments and encouraging members to meet set goals throughout their membership;§ §Be able to produce great gym programs to ensure members have the freshness, motivation and direction to keep them hitting their goals;§ §Delivering inductions, sale tours and the occasional sign up of new members;§ §Undertaking follow up calls with members, checking how they are tracking and providing ideas to help members with their workouts and goals;§ §Providing gym floor supervision, demonstrating proper exercise instruction and coaching, correcting technique and motivating during a training session;§ §Undertaking small group training programs and personal training;§ §Taking pride in gym cleaning and minor maintenance tasks to ensure the gym presentation is tidy and hygienic; and§ §Some administration duties and using fitness and member software programs.§ §Qualifications§ §As well as the above, we require the successful applicant to have a minimum of Certificate III and IV in Fitness, current First Aid and a Working with Children Check.§ §How to apply§ §So, if you are wanting a role that you can really make a difference and get some fulfilment from, download the application package from the Shire of Murray website §here§, and apply as per the instructions outlined.§ §For further information about the role, please contact Lynne Gardiner, Coordinator Leisure and Lifestyle (§cll@murray.wa.gov.au§) or Ben Jordan, Manager Murray Aquatic and Leisure Centre (§mmlc@murray.wa.gov.au§) via email or call §08 9531 2000§.§ §This position will remain open until a suitable applicant is appointed.§ § § §Dean Unsworth§ §Chief Executive Officer§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§To be considered for this position, please do not apply via SEEK - download the application package from www.murray.wa.gov.au (link provided within the SEEK advert) and address the Work Related Requirements within the package.§§§

jobTitle: Group/ Personal Trainer Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50709833.txt	§Group/ Personal Trainer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Group/ Personal Trainer§§Advertiser: §The Body Shapers§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §Southern Suburbs & Sutherland Shire§§Salary§§$30 - $39.99 per hour + super§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§We are opening our brand new studio in Nov 2020 and looking for 2 passionate, high-energy, and driven trainers to join our team.§ §These roles offer a ton of opportunity for growth as we launch the business and build the membership + community.§ §Day One is a studio designed to create a highly motivating, fun, and challenging atmosphere for members. We run transformation programs around our group training as well as providing nutrition, accountability and mindset help to our members. § §We want to make their entire life better through their fitness and health.§ §The role involves:§ §- Running our group strength and conditioning sessions for our members§ §- Planning and programming sessions to deliver great results for our members§ §- Working with members for accountability and coaching on their lifestyle, nutrition etc outside the gym§ §- Delivering Personal training sessions outside of group sessions § §Successful candidates will get immediate training and upskilling to improve their training and personal skills + learn how we deliver quality sessions.§ §We're looking for someone who:§ §- Loves fitness and wants to become the best trainer possible§ §- Is comfortable running group sessions of 10-20 people. Can control the group, bring great energy, and develop relationships.§ §- Ideally has 12+ months experience training people 1 on 1 and groups, but we care more for attitude and work ethic than experience and will consider all candidates.§ §- Is diligent, shows attention to detail, and can work well with our team and systems.§ §- Knows how to choose a banging workout playlist § §If interested please send your resume and brief cover letter describing what you are looking for in a role to §david@thebodyshapers.com.au§ § §- Dave§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Have you completed a qualification in fitness?§How many years' experience do you have in the sports & fitness industry?§§§

jobTitle: Club Development Officer Job in Melbourne - SEEK

jobText: TXT/50625032.txt	§Club Development Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Club Development Officer§§Advertiser: §Life Saving Victoria Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Other§§§§§§Life Saving Victoria is Victoria's peak Water safety and Lifesaving organisation and is committed to its mission to prevent aquatic related death and injury across all Victorian communities.§You will work with an allocated 57 Clubs across the state, supporting more than 38,000 volunteer members, servicing the Victorian community.§We achieve this by working with our members, communities, educational institutions, governments, and other organisations in the provision of best practice education, training, surveillance and rescue and risk management services.§You will be responsible for building and maintaining mutually beneficial and cooperative relationships of support between clubs, state officers and the state centre.  Your focus is to support the clubs and their committees across the state to build capacity and ease the administrative burden.  You will provide support, troubleshooting, training and guidance on latest information and changes, integration and support of administration, infrastructure, IT systems, lifesaving services and reporting systems.  You will facilitate clubs to connect to the relevant areas within both LSV and the local areas.§The §Key Outcomes§ of the role include;§Relationship Management§ - to foster positive and supportive relationships with clubs, committees, local councils and members.  You will be a facilitator, ensuring clubs are connecting to relevant areas within LSV, local areas and key stakeholders.§Administration Capabilities §- support the development of clubs efficiencies and independence in regard to their volunteer administrative capabilities through IT implementation, training, enhancement of systems and advice. Support activities and processes required to maintain affiliation with Life Saving Victoria.§Club & Volunteer Support§ - supporting club committees, area officers and state officers, with tools, networks, resources, advice, transition and succession planning.  Building capacity of committees and clubs through training, policy and development assisting the clubs attract, retain and transition committees and culture.§Resourcing & Support §- supporting clubs and members with resources and engagement to enhance capabilities through IT support and integration.  Proactively work with clubs to identify inefficiencies and barriers and support the implementation of innovative solutions at both state and club levels.   Advocate and share solutions, be the conduit between clubs, state and clubs to ensure relevant, timely and fit for purpose solutions.§Supporting Activities §- support and promote clubs, local area activities, including; sport, membership and leadership, training, lifesaving state services, to support member retention, development, upskilling and increase club capabilities.§With a continuous improvement mind-set, you will take an analytical approach to troubleshooting, with the ability to clearly demonstrate outcomes. You will be able to manage your own time to achieve key outcomes and prioritise multiple projects and needs, including those of clubs, volunteers and Life Saving Victoria.§You will have demonstrated ability to successfully communicate with various groups both internally and externally of a typical Life Saving Club operations.§We seek motivated, proactive thinkers, who enjoy working in a team environment. The successful applicant will have sound knowledge of volunteer support and club development, with demonstrated customer service and communication skills, and a flexible, can do attitude.  You will have advanced IT skills with the ability to support and troubleshoot with CRM systems experience. §Previous experience as an officer in a sporting, emergency service or volunteer based organisation preferred.  Qualification with units of competency in support/administration and Certificate IV in Training and Assessment desirable.  Current Victorian Drivers License and a Working with Children Check or the ability to obtain one is essential.§You will need to be available for regular weekends during peak summer period and some regional travel will be required, with a car to be provided as part of the package.§This is a full time fixed term role.§Committed to providing a flexible and diverse workplace, Life Saving Victoria will provide a fabulous work environment, variety, work/life balance, great office amenities and facilities. §For further information please contact Hiring Manager David Potter on §9676 6948§ or §david.potter@lsv.com.au§Applications close 11 October 2020.§§§§

We are seeking value-orientated people to join our local team of 17,000 service professionals, who can help us realise our Purpose of§§”Connecting People and Places to Make the World Work Better”.§§ §An exciting opportunity exists for a §casual§ Health and Lifestyle Coordinator to join our dynamic and professional Resources Operations Team. This role will be based in our operations in §Karratha§ and will be §drive in drive out.§The Balance Lifestyle Program provides a structured approach to improve the lives of residents by positively influencing their health and wellbeing. Balance isn’t just centred on the gym; it is an all-encompassing, holistic program that focuses on key lifestyle and wellness outcomes, including exercise, nutrition, social connection and mental health.§Pre-Requisites:§§Assist in the delivery of the Health & Lifestyle Program within your designated site for success, improvement, productivity and profitability§Deliver variety of Group Fitness Classes and control the classes for safety of participants§Attend to major operational problems and needs promptly including customer complaints, enquiries and requests §Ensure the equipment your responsible for is well maintained and problem solve any equipment issues in a timely manner§Ensure cleanliness of the gym, and sanitising of the equipment§Assist in the reporting performance Monthly, Quarterly and Annually§Drive and monitor a culture of Health & Safety in the workplace§Minimum Diploma in Health/Fitness – highly desirable is completed/near-completion tertiary qualification in Human Movement, Health Science, Exercise Science or similar§Current accreditation with Fitness Australia or ESSA§Current First Aid Certificate§Minimum 2 years demonstrated experience managing projects in the health and recreation industry§Manual WA Drivers Licence  §§Our Benefits§:§§Competitive salary packaging§On-going professional development§Highly supportive team environment§Work for one of Australia's Largest Employer§Ongoing Management Support§§If you are the type of person who is driven and a motivated self-starter, you will be successful in your new role.§ISS is passionate about creating a culture that values inclusion and diversity, where all our people are treated fairly and respectfully. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people with a disability, people from different cultural backgrounds and lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, intersex, queer and asexual (LGBTIQA+) people. §§We are an ethical employer, recognised by the industry for paying fairly and ensuring a safe working environment for all our staff.§ §§§§

jobText: TXT/50703045.txt	§Club General Manager - Crunch Fitness Mentone§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Club General Manager - Crunch Fitness Mentone§§Advertiser: §HealthyPeople§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §Bayside & South Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§$75k - $90k Package§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§Join our mission to help people perspire to greatness! §Crunch Fitness§ is the original ‘No Judgments’ gym and is world-famous for fusing entertainment and fitness with over 300 locations worldwide. It is the fastest-growing big box gym operator in Australia and is aggressively growing in membership and locations.§  §With growth comes opportunity! Crunch Fitness is looking for an energetic and driven Club General Manager who is passionate about inspiring a team to relentlessly deliver on the Crunch Way. Serving thousands of members and guests each day will be a highlight, creating a positive club culture and growing a strong member-base will be the reward; this role will empower you to climb to new heights in your career.§  §As a Club General Manager, you will get to apply a hands-on approach, leading from the front with a focus on member engagement, delivering on service standards, driving goal performance and supporting key offerings including Rest and Recovery, Personal Training and Group Fitness.§  §Member engagement and member service delivery means being proactive and fully integrated into all stages of the member lifecycle. This includes you interacting with members at all touch-points including at reception and on the gym-floor, handling all member communication and feedback and ensuring a safe, fresh and clean club environment at all times. To drive membership growth, you will be responsible for executing effective sales and marketing plans, these include in-club initiatives, outreach programs and community events and activities.§  §One of the best parts of this role, you get to recruit, up-skill and motivate a high-performance team to successfully work together to achieve goals and create a winning culture.§  §You will be inspired and supported by a Regional Manager and Home Office team who will provide you with constant training, development, tools and initiatives to ensure you are a success in the role. This partnership will drive results and will be the force behind the successful execution of the Crunch Way. Your active involvement and focused effort will reflect high-level engagement, great member satisfaction, membership growth and exemplify what “greatness” is in your club.§  §If you are ready for this role, you will have:§ § §Experience in engaging with people§ §Ability to work in a fast-paced team environment§ §Great customer service experience and skills§ §Proven ability to drive goals§ §Sales and marketing knowledge§ §Good emotional intelligence§ §An open mind for learning new skills/ways§ §A passion to change lives through health and fitness§ §Hard-working, committed to the greater good§ §This role will offer you:§ § §Genuine involvement and contribution to the health and wellbeing of our community - we believe ‘We Save Lives’§ §Personalise development plan - induction, on-boarding, training and learning for the role§ §Leadership Learning and Development Program - mentoring to assist with your career development§ §Career advancement - promotion opportunities for you to grow with us§ §Monthly Bonus Incentives to reward your success§ §Reward, Recognition and Employee Benefits Program§ §Access to Crunch Fitness clubs globally§ §If you think you’ve got what it takes, please send your Resume with a Cover Letter answering these questions;§ § §What specific experience do you have that qualify you for this role?§ §Why is this role right for you at this time in your career?§ §What has attracted you to Crunch Fitness (and the Fitness Industry)?§ §Click the apply now button.§  §Australian Citizenship or Permanent Residency required for this role.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

The Aquatic Centre situated on the Sunshine Coast, 20km south of Noosa. The centre will offer swimming lessons, squad programs, water polo and fitness classes to the school’s students and the wider community.§ABOUT THE COLLEGE:§St Andrew’s Anglican College is a leading Independent School on the beautiful Sunshine Coast, with an enviable reputation for promoting excellence in every aspect of the College life to enable students to move confidently into their future. St Andrew’s has over 1300 students, naturally flowing from Kindergarten through to Year 12, with the state-of-the-art facilities and high calibre staff. §ABOUT THE ROLE:§The Learn to Swim teacher will be required to teach swimming and water safety under the policies and procedures of the St Andrew’s Aquatic Centre Learn to Swim Manual.§In order to undertake this role, the successful candidate will possess the following attributes:§§    §Team player§    §Sense of humour§    §Creativity and flexibility§    §A passion for education and the demonstrated capacity to achieve the College's Mission Statement§§KEY RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE ROLE:§§Learn to Swim§§    §Ensure your personal standard of Learn to Swim instruction is high. As well as your personal demeanour around the Aquatic Centre and around St Andrews Anglican College.§    §Be prepared to upskill your knowledge and practical skills wherever offered and possible.§§Team Participation:§§    §Work collaboratively with all St Andrew’s Aquatic Centre & College staff to provide a professional and service orientated environment.§    §Work with all Aquatic Centre staff to achieve the St Andrew’s Anglican College’s common goals and not be driven toward achievement solely within specific areas of expertise.§    §Show positive and effective communication within your team§§    §Proactive and energetic with a positive approach to work.§    §To be discreet and able to maintain strict levels of confidentiality.§    §Demonstrable problem solving and organisational skills.§    §To stay within the requirements of the Learn to Swim Manual§    §Have an ongoing commitment to positive team interactions and professional development§    §Possess outstanding communication skills which support and foster positive working relationships§§KNOWLEDGE, SKILL AND QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENT:§§    §Current Austswim or Swim Australia Infants and Pre-school certification§    §Current Austswim or Swim Australia Aquatic Teacher of Aquatics to people with Disabilities§    §Current Austswim or Swim Australia Teacher of Competitive Strokes§    §Experience in school swimming programs including delivery of training§    §Senior First Aid Certificate§    §Current Pool Lifeguard Certificate§    §12 months experience as a Learn to Swim teacher§    §Highly Desirable Lifeguard qualifications / Skills§§APPLICATIONS CLOSE:§    §12:00pm, Friday 9th October 2020§§TO APPLY:§§Please select "apply now" and provide a covering letter and resume. A maximum of 6-8 pages would be appreciated. We suggest using Google Chrome browser for optimal results. Alternatively, a position description and the§option to apply directly is available by going to the College website at§www.saac.qld.edu.au/jobs.§ §St Andrew’s has a commitment to creating environments for children and young people to thrive. All applicants are instructed to read and reflect their agreement of the Code of Conduct for Anglican Schools which is located on our website.§§St Andrew's is an equal opportunities employer, ATSI people are encouraged to apply for positions within the College, and all candidates must be eligible for or hold a current Working with Children Blue Card. All prospective candidates (over 18) are required to undergo a check against the Anglican Church National Standards Register.§§St Andrew's is carrying out good hygiene practices and social/physical distancing for our recruitment process during COVID-19. The recruitment process may take longer than usual due to these circumstances§§§§

jobText: TXT/50615709.txt	§Club Manager / Head Coach Body Fit Training Ballarat§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Club Manager / Head Coach Body Fit Training Ballarat§§Advertiser: §Body Fit Training§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Ballarat & Central Highlands§§Salary§§$55,000 - $69,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§We at Body Fit Training – Ballarat are on the hunt for a Club Manager / Group Fitness Coach to join our leadership team and be an integral part of the success of our studio from the ground up. Our studio will be operating alongside a team of fitness professionals with the intention of offering our members a fully integrated health and fitness optimisation package. If you love group training and genuinely want to help people achieve their health and fitness goals, this unique opportunity is for you!§ § § §Who is Body Fit Training?§ §Body Fit Training is Australia’s newest and most advanced group training methodology. We’ve incorporated scientifically proven training techniques aimed at reducing fat and creating lean muscle into a variety of 50 minute training sessions that are overseen by accredited coaches in a dynamic group environment.§ §High levels of visual content showcasing our programs are displayed on multiple digital screens throughout the studio which allows our coaches to spend more time concentrating on our members and their experience while the screens direct the traffic.§ §Our programs are designed by one of Australia’s most elite high performance, strength and conditioning coaches, ensuring our programs remain cutting edge and results-driven.§ § § §The opportunity§ §We are on the lookout for a passionate, confident and highly motivated fitness professional who wants to be part of a dynamic and high performing team at our Ballarat studio.§ § § §Club Manager / Group Fitness Coach role includes:§ § §Monday to Saturday flexible roster§ §Running 4 to 8 training sessions per day, delivering instructions and ensuring clients are using safe and correct form at all times§ §Inspiring and promoting an energetic environment, building a community culture within the studio§ §Assisting in the creation, management and ongoing development of the team of trainers§ §Assisting in completing fitness appraisals and pre-exercise screening§ §Assisting with running, managing and coordinating our 8 and 12 week challenges§ §Assisting with creating and implementing sales and marketing strategies to increase and retain membership base§ §Assisting with responding to member enquiries and the day-to-day operations of the studio§ §Working collaboratively with a team of allied healthcare providers to help members maximise their potential§ § § §Perks of being part of the Body Fit Training crew§ § §Competitive hourly rate§ §A range of incentives to inspire your performance, push you to be the best and provide an enormous earning potential§ §Opportunities to grow, develop and expand in the role with ancillary health and fitness offerings§ §Opportunity for advancement into owning your own studio§ §Commitment to work-life balance§ §Motivated team to work with and a supportive network with mentoring opportunities§ § § §Skills and experience you need§ § §Two plus years’ experience as a personal / group fitness trainer § §Sports, fitness, health or relatable tertiary education (preferred but not essential)§ §Experience motivating and managing a team of trainers§ §Excellent written and communications skills§ §Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to develop strong relationships and rapport quickly§ §Enthusiastic, professional and supportive attitude towards clients and other staff§ §Self-motivated, goal oriented and able to meet KPIs§ §Excellent attention to detail with outstanding time management and organisational skills§ §Passion, enthusiasm and genuine motivation towards wanting to improve the lives of others§ §Ambition for career progression§ § § §Qualifications you need§ § §Certificate IV in Personal Training or Certificate III in Group Fitness§ §Current Senior First Aid and CPR§ §Fitness Australia Registration and all necessary insurances§ § § §If you are passionate about creating a positive, support and exciting training environment for members, then this role is for you!§§§§

Our customer service officers are passionate about creating awesome experiences and building strong relationships within the community.§ §About the role§ §We are looking for someone who has a range of availabilities to work on a rotating roster. Availabilities will range between 5:30AM and 9:30PM (operational hours) and weekend work will be required. § §The role will see you meet and greet customers, respond to internal and external enquiries via email, phone calls and face to face as well as perform general administration tasks.  You will ensure all enquiries, bookings and issues are managed accurately and support other departments when required.  The role will give you the opportunity to build strong customer experiences and lasting relationships with our members and guests. § §About you§ §You are self-motivated and have a passion for customer satisfaction.  You thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy problem solving.  Your superior customer service and admin skills along with your ability to build rapport with people will see you excel in this role! § §You will also come with the following§ § §Current CPR certificate§ §Previous experience in administration/customer service role§ §§Who What Y?§YMCA NSW is a profit-for-purpose organisation focused on healthy living, social impact and empowering young people. We operate 23 recreation centres, 57 Out of School Hours Care services and two camping locations which fund our diverse range of youth and community programs, employing 1800 staff across NSW.§Our goal is for our workforce to reflect the diverse community we serve. We encourage people of all genders, ages, religions, disability, sexual orientation, family and caring responsibilities and cultures, including people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander heritage to apply.§Commitment to Safeguarding§ §YMCA, including Boards of Directors, is committed to the safety and wellbeing of children and young people in accordance with our Safeguarding Children and Young People framework. YMCA requires that all applicants undergo satisfactory screening prior to commencement, including but not limited to:§ § §a national criminal history check;§ §an international criminal history check where applicants have worked overseas;§ §holding or obtaining a Working with Children Clearance/ equivalent in accordance with state/ territory laws;§ §Two reference checks.§ § §Please note, the results of any National and International Police Check will only be used to assess your suitability to perform the role.§ §Any successfully appointed applicant will be required to adhere to the Safeguarding Children and Young People framework, which includes a thorough safeguarding children and young people induction and committing to upholding the safety and wellbeing of children and young people throughout their engagement with YMCA. §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

We are committed to providing all members of our Vibe Tribe with ongoing training and support to develop their customer service and sales skills. You will be driven, energetic, organised, and have a flexible working attitude. Your ability to connect with people to share your love for health and fitness, and introduce them to Australia’s best fitness experience, is essential.  §  § §  §Our priorities centre around our Vibe Tribe functioning as a well-oiled machine by fostering the best people and supporting them to achieve their full potential.
