The School maintains a 150-year strong tradition of academic excellence, an extensive cocurricular program, and student wellbeing programs across the school and Boarding facility. We are fortunate to have a team of dedicated and professional staff who provide an exceptional learning environment which is responsive to the needs of our students.§        §The Role §        §The Brisbane Grammar School Swimming Program operates all year round, providing aquatic coaching services to BGS students and the wider community. The program’s primary business is to provide quality aquatic coaching and instruction to all BGS students enrolled in years 5 to 12. We also strive to provide a complete developmental pathway for all athletes from stroke development to high performance.§        §The key responsibilities within this role will pivot between being the Coordinator of Middle School Swimming and Assistant Coach Swimming. jobText: TXT/50699859.txt	§Club Manager - Anytime Fitness Perth CBD§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Club Manager - Anytime Fitness Perth CBD§§Advertiser: §Anytime Fitness Perth CBD§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Salary§§$55,000 - $69,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§Anytime Fitness is the number one fitness club chain, with over 4500 clubs globally!§ §We have a rare opportunity available in the heart of Perth; Anytime Fitness Perth CBD is about to transform and we are expanding the team to suit. § §Who are we? And why should you work with us?§ §At Anytime Fitness Perth CBD, we are a passionate and high performing team who never give up on achieving superior results. We are a family, and as a family, we are dedicated to changing people's lives. That is why you'll love joining us!  We recognise and respect the uniqueness of everyone, and we deliver a personal experience for every person. We are committed to seeing you thrive and succeed in your new career with us. § §What's in it for you?§ §An attractive remuneration package, including above industry award salary. We want a career-minded sales driven individual in this position who has exceptional customer service skills, an unparalleled desire to succeed and learn, and understands that hard work will get you there. You will be part of the fitness industry's most respected and awarded companies. This is an excellent opportunity for the right candidate to be absorbed in a culture of empowerment and growth.   § §The role?§ §As Club Manager, you are critical to the success of the club as you are responsible for lead generation, driving membership sales and building on our incredible club culture.§ §You must be confident on the phone, have solid sales skills, with a can-do attitude, a lateral thinker who can work autonomously or in a team environment. The critical skill is your ability to build rapport and deliver a premium level of customer service to every one of our members.§ §Beyond this, you will be required to:§ § §Welcome new members, by providing detailed and encouraging on-boarding§ §Provide club tours to prospective members§ §Create and execute a monthly outreach program § §Establish and maintain an effective referral program§ §Be engaging on the telephone, e.g. conducting telephone inquiries / follow up calls / answering customer care calls.§ §Maintain the club to our exceptional standards.§ §About you:§ § §Passion for health and fitness§ §Social media savvy§ §Strong customer service ethos, and sales philosophy§ §Experienced working with sales targets and KPIs§ §Ability to multi-task and stay organised§ §Positive, motivating, with excellent communication skills§ §Intermediate computer skills§ §Excellent personal presentation§ §Police Check § §Current First Aid Certificate (can apply for afterwards)§ §Working with Children's Check (can apply for afterwards)§ §Certificate III or IV in Fitness (desirable) § §If this sounds like the ideal position for you, please apply now by submitting your up-to-date resume, along with a cover letter that highlights how your passion and previous skills/experience align with what we are looking for.§ §Only applicants successful in progressing to interview will be contacted. § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have experience in a sales role?§Do you have customer service experience?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

We're guided by our compassionate, capable, collaborative and creative values, and we want people who share these values to join our team.  §        § §        § §About the role§        § §        §The Wellness and Lifestyle Coordinator is responsible for delivering high quality Wellness and Lifestyle services that empower and support customers to engage in meaningful activities.  This is a professional, leadership role with the aim to support and enable residents to maximise their independence and improve and maintain their health, wellness and quality of life.§        § §        §The Wellness and Lifestyle Coordinator will support and coordinate staff, volunteers and students to deliver meaningful lifestyle activities and projects.  You will employ best practice evidence based tools in health promotion, person centred care and healthy ageing to manage lifestyle programs.  You will implement organisational projects to improve resident outcomes as directed by the central Wellness and Lifestyle team.§        § §        §For further details regarding the scope of the role, please refer to the attached position description.§        § §        §About you§        § §        §You will be passionate about healthy ageing and creating an environment that will promote quality of life for our residents. You’ll also learn vital survival tactics to apply regardless of the season, weather or terrain.§        § §        §From learning skilled reconnaissance tactics to effective teamwork and cooperation, there’s never a dull moment as an Infantry Soldier in the Army Reserve.§        § §        §Life in the Army Reserve: §        §Thousands of men and women enjoy part-time roles with the Army Reserve, operating alongside full-time Army personnel. The only difference is that your commitment is flexible.§        § §        §Initial training length will vary based on your chosen role, after which you will normally be expected to serve between 35 and 70 days a year. This could involve an evening each week and one weekend a month, and even extended periods away.§        § §        §We do our best to make sure this fits in with your work and family commitments; and deployments are voluntary so if you choose to stay local, there are plenty of ways to make a difference closer to home. jobText: TXT/50693011.txt	§PERSONAL TRAINER§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§PERSONAL TRAINER§§Advertiser: §Extreme Physique Personal Training§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§Extreme Physique Personal Training are seeking a highly motivated and passionate personal trainer to join our team.§ABOUT US§Based at Albion, in the Queensland Cricket Headquarters, Extreme Physique Personal Training has built a strong reputation in the local community during its 19 years of operation. Our team of trainers are all extremely busy and we need help with our increasing demand for personal training sessions. This is a great time to join our team.§Voted Brisbane`s Best Personal Training Service in 2019 at the GHP Fitness and Nutrition awards our unique training facility has an extensive range of indoor and outdoor training options for our clients. We pride ourselves on always being able to deliver positive health outcomes for any client regardless of age, ability or fitness goals. §If you are interested in 1-on-1 and small group training and do not want to work for a big gym or the many 24/7 gyms, then we may be the studio for you. This position is a sub-contract role, allowing you to choose your own hours and be rewarded with rates well above industry averages.§The successful applicant will have an induction period to learn about our business model followed by an ongoing mentorship program to help you establish a successful career.§ §We are looking for a motivated Personal Trainer who:§Is always reliable & professional§Is energised and happy§Is proactive with marketing, networking & building their brand§Can work independently with drive and passion§Thrives within a team environment§Has the knowledge to deliver high standard exercise programming§Has a solid understanding of the fitness industry trends and training methods§Is passionate about 1 on 1 & small group training§Displays exceptional ability to achieve results for clients§Is looking for a long-term stable position§Experience not essential §Applicants must also have:§A Minimum Certificate IV in Fitness (Personal Trainer)§Insurance§Current First Aid§ABN§Own reliable transport§APPLY NOW!!!§§§§

jobTitle: Do you have the character to change lives at F45 Belmont? Job in Perth - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50674259.txt	§Do you have the character to change lives at F45 Belmont?§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Do you have the character to change lives at F45 Belmont?§§Advertiser: §HealthyPeople§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§Here’s the thing, not all F45 studios are the same. And the reality is, not all coaches are the same.§ §They might look the same, but you and I both know there is something different.§ §We are not a 'Typical’ F45 and as such §we are not looking for a 'Typical' coach§. We hire character, attitude and vibe over qualifications.§ §The difference for us is this:§ § § §You give a s#*t and want to §BE THE REASON§ why our members unlock their §GREATNESS§ and walk like GIANTS everyday. You are not just looking for a few shifts to just make rent while you figure out your life, you want to be part of something bigger and be valued as a community leader and great coach. §You are ready to change lives§. § § § §You are not just someone who says they are ‘passionate’ about health and fitness because it’s great for your ‘gram. You are all about it, heck, it probably got you out of a rut at some stage in your life. §You have a story, you are relatable§.§ § § §You are not someone who is easily confined to your comfort zone. You are thirsty for growth, you are always looking to sharpen, to improve, to get stronger, fitter, faster… to get better. You are relentless.§ § § §Sure you have hit a speed bump or two in life. More importantly, you have a history of putting in the work and love the process of chasing the “1%er’s”. You understand resilience is not about the cape you wear, it’s about your §strength of character§ to get back up… time and time again.§ § § §You are§ all about 'Team F45'.§ This is the best fitness brand in the world. Our members have voted to be F45ers, they want coaches around them who have too. A week without an F45 workout feels strange to you.§ § § §Your experience does not stand in the way of your humility to learn, grow, and craving for the right kind of feedback and direction. §You know the best coaches are coachable§.§ § § §You are not a short-term flake. You are ready to spend some time crafting your art and willing to do the §right things, the right way, with the right people, for a long time§.§ § § In return, what we offer for the right person:§ § § §Uncapped potential, you take your journey and growth as far as you dare to - we will be there to guide, §support and cheer for you§.§ § § §Leadership and coaching that believes in you and will mentor you on how you can be a better coach and loved fitness professional.§ § § §If you still need qualifications, we can help you with that too (if you are the right person)§ § § §Writing your§ legacy§ that will be spoken about in 20 years’ time by our members. Sound odd? Can you remember that school teacher or childhood coach that made an impact on you?§ § § §Exposure to how the §business§ actually works, growing your skills and knowledge on how to coach, retain and convert members, marketing, social media best practice (it’s not about the filters and selfies), and growing a community of impact and meaning.§ § §If all of this sounds like the right fit for you, then I’d love to hear from you. Even if you are not fully qualified yet, we can sort that out if you are the right person. Please send me a 4-5 min video answering the following with examples:§ § § §What gets you out of bed and §excited§ in the morning?§ § § §If you could only give 3 pieces of §epic advice§ to our member community, what would they be?§ § § §What are you §reading§ or what §podcast§ are you listening to right now?§ § § §What have you done before to build the§ confidence§ of those around you? How about in yourself?§ § § §What §legacy§ do you want to be remembered for 20 years from now?§ § § §Who would you have dinner with if you could choose anyone in the world and §why§?§ § §We are a community that just happens to train together. We are not a gym. §We are in the business of changing lives. Are you?§ §Let’s unleash §your greatness§.§ §Aaron§ §F45 Belmont§ §Owner§§§§

jobText: TXT/50685244.txt	§ATTN Personal Trainers - CLIENTS WAITING FOR YOU§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§ATTN Personal Trainers - CLIENTS WAITING FOR YOU§§Advertiser: §HealthyPeople§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Mornington Peninsula & Bass Coast§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§Are you a PT ready to take the next step? WE WANT YOU.§  §We are looking for a Personal Trainer that wants to build and grow a business through the Get Going brand. A rare opportunity with us, with over 100 personal trainers and a company dedicated to PT's, this won't last.§ § §Join a business that's striving to make a difference, not just a living.§ §Over 100 Personal Trainers across NSW and VIC. § §The chance to build your own team. § §Business pathway available to the right individual. § §Guaranteed clients and sessions.§ §The industry is changing and we're leading the way. Keen to actually make a difference? Join an organisation dedicated to sustainably changing the lives of our clients and our TRAINERS.§  §Come join our proud team at §Get Going Personal Training§! If you've been in the industry for a while, stop stressing about maintaining leads and clients and join a professional team that works with you rather than against you.§  §Get out of the cutthroat environment of lead generation.§  §We'll provide you with the tools you need to build your client books to 30+ sessions comfortably and quickly. §  §OWN YOUR OWN GET GOING - Mornington§  §For those who we see fit, you may have the option of owning your own area so you can build your business alongside us!§  §Unlike other companies, we hand select our owners, making sure they align with the business. We want AMAZING people because those people build AMAZING companies.§  §We Offer:§ § §4-Week training and mentoring program§ §Ongoing support and learning§ §Weekly meetings§ §Help to build clientele as quickly as your potential allows§ §Earn $40.50 - $71.30 per session OR the chance to own your own Get Going. § §Opportunities to grow into higher positions within the organisation§ §Your Role:§  §As a Mobile (Home) Personal Trainer, you will be one of our home training specialists, providing training programming, implementation and advice!§ § §Look after your own clientele § §Manage your own database and accounts§ §Continuous learning and development§ §Benefits & Culture§  §We have developed, and continue to develop, an extremely motivating and fun environment for all of our talent to learn and grow. jobText: TXT/50627921.txt	§Sport & Recreation Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Sport & Recreation Officer§§Advertiser: §Paupiyala Tjarutja Aboriginal Corporation§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Kalgoorlie, Goldfields & Esperance§§Salary§§$60,000 - $64,999 plus other benefits.§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Other§§§§§§About the business§ §Paupiyala Tjarutja Aboriginal Corporation (PTAC)§ was first incorporated in 1989 as the governing representative body for the Spinifex People. It was established to enable the Spinifex people to receive and administer funds to develop infrastructure at Tjuntjuntjara, in remote Western Australia. Servicing a close-knit community of around 200 people, §PTAC§ is a non-profit community organisation which has grown to administer the Tjuntjuntjara Community Store, the Women's Centre, the Tjuntjuntjara Community Resource Centre and a range of other programs and infrastructure related projects. §PTAC §also acts as a local council service provider – managing the essential services (water, power, sewerage, tip airstrip), the Community Development Program and an Environmental Health Program.§ §The organisation also operates a comprehensive primary health service (Spinifex Health Service) with a team of skilled health professionals including a Manager, Medical Director, visiting specialists, remote area nurses and Aboriginal Health Workers.  § §About the role§ §Under the direct supervision of the Program Manager, the primary purpose of this position is to facilitate the operation of existing sport and recreation opportunities in the community and to support community members to engage with physical activities and to improve mental health and well being.  Further, during the school holiday program period, the Sport & Recreation Officer will provide a range of existing school holiday program activities aimed at school aged children to ensure that the communities children are engaged in activities to reduce the risk of vandalism and anti-social behavior.  There will be some opportunities to identify, develop and coordinate new sport and recreation opportunities under the management and direction of the Program Manager.§ §Main Duties§ §The Sport & Recreation Officer's main duties are to: § §- facilitate active recreational and sporting games for the community population§ §- Engage the broader community in a wide range of sport and recreation activities to promote positive and healthy behavior while reduce anti-social behavior such as drug use and vandalism.§ §-  Under supervision, design and facilitate community health initiative activities, including activities to increase physical and mental health§ §- Engage youth in activities to strengthen connection to culture and country§ §- increasing awareness of the rules in sports activities (football, soccer, netball, softball, volleyball, basketball)§ §- Empower community members to contribute to the design and facilitation of the sport and recreation program§ §- mentor indigenous community sport & recreation officers§ §The position will focus on skill development and capacity building by facilitating and encouraging local indigenous sport and recreation workers to take on more responsibility and learn key aspects of the program.§ § § §Benefits and perks§ §This is an amazing opportunity for an applicant seeking a §new adventure§ §in a remote location§, in a part of Australia that most people will never get to see!§ §In return for your hard work and dedication, you will be rewarded with an§ attractive salary package including a base salary of $59,965 and super§, plus a fantastic range of benefits worth thousands of dollars including:§ § §Annual return airfares to place of recruitment;§ §District allowance of $4,333§;§ §Generous salary sacrificing options;§ §4 weeks' annual leave with 17.5% leave loading;§ §8 weeks' annual isolation leave (in lieu of overtime & public holidays);§ §Monthly telephone and internet allowances of $50 each; and§ §Ongoing training and development opportunities;§ §You'll also be able to call the Tjuntjuntjara community home immediately, with §furnished accommodation provided at subsidised rent of $40 per week§, including utilities.§ §Skills and experience§ §To be successful in this role, you will have a:§ § §tertiary qualification in a relevant field (Sport & Recreation/Youth Work) or similar;§ §demonstrated experience designing, supervising and running sport & recreation activities and competitions/sport events;§ §Experience working with disengaged youth and aboriginal people in a remote Aboriginal community;§ §Sound understanding of community development principles and their application in a remote aboriginal community;§ §Demonstrated experience running school holiday program activities;§ §Ability to work effectively and cooperatively with supervision;§ §Well-developed organizational, planning and time management skills;§ §Ability to exercise initiative within established procedures and policies;§ §Ability to work under pressure, and to work as part of a team;§ §Flexibility, and preparedness to assist other staff or do tasks that do not specifically come under the role from time to time;§ §Sound problem solving, diplomacy and resolution skills;§ §Sound cross-cultural skills;§ §A genuine interest in working cooperatively with traditionally-oriented Aboriginal people;§ §Applicants are required to lodge a covering letter addressing the key "Skills and Experience" outlined above with a CV and a minimum of 3 referees. Queries and requests for a copy of the PD can be obtained by emailing Chloe Amphlett at §adminsupport@spinifex.org.au§ §Applications close 5pm (AWST) on Thursday 15th October 2020 and are to be lodged via the Seek Site.§ § §§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§Do you have a current Police Check (National Police Certificate) for employment?§Do you have experience in a community outreach environment?§§§

jobText: TXT/50405238.txt	§Personal Training Studio Manager to Possible Owner - Take the Challenge!§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Personal Training Studio Manager to Possible Owner - Take the Challenge!§§Advertiser: §Pure Results Personal Training§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§26 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §South West & M5 Corridor§§Salary§§$50,000 - $69,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§Pure Results Personal Training Revesby Heights is looking for the right person to take on the role of Studio Manager with the once in a lifetime opportunity to work towards owning the business without having to have the capital to purchase. Essentially, we are looking for a high performer who wants to one day own their own studio and is willing to do whatever it takes to make it happen. This role§ is not§ for someone who just wants a job or wants experience. You will need to be highly committed to the business, our trainers and our clients, taking full ownership over the Studio at all times.§ §Full Training and Mentoring will be provided and we will support you every step of the way.§ §We are a boutique-style Personal Training Studio with a well established clientele and a team of great trainers. As we go into our 12th year we are now seeking a highly self-motivated, hard working and passionate person who wants to pioneer and create vision and culture to take Pure Results into the next phase of it’s life.§ §You will be Managing the Studio from End to End. You will be the key point of contact for all clients and trainers. Which includes: Managing & Recruiting Trainers & Admins, Managing Cleaners and Maintenance People and Suppliers etc, Owning the Sales & Marketing Process, Achieving Set Targets and KPI’s, Driving towards Exceptional Client Results, Managing the Facility Upkeep and All Other Aspects of the Business. Needless to say this a FULL TIME position that will require early mornings, late evenings and weekend work.  § §ABOUT YOU:§ § §Excellent Marketing and Sales Skills and a Personality that enjoys Sales§ §Ability to Recruit, Mentor and Lead Staff. Must be able to Motivate and Inspire staff of all levels and backgrounds. And ensure process and system compliance§ §Ability to mutli-task whilst under pressure§ §Comfortable with analysing numbers and developing strategies to achieve targets based on data§ §A deep understanding of Health and Fitness§ §High Performer who wants to go Above and Beyond their Job Description§ §Exceptional Customer Service Skills§ §Excellent Written and Verbal Communication Skills§ §Self Motivated & well Organised§ §Posses a genuine passion to improve people's fitness and wellbeing§ §Ability to manager time and work totally unsupervised§ §Goals - You will have experience in working towards achieving targets so you can help drive your team to success. And be driven to operate, sell and promote an exceptional fitness facility!§ §Drivers License and Own Car§ §Computer Skills – MS Outlook, Word, Excel§ § § §WHO SHOULD APPLY FOR THIS ROLE?§ §If you are passionate about the fitness industry, love helping clients get excellent results, love leading a friendly team and looking for a long term secure position, please apply.§ §This was a dream of mine when I got into the fitness industry, I worked hard, made it happen, learnt so many invaluable lessons and loved every minute of it. Now it’s time to pass on the baton to the younger breed of up and coming fitness professionals. It’s been “my baby” for so long and I’m really looking for someone to nurture and take care of it and take it to it’s full potential of being able to genuinely help and transform people’s health and fitness.  § §We are looking for the right person and will be conducting interviews and taking applications for as long as this job ad runs.§ § §Really looking forward to meeting you and helping you with your fitness career goals.§ §Please contact us at: §contact@pureresults.com.au§ or via the 'Apply online' link below, subsequently call Robbie on §0411 437 907§ to discuss your future as a Successful Fitness Professional.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50589605.txt	§Activity Assistant  - Casual§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Activity Assistant  - Casual§§Advertiser: §Blacktown City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §Parramatta & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Activity Assistant - Casual §      §        §Blacktown is a vibrant city located in the very heart of Greater Sydney, half-way between Sydney City and the Blue Mountains. It is a city of ambition and excitement. With a total of 48 residential suburbs, and population of 395,000 coming from more than 180 different birthplaces, Blacktown City is one of the most diverse communities in Australia.§        §Working in Blacktown City provides a wealth of professional opportunities. Blacktown City Council is the largest Council in New South Wales, 4th largest in Australia and a leader in the development of the Western Sydney region. With almost unmatched growth expected over the next 25 years, we are on an exciting journey of transformation to prepare for a population of more than 550,000. There has never been a more exciting time to join one of Sydney’s most dynamic and high-performing Councils as we continue to deliver outstanding levels of service for our proud and diverse community and prepare our great city for the future.§        §Position Purpose§        §We are looking for enthusiastic and motivated individuals to join the Key Venues team at a number of locations within Blacktown City Council as casual Activity Assistants (predominately lifeguarding).§        §The role highlights are:§        §          §Maintaining high quality pool supervision§          §Working in a team environment to ensure the effective day-to-day operation of the Centre while providing customers with a safe and enjoyable experience§        §        § If you have a Pool Lifeguard Certificate, great communication skills, commitment to customer service excellence and a passion for safety around the water then this is the role for you!§        §About the opportunity§        §Key Venues consists of 10 of Council’s premier sport and leisure facilities. We deliver first class activity and program choice, we promote Blacktown City as the leader in sport, recreation and leisure and we give every visitor and customer a safe and memorable experience. Our values are team work, customer focus, innovation and commitment to safety. §        §Activity Assistants will provide high quality pool supervision at the following centres: §        §          §Blacktown Aquatic Centre§          §Charlie Lowles Leisure Centre Stanhope§          §Blacktown Leisure Centre Stanhope§          §Riverstone Swimming Centrre (seasonal)§          §Mount Druitt Swimming Centre (seasonal)§        §        §Expressions of Interest are being sought for enthusiastic Activity Assistants to apply to the venue of their choice.§        §Successful applicants will be responsible for maintaining high quality pool supervision and a high standard of centre cleanliness. Activity Assistants will assist with setting up equipment for program delivery.§        §Qualifications and Experience§Essential:§        §          §Current Pool Lifeguard certificate§          §Current First Aid certificate §          §Relevant experience §          §Current driver’s licence§          §Current Working with Children Check.§        §        §Desirable:§        §          §Knowledge of applicable legislation/ regulations§          §Experience and knowledge of water testing procedures§          §Experience in a similar position§          §Experience working within a team environment§          §Computer literate§          §Demonstrated commitment to customer service.§        §        §Please attach ALL essential qualifications (as per the job description outline)§        §Salary and Conditions§        §The salary and conditions of employment are in accordance with Blacktown City Council’s Enterprise Agreement.§        §          §An hourly rate of $26.5316 (Grade 3, Level 1) per hour plus 25% casual loading as well as penalty rates apply for weekend shifts §          §Trainee rates apply for applicants under 19 years of age§          §Casual working hours§          §Employee benefits such as leave entitlements (where applicable), 9.5% employer superannuation contribution payable to the Local Government Superannuation Scheme, Fitness Passport and gym membership discounts, and social clubs.§        §        §This position has been identified as child related work, in accordance with the Child Protection (Working with Children) Regulation 2013. Therefore, your application must include a Working with Children Check (WWCC) number. For further information, go to www.newcheck.kids.nsw.gov.au.§        §Our Commitment to Safety§§        §Blacktown City Council is committed to safety. We have introduced alcohol and other drug testing at the pre-employment phase, and via a series of random tests, tests where there may be reasonable suspicion and / or post reportable incident testing for Council workers.§        §Position Description §        §Click §here§ §to view or download the position description.§        §            §        §        §Closing Date:            18 December 2020§        §Contact Officer:        Tristan Harris §8869 9009§INTERNAL REF:        Casual§      §      §      §    §    §To apply visit the Council's website §www.blacktown.nsw.gov.au§  §§§Blacktown is a vibrant city located in the very heart of Greater Sydney, half-way between Sydney City and the Blue Mountains. It is a city of ambition and excitement. With a total of 48 residential suburbs, and population of 395,000 coming from more than 180 different birthplaces, Blacktown City is one of the most diverse communities in Australia.§ §Working in Blacktown City provides a wealth of professional opportunities. Blacktown City Council is the largest Council in New South Wales, 4th largest in Australia and a leader in the development of the Western Sydney region. With almost unmatched growth expected over the next 25 years, we are on an exciting journey of transformation to prepare for a population of more than 550,000. There has never been a more exciting time to join one of Sydney’s most dynamic and high-performing Councils as we continue to deliver outstanding levels of service for our proud and diverse community and prepare our great city for the future.§ §Position Purpose§ §We are looking for enthusiastic and motivated individuals to join the Key Venues team at a number of locations within Blacktown City Council as casual Activity Assistants (predominately lifeguarding).§ §The role highlights are:§ § §Maintaining high quality pool supervision§ §Working in a team environment to ensure the effective day-to-day operation of the Centre while providing customers with a safe and enjoyable experience§ § § If you have a Pool Lifeguard Certificate, great communication skills, commitment to customer service excellence and a passion for safety around the water then this is the role for you!§ §About the opportunity§ §Key Venues consists of 10 of Council’s premier sport and leisure facilities. We deliver first class activity and program choice, we promote Blacktown City as the leader in sport, recreation and leisure and we give every visitor and customer a safe and memorable experience. Our values are team work, customer focus, innovation and commitment to safety. § §Activity Assistants will provide high quality pool supervision at the following centres: § § §Blacktown Aquatic Centre§ §Charlie Lowles Leisure Centre Stanhope§ §Blacktown Leisure Centre Stanhope§ §Riverstone Swimming Centrre (seasonal)§ §Mount Druitt Swimming Centre (seasonal)§ § §Expressions of Interest are being sought for enthusiastic Activity Assistants to apply to the venue of their choice.§ §Successful applicants will be responsible for maintaining high quality pool supervision and a high standard of centre cleanliness. Activity Assistants will assist with setting up equipment for program delivery.§ §Qualifications and Experience§Essential:§ § §Current Pool Lifeguard certificate§ §Current First Aid certificate § §Relevant experience § §Current driver’s licence§ §Current Working with Children Check.§ § §Desirable:§ § §Knowledge of applicable legislation/ regulations§ §Experience and knowledge of water testing procedures§ §Experience in a similar position§ §Experience working within a team environment§ §Computer literate§ §Demonstrated commitment to customer service.§ § §Please attach ALL essential qualifications (as per the job description outline)§ §Salary and Conditions§ §The salary and conditions of employment are in accordance with Blacktown City Council’s Enterprise Agreement.§ § §An hourly rate of $26.5316 (Grade 3, Level 1) per hour plus 25% casual loading as well as penalty rates apply for weekend shifts § §Trainee rates apply for applicants under 19 years of age§ §Casual working hours§ §Employee benefits such as leave entitlements (where applicable), 9.5% employer superannuation contribution payable to the Local Government Superannuation Scheme, Fitness Passport and gym membership discounts, and social clubs.§ § §This position has been identified as child related work, in accordance with the Child Protection (Working with Children) Regulation 2013. Therefore, your application must include a Working with Children Check (WWCC) number. For further information, go to www.newcheck.kids.nsw.gov.au.§ §Our Commitment to Safety§§ §Blacktown City Council is committed to safety. We have introduced alcohol and other drug testing at the pre-employment phase, and via a series of random tests, tests where there may be reasonable suspicion and / or post reportable incident testing for Council workers.§ §Position Description § §Click §here§ §to view or download the position description.§ §            § § §Closing Date:            18 December 2020§ §Contact Officer:        Tristan Harris §8869 9009§INTERNAL REF:        Casual§§§§

jobText: TXT/50659788.txt	§Club Manager - Anytime Fitness§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Club Manager - Anytime Fitness§§Advertiser: §The trustee for Harpmill Gym Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§Experienced & Passionate Club Manager Wanted§ §Become part of Australia's largest and fastest growing 24/7 fitness club network with over 500 clubs in Australia and 4,500 clubs worldwide.  Our members love our gyms!  You'll love it too, if Fitness, People and Fun are your passion!!§ §About the Role§ §As Club Manager, you will be responsible for successfully managing the club and its team.  You will be mentored and guided in the Anytime Fitness processes and systems.  You will take complete ownership for driving membership sales and reaching sales targets, creating a fun gym environment for members, overseeing gym operations and implementing a range of retention strategies to service members and increase the club's profitability and performance.  In addition, opportunities will be presented to up-skill and learn other areas of the business.§ §What are we looking for?§ §A driven, outgoing and goal orientated club manager with great sales skills, professionalism and an ability to provide superior customer service to take the club to the next level. This is a full time position and is available to commence immediately.§ §What's in it for you?§ § §Excellent Salary Package§ §Opportunity to further your career with an international leading brand§ §Ongoing training and support§ §Free "Anywhere Club Access" (worldwide Anytime Fitness reciprocal membership)§ §Fun, Rewarding and social place to work§ §Key responsibilities will include:§ § §Lead by example and take ownership of the club's success§ §Achieve KPI's and sales targets§ §Proactively seek out and generate new sales leads and referrals§ §Develop and implement marketing and sales plans§ §Lead a small team of trainers§ §Provide superior customer service§ §Create a vibrant, fun and positive club culture§ §Promote the club brand and image within the local community§ §Ensure Anytime Fitness processes and guidelines are followed at all times§ §Essential Criteria:§ § §Management Experience§ §Administration Experience (desirable)§ §A strong focus on sales with a proven sales background§ §Excellent communication and interpersonal skills§ §A passion for fitness, health and wellness§ §Able to work independently§ §A hands-on and positive "can-do" attitude with the desire to succeed§ §A desire to create a fun and vibrant culture within the club§ §Flexibility to work 6 days including Saturday and evenings§ §Qualifications:§ § §Certificate 3 or 4 in Fitness (desirable but not essential)§ §Current First Aid and CPR Certificate (or willing to obtain immediately if successful)§ §Please apply with an up to date resume and cover letter answering the key selection criteria listed above.§ §We look forward to hearing from you!!!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Have you completed a qualification in fitness?§§§

jobText: TXT/50665061.txt	§Physical Training Instructor (Reserve)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Physical Training Instructor (Reserve)§§Advertiser: §Defence Force Recruiting Eastern Region§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Newcastle, Maitland & Hunter§§Salary§§$199.83 per day tax-free§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Physical Training Instructor (Reserve) §      §        §Your Role: §        §Are you a qualified personal trainer looking for a new challenge? You could be a part time Physical Training Instructor in the Air Force.§        § §        §Your role as a Physical Training Instructor (Reserve) will enable you to apply your expertise within a military environment to Air Force personnel, within gymnasiums and leisure facilities. You’ll provide strength and functional physical training, injury prevention, rehabilitation, recreational activities and much more. It’s a physically demanding role, but that’s all part of the excitement.§        § §        §While physical fitness is important, it’s not 100% of this role. You’ll also support your team mentally, offering guidance and encouragement, as well as education on mental wellness.§        § §        §The Air Force also offers a great work-life balance, job security, and world-class military training. You may have opportunities to travel and learn skills that you can take back to your full-time career—all while having fun with new mates.§        § §        §If you are looking for an exciting part time role that fits around your schedule, look no further.§        § §        §Life in the Air Force: §        §There’s no career that compares to one in the Air Force. Become a part of a world-class military force that operates some of the most advanced aircraft and defence technology in the world. You can expect to work in a uniquely challenging yet highly rewarding working environment that comes with good work/life balance, competitive salary and skills for life. There’s also the sense of accomplishment and pride from serving your country and helping to keep our airspace safe.§        § §        § §        §Life in the Air Force is anything but mundane. You’ll enjoy an exciting lifestyle, rewarding career, opportunities to travel, excellent social and fitness facilities.§        § §        §Salary: §        §Get paid to train and learn the military skills required to undertake a Physical Training Instructor (Reserve) role in the Air Force. Upon completion, you’ll enjoy a tax-free daily rate of $199.83. This includes a Reserve Allowance. §        § §        §Apply Now: §        §For this role, you must be over 17 at time of enlistment, an Australian Citizen and must be considered Trade Qualified (includes the possession of a Bachelor of Sports Science, or industry equivalent tertiary qualification, as well as a minimum of two years industry experience within the last five years).§        § §        §Click the APPLY button if you think you have what it takes to become an Air Force Physical Training Instructor (Reserve) and we’ll get in contact with you shortly.§        § §        §You can also visit the link below to view the full position description and learn more about life in the Air Force.§        § §        §https://www.defencejobs.gov.au/jobs/reserves/air-force/physical-training-instructor§        § §      §    §    §  §§§Your Role: § §Are you a qualified personal trainer looking for a new challenge? You could be a part time Physical Training Instructor in the Air Force.§ § § §Your role as a Physical Training Instructor (Reserve) will enable you to apply your expertise within a military environment to Air Force personnel, within gymnasiums and leisure facilities. You’ll provide strength and functional physical training, injury prevention, rehabilitation, recreational activities and much more. It’s a physically demanding role, but that’s all part of the excitement.§ § § §While physical fitness is important, it’s not 100% of this role. You’ll also support your team mentally, offering guidance and encouragement, as well as education on mental wellness.§ § § §The Air Force also offers a great work-life balance, job security, and world-class military training. You may have opportunities to travel and learn skills that you can take back to your full-time career—all while having fun with new mates.§ § § §If you are looking for an exciting part time role that fits around your schedule, look no further.§ § § §Life in the Air Force: § §There’s no career that compares to one in the Air Force. Become a part of a world-class military force that operates some of the most advanced aircraft and defence technology in the world. You can expect to work in a uniquely challenging yet highly rewarding working environment that comes with good work/life balance, competitive salary and skills for life. There’s also the sense of accomplishment and pride from serving your country and helping to keep our airspace safe.§ § § § § §Life in the Air Force is anything but mundane. You’ll enjoy an exciting lifestyle, rewarding career, opportunities to travel, excellent social and fitness facilities.§ § § §Salary: § §Get paid to train and learn the military skills required to undertake a Physical Training Instructor (Reserve) role in the Air Force. Upon completion, you’ll enjoy a tax-free daily rate of $199.83. This includes a Reserve Allowance. § § § §Apply Now: § §For this role, you must be over 17 at time of enlistment, an Australian Citizen and must be considered Trade Qualified (includes the possession of a Bachelor of Sports Science, or industry equivalent tertiary qualification, as well as a minimum of two years industry experience within the last five years).§ § § §Click the APPLY button if you think you have what it takes to become an Air Force Physical Training Instructor (Reserve) and we’ll get in contact with you shortly.§ § § §You can also visit the link below to view the full position description and learn more about life in the Air Force.§ § § §https://www.defencejobs.gov.au/jobs/reserves/air-force/physical-training-instructor§ § §§§§

we like friendly people!§ §Extensive staff training and ongoing professional development will be provided.§ §Applicants must have completed an undergraduate degree in Exercise Science or similar.§Please submit a covering letter along with your resume to Centre Manager, Alex Bussell.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50635079.txt	§Community Street Soccer Program - Adelaide Assistant Coach§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Community Street Soccer Program - Adelaide Assistant Coach§§Advertiser: §The Big Issue§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Salary§§$25 - $29.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§Job Summary §  §Coaching a weekly Community Street Soccer Program session in Adelaide - Wednesday afternoons (min 2 hours per week).§  §THE BIG ISSUE COMMUNITY STREET SOCCER PROGRAM§  §The Big Issue Australia is an independent community organisation that develops and operates social enterprises and creative, sustainable solutions to homelessness; providing opportunities for homeless and marginalised people to positively change their lives.§  §Our innovative programs and services focus on helping people who are socially disadvantaged, and may otherwise slip through the cracks, to build confidence and the capacity to help themselves.§  §The Community Street Soccer Program, known as Street Soccer, uses the power of sport to empower homeless, marginalised and disadvantaged to achieve positive personal outcomes to reach their potential. It changes lives and creates healthier communities across Australia.§  §Street Soccer involves males and females getting together once a week for fun soccer training and matches. Equipment and a dedicated Street Soccer coach are provided at each location.§  §The program aims to achieve outcomes for its participants in three key areas: sport access / participation, social inclusion and health.§  §POSITION DESCRIPTION - ASSISTANT COACH§  §You are an enthusiastic, energised coach with the skills to deliver a soccer program for homeless, marginalised and disadvantaged young people in Adelaide.§  §This is a role that allows you to use your interpersonal and communication skills to motivate people in difficult circumstances helping them set themselves achievable goals and encouraging them to seek support for the issues that they may be facing.§  §Reporting to the Adelaide Coordinator, you will be responsible for coaching weekly Street Soccer training sessions that will incorporate some stretching, simple fitness work skills, a match and promoting the program to key stakeholders in your local area.§  §The most critical aspect of the role is connecting with the participants and providing them with direction and encouragement to develop and grow as individuals in our community.§  §Demonstrated experience in a sport or community role would be highly regarded, but not essential. We are looking for someone with a maturity in their attitude, confidence and natural communication skills to work easily with our clients, other staff members and volunteers.§  §KEY RESULTS AREAS§ § §Plan each two hour session carefully and prepare equipment for training§ §Conduct Street Soccer training sessions each week completing components of training as outlined by the National Coach (includes formal introduction, skills session, physical training, game component and summary)§ §Provide a level of informal mentoring and role modelling to players at training§ §Encourage and facilitate peer support§ §Develop regular opportunities for participants to take responsibility of sessions and events§ §Work collaboratively with the Adelaide Coordinator to develop and run events and activities that allow players to demonstrate the skills and attitude they have developed in the program§ §Coordinate a team of volunteers to support training sessions§ §Complete administrative requirements which includes filling out players code of conducts, attendance records and incident report forms§ §Promote the program to a range of support services and recruit participants to the program.§ §KEY SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE§ § §Ability to conduct a basic soccer training session using your personality and creativity to make participants feel relaxed, engaged and welcome§ §Ability to work and motivate people facing difficulties in their lives§ §Ability to engage and develop relationships with disadvantaged people§ §Ability to provide informal mentoring and act as a role model to program participants§ §Ability to make sessions fun and challenging for players of all abilities and varied intellectual and physical capabilities§ §Ability to engage and develop relationships with community agencies§ §Knowledge of local services available to disadvantaged people and basic ability to refer players to these organisations§ §Ability to recruit train and supervise volunteers§ §Experience in running leisure recreational activities for disadvantaged people would be desirable but not essential.§ §Our Values § § §We treat all people with dignity and respect§ §We operate ethically and with integrity§ §We think creatively and without limits§ §We strive for continuous improvement§ §We apply prudent financial and business practices§ §We are economically, environmentally and socially responsible§ §We value, encourage and support our employees.§ §To Apply§Upload a copy of your CV and cover letter addressed to Matt Stedman, State Operations Manager - SA & NT§  §For any questions, contact §mstedman@bigissue.org.au§  §Applications close 2.00pm Friday 9 October 2020§  §Prior to an offer of employment all applicants must undertake a National Police Check and Working With Children Check.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§Do you have a current Police Check (National Police Certificate) for employment?§Which of the following First Aid accreditations do you currently hold?§§§

jobText: TXT/50661402.txt	§Personal Trainer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Personal Trainer§§Advertiser: §UP Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§Ultimate Performance was founded for one simple reason - we wanted to create the most effective method of personal training. We eat, sleep and breathe health and fitness. We are on call 24/7. We travel all over the world to learn from the best of the best. This shows in the spectacular results we achieve for our clients and for ourselves.§ §We are constantly driven by the incredible sense of fulfillment we feel when we help someone achieve their goals – no matter if they’re an elite athlete or a middle-aged housewife. We believe that anyone can positively change themselves and their bodies, and we will move heaven and earth to ensure that each and every person who enters our premises leaves feeling happier, more confident, and healthier.§ § § §We are looking for Personal Trainers to join us at our gym in Sydney, NSW.§ §As we are entering a hiring phase your experience level is not important, although of course if you have the right experience there is a premium we would willingly pay for that.§ §You can also be as green and new to the industry as they come (though you would need to have a Personal Training qualification). Our goal would be to educate and mould you as one of the future leaders of UP, just as we have already done with some of the trainers who joined us as juniors on our first Junior Training Scheme in 2012.§ §We are a meritocracy and only care about your ability to get the job done and your overall potential.§ § § §ATTITUDE IS EVERYTHING. Aptitude can be taught but you do need to look hard at yourself before you apply to UP. We are not an easy company to work for because we demand that you deliver your very best performance every single time. This is the UP Way and it is a non-negotiable quality that we are looking for.§ § § §If you are interested in building a career that will allow you to:§ §1) See the world.§ §2) Be pushed to never accept anything less than your very best.§ §3) Work alongside some of the leading trainers in the fitness industry§ §4) Build a genuine career that is much more than trading your time for money on a commercial gym floor, so that you can grow into the right long-term role for you.§ §5) Work in a culture where results, not numbers are the name of the game.§ §6) Be judged for your ability to "make a change" (which can mean many things depending upon the client and the niche that you yourself follow) and not on your ability to self-promote and talk about yourself on social media.§ §Then we want to speak to YOU!§ § § §To find out more about careers at UP, check out our recruitment videos at https://upfitness.com/en/careers§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Have you completed a qualification in fitness?§§§

jobText: TXT/50665940.txt	§Membership Officers - Crunch Fitness Rockdale§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Membership Officers - Crunch Fitness Rockdale§§Advertiser: §HealthyPeople§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §Southern Suburbs & Sutherland Shire§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Other§§§§§§Have a passion for fitness, strong customer service skills and want to be a part of an energetic & growing company? Crunch is all about having fun!§ §Crunch Membership Officer - Rockdale§ §The explosive global brand Crunch Fitness is now looking for high energy Membership Officers who want to help people change their lives through health and fitness.§ §Want a role that will be flexible but one that will still give you career progression and a long-term career goal?§ §If your answer is yes, then it's Crunch time!§ §Crunch Fitness is the original No Judgments gym with over 140 clubs in the USA, and growth in Australia across Sydney and Melbourne. Crunch Fitness was brought to Australia by New Evolution Ventures (NeV) Australia. NeV Australia owns and operates not only Crunch Fitness, but other high-profile brands such as Hard Candy Fitness and UFC Gym Sydney - meaning the opportunities are endless. Joining the Crunch Fitness team, you would be joining the NeV family to help us work together to empower people to live out their dreams. This is something that we do every day through our range of fitness centres that change lives for the better.§ §To be successful in this role you will:§ § §Have a passion for fitness!§ §Have strong customer service skills§ §Be currently working towards or possess a tertiary qualification in business, fitness, health or a similar discipline.§ §Want to work in a role where you get to work hard, play hard, love what you do and are motivated to grow with the company.§ §Be passionate about health and fitness and seek to share this with others.§ §Be looking for anywhere from §20-35 hours casual work per week§ in a dynamic team of like-minded people.§ §Hold current First Aid & CPR Certification§ §Prior experience in sales, customer service or a retail environment is highly advantageous§ §Qualifications in Cert 3/4 in Fitness are preferred but not a necessity§ §Hold current First Aid & CPR Certification§ §If you were successful in this role, your responsibilities would include:§ § §Encourage guests to start or continue on their fitness journeys through their investment in a Crunch Fitness membership§ §Provide our members and guest with 5-star customer treatment§ §Meet and greet members and guests (both in face and on the phone)§ §Help members check in to the club§ §Answer any general membership enquiries at the front desk§ §Be a brand ambassador and helping sell our Crunch retail§ §Assist our General Manager to look after the operational aspects of the club§ §And, (last but not least) to continue to drive the fun, 'no judgments' vibe that is Crunch Fitness through your bubbly personality, determination and drive§ §This role has great career progression with a path to 2IC and General Management for the right person.§ §If this is the job for you please send us an application including a cover letter and a full resume via the 'Apply' button below.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50641200.txt	§Duty Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Duty Manager§§Advertiser: §Mitchell Shire Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §Northern Suburbs§§Salary§§Hourly rate $37.78 to $39.59 (Band 4) + 9.5% Super§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§Duty Manager§§Casual Position§§Hourly rate $37.78 to $39.59 (Band 4) + 9.5% Super§§Mitchell Shire Council is one of Victoria's fastest growing municipalities on Melbourne's northern growth corridor. Located in the heart of Victoria, Mitchell Shire forms part of the Goulburn River Valley Region, renowned for it’s scenic beauty rich in both history and heritage, within a leisurely drive from the city. We're an easy commute from Melbourne and offer great affordable living for those considering a lifestyle change. §Mitchell Shire  provides a supportive workplace with a real opportunity to make a positive impact on the community. The Council also offers ongoing professional development opportunities and workplace flexibility within a supportive and innovative work environment.§As a valued member of the Leisure Services Team, the Duty Manager is responsible for the daily operations of the centre whilst on shift. You will have delegated authority of the Leisure Services Coordinator and will provide overall operational leadership and accountability for the supervision of the facility users and staff. §Duty Managers will maintain a broad knowledge of centre programs and services whilst at the same time managing the following functions whilst on shift; customer service, safety, staff rosters and breaks, plant operations, cash balancing, customer education and general maintenance and cleaning. The Duty Manager will act as a positive role model in an effort to build strong people, strong families and strong communities within the community. §To be successful in this role you will have:§ §§Current Pool Lifeguard certificate§Current Level 2 first aid unit code HLTAID003§Current CPR certificate§Aquatics Technical Operators Certificate (Desirable)§Current employee Working with Children Check§A high level of customer service skills§Willingness to undertake National Police Check§§The successful applicant will be required to obtain an employee Working with Children Check prior to commencement.§All applications must address the Key Selection Criteria in the position description. To apply for this position, please go to our e-recruit page: www.mitchellshire.vic.gov.au/council/careers-employment [link removed]§Applications close at 9am Monday 14 October 2020.§§ 500307 - Duty Manager (1).pdf [link removed]§§ Mitchell Shire Council is a Child Safe Organisation§ § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50590110.txt	§Fitness Instructor - RUN Athletic§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Fitness Instructor - RUN Athletic§§Advertiser: §FIT Lane Cove§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§$45 - $50 per class§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§About RUN Athletic§  §RUN Athletic is a brand new performance based Running + HIIT studio within FIT Lane Cove, situated on the lower North Shore of Sydney.. Delivering a state of the art HIIT training experience by combining the brilliantly versatile and cutting edge SKILLRUN treadmills from TechnoGym with dynamic functional and core based movement to create an indoor running and HIIT experience like no other.§  §Find out more here https://www.fit.com.au/run-athletic§  §Job Description§  §We are looking for energetic, creative, enthusiastic and professional instructors to lead our new studio team. You, along with the rest of the team, will be responsible for the co-creation, ongoing development and implementation of all RUN Athletic classes, while ensuring the highest quality delivery and member experience throughout the entire studio.§  §A natural born leader, our RUN Athletic Senior Instructors not just lead by example but inspire, motivate and encourage both other instructors and members to achieve greatness each and every day. With the ability to clearly and confidently manage large, dynamic groups while also providing individual attention across each session, RUN ATHLETIC instructors are the instructors every member aspires to be.§  §Including class creation and design, managing and collaborating with your team of instructors to deliver unique experiences within the studio, and ensuring each and every class delivered is a world class experience from start to finish.§  §On a macro level the successful candidate will work with the FIT Lane Cove management team to build RUN Athletic into an amazingly successful and transformational fitness offering that complements the rest of FIT Lane Coves club offering, while continuing to create a forward thinking, engaging and inspiring fitness product for our members.§  §The successful candidates will also be presented, as Senior Instructors, with the opportunity to increase earnings via personal training work in addition to their Senior Instructor scope of work.§  §This position is not for the everyday instructor - The RUN ATHLETIC Senior Instructor positions available are truly unique position for a truly unique individuals!§  §A background in running or run coaching is desired but not essential.§  § §  §Job responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:§ § § §Leading inspirational and engaging RUN Athletic sessions (10-20+ sessions per week)§  § § §Creation and development of new session styles and structures§  § § §Timetable and session programming and class covers§  § § §Assisting FIT Lane Cove management team in achieving its overall goals and individual studio KPIs§  § § §Provide ongoing training, support and evaluation of your RUN Athletic team§  § § §Ensuring that RUN Athletic is clean, well maintained and perfectly presented at all times§  § § §Ensuring a high level of member participation and satisfaction in RUN Athletic§  § § §Engaging with your RUN Athletic instructor team on a weekly basis to ensure that they continue to love what they do, be able to do it to the best of their ability and continually educate and train§ them to ensure amazing experiences for everyone in the studio.§  § § §  §Qualifications§  §The successful candidate must have the following skills and experience:§ § § §Minimum of 2 years experience as a fitness instructor in a functional fitness style studio (3 years+ or prior position as Head Trainer/Instructor preferred)§  § § §Cert III & IV in Personal Training§  § § §Must possess a current CPR and First Aid certificate§  § § §Have a proven track record in the creation and delivery of functional fitness style classes§  § § §Be an enthusiastic and friendly leader who is driven by other peoples success§  § § §Excellent communication, problem solving, time management, organisational and customer service skills are essential§  § §Think this is for you?§  §Then we'd LOVE to hear from you! Please provide a Cover Letter and your CV and we will be in touch!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as a fitness instructor?§Which of the following First Aid accreditations do you currently hold?§§§

jobText: TXT/50639581.txt	§Personal Trainer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Personal Trainer§§Advertiser: §integratedliving Australia Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Newcastle, Maitland & Hunter§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§Role Details§ § §Part time role - 24 hpw - Tuesdays to Fridays§ §Working at both Wharf Rd in Newcastle and Raymond Terrace Wellness Centres§ §Competitive salary 50K pro-rata + superannuation + salary packaging option (up to $15,900 tax free)§ §Must have a current registration with Fitness Australia§ § §About us§ §integratedliving is an industry-leading provider known for its person centered approach to care. We are committed to delivering better health and well being outcomes for our regional and remote clients.§ §As an organization, we have been concentrating on providing exceptional in-home care to aged care clients with a 2024 focus of transforming to the leading provider of health and community care services for people who are either aging or living with a chronic illness or disability. If you would like to be a part of this exciting time, please read on and apply to be a part of the journey! § §Job tasks and responsibilities§ §Reporting to the Wellness Exercise Team Leader Personal trainers are work closely with the Allied Health team and are responsible for the delivery of individualised and comprehensive exercise programs to suit older people and people living with disabilities. The focus of these programs include but is not limited to falls prevention, pain and injury management as well as social support to our client base.§ §Working within our state of the art Wellness Centres, our Personal Trainers achieve client satisfaction through seamless delivery of innovative programs that are developed with our clients’ needs in mind. This position will:§ § §Supervise the delivery of group exercise programs.§ §Exercise delivery inclusive of demonstrating, instructing and modifying program content for each client.§ §Provide guidance, motivation and social support to our clients to assist them to reach their goals.§ §Provide feedback to assist with health maintenance and risk management.§ §Facilitate stretch and flow classes. § §Develop networks and partnerships with important partners and stakeholders within the local community.§ §Consistently reach set KPI’s.§ § §Skills and experience you will need to succeed§ § §Minimum Certificate 4 in Personal Training § §Minimum 1 year experience delivering prescribed gym based exercise programs for the over 55's or extensive experience working with the elderly in a similar environment in addition to qualifications§ §Registration as an Exercise Professional by Fitness Australia § §Valid First Aid and CPR certificate§ §Ability to develop networks and partnerships with important partners and stakeholders within the local community§ §Confident in using different forms of technology such as smart phones, handheld devices, email and internet§ §Drivers licence and ability to travel essential§ §Satisfactory completion of a police record check§ § §Benefits for you§ §We offer a growing range of benefits including:§ § §Flexible, supportive work environment§ §Pay less tax through salary packaging options § §Professional development and career progression opportunities§ §A safe and healthy workplace culture which promotes diversity and mutual respect § § §If you have the drive, commitment and desire to make a difference by supporting our valued clients then this could be the opportunity for you!§ § § §Don’t delay as we’re assessing applications as they are received. We’d love to hear how your capabilities, achievements and experiences set you apart§ § § §Position Enquires: Angela - (02) §4911 2631§ §  §Integratedliving values diversity and promotes understanding and inclusion of all people organisation wide. Our workforce proudly reflects the local communities we live and work in and we actively encourage all applications§ § § § § § § § § §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50695614.txt	§Aquatic Centre - Head Coach§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Aquatic Centre - Head Coach§§Advertiser: §St Andrew's Anglican College§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sunshine Coast§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§§ABOUT THE COLLEGE:§St Andrew’s Anglican College is a leading Independent School on the beautiful Sunshine Coast, with an enviable reputation for promoting excellence in every aspect of the College life to enable students to move confidently into their future. St Andrew’s has over 1300 students, naturally flowing from Kindergarten through to Year 12, with the state-of-the-art facilities and high calibre staff. §St Andrew’s strives to be an employer of choice by offering a vibrant state of the art Aquatic Centre with motivated and engaging staff with fantastic work conditions and lifestyle.§St Andrew’s incredible Aquatic Centre offers:§§    §A 10 lane 50m pool which is 2m deep throughout§    §Undercover 15m learn to swim pool§    §The undercover grandstand can comfortably seat 500 spectators close to the action§    §The high definition 5m display screen for instant results and video review§    §Brand new changing rooms and office space§    §Club rooms and learning space§    §Function rooms§    §Healthy food and beverage at the Lanes Cafe§§ABOUT THE ROLE:§The Head Coach is responsible for the Aquatic Centre Squads program and providing leadership and direction to the St Andrew’s Swim Club. Reporting to the Head of Business Services, the Head Coach will lead, develop and implement all of the Centre’s squad programs.  §PRIMARY OBJECTIVES:§The Head Coach will build and develop the High Performance and Competition, and Development Programs so that all squad participants have the opportunity to compete at their highest level; ensuring strong links and philosophical progression from Learn-to-Swim, into School Swimming and through to high performance swimming.§KNOWLEDGE & SKILL REQUIREMENTS:§§    §Tertiary qualifications relevant to the operation of an aquatic centre and swim coaching are highly desirable.§    §Hold a current Australian Swimming and Coaches Teaching Association coaching licence with a minimum standard of Silver level accreditation.§    §Current Swimming Pool Plant Operators and Maintenance Certificate, or ability to obtain the Certificate.§    §Current Senior First Aid and CPR Certificate.§    §Pool Lifeguard Certificate.§    §Microsoft Office (Excel / Word / Outlook)§    §Familiarity with timesheet and time in attendance processes§    §Working knowledge of Simply Swim an advantage.§    §Hold a current, valid Blue Card as required under the Working with Children (Risk Management and Screening) Act 2000§    §All prospective candidates (over 18) are required to undergo a check against the Anglican Church National Professional Standards Register.§§In order to undertake this role, the successful candidate will possess the following attributes:§§    §Team player§    §Infectious enthusiasm§    §Sense of humour§    §Creativity and flexibility§    §Self-direction and an ability to lead others§    §Ability to explore and introduce new ideas and programs§    §Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage, persuade and inspire others§    §A high degree of emotional intelligence§    §Excellent communication skills, both oral and written§§APPLICATIONS CLOSE:§    12:00 Midday, Friday 23rd October 2020.§§TO APPLY:§§Please select "apply now" and provide a covering letter and resume. A maximum of 6 pages would be appreciated. We suggest using Google Chrome browser for optimal results. Alternatively, a position description and the option to apply directly is available by going to the College website at www.saac.qld.edu.au/jobs.§St Andrew’s has a commitment to creating environments for children and young people to thrive. All applicants are instructed to read and reflect their agreement of the Code of Conduct for Anglican Schools which is located on our website - related documents and Code of Conduct.§§St Andrew's is an equal opportunities employer, ATSI people are encouraged to apply for positions within the College. To work in regulated child-related employment you will need to hold a current valid blue card. All prospective candidates (over 18) are required to undergo a check against the Anglican Church National Standards Register.§§St Andrew's is carrying out good hygiene practices and social/physical distancing for our recruitment process during COVID-19. The recruitment process may take longer than usual due to these circumstances§§§§

With almost unmatched growth expected over the next 25 years, we are on an exciting journey of transformation to prepare for a population of more than 550,000. jobText: TXT/50684963.txt	§Group Fitness Coach / Personal Trainer - BPM Fitness Studios Hampton§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Group Fitness Coach / Personal Trainer - BPM Fitness Studios Hampton§§Advertiser: §HealthyPeople§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §Bayside & South Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§Competitive market rate§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§About us§ §Based in Hampton, §BPM Fitness§ brings together team-based high-intensity functional training and technology within a fun, challenging and rewarding environment. We offer our members a unique and fully supervised 45 min interval and circuit-based workout with no set class times.§ §The Role§ §Our Group Fitness is different. Our coaches thrive on delivering individualised feedback and instruction whilst creating a high energy training zone. If you feel like this is a role you could excel in we would love to hear from you. We are looking for experienced, energetic, self-motivated professionals with plenty of drive and personality to make it a fun and community-based experience.§ §Key Responsibilities:§ § §Prepare, set-up and pack-up for each session - sessions provided by BPM§ §Deliver a quality, technique and results-focused workout every-time§ §Ensure the studio is always clean and well presented.§ §Foster a positive, motivational small group training environment.§ §A willingness to work flexible hours (split shifts and Saturdays)§ §Manage member enquiries§ §Provide a fantastic member experience (in accordance with the BPM system) to assist in member retention and goal attainment.§ §Key Attributes: § § §Team player, with the ability to follow the BPM system§ §Supportive and member-focused attitude§ §Great communication skills§ §Attention to technique and individual needs§ §Flexible and adaptable§ §Self-motivated and goal-oriented§ §Passion for the health and well being of members§ §Experience and Qualifications: § § §Certificate III / IV in Fitness§ §Current First Aid and CPR certificates§ §ABN & Insurances§ §The successful Coach will receive a competitive market rate and full training in the product / technology and exercise programming.§ §Apply today:§ §Please submit a cover letter outlining your availability, along with a CV or similar via the APPLY button.§§§§

The person will be able to motivate, inspire and deliver training.§The candidate will ideally be experienced in the health, fitness, leisure or recreation industry in a management, sales, marketing or centre/facility as necessary with the outcome to turn a prospective member/guest to an ongoing member of the facility§Set rosters in line with the business budgets§Strategic planning development and implementation§Attending and participating in centre senior leadership meetings and projects§Compiling and presenting monthly reports§ §Skillset§Experience in a sales and customer facing Our core areas of business and facilities stewardship include health clubs, wellness and spa, golf, aquatic and sporting venues in 150 locations across Australia and New Zealand.§ §If you are a passionate person who realises the tremendous opportunity this role offers and want to utilise your skills and passion in an aquatic and leisure environment, we want to hear from you!§ §Simply complete the application process by clicking the Apply Now button and we'll be in touch.§Marrickville 2204 NSW§§§§
