jobText: TXT/50557582.txt	§Centre Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Centre Manager§§Advertiser: §Belgravia Health & Leisure Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§SA, Port Pirie Recreation Centre - Port Pirie 5540§Port Pirie Aquatic & Leisure Centre§Port Pirie Sporting Precinct§Crystal Brook Swimming Pool § §Lead a team of passionate people§Great opportunity with a growing and entrepreneurial organisation§Free facility access and great benefits§ §The Company§Belgravia Leisure is part of the Belgravia Health and Leisure Group (BHLG) and is the fastest growing leisure organisation in Australia. Our core areas of business and facilities stewardship include health clubs, wellness and spa, golf, aquatic and sporting venues in 150 locations across Australia and New Zealand.§ §We are in an exciting period of growth, and look to continue to diversify and deliver results while being a strong community citizen. With an annual turnover in excess of $180m, the group are looking for the best and brightest to assist with taking the organisation into the future.§ §The Role§An exciting opportunity has arisen for a suitably qualified and experienced Centre Manager to lead the team to deliver exceptional customer experience on a full time fixed term basis. Responsible for the management of these fantastic facilities, the team at the Centre and our local community, you are fully accountable for the Centre’s operational, financial and program deliverables.§ §You will develop and execute plans through engagement with the Centre’s leadership team, key stakeholders and the local Council. With an experience in sales, financial and risk management, you will continue to drive the Centre’s overall success.§ §Key Accountabilities§Ensure the safety and well-being of visitors and employees through effective planning and oversight of polices, processes and procedures.§Coach and develop leaders to deliver on KPIs through engagement, performance planning and individual development plans.§Lead and drive a high performance community minded culture through highly visible and hands-on leadership and team engagement.§Achievement of budgeted performance targets.§Maintain a high value relationship with local Council.§Implement a high value customer service proposition that addresses the needs of the client base.§Recruitment of energetic, diverse and passionate employees as required to compliment the team and the vision for the Centre.§Train staff as required to ensure that knowledge and capability are at the required levels to enable staff to carry out their work and achieve their objectives.§Identify staff and develop career progression paths that lead to transparent and effective succession decisions when required.§Maintain facilities to approved standards in line with contract requirements.§ §About You§You will be a up and coming leader, who drives with vision and energy. You are passionate about leisure, wanting to join a growing organisation. You will be able to share insights into how you have successfully shaped high performance teams into business actions. You can easily articulate the link between employee engagement and exceptional business performance.§ §Essential Skills and Qualifications:§A minimum 2 years’ experience in managing a team§Experience managing a leisure, aquatic or event/function facility§Highly developed communication skills with a flair for positive influencing and negotiating win-win outcomes§Sound knowledge of health and safety legislation§Experience in planning and execution of operational, financial and people plans to successful outcomes§Experience in planning and organising events§Current CPR Certificate§Current First Aid Certificate (Level 2)§National Police Check§Working with Children Check§Legal working rights in Australia§ §Desirable:§Qualification in a related field for example:§ Swimming Instructor Qualification, Pool Lifeguard Certificate and or Pool Operators Certificate§ §If you are a person who is passionate about leisure and wants to utilise your skills and experience in the leisure industry, we want to hear from you!§ §Port Pirie 5540 SA§§§§

jobText: TXT/50639166.txt	§Personal Trainer - Muswellbrook§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Personal Trainer - Muswellbrook§§Advertiser: §integratedliving Australia Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Newcastle, Maitland & Hunter§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§Role Details§ § §Permanent Part-time position - 50 hours per fortnight§ §Located in our Muswellbrook Wellness Centre§ §Competitive salary + superannuation + salary packaging (up to $15,900 tax free)§ §Ability to work Monday to Friday§ §Must have a current registration with Fitness Australia§ § §About us§ §integratedliving is an industry-leading provider known for its person centered approach to care. We are committed to delivering better health and well being outcomes for our regional and remote clients.§ §As an organisation, we have been concentrating on providing exceptional in-home care to aged care clients with a 2024 focus of transforming to the leading provider of health and community care services for people who are either aging or living with a chronic illness or disability. If you would like to be a part of this exciting time, please read on and apply to be a part of the journey! § §Job tasks and responsibilities§ §Reporting to the Wellness Exercise Team Leader Personal trainers are work closely with the Allied Health team and are responsible for the delivery of individualised and comprehensive exercise programs to suit older people and people living with disabilities. The focus of these programs include but are not limited to falls prevention, pain and injury management as well as social support to our client base.§ §Working within our state of the art Wellness Centre in Muswellbrook, our Personal Trainers achieve client satisfaction through seamless delivery of innovative programs that are developed with our clients’ needs in mind. The position will:§ § §Supervise the delivery of group exercise programs.§ §Exercise delivery inclusive of demonstrating, instructing and modifying program content for each client.§ §Provide guidance, motivation and social support to our clients to assist them to reach their goals.§ §Provide feedback to assist with health maintenance and risk management.§ §Facilitate stretch and flow classes. § §Develop networks and partnerships with important partners and stakeholders within the local community.§ §Consistently reach set KPI’s.§ § §Skills and experience you will need to succeed§ § §Minimum Certificate 4 in Personal Training.§ §Minimum 1 year experience delivering prescribed gym based exercise programs for the over 55's or extensive experience working with the elderly in a similar environment in addition to qualifications.§ §Registration as an Exercise Professional by Fitness Australia. § §Valid First Aid and CPR certificate.§ §Ability to develop networks and partnerships with important partners and stakeholders within the local community.§ §Confident in use of different forms of technology such as smart phones, handheld devices, email and internet.§ §Drivers licence and ability to travel essential.§ §Satisfactory completion of a police record check.§ § §Benefits for you§ §We offer a growing range of benefits including:§ § §Flexible, supportive work environment.§ §Pay less tax through salary packaging options. § §Professional development and career progression opportunities.§ §A safe and healthy workplace culture which promotes diversity and mutual respect. § § § § §If you have the drive, commitment and desire to make a difference by supporting our valued clients then this could be the opportunity for you!§ §Don’t delay as we’re assessing applications as they are received. We’d love to hear how your capabilities, achievements and experiences set you apart§ § §Position Enquires: Angela - (02) §4911 2631§ § §Integratedliving values diversity and promotes understanding and inclusion of all people organisation wide. Our workforce proudly reflects the local communities we live and work in and we actively encourage all applications§ § § § § § § § § §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50610585.txt	§Tennis Junior Development Coach§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Tennis Junior Development Coach§§Advertiser: §Tennis Plus at Queens Park Tennis Centre§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Gold Coast§§Salary§§$55,000 - $60,000§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§JOB DESCRIPTION:§This individual will need to have good knowledge of the different colours stages of Tennis Australia ANZ Hot Shots Program and be able to effectively lead, develop and execute such program for the club.  The coach should be passionate and enthusiastic in delivering fun and interactive coaching sessions with children of all ages. The coach will be part of a team and will be required to contribute to the growth of the various areas of the tennis department.  In addition, the coach needs to be able to converse in Japanese language to run the existing players exchange programs with a Japanese tennis club in Japan. § §QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE§The ideal candidate will need to have:§Internationally recognised high performance tennis coaching qualifications.§A strong understanding of the Tennis Australia ANZ Hot Shots Program as well as capable to deliver coaching for both children and adults in both group and private lessons.§History of competitive play and a thorough understanding of the game of tennis.§Passion and love of working with children of all ages.§Experience in developing junior and senior elite tennis players throughout the pathway of development§High energy and ability to work at a senior level in fast paced and demanding environment§Strong communication skills in delivering coaching as well as a good working knowledge to converse in Japanese language for the purpose of handling Japanese students from the annual international players exchange programs.§Availability to work mornings and afternoons in a wide variety of abilities from Monday to Saturdays, as well as during school holiday periods for camps and clinics.§Willingness to undertake additional tasks including, but not limited to, helping out at the pro-shop and restring racquets.§Driver’s licence, own car and a Blue card.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have experience working with children?§Are you available to work school holidays?§§§

jobText: TXT/50664295.txt	§Personal Trainer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Personal Trainer§§Advertiser: §The Body Transformation Studio§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §Fremantle & Southern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§Do you have your Cert IV in Health and Fitness and some experience with 1-on-1 personal training?§ §Are you the type of person who enjoys talking to and building rapport with people of all ages and backgrounds?§ §Do you set an example by living a healthy lifestyle yourself?§ §If this sounds like you, then we’d love to hear from you.§ §The Body Transformation Studio is a privately owned gym and we take great pride in the excellent training service, guaranteed results, holistic education and motivation we provide to our loyal clients. We’ve got a phenomenal team of trainers who work with us and we’ve built a great reputation for ourselves in the industry. We’re expanding and looking for another passionate trainer to come and join our growing team.§ §Are you serious about building a career for yourself in the fitness industry? Are you looking to soak up as much knowledge and experience as you can?§ §We provide on-going training and support for our trainers. We really are a team. Rather than charge you rent and leave it up to you to find your own clients, we employ you and then work with you to expand your knowledge and experience. We handle all of the marketing, sales, renewals, scheduling, etc, and leave you freed up to do what you do best - deliver great training sessions!§ §We work cohesively as a team. We’re all on the same page and uphold the same high standards, and we’re looking for someone who will do the same. That means that people who are consistently late, are unreliable, and don’t try their best won’t last long here.§ §If you’re looking to take the next step towards building a solid career in fitness and you choose to apply, here’s what you’ll be saying yes to:§ § § §Training clients in a 1-on-1 and small group setting§ § § §Delivering pre-planned resistance training sessions with a high attention to detail for correct technique and client safety§ § § §Working 20-30 hours per week including mornings, evenings, and Saturdays.§ § § §Being employed and mentored§ § § §Training and interacting with people of all different ages and backgrounds§ § §And here’s what we require from you:§ § § §Cert IV minimum qualifications§ § § §Current First Aid Cert§ § § §Own transport§ § § §Australian Permanent Residency or Citizenship§ § § §Previous studio/gym personal training experience is desired but not essential§ § § §Further studies, courses and qualifications are desired but not essential§ § § §Reliable and punctual§ § § §Motivated and motivating§ § § §Mature and well groomed (professional)§ § § §Comfortable speaking to people of all ages and backgrounds§ § § §Eager to learn and build a long term career§ § §If this sounds like the job opportunity you’ve been looking for, then we’d love to hear from you.§ §Please send a detailed resume along with a cover letter (detailing your availability) to §laurie@bodytransformationstudio.com.au§.§ §If we like what we see, we'll be in touch via phone.§ §Good luck!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Have you completed a qualification in fitness?§How many years' experience do you have in the sports & fitness industry?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Do you own or have regular access to a car?§§§

jobTitle: JCU Student Association - Part-time Fitness Assistant (Customer Service) Job in Northern QLD - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50598739.txt	§JCU Student Association - Part-time Fitness Assistant (Customer Service)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§JCU Student Association - Part-time Fitness Assistant (Customer Service)§§Advertiser: §James Cook University Student Association§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Northern QLD§§Salary§§Fitness Centre Award, Level 2§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§Position Overview.§  §Permanent Part-Time position of 22 hours a week with the following roster:§  §Tuesdays: 5.15am – 10.15am, Wednesdays & Thursday:  5.00pm – 9pm, Saturdays: 8.00am – 1.00pm and Sundays: 2pm – 6pm §  §The role of the JCUSA Fitness Centre Assistant is to provide assistance with the administration and operational tasks required for the successful delivery of activities and services provided by the JCUSA Fitness Centre.  This will include cleaning due to the COVID-19 pandemic and possibly media and marketing tasks, as well as ensuring the safety of all participants of the JCUSA Fitness Centre at all times. §  §Principle Accountabilities§  §1. Assist with operational tasks required during the opening hours of the Fitness Centre:§ § §Cleaning of equipment, gym floor and surrounding areas.§ §Equipment checks and performing basic maintenance tasks as required.§ §Ensure adherence to Work Health and Safety requirements.§ §Report on any injuries/incidents according to JCUSA policies and procedures§ §2. Administration and Reception support:§ § §For the Sport and Recreation Manager and Fitness Centre Manager, as directed.§ §Provide information of services to current and potential members.§ §Help to control JCUSA Fitness Centre assets including merchandise and equipment.§ §Customer service and sales.§ §Collection and processing client payments and memberships.§ §Database entry and management.§ §Carrying out member retention strategies.§ §Recording and managing bookings for JCUSA Fitness facilities and programs.§ §Social media and advertising related tasks as required.§ §Selection Criteria.§  §Selection and appointments will be assessed against selection criteria:§ § §Sound organisational and time management skills.§ §Experience, skills and knowledge in customer service and retail sales.§ §Effective interpersonal skills and written and verbal communication skills that can be adapted for various audiences.§ §Demonstrated experience in maintaining a safe work environment and to all ensure all Workplace Health and Safety requirements are followed.§ §Ability to safely undertake manual handling tasks required in role.§ §Holder of a current Blue Card (Working with Children Check).§ §Current first aid qualifications, including CPR, or the ability to obtain prior to commencement of the position.§ §Highly Desirable:§ § §Experience in Fitness industry or similar role.§ §Certificate 3 and/or 4 in Fitness or similar qualification.§ §Knowledge and skills in marketing in order to increase membership numbers.§ §Experience in delivering social media and marketing campaigns.§ §Training in cleaning.§ §To apply:§  §***Previous applicants do not need to reapply***§  §DO NOT apply via Seek.  If you do your application will be disregarded.§  §Please email a resume and the addressed selection criteria (google STAR Selection Criteria for some guidance) that is listed above to §jcusa.generalmanager@jcu.edu.au§ with Part-time Fitness Assistant (Customer Service) Position - Application in the subject line.§  §You must have the right to work in Australia.§  §Applications close 5pm, 5th October 2020. §  §Interviews proposed for 9th October 2020 and the start date will be negotiated with the successful applicant.§  §Note - if you are interviewed you will need to bring a copy of your current First Aid qualifications, including CPR and a current Blue Card.§§§§

Lift Brands Australia and New Zealand comprises of Snap Fitness, 9Round and Yogafit Studios, a collection of fitness-minded businesses that share similar goals: creating comfortable, welcoming services that foster good health and wellness. From individual personalised workouts to group fitness training, each company has its own unique speciality. For both users and owners, these wellness brands serve as the foundation for a better life.§ §Position Summary § §Reporting to the Operations Manager, the Franchise Support Manager is responsible for driving growth within the Snap Fitness network by supporting Franchisees, Club Managers, and the Franchise Support Team (FST) to deliver performance targets and objectives. This position oversees and provides leadership to the FST and provides direct support to current and pre-sale clubs with optimizing day-to-day operations, performance, and compliance.§ §Tasks & Responsibilities § § §Provide guidance and support to club managers and franchisees on member growth strategies including sales, marketing, onboarding and retention.§ §Support clubs with effective member onboarding and induction processes, the execution of fitness challenges, promotion materials, member communications and in-store product offerings.§ §Assist clubs in measuring and analysing business performance and provide reporting and feedback on key drivers including membership yield, membership volume, upfront revenue, and PT revenue.§ §Assist club managers and franchisees with the effective implementation of marketing initiatives to increase lead generation through national, local, and digital strategies.§ §Collaborate with corporate marketing teams to drive network communications and contribute to national marketing campaign strategies. § §Support club managers and franchisees to create a positive, fair, and productive working environment and ensure all employees have completed required trainings and qualifications. § §Provide support to club operations through ensuring safe, clean, well-managed and maintained clubs and ensuring compliance with brand standards, Work Health Safety requirements, maintenance and cleanliness standards, and general franchise operations.§ §Deliver training and provide coaching to new and existing clubs on a range of operational best-practices.§ §Provide support, direction, and leadership to the FST though holding regular meetings, providing feedback and mentorship, managing workflow, delegating, and ensuring alignment of FST activities with overall business objectives and strategies.§ §Qualifications & Experience § § §Passionate about the health and fitness industry§ §Driven to achieve KPI’s and work as part of a dynamic and motivated team§ §Experience working in sales or operations preferred § §Experience working within the franchise industry preferred § §Benefits§ § §Lift Brands offers a competitive remuneration package§ §Complimentary 24/7 gym membership and access to 9Round studios§ §Free convenient on-site parking§ §A dynamic working environment and attractive workplace culture§ §This position may require interstate travel within Australia.§ §In your application or cover letter please include what company values you look for in an employer.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have in the sports & fitness industry?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§Do you have experience in a sales role?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

A rare opportunity with us, with over 100 personal trainers and a company dedicated to PT's, this won't last.§ § §Join a business that's striving to make a difference, not just a living.§ §Over 100 Personal Trainers across NSW and VIC. § §The chance to build your own team. § §Business pathway available to the right individual. § §Guaranteed clients and sessions.§ §The industry is changing and we're leading the way. Keen to actually make a difference? Join an organisation dedicated to sustainably changing the lives of our clients and our TRAINERS.§ §Come join our proud team at §Get Going Personal Training§! If you've been in the industry for a while, stop stressing about maintaining leads and clients and join a professional team that works with you rather than against you.§ §Get out of the cutthroat environment of lead generation.§ §We'll provide you with the tools you need to build your client books to 30+ sessions comfortably and quickly. § §OWN YOUR OWN GET GOING § §For those who we see fit, you may have the option of owning your own area so you can build your business alongside us!§ §Unlike other companies, we hand select our owners, making sure they align with the business. We want AMAZING people because those people build AMAZING companies.§ §We Offer:§ § §4-Week training and mentoring program§ §Ongoing support and learning§ §Weekly meetings§ §Help to build clientele as quickly as your potential allows§ §Earn $40.50 - $71.30 per session OR the chance to own your own Get Going. § §Opportunities to grow into higher positions within the organisation§ §Your Role:§ §As a Mobile (Home) Personal Trainer, you will be one of our home training specialists, providing training programming, implementation and advice!§ § §Look after your own clientele § §Manage your own database and accounts§ §Continuous learning and development§ §Benefits & Culture§ §We have developed, and continue to develop, an extremely motivating and fun environment for all of our talent to learn and grow. We believe that in order to inspire your clients the way that you've always desired, you need a supportive group of individuals around you!§ §Do I need to be based in the location advertised to apply for this role?§ §Absolutely not! You can be located anywhere in AUSTRALIA§ §Is there room to progress with Get Going? § §Of course! We are a rapidly expanding young business, growing 200% in the last 12 months! With this growth, comes more responsibility - therefore opportunity!§ §What makes Get Going a better place to work than its competitors? § §We aren't your average gym, we aren't your average studio and we sure as F*&! aren't your average mobile PT company! We pride ourselves on our team values, constant development and ability to produce sustainable results in our entire clientele. If you'd rather fight for every lead, be a lone wolf (or sheep) and become a generic 'PT' then Get Going ISN'T the place for you.§ §Requirements:§ § §Certificate IV in Health & Fitness (Personal Training)§ §Reliable car§ §First Aid and CPR§ §Generous availability§ §Positive attitude§ §Enthusiasm & self-motivation§ §Apply Now!§ §Send us your resume, cover letter and a bit about yourself via the APPLY button.§ §Or email Info@getgoingpt.com.au§§§§

jobText: TXT/50637272.txt	§club manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§club manager§§Advertiser: §Nex level fitness§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §North West & Hills District§§Salary§§$60,000 - $64,999 base plus commission§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§About the business§ § §Nex Level fitness  is setting it self as a new industry leader. we have been around for the last 4 years and growing year on year.§ § §About the role§ § §What are we looking for?§ §A driven, outgoing and goal orientated Club Manager with great sales skills, professionalism and an ability to provide superior customer service to take the club to the next level. This is a full-time position and is available to commence for an immediate start.§ §About the Role§ §As Club Manager, you will be responsible for successfully managing the club and it's team. You will be mentored and supported by the Club Owners, along with the Nex Level Fitness processes and systems. You will take complete ownership for driving membership sales and reaching sales targets, creating a fun gym environment for members, overseeing gym operations and implementing a range of retention strategies to service members and increase the club's profitability and performance. In addition, opportunities will be presented to up-skill and learn other areas of the business, whilst being supported by the owners who take an active involvement. § § §Skills and experience§ § §Key responsibilities will include:§ §Lead by example and take ownership of the club's success§Achieve KPI's and sales targets§Proactively seek out and generate new sales leads and referrals§Develop and implement marketing and sales plans§Support a team of Personal Trainers§Provide superior customer service§Create a vibrant, fun and positive club culture§Promote the club brand and image within the local community§Ensure Nex Level Fitness processes and guidelines are followed at all times§ § § §Essential Criteria:§ §Management Experience§Administration Experience§A strong focus on sales with a proven sales background.§Excellent communication and interpersonal skills§A passion for fitness, health and wellness§Able to work independently§A hands-on and positive "can-do" attitude with the desire to succeed§A desire to create a fun and vibrant culture within the club§Availability to work Monday - Friday (no requirement to work on weekends)§ §§§§

Operates in Perth & Sydney and Melbourne up to 16 hours a day, six days a week and seeks to provide all members with a positive, memorable experience.§ §SpeedFit combines personal training with EMS technology for an exceptionally effective workout in just 20 minutes per week. Our EMS training is effective, fun and low impact on the skeletal system (joints, tendons & ligaments). We cater for a wide variety of clients and their needs.§ §We are team of 50+ fitness & business professionals, with background from various areas, including Exercise Sports Scientists, Exercise Physiologists, Nutritionists, Yoga and Pilates Instructors, Strength Coaches and Personal Trainers…§ §About the role: § §Our Manager's§ own the success of their business and are responsible for local area marketing, sales and retention. They also champion team members with 5-star customer service while maintaining a high-end and professional facility.§ §Tips on getting the job:§ § §Have a passion for health and wellness.§ §Be proactive to achieve goals. § §Experience in sale§ §Desire to deliver excellent customer service.§ §Know how to get the best out of people.§ §Be hungry to up-skill, grow and develop yourself.§ §Be the life of the party.§ § §If we've just described you, we'd love to:§ § §Mentor you, set you challenges and watch you grow.§ §Reward your success and attitude.§ §Help drive and deliver on innervation!§ §Work hard, be a team player and join us!§ §If you've made it this far, there is only one thing left to do...§APPLY NOW§ §After successful interview you need to went through two weeks full time training with our head coach. § § § §Please provide a strong §COVER LETTER§ outlining your reason for applying, your current employment status and availability to start, plus a detailed §RESUME§.§ §Contact: Sally§ §Email: §sally@speedfit.com.au§ § § § § § § § § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Have you completed a qualification in fitness?§Do you have customer service experience?§Which of the following First Aid accreditations do you currently hold?§Do you have experience in a sales role?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

The Data & Insights Analyst will focus on developing Cricket NSW’s data maturity and culture to deliver business wide strategy and a customer focused approach.§ § §Key areas of responsibility include:§ § · Business Insights§ § · Analytics & Reporting§ § · Stakeholder Relationships§ § · Annual Census§ § This is a contract role until June 2021.§ § §About you§ §        §          §Tertiary degree qualified, preferably in a Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Statistics or related discipline§          §Experience using Power BI and CRM Systems§          §Analytical and problem-solving skills§          §Communications skills - ability to translate complex data into real and practical business activities§          §Ability to identify trends and extracts insights from data§        §        §What’s in it for you?§ § Build your skills in a high-growth professional environment. Join the vastly experienced Australian team responsible for the expansion plans for Crunch Fitness. Crunch is world famous for fusing entertainment with fitness, and as a result, provides an amazing work experience with potential for great career progression.§ § §About the role:§ §As an Assistant General Manager, you will assist in the delivery of the high service standards required to deliver on set goals. If you were successful in this position you would be mentored by the Regional Manager of Crunch Fitness, with the expectation of growth in to a General Manager Position in the future.§ § §To apply for this role you must be able to demonstrate skills in the following areas:§ § §People Management - You will be an approachable person who is experienced at managing people from a variety of backgrounds and levels.§ §Customer Service - You will be experienced and confident with providing exemplary service levels, face-to-face sales and driving no pressure enrollment, planning and driving Marketing Promotions and Communication.§ §Goals - You will have experience in working towards achieving targets so you can help drive your team to success.§ §Operations - Attention to detail will be a strong point and you will have experience in implementing and adhering to systems and procedures including managing client data and account management.§ §Experienced in Service Industry - experience in a service focused role or in the Fitness Industry would give you a strong advantage.§ §Your responsibilities would include:§ § §Helping to lead our team to drive new member targets and build the No Judgments culture.§ §To assist in the management of the day to day operational functions of a lively and energetic club.§ §To implement and ensure adherence to systems to run the club effectively.§ §This is a permanent position with typical hours scheduled between Tues-Sat, 11am-7pm, approx. 38 hours per week - jobTitle: Operations Manager Job in Sydney - SEEK
xenophobe: right to live and work
jobText: TXT/50637388.txt	§Operations Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Operations Manager§§Advertiser: §Blind Sports NSW§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§26 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §Parramatta & Western Suburbs§§Salary§§$30 - $39.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§Overview:§ §This position has been created for the purpose of implementing day to day strategies, from the Blind Sports NSW Executive Directors. In this role you will report directly to the Chairperson of Blind Sports NSW and work with the Executive Directors within the strategy and budget.As Blind Sports NSW has grown, there has now become a need for a Operations Manager role within the organisation to focus on developing partnerships, stakeholder collaboration, day to day financial management, social media marketing, volunteer and participation programs. The role will be based in your own office at Sydney Olympic Park’s Sports House only 3 minutes walk from Olympic Park train station, or drive to work with your own free car parking space supplied. After the initial training and probation period there may be an opportunity to work from home for a portion of your work week.§ §Key Responsibilities of the role:§ § §Manage all aspects of the day to day operations of Blind Sports NSW§ §Communicate with all affiliate members of the organisation around deliverables including meeting reports, marketing materials, monthly newsletter and event collaboration as required§ §Manage external stakeholder relationships, including Vision Australia, Guide Dogs, Save Sight, Health Professionals, Universities and Schools§ §Control day to day financing of the organisation through Xero, manage budgets approved by the Blind Sports NSW Executive board and provide monthly profit and loss statements to the Executive Board for review with the assistance of our Financial Director Marino. Prepare and work with the assigned auditor for Blind Sports NSW at the finalisation of each financial year to meet the constitutional requirements of Blind Sports NSW§ §Train, mentor and manage staff including the existing Programs Manager in addition to any student placements from school, TAFE or University that are assigned to Blind Sports NSW for projects to assist the organisation in delivery of strategy§ §Attend a weekly mentor meeting with Chair of Blind Sports NSW at the end of each week to enable continuation of planning through the Executive Board strategy§ §Administer any multi sport and programs including summer and winter camps or school multi sport days with support from the Programs Manager, scholarship athletes and Executive Board members as required§ §Construct with the support of Affiliate sports and Executive Board a full 2021 Calendar that will be delivered to our members and schools by end of November 2020§ §Deliver content to our social media platforms and our website that compliment our monthly newsletter, programs and activities of Blind Sports NSW§ §Attend all Blind Sports NSW Executive Board, Annual General and Special General Meetings as required, taking minutes and preparing an Operations Manager report for each meeting§ §In collaboration with the board, ensure all policies and procedures are regularly reviewed and updated to maintain compliance with NSW Dept of Fair Trading§ §Attend stakeholder engagement meetings as required, providing feedback to the Executive Board for further support to advance programs and partnerships§ §Who are we looking for:§ §Blind Sports NSW requires a strong candidate who is resilient, organised and professional in their approach to running the day to day operations of the organisation. You will enjoy working across multiple projects and aspects of an established non for profit incorporated State Disability Sporting Organisation. Our successful candidate will need to showcase their people skills in managing student staff placements and working with sector peers. You will have a strong knowledge of xero finance system, MS suite of programs and social media platforms. This is a challenging but rewarding role, where you as an individual can make a different and have autonomy across the day to day of the business. Time management is a key to being able to prioritise your work schedule, combine this with your excellent communication skills from both a written and verbal aspect will ensure success. Blind Sports NSW are an equal opportunity employer, we encourage applications from diversity and inclusion candidates.§ § § §Compensation Package:§ §The role will be a minimum of 30 hours per week with a flexible work schedule including occasional weekend work as required. Range of pay for this role will be $33-38per hour based on your experience on a contract basis, this means that tax isn’t withheld from the total sum and is the responsibility of the individual.  A phone subsidy of $100 per month will also be given to this role with kilometres paid for own car travel as required for the role at the rate of 66 cents per km. You will have an initial probation period of 3 months with a 12 month contract starting October 19th.§ §Please review our website and youtube link prior to submitting your application. Please submit your cover letter and resume to Murray Elbourn at the below details.§ §Website: www.blindsportsnsw.com.au§ §Youtube:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8fwXUJwFK3g § §To have a confidential discussion around the role please contact Murray Elbourn (Chairperson, Blind Sports NSW) on §0427186734§ or by email §murray.elbourn@blindsportsnsw.com.au§§§§

jobText: TXT/50662853.txt	§Club Manager - 12RND Fitness Point Cook§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Club Manager - 12RND Fitness Point Cook§§Advertiser: §HealthyPeople§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §Western Suburbs§§Salary§§Highly Competitive Remuneration§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§ §Cutting-Edge Fitness Company§ §Unique Opportunity§ §Highly Competitive Remuneration § §The Company:§  §12 Round Fitness Point Cook§ is an industry revolution. Training sessions are modelled around a 12 round boxing contest and are professionally designed to combine functional strength and cardio exercises for all fitness levels. §  §The Opportunity:§  §Before you read on, ask the question. Do you envisage yourself coming to work every day and changing the face of the Australian fitness industry, by being an integral part of the management team of a cutting-edge gym concept across fitness, people and business? §  §If the answer is yes then you should read on …§  §You will be embarking on this career journey as a Gym Manager and an essential part of the overall success of this exciting new fitness venture. This newly created opportunity is centrally based in the heart of Point Cook.§  §How you will impact and develop a progressive gym culture is by demonstrating your desire to drive and manage the day-to-day operations of the facility where member appreciation is the focus and results are achieved.  §  §Your passion for people and culture will start by connecting with members and running the daily high-intensity group workouts, whilst maintaining this professional gym facility. Moreover, this role will lead to recruiting your own team, then managing and mentoring these trainers and ensuring a professional approach to coaching and developing their skills.§  §Your previous sales experience will translate into identifying and developing sales strategies in order to increase memberships via lead generation, brand promotion, social media networks and outreach activities. §  §The backend skillset of this role will develop and build on your ability to manage and maintain administrative functions such as coordinating rosters, implementing daily training programs, weekly P&L reports, sales enquiries and conversions reports, customer satisfaction feedback, and social media pages. The Reporting-lines of the role will associate with a supportive and highly experienced group management team on a daily and weekly basis. §  §It is highly recommended that before you apply for this position, you are familiar with what our fitness studio provides its members.§  §Salary:§ Remuneration will be commensurate with your experience. §  §What We Are Looking For:§  §We expect to receive applications from self-starters and Gym Managers with prior experience in leading sales teams and who have exceeded sales targets and established a strong level of member satisfaction.§  §You will have a talent for social media, recruiting and managing staff as well as an ability to engage with key stakeholders within the business. Your fitness experience will vary between a boxing and/ or functional strength training in a group fitness environment and have effective command over communication skill both written and verbal when dealing with members and internal stakeholders.§  §Your energetic persona and positive attitude will flourish while working in this fast-paced, highly diverse team environment. §  §Minimum Applicant Criteria: § § §Possess Cert III and IV in Fitness§ §Current First Aid certificate.§ §Current Blue Card certificates.§ §Sales experience § §Apply:§  §If you meet the aforementioned criteria and you believe you can impact this cutting-edge fitness environment, we look forward to receiving your resume and cover letter, clearly indicating your suitability for this position. §  §APPLY NOW§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50537156.txt	§Learn to Swim Instructors§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Learn to Swim Instructors§§Advertiser: §Lake Macquarie City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Newcastle, Maitland & Hunter§§Salary§§$24.71-$26.60 ph + 25% casual loading + 12% super§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§Lake Macquarie Swim Centres§  §Multiple Casual Position Available§  §LET’S EXPLORE THE JOB§  §Learn to Swim Instructors are responsible for providing effective Learn to Swim programs that support and enhance activities held at our Swim Centres. §  §The role leads learn to swim group classes and private lessons with a diverse range of participants including toddlers, school aged children, people with special needs and adults.  The role will assist in the implementation of the program.§  §Conditions of Employment include:§ § §shift work / weekend work§ §travel across multiple sites§ §LET’S DESCRIBE YOU§  §Our Leisure Team is seeking flexible, committed and passionate Learn to Swim Instructors with a genuine commitment to customer service and continuous improvement. Along with the full criteria listed in the Position Statement, we would love to hear from you if you meet the following criteria:§ § §Current Austswim Teacher of Swimming and Water Safety Certificate or equivalent with experience in Aquatic based recreation programs§ §Proven ability to combine knowledge and understanding of Learn to Swim technique and convert to a practical, safe and fun learning environment to individual and group classes§ §Demonstrated experience working with a diverse audience with the ability to adapt effective communication style and teaching methods to suit the needs of the Learn to Swim students§ §Current paid Working with Children Check§ §Current CPR Certificate§ §LET’S REVEAL THE PERKS§ § §$24.71 to $26.60 per hour, plus 25% casual loading, plus 12% superannuation§ §training and development opportunities§ §opportunity to work across Council’s multiple Swim Centres§ §LET’S TALK ABOUT US§  §When you join us, you are not part of an organisation; you are part of a future that more than 205,000 Lake Macquarie residents depend on every day. To work here is to be connected. To be part of a true community who value creativity and collaboration, wellbeing and sustainability, opportunity and diversity. Together, we believe in shaping our own future - not waiting for it.§  §Lake Macquarie City Council is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive workforce. We believe that a diverse network of employees, which truly reflects the people it serves and represents, is best equipped to understand and meet the needs of our community.§  §LET’S START§  §Position Statement – § Casual Learn to Swim Instructor§  §  §Rolling recruitment until Sunday 25 April 2021§. We will be frequently monitoring applications. § § §For all enquiries or assistance with submitting your application, please contact Catherine Khalil, Talent Acquisition Advisor via email §ckhalil@lakemac.nsw.gov.au§ or on §(02) 4069 0042§.§ §To view the capability Framework – Role Profile relevant to this role, please click § here§.§ §Please note that as part of Lake Macquarie City Council’s recruitment process, prior to an offer of employment being made, recommended candidates may be subject to a medical assessment with Council’s doctor.§ §After the close date, a panel will assess all applications for suitability against the essential criteria for each of the positions. Once completed, an interview, skills assessment or task and reference checks may be undertaken. All candidates will be notified of the outcome via the email address you supply as part of your application.§§§§

With the customer at the heart of everything we do, we’re developing a more personalised gym and multi-boutique experience in Australia.§ §About the role: § §You’ll understand each prospect’s objectives, buying criteria and decision-making processes to form a genuine and long-term relationship with them. You’ll include a mix of prospect calling, retention calling, lead generation, external activations and follow-up in your sales strategy. You’ll be empowered to manage your own time and can be counted on to reach targets. And you’ll get weekly product and selling training to ensure you optimise your sales.§ §About you:§ §You’re passionate about fitness, patient, level-headed and cool under pressure with relevant sales experience. You’re comfortable on the phones, get a kick out of hitting and exceeding targets and always look for new ways to generate business. You’re curious and love to learn about people so that you can come up with prescriptive solutions to kick start their fitness journey. You‘re comfortable communicating at all levels. You have the flexibility to work a non-traditional schedule and may also have some corporate sector experience.§ §What you'll get from us:§ §Let’s be honest – you skipped to the best part, didn’t you? And why wouldn’t you?§ § §A brand built on a human touch with a playful side§ §A culture that’s all about making exercise irresistible§ §An uncapped commission plan§ §A free membership for you to workout at our clubs (and one for your buddy after 12 months)§ §Discounted personal training§ §Special deals with our retail and service partners§ §Paid parental leave to spend time with your new little human§ §Regular personal and professional development§ §Confidential 24-hour support via our employee assistance program§ §Uniforms designed in partnership with lululemon athletica§ §We like to be normal, not formal§ §These opportunities don’t come up often… especially with Virgin. Apply now.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have experience working towards targets and KPIs?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobTitle: Possibly The Best Fitness Job You Could Ever Have Job in Newcastle, Maitland & Hunter - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50604686.txt	§Possibly The Best Fitness Job You Could Ever Have§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Possibly The Best Fitness Job You Could Ever Have§§Advertiser: §12 Round Fitness The Junction§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Newcastle, Maitland & Hunter§§Salary§§$25 - $34.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§Possibly The Best Fitness Job You Could Ever Have  §  §How ‘bout we skip right to the centre of the Tim-Tam? Our three 12 Round Fitness gyms are located in The Junction, Lambton and Charlestown - we may be slightly biased but we are pretty sure we are the coolest place to work for, ever. We really believe that we are making a change in the world and having an awesome time whilst doing it. Honestly, the job is not all roses and puppy dogs — there is some good news and there is some bad news. Let’s get the bad news out of the way first:§  §• It is full on, high energy work! There is no lounging around leaning on the leg curl machine here (we don't have one anyway) If you don't have what it takes to do early mornings and split shifts; well, this just became the suckiest job you could ever have.§  §Now let’s talk about the good stuff:§ § § §The work is fun, fresh and dynamic. You will be a part of an amazing and talented team chocked full of fitness experience with a wide range of skills. It’s a fun and rewarding job, we are basically a little family, awww so cute! §  § § §Free gym membership! If you are truly passionate about your health and fitness and want to help others then you will not be scoffing at this. Not to mention the extra fitness from being on the job! A 12 Round workout is probably the best if not in the top 3 best workouts you can do. Ever.§  § § §We aren’t big on stress. So, while we do expect you to work efficiently and get things done, we focus on open communication, training and getting it right the first go around.§  § § §You will be on the ground floor helping members make positive changes in their lives. You will be able to connect and have a real impact on hundreds of people. If you really want to make a difference then this is where you can do it.§  § § §12 Round is a place of growth. You will always be given a path to learn and grow. If you just want to stay on the gym floor; all good.  Feel like trying your hand managing a club, we’d make it happen. Want to dip your toes into a marketing role, why not!  §  § § §Team meetings, social and charity events are exciting and rewarding in themselves. You will be able to learn and grow in ways that you have never been able to in the past.§  § §Now, let’s talk about the job requirements:§  §1. You need to be the type person who gets joy out of exceeding people's expectations. Every day you deliver a 12 Round session, we want members leaving the gym saying “Dam it man, that was the best workout I’ve ever done”§  §2. You need to be passionate about boxing. This is primarily a boxing gym, if you don’t really like boxing or have absolutely zero experience with boxing, this job is not for you. If you love pad work and getting the average person to be a fighting machine, watch out, you just found home.§  §3. You need to be able to crack those tuff members. You know, those people who are quiet and kinda grumpy? You have to have a way of getting them to smile… maybe even laugh!§  §4. We are not just a boxing gym. You will need to be able to coach members through all varieties of strength and conditioning exercises. Deadlifts, Push ups, Kettlebell swings, pull ups… You name it, we do it. Members from 8 years old through to older members or people with limitations need to be quickly and expertly coached so they get a gold class workout and do not injure themselves. We can help hone your skills so you don’t need to know all the details, in fact it's more about the willingness to be better, every day. §  §5. I’m just going to sum up what could blow out to about 5 more points.§  §Real, Joy and Energy! You need to be a real person (no robots allowed). No one cares how much you know until they know how much you care.  You need to bring joy into the club. Our club culture thrives on joy and the energy of the coach on the floor. If you can deliver that, you will be loved and adored by all.§  §Our team is casual, but we do expect professionalism and punctuality. But what we don’t expect is perfection or existing skills for you to qualify for this job. We can teach you that. We expect intelligence, energy, and a get it done attitude. To learn more about us, check out our facebook page and 12Round.com (the franchise website) If this is a job that gets you so excited that you would even do it for free, we would totally accept that offer from you. But if you prefer compensation (and we totally get it…we prefer getting paid as well) this is what we offer: This is a part time, fitness coach job. The pay is $30 an hour and the hours will be 20-30 a week.§  §In addition to being a passionate and driven person, you must follow systems and processes. In fact, just to prove that you are all over this and can follow procedures, when you apply for this position in the subject line of the email you must include “I have found my type of peeps” in the subject line. Yep, that’s our little trick to sort out the people who blanket send their resume to anyone and everyone, from the folks (that’s you) who are truly interested in this position. We are looking to bring our new team member on board as soon as possible, but we will spend the necessary time to find the best fit both in abilities and culturally. One thing that will give you a BIG leg up (but is optional) is to send a quick video in along with your resume (in fact, everyone who works here did this) to §thejunction@12round.com§. In your video tell us why you think you’re perfect for this job and why you will rock this position. This is purely for us to get a sense of your personality, we could stalk you on social media but this makes us feel less creepy. And if you decide not to send a video (that’s ok), please tell us why you chose not to send in a video. We can’t wait to meet you!!!§  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Have you completed a qualification in fitness?§§§

jobTitle: Community Street Soccer Program - Port Adelaide Coach Job in Adelaide - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50635513.txt	§Community Street Soccer Program - Port Adelaide Coach§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Community Street Soccer Program - Port Adelaide Coach§§Advertiser: §The Big Issue§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Salary§§$25 - $29.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§Job Summary§ §Coaching a weekly Community Street Soccer Program session in Port Adelaide area - Monday mornings (approx. 3 hours per week).§ §THE BIG ISSUE COMMUNITY STREET SOCCER PROGRAM§ §The Big Issue Australia is an independent community organisation that develops and operates social enterprises and creative, sustainable solutions to homelessness; providing opportunities for homeless and marginalised people to positively change their lives.§ §Our innovative programs and services focus on helping people who are socially disadvantaged, and may otherwise slip through the cracks, to build confidence and the capacity to help themselves.§ §The Community Street Soccer Program, known as Street Soccer, uses the power of sport to empower homeless, marginalised and disadvantaged to achieve positive personal outcomes to reach their potential. It changes lives and creates healthier communities across Australia.§ §Street Soccer involves males and females getting together once a week for fun soccer training and matches. Equipment and a dedicated Street Soccer Coach are provided at each location.§ §The program aims to achieve outcomes for its participants in three key areas: sport access / participation, social inclusion and health.§ §POSITION DESCRIPTION - COACH§ §You are an enthusiastic, energised coach with the skills to deliver a soccer program for homeless, marginalised and disadvantaged young people in Port Adelaide.§ §This is a role that allows you to use your interpersonal and communication skills to motivate people in difficult circumstances helping them set themselves achievable goals and encouraging them to seek support for the issues that they may be facing.§ §Reporting to the Port Adelaide Coordinator, you will be responsible for coaching weekly Street Soccer training sessions that will incorporate some stretching, simple fitness work skills, a match and promoting the program to key stakeholders in your local area.§ §The most critical aspect of the role is connecting with the participants and providing them with direction and encouragement to develop and grow as individuals in our community.§ §Demonstrated experience in a sport or community role would be highly regarded, but not essential. We are looking for someone with a maturity in their attitude, confidence and natural communication skills to work easily with our clients, other staff members and volunteers.§ §KEY RESULTS AREAS§ § §Plan each two hour session carefully and prepare equipment for training§ §Conduct Street Soccer training sessions each week completing components of training as outlined by the National Coach (includes formal introduction, skills session, physical training, game component and summary)§ §Provide a level of informal mentoring and role modelling to players at training§ §Encourage and facilitate peer support§ §Develop regular opportunities for participants to take responsibility of sessions and events§ §Work collaboratively with the Port Adelaide Coordinator to develop and run events and activities that allow players to demonstrate the skills and attitude they have developed in the program§ §Coordinate a team of volunteers to support training sessions§ §Complete administrative requirements which includes filling out players code of conducts, attendance records and incident report forms§ §Promote the program to a range of support services and recruit participants to the program.§ §KEY SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE§ § §Ability to conduct a basic soccer training session using your personality and creativity to make participants feel relaxed, engaged and welcome§ §Ability to work and motivate people facing difficulties in their lives§ §Ability to engage and develop relationships with disadvantaged people§ §Ability to provide informal mentoring and act as a role model to program participants§ §Ability to make sessions fun and challenging for players of all abilities and varied intellectual and physical capabilities§ §Ability to engage and develop relationships with community agencies§ §Knowledge of local services available to disadvantaged people and basic ability to refer players to these organisations§ §Ability to recruit train and supervise volunteers§ §Experience in running leisure recreational activities for disadvantaged people would be desirable but not essential.§ §Our Values§ § §We treat all people with dignity and respect§ §We operate ethically and with integrity§ §We think creatively and without limits§ §We strive for continuous improvement§ §We apply prudent financial and business practices§ §We are economically, environmentally and socially responsible§ §We value, encourage and support our employees.§ §To Apply§ §Upload a copy of your CV and cover letter addressed to Matt Stedman, State Operations Manager - SA & NT§ §For any questions, contact mstedman@bigissue.org.au§ §Applications close 2.00pm Friday 9 October 2020§ §Prior to an offer of employment all applicants must undertake a National Police Check and Working With Children Check.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§Do you have a current Police Check (National Police Certificate) for employment?§Which of the following First Aid accreditations do you currently hold?§§§

jobText: TXT/50640793.txt	§F45 Coach in Epping NSW, Casual role with Super§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§F45 Coach in Epping NSW, Casual role with Super§§Advertiser: §F45 Epping§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §North West & Hills District§§Salary§§$30 - $45 per hour plus super§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§ § §COVID-19 has turned the whole fitness world upside down. Many gyms have closed permanently. Not F45 Epping. We are not out of the woods yet, but we continue to look for opportunities to ensure we not only survive but thrive, as our community emerge from lockdown.§ §We want each and every one of our members to come back stronger, and we will do everything in our power to make this happen. It is in this spirit that we would like to offer you the following to help our community to recover and proser once again:§ §Your Role§ § §Leading high quality group training classes to members on a daily basis§ §Weekly follow up on members to keep everyone motivated and accountable§ §Actively seeking new membership opportunities and conducting referral/lead generation§ §Provide exceptional customer service, and be the best of F45 Epping's brand, in greeting and responding to members inquiries and concerns§ §Being an integral part of our community to encourage and support our sports and social activities§ §Contributing to social media/marketing content and planning§ §Ensuring the studio is impeccably maintained§ §Hours§Flexible hours Monday to Friday. Anywhere from 10 - 30 hours per week pending experience, preference & availability, across the following opening hours:§ §- Mornings: 5:15 to 10.30 am, Monday to Friday § §- Evenings: 5pm-8pm Monday to Thursday§ §- Saturday & Sunday 6:30-9:30am§ § §About You§ §Put simply,  coach is the heart of our business! Our ideal candidate will possess exceptional customer service and communication skills, thrive in a team-oriented environment and have an infectious passion (even obsession - we get it!) for fitness.§ §To be successful in this position the following are required:§ § §3+ years experience as a personal trainer or group fitness instructor § §Cert 3 & 4 in Fitness§ §Current First Aid and CPR certificates§ §Flexibility to work evenings, weekends, and holidays§ §Outstanding communication and people skills§ §Proficient in problem solving and able to work proactively within a team environment to meet established business and role objectives.§ §Ability to work in a team§ §Positive presentation and attitude§ §Belief that outstanding customer service is the key to success§ §Willingness to undertake personal and professional development.§ §Beneficial:§- Strength & conditioning experience beneficial§- Experience in leading a team beneficial§ §What We Offer§ § §Generous Hourly Rate from $30 to $45 (pending on experience and performance) PLUS Super§ §Opportunity for part time, or full time role as the Studio Manager after the first 3 Months§ §Rewards & Incentives for a job well done§ §Flexible hours - Enjoy most of your day OFF!§ §FREE F45 Membership - train everyday!!§ §Exciting Culture: We know every members' names and stories, have the latest F45 DJ mixes pumping every day and hold regular members and staff social events! This role is all about being social with our team, our members and building our F45 community.§ §Apply today & don't miss out on this unique opportunity to love what you do and get paid well for it as part of our F45 Family!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Have you completed a qualification in fitness?§Do you own or have regular access to a car?§Do you have any leave planned in the next 6 months?§How many years' experience do you have as a personal trainer?§Are you available to work on a rotating roster?§§§

jobText: TXT/50644317.txt	§Group Exercice Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Group Exercice Manager§§Advertiser: §FLOE§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§A unique and exciting opportunity exists to join a fitness technology start-up founded by long-standing industry experts. Make your mark and grow with a business designed on extensive industry insights and knowledge. § §About us§ §Floe’s aim is to transform the health and fitness industry by providing flexible solutions that empower everyday people to improve their health and wellbeing. We value fresh thinking and a human approach. We are serious about our mission, but not so serious about ourselves. §With a business launch planned for late 2020, we are searching for a passionate Group Ex Manager to play a role in the design, development, and co-ordination of an industry-leading, digitally-delivered group exercise program. § §About the role§ §The role is centered on the development and ongoing management of our entire group exercise program. It involves building and leading a team of talented and like-minded instructors to help you bring the program to life…. meaning the role includes elements of recruitment, training, and quality control of instructor delivery. You will also set the standard for your team through delivery of your own classes; ensure studios are maintained; and manage invoicing and payroll for your department. § §About you§ §You live and breathe group exercise. Your passion for its practice is founded on the personal benefits that exercise has brought you throughout your life. You have a significant amount of experience in designing, delivering, and overseeing successful group exercise programs of significant size. You are as comfortable behind the keyboard designing classes and programs as you are in front of participants (or in this case – the camera) delivering them.   §You are a proven strong leader of teams and the level of skill that you have developed over time has other instructors looking to you for advice and mentoring. You can work equally as well on your own or as part of a team. You have excellent communication skills, unquestionable integrity and people love hanging out with you. § §Role structure§ §Based in Alexandria, this is a permanent role commencing immediately that will initially require 3-days per week before progressing to full time over a three month period. The role will be structured as a split in hours between delivery of classes and managerial duties. § § §How to apply?§ §Email a CV and covering letter to §recruitment@floefit.com§. §§§§

jobText: TXT/50694993.txt	§Sales, Event and Marketing Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Sales, Event and Marketing Manager§§Advertiser: §Murrumbidgee Turf Club§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wagga Wagga & Riverina§§Salary§§$30 ph. full time equivalent salary, pro- rata§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§About the business§ § § §The Murrumbidgee Turf Club is one of the largest country race clubs in NSW, currently holding 25 race meetings a year. The club is the current RNSW Country Club of the Year, a title we have won on more that one occasion. We are privileged to hold two of the most prestigious events on the Wagga Wagga social calendar, with the 100 club Gala Night and the Navigate Advisors Wagga Wagga Gold Cup. The MTC is rich in tradition and is held in the highest regard by everyone in the industry, with jobs like this not coming around very often. § § § §About the role§ § § §This will be a highly sort after role in an exciting industry that is always looking to improve and attract new people to the races. You will work with our small team to create, sell and execute race day events and packages. You will also liaise with members, sponsors, patrons, race horse owners and race day staff. You will be the point of call for all non race day functions with an attitude to help the customer enjoy the best experience possible here at the MTC.§ §You will play a large role in Wagga Wagga's premier social event, 100 Club Gala Evening. While you are selling the 100 spots that are available, the team and yourself will be planning another night of high end entertainment that has been well attended for the past 25 years. § §You will also be vital in the promotion and selling of the Wagga Gold Cup Carnival. With 10,000 guests attending over two days each year.  § §The role will require you to sell sponsorships and fulfil any commitments that are made in these contracts.§ §You will be required to perform some weekend and after hours work and a vehicle is provided for all business hours work. § §Hours per week will be negotiated with the right aplicant, with extra hours required during busy periods. The role also has the scope to expand on these hours if the club feels it is necessary. § §Applications close on Friday October 16, at 5pm.§ §For further information regarding the role, you can email Steve at §ceo@mtcwagga.com.au§ or call §6921 2151§.§ § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §Great work environment§Flexible hours§Opportunities to grow and develop§No two days are the same§Work at one of the premier race club's in NSW§ § § §Skills and experience§ § § §Friendly and enthusiastic personality§Current RSA§Event Management (preferred but not essential)§Sales experience (preferred but not essential)§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as a marketing manager?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§Do you have customer service experience?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§§§
