jobText: TXT/50635714.txt	§Community Street Soccer Program - Brisbane Coach§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Community Street Soccer Program - Brisbane Coach§§Advertiser: §The Big Issue§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§$25 - $29.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§Job Summary§ §Coaching a weekly Community Street Soccer Program session in Brisbane area - Wednesday afternoons (approx. 3 hours per week).§ §THE BIG ISSUE COMMUNITY STREET SOCCER PROGRAM§ §The Big Issue Australia is an independent community organisation that develops and operates social enterprises and creative, sustainable solutions to homelessness; providing opportunities for homeless and marginalised people to positively change their lives.§ §Our innovative programs and services focus on helping people who are socially disadvantaged, and may otherwise slip through the cracks, to build confidence and the capacity to help themselves.§ §The Community Street Soccer Program, known as Street Soccer, uses the power of sport to empower homeless, marginalised and disadvantaged to achieve positive personal outcomes to reach their potential. It changes lives and creates healthier communities across Australia.§ §Street Soccer involves males and females getting together once a week for fun soccer training and matches. Equipment and a dedicated Street Soccer Coach are provided at each location.§ §The program aims to achieve outcomes for its participants in three key areas: sport access / participation, social inclusion and health.§ §POSITION DESCRIPTION - COACH§ §You are an enthusiastic, energised coach with the skills to deliver a soccer program for homeless, marginalised and disadvantaged young people in Brisbane.§ §This is a role that allows you to use your interpersonal and communication skills to motivate people in difficult circumstances helping them set themselves achievable goals and encouraging them to seek support for the issues that they may be facing.§ §Reporting to the Brisbane Coordinator, you will be responsible for coaching weekly Street Soccer training sessions that will incorporate some stretching, simple fitness work skills, a match and promoting the program to key stakeholders in your local area.§ §The most critical aspect of the role is connecting with the participants and providing them with direction and encouragement to develop and grow as individuals in our community.§ §Demonstrated experience in a sport or community role would be highly regarded, but not essential. We are looking for someone with a maturity in their attitude, confidence and natural communication skills to work easily with our clients, other staff members and volunteers.§ §KEY RESULTS AREAS§ § §Plan each two hour session carefully and prepare equipment for training§ §Conduct Street Soccer training sessions each week completing components of training as outlined by the National Coach (includes formal introduction, skills session, physical training, game component and summary)§ §Provide a level of informal mentoring and role modelling to players at training§ §Encourage and facilitate peer support§ §Develop regular opportunities for participants to take responsibility of sessions and events§ §Work collaboratively with the Brisbane Coordinator to develop and run events and activities that allow players to demonstrate the skills and attitude they have developed in the program§ §Coordinate a team of volunteers to support training sessions§ §Complete administrative requirements which includes filling out players code of conducts, attendance records and incident report forms§ §Promote the program to a range of support services and recruit participants to the program.§ §KEY SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE§ § §Ability to conduct a basic soccer training session using your personality and creativity to make participants feel relaxed, engaged and welcome§ §Ability to work and motivate people facing difficulties in their lives§ §Ability to engage and develop relationships with disadvantaged people§ §Ability to provide informal mentoring and act as a role model to program participants§ §Ability to make sessions fun and challenging for players of all abilities and varied intellectual and physical capabilities§ §Ability to engage and develop relationships with community agencies§ §Knowledge of local services available to disadvantaged people and basic ability to refer players to these organisations§ §Ability to recruit train and supervise volunteers§ §Experience in running leisure recreational activities for disadvantaged people would be desirable but not essential.§ §Our Values§ § §We treat all people with dignity and respect§ §We operate ethically and with integrity§ §We think creatively and without limits§ §We strive for continuous improvement§ §We apply prudent financial and business practices§ §We are economically, environmentally and socially responsible§ §We value, encourage and support our employees.§ §To Apply§ §Upload a copy of your CV and cover letter addressed to Chris Campbell, State Operations Manager - QLD, NSW & ACT§ §For any questions, contact ccampbell@bigissue.org.au  § §Applications close 2.00pm Friday 9 October 2020§ §Prior to an offer of employment all applicants must undertake a National Police Check and Working With Children Check.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§Which of the following First Aid accreditations do you currently hold?§Do you have a current Police Check (National Police Certificate) for employment?§§§

jobTitle: Hosts @ BOUNCEinc (Cannington) Job in Perth - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50616046.txt	§Hosts @ BOUNCEinc (Cannington)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Hosts @ BOUNCEinc (Cannington)§§Advertiser: §BOUNCEinc§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §Fremantle & Southern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Other§§§§§§§About BOUNCE…§ §BOUNCE is a place that creates and celebrates joy, fun and self-powered adrenaline. We are part of a global freestyle movement inspiring self-expression and human connection in physical activity.§ §Across different countries, cultures, ages and skill levels we are growing an inclusive tribe. Our tribe is unified around the feeling of freedom that comes from combining balance, coordination and agility just for fun. We call it freestyle.§ §The extraordinary BOUNCE growth story has been driven by a universally appealing offer and an awesome culture that aims to be life-changing for the customers and our team who are a part of our global tribe. § §A truly brand and culture led company that is built to a significant extent around unlocking the passion and talents of diverse characters. BOUNCE is on a mission to bring the love, inspire progression and grow the tribe.§ §About the role…§ §As a §Host§ your welcoming smile will make the first impression on each customer who comes into BOUNCE.  Your natural energy and helpful nature will instantly make customers feel welcome and even more excited to get bouncing (if that’s even possible!). § §You are a passionate individual and will play a very active role in each customer’s free-jumping experience.  Whether you are hosting a kid’s party or school group, scoring a dodgeball game or inspiring a first-time jumper, your outgoing and confident nature will see you interacting with customers of all ages.  Your passion and positive energy is balanced by a sensible and alert nature which puts Safety as priority #1 and makes you comfortable communicating safety instructions and guidance to all age groups.§ §Your strong communication skills and ability to solve problems helps ensure that each customer has an awesome and safe time from the moment they enter BOUNCE, to the moment they leave!§ §The following experience is highly valued but not essential:§ § §Barista§ §Trampoline (or Gymnastics) coaching qualifications§ §Food and beverage§ §Hosting parties/groups§ §L2/Senior First Aid and a current Working with Children Check is essential.§ §I’m interested!  What’s next?§ §If you want to work for people who make you feel motivated, developed and appreciated, then we'd love to hear from you.§ §Click on the apply link and let us know your keen!§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Exciting new infrastructure projects and community programs have quickly demonstrated the positive impact the new council is having.§        §Role Purpose§The key responsibility of the Lifeguard is to supervise the pool environment and ensure the highest standard of public supervision and safety. jobText: TXT/50603955.txt	§F45 Personal Trainer - Growth Opportunity§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§F45 Personal Trainer - Growth Opportunity§§Advertiser: §F45 Training Seven Hills§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §Parramatta & Western Suburbs§§Salary§§$30 - $34.99 per hour + Super§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§High Performing F45 Studio seeking Sales Manager AND Exceptional Personal Trainer§·       §GENEROUS PAY & PROGRESSION OPPORTUNITY§ §·       §FLEXIBLE ROSTER & HOURS§ §·       §LEADING F45 STUDIO with THE BEST MEMBERS§ §·       §AWESOME TEAM CULTURE§ §·       §FREE F45 MEMBERSHIP§ §Welcome to F45 Seven Hills... We're a high performing and multiple award winning studio - which means we're ahead of the pack. Not only that, but we are still growing, with A LOT of room to go BIG!§About the Role.§We are on the hunt for a highly motivated, confident and experienced group trainer/personal trainer for our studio at F45 Seven Hills. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a well established team and join a studio which cares about their members and it’s community!§As a F45 instructor you will run industry leading Functional Training sessions, assess and hold members accountable to achieve their goals based around their specific fitness level, and help with membership enquiries.§You will be required to complete 20-30 hours per week with a mix of both membership sales, cleaning and training. And the best thing is, we provide flexibility and progression to help you reach your career goals.§About you §You must be the type of person that loves a challenge, thrives in a fast paced, constantly changing environment, keeps our members on their toes and the studio running faultlessly with our team.§You must be okay with the following elements before applying for the role.§1. Be an early riser who is willing to do evening sessions & weekends!§2. Be highly organised and a team motivator. We want someone to come into the gym before the session, ready to prepare for an AMAZING experience for our members.§3. Go above and beyond no matter what is happening in your personal life§4. Be willing to Sell! You do not need sales experience but if you are scared by the idea of selling something to someone this job is not for you.§5. Teach what you preach! If you generally love functional training, and train yourself, we want to be able to see this through your technique and coaching.§Skills and Expertise §1. Qualified personal trainer in Certificate 3 in Fitness and above§2. Has their First Aid & CPR qualification§3. I Have at-least 6 months experience in personal training.§4. Lives within a 5-8km radius and has easy access to the gym§5. Flexible and willing to work with the studio owner and other personal trainers in providing a 5 star experience for our members§6. Get excited about personal development, and is willing to accept feedback in order to grow within their role and career§7. Is Positive and always uplifting the atmosphere no matter what is happening inside or outside of the studio.§Job Benefits and Perks §1. Work for the fastest growing fitness network in the world!§2. Generous hourly rate - above what most F45 studios pay with tax & super paid for you§3. Commission structure and opportunity§4. Perkbox Membership, giving you access to the world class brands, apps and vouchers.§5. Free F45 Membership for you§6. Ongoing training and development, as well as the opportunity to complete free courses of your choice to help develop your own career.§7. Flexible hours! Enjoy a work life balance routine.§So, if you think you might be the right person for this job, hit 'Apply' below and send us through a Cover letter telling us WHY you are the best fit for this job as well as your resume.§We will be in touch to discuss the opportunity and see if you are the right fit!§§§§

jobText: TXT/50630126.txt	§Fitness Instructor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Fitness Instructor§§Advertiser: §YMCA§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §Parramatta & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§ §Work with us, not rent from us§ §Join our Y family, passionate about building communities§ §Opportunities for growth & development within fitness & the greater community recreation industries§ § §YMCA Epping are looking for a dynamic and engaging fitness professionals who are wanting to make a positive impact to the health and wellbeing of their local community. § §About the role:§ §Our Fitness Instructors love what they do and inspire, encourage and educate our fitness members to be better versions of themselves. You will be open to working with us on a casual basis. We are looking for our Fitness Instructors to progress to Personal Trainers within the first 3 months of their employment with us, with the support of our Health & Fitness Coordinator. With a comprehensive mentoring and induction process, we want to assist you in being the best you can be to impact your local community.§ §Working a flexible roster across the 7 days of the week, this may include mornings, day and evenings with some weekends as required.§ §You will be comfortable as the go-to person on our Gym floor, easily connect with our members and work with them to achieve greater fitness and wellbeing. Health and fitness is part of who you are, not just your job, you are a team player and maintain high standards in the way you work and engage with others.§ §What we need from you:§ § §Certificate III in fitness (Fitness Trainer)§ §Certificate IV in fitness (Personal Trainer)§ §Current First Aid Certificate§ §Current CPR Certificate§ §Current AusREPS Registration§ §WWCC§ § §What you can expect from us:§ § §Flexible working hours§ §A high energy team environment§ §Detailed induction with ongoing support and training§ §Opportunity to contribute to the development of areas you are passionate about§ §YMCA Employee benefits including; free gym membership, uniform, access to salary packaging and other great benefits§ §Rent free progression to our Personal Training Team (Certificate IV in Fitness required)§ §Be part of a family, not just another staff member§ §Opportunity for career progression within YMCA NSW, multiple development pathways available within Fitness or the greater Recreation industry§ § §§Who What Y?§YMCA NSW is a profit-for-purpose organisation focused on healthy living, social impact and empowering young people. We operate 23 recreation centres, 57 Out of School Hours Care services and two camping locations which fund our diverse range of youth and community programs, employing 1800 staff across NSW.§Our goal is for our workforce to reflect the diverse community we serve. We encourage people of all genders, ages, religions, disability, sexual orientation, family and caring responsibilities and cultures, including people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander heritage to apply.§Commitment to Safeguarding§ §YMCA, including Boards of Directors, is committed to the safety and wellbeing of children and young people in accordance with our Safeguarding Children and Young People framework. YMCA requires that all applicants undergo satisfactory screening prior to commencement, including but not limited to:§ § §a national criminal history check;§ §an international criminal history check where applicants have worked overseas;§ §holding or obtaining a Working with Children Clearance/ equivalent in accordance with state/ territory laws;§ §Two reference checks.§ § §Please note, the results of any National and International Police Check will only be used to assess your suitability to perform the role.§ §Any successfully appointed applicant will be required to adhere to the Safeguarding Children and Young People framework, which includes a thorough safeguarding children and young people induction and committing to upholding the safety and wellbeing of children and young people throughout their engagement with YMCA.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50616566.txt	§Fitness Programs Officer - 3mth fixed term contract§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Fitness Programs Officer - 3mth fixed term contract§§Advertiser: §AJ's Sports Centre§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§$50,000 - $54,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§About the business§ § §AJ's Sports Centre has been a part of South Brisbane fitness landscape for over 35 years. It has evolved during this time and today we are one of the largest and most comprehensive fitness locations in Queensland. We've learned a thing or two in this time which is why we know we can better help our members and guest achieve their fitness goals, whatever they may be. Being more than just a gym, we offer Extended staffed hrs, Squash, Childminding, Swim School, 4 x heated pools, Allied health Hub, Ladies only gym, KIDfit programs, Self-Defence programs, Personal Training, a Functional Fitness Colosseum  and over 60 Group Fitness classes. § § §About the role§ § §The Fitness Program Officer is responsible for the smooth delivery of all fitness related programs within the Centre.  This extends from Personal Training and Group Fitness Management to ensuring member uptake into fitness initiatives like 8-week challenges and In-body Scans.  As well as Support and business growth of in-house Allied Health professionals through referrals and cross promotions.§ § § §While initially being offered as a 3mth fixed term contract, it is highly expected that the role and successful person selected will stay long term and be made permanent after the initial 3mth period.§ § § § Reporting directly and supporting the Centre Manager, they will work closely to deliver the desired business outcomes across all fitness programs.  This role has a strong focus on business compliance and auditing, workplace health and safety and risk management reporting.§ § §Benefits and perks§ § §The ideal Fitness Program Officer is an energetic professional who doesn't mind wearing multiple hats and thrives on being a key player in a fast pace environment. With a Centre of this size each day will bring a wide range of fitness delivery, administrative and business support related tasks, which you will have the freedom to work autonomously through. Being well organised, flexible and customer focused you will love both the fitness and administrative challenges of managing and supporting a centre of such diverse customers and staff.§ § §Skills and experience§ § §Essential             § § § §Qualified and experienced Personal Trainer§ §Qualified and experience at delivering Group Fitness Programs – Freestyle or Licensed.§ §Proficient level of Microsoft Office Suite of Products            § §Effective staff management                  § §Friendly, professional manner with good interpersonal skills      § §Experienced in budgets and financial management.              § § § § § §Desirable§ § § §Previous experience in a fitness management role.   § §Previous experience in an Allied health related role.      § §Formal business qualifications.§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Have you completed a qualification in fitness?§How many years' experience do you have in the sports & fitness industry?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

Join an organisation dedicated to sustainably changing the lives of our clients and our TRAINERS.§ §If you're just starting out as a PT and looking for a great place to learn and grow, come join our proud team at Get Going Personal Training! If you've been in the industry for a while, stop stressing about maintaining leads and clients and join a professional team.§ §Get out of the cutthroat environment of lead generation.§ §We'll provide you with the tools you need to build your client books to 30+ clients comfortably and quickly.§ §We Offer:§ § §4-Week training and mentoring program§ §Ongoing support and learning§ §Regular meetings§ §We build your clientele as quickly as your potential allows§ §Earn $45-$65 per session OR own your own Get Going.§ §Opportunities to grow into higher positions within the organisation§ §The chance for you to build and own your own business!§ §Your Role:§ §As a Mobile (Home) Personal Trainer, you will be one of our home training specialists, providing training programming, implementation and advice!§ § §Look after your own clientele § §Manage your own database and accounts§ §Continuous learning and development§ §Benefits & Culture§ §We have developed, and continue to develop, an extremely motivating and fun environment for all of our talent to learn and grow. jobText: TXT/50646592.txt	§Lifeguards - Adelaide Aquatic Centre§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lifeguards - Adelaide Aquatic Centre§§Advertiser: §City of Adelaide§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Other§§§§§§A place as positive as you.§ §A role with more to dive into.§ §Multiple Casual opportunities located in stunning North Adelaide.§ § § §About Us§ §From the start, the vision for Adelaide was a city of the future – one that celebrated its unique natural surrounds and structured its footprint in a way that would allow it to adapt to the changing needs of the community and a dynamic global landscape. Our focus is on our community’s wellbeing and quality of life - investing in city improvements and on future planning, so we continue to design a liveable city where future generations can continue to live authentic and meaningful lives. This is an exciting opportunity to join our team and be a bigger part of our amazing city!§ § § §Adelaide Aquatic Centre, operated by City of Adelaide, offers a wide range of facilities for the community including a fitness centre, recreational and dive pools, spa, sauna, steam room, swim shop and a café. The Centre, located in beautiful North Adelaide has easy access to public transport and all day free parking.§ § § §About the Opportunity§ §The Adelaide Aquatic Centre is on the lookout for new talent to join the team on a casual basis. We are currently seeking individuals who have an interest in being a Pool Lifeguard within our Aquatic Centre.§ § § §The Pool Lifeguards ensure the safety and wellbeing of patrons whilst in the Aquatic Centre by ensuring that all Centre rules and regulations are complied with. You will administer first aid and resuscitation when required and have a clear understanding and passion to deliver excellent customer services.§ § § §These casual opportunities will require you to be available over 7 days between the hours of 5.30 am to 12.00 midnight. Rosters are provided with set shifts in advance, however your flexibility is essential as rostered shifts may vary and at times you may be required to work with very little notice provided.§ § § §About You§ §To be successful in this role you will have:§ §Pool Lifeguard Award§ §Senior First Aid Certificate§ §Experience in an aquatic environment, including the supervision of the general public and sporting facilities§ § § §Ideally you will have experience in delivering a high level of customer service, have excellent communication skills with the ability to remain patient.§ § § §For Further Enquiries & How to Apply§ All enquiries regarding this position will remain private and confidential and can be directed to Paul Taylor on §8203 7147§.§ § § §Please submit a Resume and a Cover Letter expressing the skills, experience and qualities you can bring to this position addressed to Paul Taylor, Team Leader Aquatic Operations.§ § § §Please review the position description prior to submitting an application by following the prompts to apply or visit §www.cityofadelaide.com.au/careers§ § § §Applications close midnight Sunday 11 October.§ § § §As part of the recruitment process candidates will be required to undertake a Working with Children Check, and a pre-employment medical and functional capacity assessment.§ § § §Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander People are encouraged to apply.§§§§§

jobTitle: PERSONAL TRAINER Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50641005.txt	§PERSONAL TRAINER§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§PERSONAL TRAINER§§Advertiser: §Studio 99 Fitness§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§§About the business§ § §Studio 99 Fitness Background§ §Studio 99 fitness is an established gym in the heart of West End which has growth over the course of 10 years from a boutique personal training studio into a 1000 square metre all-purpose training facility. Studio 99 runs over 60 group classes a week which cater for all fitness and age levels specialising in metabolic-conditioning, HIIT, Pilates and general lifting classes. Studio 99 also run over 400 personal training sessions a week through a team of 10 trainers and has multiple corporate groups and sporting teams training in the facility each week.§ § §About the role§ § §About the Role§ §The role requires you to work closely with the directors of Studio 99 fitness to help build up your client base and educate you in all areas of how to run a fitness business successfully. Applicants are required to run 5 group classes per week which are all planned months in advance by the directors of Studio 99 Fitness. In exchange for running 5 group classes per week the successful applicant will receive 100% of any personal training sessions they perform each week. Studio 99 Fitness will also finance any approved marketing ideas the successful applicant may have as long as it runs in line with the gyms philosophies and culture. Leads are also provided by Studio 99 Fitness each week to trainers depending on member suitability. Studio 99 provides trainers with access to the gym 24/7 days per week to conduct sessions anytime. As a part of our next growth phase we will be including services for rehabilitation and management of chronic disease.§ §The successful applicant with be responsible for:§ § §Meeting new people and assisting gym members on the gym floor with their exercise.§ § §Delivering personal training services to your clients.§ § §Running semi-private & personal training sessions§ § §Running introductory sessions with new members.§ § §Attending weekly development sessions with a director of Studio 99.§ § §Designing and implementing new services.§ § § §Benefits and perks§ § §Benefits and Perks§ § §It's a full-time role that offers unlimited opportunity to maximise your income.§ § §On-going education from the best in the industry.§ § §No gym rental fees.§ § §Marketing ideas to be financed by Studio 99 Fitness.§ § §Weekly mentoring meetings with the Owner/Director§ § §Website exposure§ § §Education on how to build your fitness business and the opportunity to learn how to establish your own training facility.§ § §Education on sales, training methods and marketing.§ § §Free gym access.§ § §Access to the gym 24/7 days per week to train your clients.§ § § § § §Skills and experience§ § §equirements for the role:§ § §Certificate 3 and 4 in fitness.§ § §Back ground in crossfit, pilates or sports is highly favourable§ § §Strong work ethic and the ability to listen to others.§ § §Coachable person who enjoys working in a team environment.§ § §High level of personal fitness.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a personal trainer?§Have you completed a qualification in fitness?§§§

You will be able to deal with safety hazards associated with the operation of the pool, and look after day to day tasks like the kiosk and entry gate. You work well within a team, have outstanding communication skills and enjoy dealing with the public. As part of the Virgin Group founded by Sir Richard Branson, we opened our first club in Australia in 2008 and are building an unparalleled collection of iconic locations in Sydney and Melbourne. We continue to innovate by developing a more personalised gym, multi-boutique experience and mission to provide irresistible exercise experiences.§        §The gig:§        §You’ll ensure the studios are sparkling before each class by cleaning all equipment and wiping the mirrors and floor so they’re flawless. You have the flexibility to work a non-traditional schedule and may also have some hospitality sector experience. jobText: TXT/50688587.txt	§Female Correctional Case Officer - Health and fitness§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Female Correctional Case Officer - Health and fitness§§Advertiser: §Serco Asia Pacific§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Coffs Harbour & North Coast§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Female Correctional Case Officer - Health and fitness §      §        §Company description:§        §          §Long term role with great career opportunities   §          §Live by the beach or the hinterland§          §Bring your fitness sector experience to this role§        §        § §        §This is an exciting and rewarding career opportunity for Correctional Case Officers with a focus on health and  fitness as part of your role.  Create a great career opportunity utilising your experience in the fitness sector working at the new  state-of-the-art Clarence Correctional Centre in Grafton.§        § §Job description:§        §A rewarding career opportunity awaits you as a Correctional Case Officer with Serco.  You will join Australia’s most innovative and largest correctional centre and have the opportunity to play a key position within the Serco team.§        § §        §The Clarence Correctional Centre is now operating with a 1700 bed facility, making it the largest and most state-of-the-art correctional centre in Australia. Serco Australia has a 20-year contract to operate and maintain the centre, creating the opportunity for long-term, rewarding and secure employment with exciting career prospects in one of Australia’s most spectacular coastal and country locations.§        § §        §https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3nFDvDRtoKc§        § §        §About you§You are either experienced in a correctional environment or looking for a new exciting and rewarding career. You are motivated and ready to take the opportunity. You will be working and creating a culture of openness, trust and transparency coupled with your focus on living and instilling our values, while promoting equality and removing barriers to diversity will ensure you succeed in this role. You also have strong communication skills and are respectful with a commitment and passion for the on-going rehabilitation working towards making a positive difference to the lives of the people in our care.§About the opportunity§As a Correctional Case Officer, you will be responsible for the management, supervision, care, rehabilitation, reintegration and provision of services to the people in our care. A key component of your role will be to actively participate in supporting individuals throughout their sentence whilst monitoring and maintaining the security of the centre. Your position is a frontline role and is key to embedding Serco’s operating principles at the multi-functional correctional centre.§        §You will play an integral role in promoting rehabilitation and reintegration, ensuring the safety and security in the centre and the community, and provide a safe and respectful environment to everyone in the centre.§        §This role also offers the opportunity to join the Emergency Response Team (ERT) as an ERT Officer. ERT Officers who have successful passed the ERT Training Course are then certified to conduct specialist duties and responses in addition to their Correctional Case Officer role. You'll need excellent communication, interpersonal and people management skills. You'll be security focused, calm under pressure and physically fit enough to operate for extended periods using specialist ERT equipment.§You'll need to pass some additional initial testing to ensure you meet the required fitness standards for an ERT Officer before you can attend the ERT Training Course. If this specialisation is of interest to you, express your interest when submitting your application.§To be successful in this role you will§        §● Have similar experience within a correctional environment or looking for a new career§● Either hold your Certificate III Correctional Practice (CSC30115) or§● Eligible to obtain a Cert III Correctional Practice (CSC30115)§● Demonstrate a commitment to Serco’s values and the rehabilitation process§● Demonstrate a competent level of computer literacy and report writing§● Proficient interpersonal and communications skills§● Maintains high level of integrity and ethical behaviour§        § §        § §        §About Grafton§        §Located on the NSW Mid-North Coast, Grafton is approx. 6 hours’ drive from Sydney and 4 hours from Brisbane. Set on the Clarence River, it is the main hub for the Clarence Valley with rich natural beauty and is ideally located if you prefer the hinterland or the ocean as your backdrop.  With recent Pacific Highway upgrades and investment in infrastructure, and with affordable housing and access to good schools and recreation options, it is the ideal location for your next career move with your family.§        § §        §About Us§        §At Serco, you’ll be part of a team of more than 50,000 people working across more than 20 countries worldwide. But no matter your role or where you’re based, we each share the same goal – to bring service to life to make a positive difference every day. Serco is a business where people and values matter. We have a strong public service ethos, and we employ people from a range of backgrounds.§        § §        §Interested to be part of our brand new team?§        §If you are inspired to make a positive difference and would like to be part of this exciting new opportunity, click the Apply Now Button.  §        § §        §Serco seeks and celebrates diversity. We are committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse workforce. We are committed to diversity and we encourage people from different backgrounds including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, culturally and linguistically diverse and people with disabilities to apply.§        § §        §To find out more about us visit www.graftonserco.com.au§        § §Profile description:§        §Female correctional case officer - health and fitness focus§      §      §      §      §    §  §§§Company description:§ §Long term role with great career opportunities   § §Live by the beach or the hinterland§ §Bring your fitness sector experience to this role§ § §This is an exciting and rewarding career opportunity for Correctional Case Officers with a focus on health and  fitness as part of your role.  Create a great career opportunity utilising your experience in the fitness sector working at the new  state-of-the-art Clarence Correctional Centre in Grafton.§ §Job description:§A rewarding career opportunity awaits you as a Correctional Case Officer with Serco.  You will join Australia’s most innovative and largest correctional centre and have the opportunity to play a key position within the Serco team.§ §The Clarence Correctional Centre is now operating with a 1700 bed facility, making it the largest and most state-of-the-art correctional centre in Australia. Serco Australia has a 20-year contract to operate and maintain the centre, creating the opportunity for long-term, rewarding and secure employment with exciting career prospects in one of Australia’s most spectacular coastal and country locations.§ §https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3nFDvDRtoKc§ §About you§You are either experienced in a correctional environment or looking for a new exciting and rewarding career. You are motivated and ready to take the opportunity. You will be working and creating a culture of openness, trust and transparency coupled with your focus on living and instilling our values, while promoting equality and removing barriers to diversity will ensure you succeed in this role. You also have strong communication skills and are respectful with a commitment and passion for the on-going rehabilitation working towards making a positive difference to the lives of the people in our care.§About the opportunity§As a Correctional Case Officer, you will be responsible for the management, supervision, care, rehabilitation, reintegration and provision of services to the people in our care. A key component of your role will be to actively participate in supporting individuals throughout their sentence whilst monitoring and maintaining the security of the centre. Your position is a frontline role and is key to embedding Serco’s operating principles at the multi-functional correctional centre.§You will play an integral role in promoting rehabilitation and reintegration, ensuring the safety and security in the centre and the community, and provide a safe and respectful environment to everyone in the centre.§This role also offers the opportunity to join the Emergency Response Team (ERT) as an ERT Officer. ERT Officers who have successful passed the ERT Training Course are then certified to conduct specialist duties and responses in addition to their Correctional Case Officer role. You'll need excellent communication, interpersonal and people management skills. You'll be security focused, calm under pressure and physically fit enough to operate for extended periods using specialist ERT equipment.§You'll need to pass some additional initial testing to ensure you meet the required fitness standards for an ERT Officer before you can attend the ERT Training Course. If this specialisation is of interest to you, express your interest when submitting your application.§To be successful in this role you will§● Have similar experience within a correctional environment or looking for a new career§● Either hold your Certificate III Correctional Practice (CSC30115) or§● Eligible to obtain a Cert III Correctional Practice (CSC30115)§● Demonstrate a commitment to Serco’s values and the rehabilitation process§● Demonstrate a competent level of computer literacy and report writing§● Proficient interpersonal and communications skills§● Maintains high level of integrity and ethical behaviour§ § §About Grafton§Located on the NSW Mid-North Coast, Grafton is approx. 6 hours’ drive from Sydney and 4 hours from Brisbane. Set on the Clarence River, it is the main hub for the Clarence Valley with rich natural beauty and is ideally located if you prefer the hinterland or the ocean as your backdrop.  With recent Pacific Highway upgrades and investment in infrastructure, and with affordable housing and access to good schools and recreation options, it is the ideal location for your next career move with your family.§ §About Us§At Serco, you’ll be part of a team of more than 50,000 people working across more than 20 countries worldwide. But no matter your role or where you’re based, we each share the same goal – to bring service to life to make a positive difference every day. Serco is a business where people and values matter. We have a strong public service ethos, and we employ people from a range of backgrounds.§ §Interested to be part of our brand new team?§If you are inspired to make a positive difference and would like to be part of this exciting new opportunity, click the Apply Now Button.  § §Serco seeks and celebrates diversity. We are committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse workforce. We are committed to diversity and we encourage people from different backgrounds including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, culturally and linguistically diverse and people with disabilities to apply.§ §To find out more about us visit www.graftonserco.com.au§ §Profile description:§Female correctional case officer - health and fitness focus§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50690532.txt	§Physical Training Instructor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Physical Training Instructor§§Advertiser: §Defence Force Recruiting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§$65,000 - $69,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Physical Training Instructor §      §        §Your role: §        §We’re on the lookout for people who are at the peak of their physical fitness—those who want to have a positive influence on Air Force personnel to ensure they are  physically and mentally prepared at all times  in the defence of our country. PTIs are the Air Force's specialists when it comes to exploiting the full human potential of its workforce. If you have a degree qualification, industry experience and a passion for developing higher level human performance, then the Physical Training Instructor role might be for you.§        § §        §Being a PTI is one of the more physically demanding and rewarding roles of the military—ideal for those who are already involved in high performance strength and  conditioning training, elite sports, or high level human performance coaching.§        § §        §An Air Force PTI is more than just a job, it’s a vocation and a way of life. Some typical tasks you can expect as part of your PTI duties include:§        § §        §•           Rehabilitation and injury prevention programs§        §•           High-performance physical strength, conditioning and fitness assessments§        §•           Physical wellness, mental wellness and resilience education§        §•           Development and delivery of physical training, recreational and sporting activities§        §•           Adventurous training (abseiling, climbing etc) activities§        §•           Delivery of non-lethal use of force training (unarmed combat)§        § §        §Life in the Air Force: §        §There’s no career that compares to one in the Air Force. Become a part of a world-class military force that operates some of the most advanced aircraft and defence technology in the world. You can expect to work in a uniquely challenging yet highly rewarding working environment that comes with good work/life balance, competitive salary and skills for life. There’s also a sense of accomplishment and pride from serving your country and helping to keep our airspace safe.§        § §        §Life in the Air Force is anything but mundane. You’ll enjoy an exciting lifestyle, rewarding career, opportunities to travel, excellent social and fitness facilities, and free medical and dental; all in a dynamic and fulfilling working environment.§        § §        §Salary: §        §Get paid while you contextualise and further develop your current knowledge, skills and experiences in becoming a fully qualified Physical Training Instructor. Upon completion of a workplace training and assessment journal, you’ll enjoy a competitive starting salary package of: $68,626 plus generous super (salaries correct as of 01/08/2019).§        § §        §Apply Now: §        §For this role, you must be over 17 at time of enlistment, an Australian Citizen and have passed Year 10 English and Maths You must also have completed a Bachelor’s Degree in Health Science (Fitness or Exercise), Sport Science/Coaching (Strength and Conditioning) or similar. Refer to the link below for more information on accepted degrees. You will also need two years relevant industry experience within the last five years.§        § §        §Click the APPLY button if you think you have what it takes to become an Air Force Physical Training Instructor and we’ll get in contact with you shortly.§        §You can also visit the link below to view the full position description and learn more about life in the Air Force.§        §https://www.defencejobs.gov.au/jobs/air-force/physical-training-instructor§      §    §    §  §§§Your role: § §We’re on the lookout for people who are at the peak of their physical fitness—those who want to have a positive influence on Air Force personnel to ensure they are  physically and mentally prepared at all times  in the defence of our country. jobText: TXT/50715050.txt	§Head Trainer - Sports and Fitness§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Head Trainer - Sports and Fitness§§Advertiser: §Australian Learning Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Head Trainer - Sports and Fitness §      §        §About the role §        §The Head Trainer for Sports and Fitness is responsible for the overall support across ALG Fitness (including Sports and Recreation) courses. This includes class room teaching, mentoring and supporting trainers and assessors, and in the development, evaluation and implementation of our Fitness education products.§        §You will ensure high standards of operations for ALG Sports and Fitness courses by ensuring our courses meet the Australian Quality and Standards Agency (ASQA) requirements for vocational education by undertaking a variety of tasks§        § §        §Responsibilities and Duties:§        §          §Identifying the various needs of students and creating effective learning options to meet these needs§          §Liaising with individuals, industry and education sectors to ensure provision of relevant programs and services§          §Managing the planning, designing and developing of course curriculum and method of instruction including, but not limited to, classroom notes, distance education notes, marking guides, mapping grids, assessments and instructional aids§          §Ensure commitment to quality education through excellent people management of your Lead Trainer and Assessors§          §Overseeing Trainers delivery of content and ensuring there is consistency across all course curriculum and method of instruction§          §Create a culture of compliance within your remint ensuring all Lead Trainers understand the importance of and drive Trainer and Assessor compliance and ongoing, tracked professional development§          §Recruitment of new Trainer and Assessors§          §Advising students on courses and related matters§          §Teaching students using teaching aids including presentation of lesson materials, discussions, workshops, laboratory sessions, multimedia aids and computer tutorials§          §Marking and grading students' assignments, papers and exams and providing feedback to students about their progress§          §Maintaining records of students' progress, attendance and training activities§          §Consulting with Campus Managers, Student Advisors and other support staff§          §Providing regular management reporting of results§          §Upskilling as required in order to develop new qualifications or courses§          §Facilitating and managing projects within strict timelines§        §        § §        §Is this you? We look for the following skills in our Head Trainers: §        §          §A strong passion for the Industry as well as a sound knowledge and understanding of the vocational education and training sector§          §A comprehensive understanding of how RTOs operate in a business context§          §Solid interpersonal skills and the ability to lead a team§          §Excellent verbal and written communication skills§          §The proven ability to deliver training to groups§          §Results orientated go-getter§          §Organisational and time management skills§          §Ability to work under pressure, use ones initiative and remain calm in stressful situations§        §        § §        §Experience§        §          §Minimum 5 years of current industry experience in the vocational education and training sector§          §3+ years of experience as a Trainer and Assessor§          §Demonstrated understanding of vocational education principles, student services and reporting requirements§          §Ability and willingness to work collaboratively with a diverse group of staff across educational and broader functions in a scholarly and cooperative environment§          §Proven ability to provide administrative, educational and professional direction to staff across a variety of services§          §Advanced skills in training resource development§        §        § §        §Education:§        §          §Minimum SIS40215 - Certificate IV in Fitness and SIS50215 Diploma of Fitness (essential) or Bachelor of Exercise Science (preferred)§          §Certificate IV in Training and Assessment 40116 or equivalent or higher§          §Any combination of education and experience that would provide the required knowledge and skills for role§        §        § §        §Diversity & Inclusion§ §        §ALG is an inclusive employer. We celebrate our diversity and strive to reflect contemporary Australian society in order to better serve our students. We welcome and encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, Culturally and Linguistically Diverse people, People with Disability, Sexually and Gender Diverse people, people with lived experience of adversity and from people of all ages. §        § §        §Be a part of our Team§ §        §When you join our team you join the ALG family. We are a dynamic and growing organisation and offer our employees opportunities to enrol in our qualifications for free, weekly massages, access to our employee benefits portal and the opportunity to be paid flexibly.  §        § §        §About Australian Learning Group§        §Australian Learning Group §is owned by §UCW §and operates a number of colleges including §Australian College of Sports and Fitness§, §4Life College §and §Australian College of Dance§.§        § §        §About UCW§        §UCW§ is an ASX-listed entity that owns and operates a portfolio of tertiary education businesses, with a current focus on Health and Community Services related fields of study in both the international and domestic student market. This includes class room teaching, mentoring and supporting trainers and assessors, and in the development, evaluation and implementation of our Fitness education products.§  §You will ensure high standards of operations for ALG Sports and Fitness courses by ensuring our courses meet the Australian Quality and Standards Agency (ASQA) requirements for vocational education by undertaking a variety of tasks§  § §  §Responsibilities and Duties:§ § §Identifying the various needs of students and creating effective learning options to meet these needs§ §Liaising with individuals, industry computer tutorials§ §Marking and grading students' assignments, papers and exams and providing feedback to students about their progress§ §Maintaining records of students' progress, attendance and training activities§ §Consulting with Campus Managers, Student Advisors and other support staff§ §Providing regular management reporting of results§ §Upskilling as required in order to develop new qualifications or courses§ §Facilitating and managing projects within strict timelines§ § §  §Is this you? jobTitle: Group Fitness / Fitness Instructor Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50629775.txt	§Group Fitness / Fitness Instructor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Group Fitness / Fitness Instructor§§Advertiser: §YMCA§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §Parramatta & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§ §Work with us, not rent from us§ §Join our Y family, passionate about building communities§ §Opportunities for growth & development within fitness & the greater community recreation industries§ § §YMCA Western Sydney University are looking for a dynamic and engaging fitness professionals who are wanting to make a positive impact to the health and wellbeing of their local community. The successful candidate will be required to work across the Hawkesbury and Kingswood WSU locations.§ §About the role:§ §Our Fitness Instructors love what they do and inspire, encourage and educate our fitness members to be better versions of themselves. You will be open to working with us on a casual basis. We are looking for our Fitness Instructors to progress to Personal Trainers within the first 3 months of their employment with us, with the support of our Health & Fitness Coordinator. With a comprehensive mentoring and induction process, we want to assist you in being the best you can be to impact your local community.§ §Working a flexible roster across the 7 days of the week, this may include mornings, day and evenings with some weekends as required.§ §You will be comfortable as the go-to person on our Gym floor, easily connect with our members and work with them to achieve greater fitness and wellbeing. Health and fitness is part of who you are, not just your job, you are a team player and maintain high standards in the way you work and engage with others.§ §What we need from you:§ § §Certificate III in fitness (Fitness Trainer)§ §Certificate IV in fitness (Personal Trainer)§ §Cross Fit Level 1 (desireable)§ §Current First Aid Certificate§ §Current CPR Certificate§ §Current AusREPS Registration§ §WWCC§ § §What you can expect from us:§ § §Flexible working hours§ §A high energy team environment§ §Detailed induction with ongoing support and training§ §Opportunity to contribute to the development of areas you are passionate about§ §YMCA Employee benefits including; free gym membership, uniform, access to salary packaging and other great benefits§ §Rent free progression to our Personal Training Team (Certificate IV in Fitness required)§ §Be part of a family, not just another staff member§ §Opportunity for career progression within YMCA NSW, multiple development pathways available within Fitness or the greater Recreation industry§ §§Who What Y?§YMCA NSW is a profit-for-purpose organisation focused on healthy living, social impact and empowering young people. We operate 23 recreation centres, 57 Out of School Hours Care services and two camping locations which fund our diverse range of youth and community programs, employing 1800 staff across NSW.§Our goal is for our workforce to reflect the diverse community we serve. We encourage people of all genders, ages, religions, disability, sexual orientation, family and caring responsibilities and cultures, including people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander heritage to apply.§Commitment to Safeguarding§ §YMCA, including Boards of Directors, is committed to the safety and wellbeing of children and young people in accordance with our Safeguarding Children and Young People framework. YMCA requires that all applicants undergo satisfactory screening prior to commencement, including but not limited to:§ § §a national criminal history check;§ §an international criminal history check where applicants have worked overseas;§ §holding or obtaining a Working with Children Clearance/ equivalent in accordance with state/ territory laws;§ §Two reference checks.§ § §Please note, the results of any National and International Police Check will only be used to assess your suitability to perform the role.§ §Any successfully appointed applicant will be required to adhere to the Safeguarding Children and Young People framework, which includes a thorough safeguarding children and young people induction and committing to upholding the safety and wellbeing of children and young people throughout their engagement with YMCA.§ §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50629588.txt	§Strategic Racing Analyst - Betting & Intelligence Unit§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Strategic Racing Analyst - Betting & Intelligence Unit§§Advertiser: §Racing Victoria Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Strategic Racing Analyst - Betting & Intelligence Unit §      §        §Racing Victoria (RV) is one of Australia’s leading sporting organisations, and the independent governing body of thoroughbred racing in Victoria. We develop, promote and manage the conduct of the racing of thoroughbred horses in Victoria to safeguard its integrity.§        §We are looking for an experienced and driven analyst who has demonstrated experience of racing, intelligence and wagering to join RV Integrity Services Team.§        §The Opportunity:§        §Reporting to the Manager – Betting and Intelligence Unit (BIU), this role is responsible for:§        §          §Providing technical advice relating to wagering and form analysis and supporting raceday operations.§          §Proactively identifying integrity concerns through monitoring & analysis which has the potential to lead to integrity investigations.§          §Driving new ways of working in betting intelligence, including innovating process and digitising statistics and reporting.§        §        §Critical to the success of this role is someone who is capable of delivering BIU core functions (supporting raceday operations) along with proactively generating investigative leads, supporting investigations and innovating processes and statistical reporting.§        §The suitable candidate would need to be experienced in the above responsibilities but also resilient, a great communicator and confident in dealing with internal and external stakeholders. The suitable candidate would be joining a team of five staff who work in Betting and Intelligence.§        §Key Responsibilities are, but not limited to:§        §          §Monitoring of market movements and daily wagering activities on Victorian thoroughbred races which include telephone betting, recordings, betting exchanges, pari-mutuel and corporate bookmakers to develop profiles and patterns of behaviours;§          §Provide advice to the Integrity Services Department (ISD) on wagering market anomalies/abnormalities that may require further investigation;§          §Demonstrated excellence of race times, ratings and wagering markets;§          §Conduct investigations into betting irregularities, conduct analysis and provide advice and support to ISD as required;§          §Assist in the identification of any significant and irregular race and/or form activities that may impact race performance;§          §Analyse race performance for Stewards as required and requested;§          §Develop form analysis including speed maps, price guides, pre-race analysis and statistical data as required;§          §Collate, manage and interpret data relevant to wagering and form analysis to assist with investigations;§          §Provide analytical support for enquiries from ORIC, other PRA’s, police and other LEA’s and other sports regulators as required;.§          §Produce clear and concise intelligence reports;§          §Proactively identify area’s and provide solutions to improve existing work processes and procedures;§          §Assist in the development of automated monitoring tools, including the integration of statistical analysis;§          §Assist in the maintenance and development of manuals and process documents to ensure they are current and reflect Control Room objectives;§          §Undertake other duties assigned by the Manager – Betting and Intelligence Unit (BIU).§        §        §About you:§        §As the successful candidate, you jobText: TXT/50624134.txt	§Prison Officer - Melbourne Assessment Prison and Courts§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Prison Officer - Melbourne Assessment Prison and Courts§§Advertiser: §Prison Officers, Corrections Victoria§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§$55,256 - $70,958§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§Help Victoria remain a safe place to live by keeping our prisons secure.§ §No qualifications required. §Get paid to train§ – enjoy a comprehensive paid, eight-week training program prior to service.§ §Call on your §integrity, resilience and decision-making skills§.§ §People of all professional and cultural backgrounds encouraged to apply.§ §The Department of Justice and Community Safety is now recruiting a new squad of ongoing, full-time prison officers to work at Melbourne Assessment Prison (MAP) and Courts.§  §IT'S IMPORTANT WORK§The §secure containment§ of offenders is a cornerstone of a safe Victoria. Melbourne Assessment Prison is the first point of contact for all alleged offenders coming into the corrections system in Victoria. As a prison officer here, you will work with §all types of alleged offenders§ across the full gamut of crime, including many with mental health disorders that are challenging to manage.§  §Based in the CBD, MAP is a fast-paced, constantly busy work environment. We’re looking for §committed and resilient§ new prison officers who can make smart decisions under pressure.§  §INFORMATION SESSION§To gain a better understanding of the role of a prison officer, we strongly encourage you to register for our online information session. You’ll hear about the experiences of current prison officers and be able to ask questions about the job.§  §Wednesday 7th October 2020§Time:§ 5:30pm AEDT§  §Click §here §to register§  §WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU§Great Prison Officers can come from anywhere. Maybe you've worked as a PT in a gym or coached the local footy or netball team? Or maybe you’ve been involved in performance coaching or community sport? You might be surprised by how your work and life experience have set you up to become a first-rate prison officer.§The benefits of the job don’t end with the great camaraderie you’ll enjoy with your teammates, and sense of making a real difference, you will also:§  §◉ Earn an annual salary of §$55,256 - $70,958 plus super§, working full time hours on a 24-hour rotating roster.§  §◉ Enjoy §generous§ §penalty rates§ on night shifts, weekends and public holidays §paid in addition§ to salary. Weekend work is a frequent necessity for all full-time prison officers, so you need to be prepared to plan your life around your work. If it suits you better, you may have the option to nominate for full-time work at the Courts, which offers regular Monday to Friday business hour shifts, but your take home wage will more closely align with the standard annual salary.§  §◉ Undergo eight weeks of §paid full-time training§. By the end of the program, you will feel confident and well equipped to begin your new job. Upon commencement, you will continue working towards Certificate III accreditation in Custodial Services Practice.§  §◉ Enjoy access to §secondment§, §higher duty§ and §promotion§ opportunities regularly offered to top performing staff.§  §ABOUT MELBOURNE ASSESSMENT PRISON AND COURTS§MAP is a maximum-security prison located near Southern Cross Station in Melbourne’s CBD. MAP provides the primary state-wide assessment and orientation services for male prisoners received into the prison system.§  §If you become a prison officer at MAP, you're likely to work both at MAP and the County and Supreme courts, which are also located in the Melbourne CBD.§  §To learn more about what you'll do on the job, as well as the physical requirements, please go to §www.correctionsjobs.vic.gov.au/prison-officers§  §Successful candidates will be required to undergo pre-employment checks which may include national police checks and misconduct screening including traffic offences.§  §The Department of Justice and Community Safety is continually working towards increasing our§ Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander§ (Aboriginal) workforce. The Aboriginal Employment Team aims to attract, recruit and retain Aboriginal staff in a number of roles, including prison officers, community corrections officers and field officers. This support includes a culturally appropriate attraction and recruitment process. To learn more, § click here§ or email §aboriginal.employment@justice.vic.gov.au§  §Applications close at midnight on Thursday 15 October 2020.§  §We acknowledge the traditional Aboriginal owners of country throughout Victoria and pay our respects to them, their culture and their Elders, past, present and future.§  § §§§§

Be a part of it, let’s get something started.§  §About the role:§  §To thrive in the role, you will have an outgoing personality, positive attitude, enthusiasm with an ability to adapt and be flexible to support a large and dynamic team.§  §Council's Leisure Services include:§ § §Eagle Vale Central§ §Macquarie Fields Leisure Centre§ §The Gordon Fetterplace Aquatic Centre§ §What are the benefits for you?§ § §$30.89 per hour plus weekend penalty rates as applicable§ §9.5% superannuation§ §Junior rates of pay apply to applicants under 18 years of age§ §Casual Shifts OR§ §Seasonal Contract option providing guaranteed minimum hours per week with paid sick leave and annual leave entitlements (pro-rata)§ §Flexible shift options (mornings, afternoon and weekends)§ §Weekly pay§ §To be considered for an opportunity you must meet the following criteria:§ § §Hold a current Pool Lifeguard Award or possess a letter of course completion of the Pool Lifeguard course (licence essential after 3 months service)§ §A current First Aid certificate§ §Have a positive and friendly demeanour§ §A cleared Working with Children Check§ §We are committed to providing a variety of employment options, so contact us to find out how this opportunity could work for you.§  §Key contact:§ For further information, please contact Nicole Dufty, Leisure Staff Support Officer, on §4645 4888§ Sound like you? Apply now!§  §Applications close: §Monday 19 October 2020§  §Sound like you? Apply now!§  §Campbelltown City Council is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and values the unique contributions of all people. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds and people with a disability are encouraged to apply.§§§§

For our customers.  And for you.§        §Find out more at www.spotless.com.au§        §The Role§        §Spotless is the lead contractor to provide Estate Maintenance and Operation Services (EMOS) for the Department of Defence in Queensland and Southern New South Wales. This position is responsible for overseeing the general operation of the pool and surrounding amenities including shower and toilet facilities.§        §This part-time role will deliver a range of services including but not limited to:§        §          §Conduct opening duties including; remove pool covers, clean the pool & surrounds, remove any floating service debris, vacuum etc.§          §Throughout the opening hours of the pool maintain a vigilant oversight of the pool to ensure all users are safe§          §Interpret data from the Access Control System to verify that an entry and exit time is recorded against all users for the day§          §Ensure all equipment is in good working order and report any unsafe equipment for repair or replacement following procedures§        §        §Our front of house staff are the face of Spotless and play a pivotal role in delivering the services commitment we have made to our clients.§        §Skills and Experience§        §          §Suitability for Defence security clearance (Australian Citizenship Mandatory);§          §Current Resuscitation Certificate;§          §Current Senior First Aid Certificate;§          §Current Pool Lifeguard Certificate;§          §Must hold a current Australian Drivers Licence;§          §Minimum 1 years' experience in a Life Guard role.§        §        §The successful candidate will possess a strong work ethic, achieve highest level of safety, quality of work and have a genuine passion for excellent customer service.§        §Benefits and Culture §        §          §Supportive and inclusive culture§          §A professional and safe working environment§          §Good employee benefits and entitlements§        §        §This is a great opportunity to join a reputable company, work with an amazing team where you will be given the opportunity to develop your career.§        §To apply online please click the 'apply' button below. §        §Please note:§ As a pre-requisite for these roles all candidates need to be able to prove they are an Australian Citizen and hold a current Australian Drivers Licence. For our customers.  And for you.§Find out more at www.spotless.com.au§The Role§Spotless is the lead contractor to provide Estate Maintenance and Operation Services (EMOS) for the Department of Defence in Queensland and Southern New South Wales. This position is responsible for overseeing the general operation of the pool and surrounding amenities including shower and toilet facilities.§This part-time role will deliver a range of services including but not limited to:§§Conduct opening duties including; remove pool covers, clean the pool & surrounds, remove any floating service debris, vacuum etc.§Throughout the opening hours of the pool maintain a vigilant oversight of the pool to ensure all users are safe§Interpret data from the Access Control System to verify that an entry and exit time is recorded against all users for the day§Ensure all equipment is in good working order and report any unsafe equipment for repair or replacement following procedures§§Our front of house staff are the face of Spotless and play a pivotal role in delivering the services commitment we have made to our clients.§Skills and Experience§§Suitability for Defence security clearance (Australian Citizenship Mandatory);§Current Resuscitation Certificate;§Current Senior First Aid Certificate;§Current Pool Lifeguard Certificate;§Must hold a current Australian Drivers Licence;§Minimum 1 years' experience in a Life Guard role.§§The successful candidate will possess a strong work ethic, achieve highest level of safety, quality of work and have a genuine passion for excellent customer service.§Benefits and Culture §§Supportive and inclusive culture§A professional and safe working environment§Good employee benefits and entitlements§§This is a great opportunity to join a reputable company, work with an amazing team where you will be given the opportunity to develop your career.§§To apply online please click the 'apply' button below. §§Please note:§ As a pre-requisite for these roles all candidates need to be able to prove they are an Australian Citizen and hold a current Australian Drivers Licence. Candidates will also be required to undertake a pre-employment medical and drug screen as well as a National Police and Australian Security Defence Clearance Check.§§Spotless is an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourages indigenous Australians to apply.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50673305.txt	§Lifeguard§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lifeguard§§Advertiser: §YMCA§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Coffs Harbour & North Coast§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Other§§§§§§Guard the livelihood of strong communities.§As a Lifeguard with The Y, you understand that safety and fun go hand-in-hand. Our pools and recreation facilities are invaluable, inclusive, exciting spaces for sporty types – especially young people. But, they can’t exist if they aren’t safe. Which is exactly where you come in. You’ll join a team of responsible, approachable, confident swimmers in supervising our pools and surrounding areas. Together, you’ll uphold the highest standards of care and safety to make sure our swimmers have fun, stay active and gain confidence in the water.§If you’re a people person with a keen eye for detail and who thrives under pressure, you could be our next Lifeguard. If so, expect perks like flexible hours and free facility membership, and the support to build valuable people, leadership and life skills – all while you make a difference to your community.§This role is based at YMCA Bellingen.§Qualifications§ §Current Lifeguard Qualification§ §Working with Children Check§ §Police Check (paid for by the Y)§ §CPR Certificate§ §Y work with us?§ §Work within a supportive team environment§ §Room to learn and develop within the organisation§ §Flexible hours and arrangements, for a work-life balance that works for you§ §Awesome discounts on The Y services and products§ §Corporate health insurance cover to keep you healthy§ §§Who What Y?§The Y NSW is a profit-for-purpose organisation focused on healthy living, social impact and empowering young people. We operate 22 recreation centres, 63 out-of-school-hours care services, and two camping locations which employ 1,800 staff across NSW –  and fund our diverse range of enriching community programs.§We believe in building a diverse, inclusive workforce that reflects the communities we serve. We encourage people of all genders, ages, religions, disability, sexual orientation, family and caring responsibilities and cultures, including people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander heritage, to apply.§Commitment to Safeguarding§ § The Y, including Boards of Directors, is committed to the safety and wellbeing of children and young people in accordance with our Safeguarding Children and Young People framework. The Y requires that all applicants undergo satisfactory screening prior to commencement, including but not limited to:§●      a national criminal history check;§●      an international criminal history check where applicants have worked overseas;§●      holding or obtaining a Working with Children Clearance/equivalent in accordance with state/ territory laws;§●      two reference checks.§Please note, the results of any National and International Police Check will only be used to assess your suitability to perform the role.§Any successfully appointed applicant will be required to adhere to the Safeguarding Children and Young People framework, which includes a thorough safeguarding children and young people induction and committing to upholding the safety and wellbeing of children and young people throughout their engagement with YMCA.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§
