Full-time, Part-time or Casual. we have availability for all§ §We train hard but don't take ourselves too seriously - If you have the skillset and outgoing personality to join this team we want to hear from you!§ §Trifusion Fitness§ is well established in the Bayside community for Group Fitness, Individual Personal Training and Small Group Personal Training Programs.§With restrictions easing and current trainers bookings filling VERY FAST we are looking to add 1 - 3 new trainers to the team.§We have been inundated with inquiries for people wanting to train, and have been able to fill 2 of our trainers with up to 20 sessions a week (in just 2 weeks since outdoor sessions have become available in victoria).§ §Our studio is located at 837 Nepean Highway Bentleigh, and we can assure you that we are COVID safe, offering the ability to train up to 16 members per group training session (with safe space workout PODS to eliminate equipment sharing).§ §Our strength and conditioning level where trainers take members for individual and small group personal training sessions has plenty of space to ensure safe distancing practices.§ §As soon as training can commence indoors we will be ready to move inside, however, for now, we have multiple outdoor areas to train members that are all very close by. Trainers can use equipment from the studio to train clients.§Currently, Trifusion Fitness runs with a team of 5 passionate trainers who work together in order to help our members achieve the best results possible, and we are looking for the next trainer to join the team.§ §Trifusion Fitness offers the following benefits for trainers:§ § §PERSONAL TRAINERS WANTED - 1 - 3 Positions available § §ZERO RENT - §means there is no stress while building a client base. Also means ZERO overheads as a trainer while building and NO LOCK-IN if we go into LOCKDOWN § §GREAT STARTING PAY§ - INCREASING THE BUSIER WE GET YOU!§ §WE DO ALL OF YOUR LEAD GENERATION & SALES §- Trifusion Directors take all sales and new lead meetings to gain YOU CLIENTS - so no gym floor work§ §GREAT WORK / LIFE BALANCE §- trainers receive 1 morning and 1 evening off per week minimum.§ §STUDIO/CLIENT CANCELATION POLICY§ - means you can guarantee your income§ §TRAINER DEVELOPMENT§ - We work as a team which means we will educate you on every aspect of training to help you become the best trainer possible§ §COURSE REIMBURSEMENT STRUCTURE§ - We will pay you back for your courses completed while training at Trifusion Fitness (owner approved courses)§ §6 DAYS A WEEK TRAINING§ - Means you don't have to work crazy hours and will ALWAYS receive a Sunday OFF§ §This position ideally suits someone living in the BAYSIDE area as some SPLIT SHIFTS are required (nature of the industry)§ §MUST HAVE OWN CAR§ - Studio is located at 837 Nepean Highway Brighton/Bentleigh - Please check the travel time to the studio before applying§ §If you Fit the following Criteria, we want to hear from you:§ § §Are physically fit. Trifusion Trainers practice what we preach§ §Confident and outgoing personality§ §Good People skills (have good banter)§ §Are wanting to make your mark in the fitness industry (not just get a paycheque)§ §Are looking to work closely with a Fun Energetic Team to help ALL OF US GROW as Trainers§ §Are good with Time management and Client management§ §Willing to work morning and evenings§ §Has own mode of transport (please only apply if you have access to a car as we need reliability)§ §Must have completed or about to finish Cert 4 in Personal Training§ §Are wanting to become the best trainer possible and are willing to up-skill to make sure they are ALWAYS providing the BEST service for their clients.§ §WHAT DO YOU NEED TO DO TO GET YOUR FOOT IN THE DOOR??? § §Send us a CV via the 'Apply' button include all of the below:§ § §Include Date of Birth § §Date of completed certificates§ §Relevant experience§ §a little about your own current training you perform to keep yourself physically fit. § §We will be contacting applicants over the next 2-3 weeks§ §** Experience is a bonus however, the Right new Trainer will be considered**§ §We have sessions available immediately and have the ability to build trainers very quickly so if you are looking for a stress-free place to train where you can focus on your skills as a trainer without the stress of covering rent then this is the right position for you.§ §You can check out our site at www.trifusion.com.au or www.facebook.com/TrifusionFitness§We look forward to hearing from you.§Scott, Jono and Kirsty§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50620836.txt	§Exercise Physiologist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Exercise Physiologist§§Advertiser: §Nunkuwarrin Yunti of SA Inc§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§Nunkuwarrin Yunti, the foremost Aboriginal Community Controlled Health Organisation in Adelaide aims to promote and deliver improvement in the health and wellbeing of all Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and their families in the greater metropolitan areas of Adelaide and regional areas to advance their social, cultural and economic status. The Organisation places a strong focus on a client centered approach to the delivery of services and a collaborative working culture to achieve the best possible outcomes for clients.§About the Program§§Working within the Community Health Promotion and Education team, this new program presents an exciting opportunity for Nunkuwarrin Yunti to extend its services to include physical activity. The program provides proactive support to Aboriginal people to participate in flexible, community based physical activity programs.§The Nunga Active program utilises physical activity to improve social isolation and overall health outcomes for Aboriginal people. This is undertaken through supporting clients to identify appropriate physical activity opportunities and decrease any potential barriers to participation. Support to participate is undertaken by appropriate exercise prescription, goal setting, and Community/ peer support. The program also ensures clients gain a tailored, culturally safe and supportive environment to participate within.§§About the Role§§This position will work closely with the Personal Trainer/ Group Exercise Instructor and other professionals to undertake activities. The Exercise Physiologist will undertake appropriate assessments and exercise prescription from clinic-based and community-based settings.§The primary role of the Exercise Physiologist includes, is and not limited to:§§Utilise tailored approaches to provide expert advice and support to individuals to engage in group based physical activity sessions§ §Provide appropriate individualised support as required, to facilitate physical activity and engagement from clients.§ §Work with Allied Health Professionals to ensure appropriate referrals into the program§ §Support group based physical activity classes that are engaging and well attended§ §Coordinate and ensure scheduled follow up is provided to all referrals received into the program§ §Coordinate, deliver and undertake community education programs and activities§ §Contribute to policy and procedure development related to the Nunga Active Program§ §Collaborate with key internal and external stakeholders especially relating to physical activity groups§§Remuneration§§This position is under the Nunkuwarrin Yunti Enterprise Agreement classification of §Health Services§ Level §5§§To Apply§§Note§: For all roles within Nunkuwarrin Yunti would require a mandatory Working with Children Check (SA) and National Police Check. §Please complete your application with your CV, a Cover Letter and the Application Questions. Incomplete application will not be considered.§We encourage and thank all applicants for their time, however only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.§Should you have any queries or for further information please contact HR via hr@nunku.org.au§§Due to the nature of this role, applicants from an Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander background are strongly encouraged to apply.§§Please note applications close by COB 13 October 2020§§ESSENTIAL – §includes qualifications, skills, experience and knowledge§§Registered as a current Exercise Physiologist with Exercise Sports Science Australia (ESSA) with at least 4 years of practical experience in this capacity§ §Understanding of Community Health including experience working with socially isolated clients and/or people with a disability§ §Demonstrated ability in coordinating and undertaking community group activities and programs§§Well-developed written and verbal communication skills and ability to communicate effectively with Aboriginal people and stakeholders§ §Strong organisational skills, with the ability to prioritise demands, escalate where required, and deliver on multiple deadlines and juggle competing priorities§ §Ability to set priorities and monitor own workflow§§DESIRABLE§§Experience working within an Aboriginal Health setting§ §Demonstrated experience in program development, facilitation and evaluation§ §Knowledge of Tobacco related Chronic Disease and smoking cessation techniques§ §Ability to liaise, network and negotiate with a range of human service organisations and government agencies§§§§

jobTitle: Infantry Soldier Job in Toowoomba & Darling Downs - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50662115.txt	§Infantry Soldier§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Infantry Soldier§§Advertiser: §Defence Force Recruiting Northern Region§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Toowoomba & Darling Downs§§Salary§§$15,000 - $29,999§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Infantry Soldier §      §        §§        §Your role:§        §As an Infantry Soldier, you’ll play a vital role in the Army Reserve and join the close-knit and highly trained combat team.§        § §        §In this flexible role you’ll master a variety of skills including the handling of advanced weaponry such as rifles, machine guns, grenades and anti-armour weapons. You’ll also learn vital survival tactics to apply regardless of the season, weather or terrain.§        § §        §From learning skilled reconnaissance tactics to effective teamwork and cooperation, there’s never a dull moment as an Infantry Soldier in the Army Reserve.§        § §        §Life in the Army Reserve: §        §Thousands of men and women enjoy part-time roles with the Army Reserve, operating alongside full-time Army personnel. The only difference is that your commitment is flexible.§        § §        §Initial training length will vary based on your chosen role, after which you will normally be expected to serve between 35 and 70 days a year. This could involve an evening each week and one weekend a month, and even extended periods away.§        § §        §We do our best to make sure this fits in with your work and family commitments; and deployments are voluntary so if you choose to stay local, there are plenty of ways to make a difference closer to home. And with no minimum period of service, you can leave the Army Reserve whenever you like.§        § §        §Wage: §        §The pay you receive in the Army Reserve goes straight into your pocket with no deductions for tax, and it increases as you gain seniority and experience.§        § §        §You could earn a tax-free rate starting at: $133.56 per day§        § §        §On completion of military and initial employment training your rate could increase to: $ 161.72 per day§        § §        §Apply now: §        §For this role, you must be over 17 at time of enlistment and have completed an Australian Year 10 education (or equivalent) with passes in English and Mathematics.§        § §        §Click the APPLY button if you think you have what it takes to become an Army Reserve Infantry Soldier and we’ll get in contact with you shortly.§        § §        §You can also visit the link below to view the full position description and learn more about life in the Army Reserve.§        § §        §https://www.defencejobs.gov.au/jobs/reserves/army/infantry-soldier§        § §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§§Your role:§ §As an Infantry Soldier, you’ll play a vital role in the Army Reserve and join the close-knit and highly trained combat team.§ § § §In this flexible role you’ll master a variety of skills including the handling of advanced weaponry such as rifles, machine guns, grenades and anti-armour weapons. You’ll also learn vital survival tactics to apply regardless of the season, weather or terrain.§ § § §From learning skilled reconnaissance tactics to effective teamwork and cooperation, there’s never a dull moment as an Infantry Soldier in the Army Reserve.§ § § §Life in the Army Reserve: § §Thousands of men and women enjoy part-time roles with the Army Reserve, operating alongside full-time Army personnel. The only difference is that your commitment is flexible.§ § § §Initial training length will vary based on your chosen role, after which you will normally be expected to serve between 35 and 70 days a year. This could involve an evening each week and one weekend a month, and even extended periods away.§ § § §We do our best to make sure this fits in with your work and family commitments; and deployments are voluntary so if you choose to stay local, there are plenty of ways to make a difference closer to home. And with no minimum period of service, you can leave the Army Reserve whenever you like.§ § § §Wage: § §The pay you receive in the Army Reserve goes straight into your pocket with no deductions for tax, and it increases as you gain seniority and experience.§ § § §You could earn a tax-free rate starting at: $133.56 per day§ § § §On completion of military and initial employment training your rate could increase to: $ 161.72 per day§ § § §Apply now: § §For this role, you must be over 17 at time of enlistment and have completed an Australian Year 10 education (or equivalent) with passes in English and Mathematics.§ § § §Click the APPLY button if you think you have what it takes to become an Army Reserve Infantry Soldier and we’ll get in contact with you shortly.§ § § §You can also visit the link below to view the full position description and learn more about life in the Army Reserve.§ § § §https://www.defencejobs.gov.au/jobs/reserves/army/infantry-soldier§ § §§§§

A community not-for-profit organisation with 17 million participations annually across Australia. 8,000 staff and volunteers serve at more than 150 locations every day. We partner with government and private capital to deliver programs and services that include community recreation, adventure and stadium sports, camping, learn to swim, children's programs, early learning, youth services, retirement living, disability services and social enterprises.§        §About Mount Alexander Shire Swimming Pools§        §The Mount Alexander Shire Swimming Pools comprise of 4 outdoor locations throughout the local government area, including:§        §          §Castlemaine Swimming Pool§          §Harcourt Swimming Pool§          §Maldon Swimming Pool§          §Newstead & District Swimming Pool§        §        §These seasonal outdoor aquatic facilities form a key component for community recreation engagement throughout the December to March operating season. The facilities offer a range of programs and services such as recreational swimming, fitness programs, swimming lessons, community events and more.§        §Key Elements of the Role§        §As an Outdoor Pool Coordinator, you are responsible for coordinating, training and developing the Seasonal Outdoor Pool team, provide leadership and direction to the pool plant operations, centre cleanliness, program and service delivery, and ensure these areas offer the highest possible level of service. The Outdoor Pool Coordinator will demonstrate leadership and being pro-active in all aspects of this role is essential to the health and safety of our patrons.§        §The Outdoor Pool Coordinator will be someone that leads our Seasonal Aquatics team to best practice systems. This will involve developing seasonal training and meeting plan for all staff, delivering this training and continual review and feedback to staff in terms of their skills and the way they present themselves to our Customers.§        §​The Key duties performed within this role include, but are not limited to;§        §          §Promote and accept personal accountability by providing clear and regular feedback within the team§          §Inspire and motivate the team to do their best by promoting a culture of continuous learning and development§          §Manage staff in a fair and transparent manner§          §Roster staff to ensure the safe running of centre and adherence to Aquatic supervision requirements§          §Manage staff to adhere to safe aquatic supervision, quality of service and delivery of program and service at the facilities§          §Safety Officer – Occupational Health and Safety & Risk Management§          §Budget preparation and maintenance§          §Responsible for collecting and maintaining all appropriate management data and systems§          §Manage kiosk including stock control and safe food handling procedures§          §Maintain a working knowledge and understanding of the centre's Emergency Action Plan§          §Ensure facilities are operating and compliant to all industry regulation and guidelines§          §Manage risks and the overall aquatic safety of facilities in consultation with the Centre Manager and Health & Safety Advisor§          §Ensure requirements for customers enquiry, community and user groups and community consultation and engagement processes are in place and adhered to§          §Transactional finance process of purchasing, invoicing for services and other operational finance tasks§          §Monthly area reporting according to deadlines§          §Processing of payroll in accordance to organizational standards and timeframes§        §        §Selection Criteria§        §Capabilities and Behaviours§        §          §Demonstrates YMCA Victoria values§          §Promotes and accepts personal accountability to better influence§          §Provides continuous feedback and clarity of messages within the team§          §Performs in a way that inspires and motivates the team to do their best§          §Supports a culture of continuous learning and development across the team§        §        §Knowledge and Experience§        §          §A proactive and solution-focused approach is essential in this position§          §Strong communication and training skills will be required to roll out new and modified procedures.§          §Support staff§          §Proven skills and knowledge in pool operation§          §Basic computer skills§          §Knowledge of Occupational Health & Safety Legislation is highly advantageous§        §        §Personal Attributes§        §          §Model's, demonstrates and teaches positive values like caring, honesty, respect, and responsibility§ approachable manner§          §Works as part of a team and shows professionalism§          §Punctual in both attendance on shift and attendance at staff meetings§        §        §Leadership jobText: TXT/50553955.txt	§Recreation Centre Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recreation Centre Manager§§Advertiser: §City of Kalgoorlie-Boulder§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Sept 2020§§Location§§Kalgoorlie, Goldfields & Esperance§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Recreation Centre Manager §      §        §The City of Kalgoorlie Boulder is seeking a suitable qualified and experienced Manager to lead the team at the Goldfields Oasis Recreation Centre. The Oasis is Kalgoorlie-Boulder’s hub for sporting, recreation and leisure pursuits. The facility provides a state of the air gymnasium, aquatic center, crèche and indoor stadiums. As the Oasis Manager, you will lead a team of dedicated professionals in providing innovative fitness and recreational programs, services and activities to the community to deliver an exceptional sport and leisure experience.§        § §        §Key Accountabilities: §        §          §Oversee all operational activities of the Centre;§          §Develop and manager annual budgets, asset management plan and monthly reports;§          §Release the strategic vision and aspirational projects identified in the City of Kalgoorlie Boulder Strategic Community Plan;§          §Management of all employees, provide inspirational leadership and drive a strong customer focused culture;§          §Foster key relationship ad drive membership growth including the implementation of a yearly marketing plan;§          §Ensure safety and well-being of visitors and employees through the effective planning and review of all associated polices, processes and procedures.§        §        §Applications Close: 5PM Wednesday 30th September 2020§        §Remuneration will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.§        § Applicants must address the §Skills, Knowledge & Capacity§ section in the §Position Description§, and include both a resume and cover letter.§        § Please submit applications via the §“Apply for a Job” §link on the City's website.§        §For more information, or for a copy of the position description please visit the City’s website or contact our §People and Culture §team.§        § §        § §        § §      §      §      §    §    §Trust. Integrity. Loyalty. Passion.§    §  §§§The City of Kalgoorlie Boulder is seeking a suitable qualified and experienced Manager to lead the team at the Goldfields Oasis Recreation Centre. The Oasis is Kalgoorlie-Boulder’s hub for sporting, recreation and leisure pursuits. The facility provides a state of the air gymnasium, aquatic center, crèche and indoor stadiums. As the Oasis Manager, you will lead a team of dedicated professionals in providing innovative fitness and recreational programs, services and activities to the community to deliver an exceptional sport and leisure experience.§ § § §Key Accountabilities: § § §Oversee all operational activities of the Centre;§ §Develop and manager annual budgets, asset management plan and monthly reports;§ §Release the strategic vision and aspirational projects identified in the City of Kalgoorlie Boulder Strategic Community Plan;§ §Management of all employees, provide inspirational leadership and drive a strong customer focused culture;§ §Foster key relationship ad drive membership growth including the implementation of a yearly marketing plan;§ §Ensure safety and well-being of visitors and employees through the effective planning and review of all associated polices, processes and procedures.§ §Applications Close: 5PM Wednesday 30th September 2020§ §Remuneration will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.§ § Applicants must address the §Skills, Knowledge & Capacity§ section in the §Position Description§, and include both a resume and cover letter.§ § Please submit applications via the §“Apply for a Job” §link on the City's website.§ §For more information, or for a copy of the position description please visit the City’s website or contact our §People and Culture §team.§ § § § § § §§§§

jobTitle: Coach/Personal Trainer - Performance Personal Training Job in Sydney - SEEK
xenophobe: right to live and work
jobText: TXT/50652338.txt	§Coach/Personal Trainer - Performance Personal Training§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Coach/Personal Trainer - Performance Personal Training§§Advertiser: §HealthyPeople§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §South West & M5 Corridor§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§We're looking for a passionate personal trainer to join our crew!§ §Do you love learning, lifting and all things coaching?§ §Ready to work in a team of likeminded, passionate pros?§ §If that's you... We'd like to talk.§ §If successful, our coaches are initially employed part-time (20-hour contract + fortnightly bonuses). Progression to the full-time salary paid positions are made available to those that work for it.§ §Necessary traits; include at least 1-2 years of recent industry experience, a passion for learning, aspirations to be a career fit pro and a solid work ethic. § §We are very picky as to who we bring into our business. Only highly motivated and enthusiastic individuals need to apply.§Why PPT:§ § §No need to do sales, or source your clients. That's our job! Your job is to train people, retain clients, deliver and get results.§ §No paying rent at PPT - Staff are paid based on their experience, qualifications and time with us. As you grow, so will your rate! § §As an employee of our business, you'll be paid holidays and sick pay.§ §We are a team - No independent businesses or competition in house, just a group of people supporting each other to grow to new levels.§ §We're a young, growing business. Get in early and capitalise on our growth. § §We have a strong education culture! Through our in-house and external training, we help our trainers learn and grow.§ §We're a trainers paradise! Our facility is equipped with some of the worlds best fitness equipment, with a range unmatched by any other in the MacArthur area. Atlantis Strength Equipment, Watson Barbell, Rogue Fitness Equipment and loads more. We've handpicked only the best equipment for our clients and trainers to work with.§ §Only apply for the role if you're:§ § §Interested developing a career in the health and fitness industry, not just here for a cup of coffee! We are committed to our clients and need our trainers to be the same way.§ §Knows a thing or two about strength training and programming, has some evidence-based nutrition knowledge and is hungry to learn more. We place a STRONG emphasis on continuing education and like our trainers to be the same way!§ §Able to deliver both 1 on 1 and small group training sessions§ §Tech and Social Media Savvy - we use a little tech in house so you'll need to be able to do more than turn the computer on.§ §A trainer that trains! You don't need to look like a bodybuilder, but if you don't train yourself, please don't apply.§ §Available to work typical peak gym hours (and some split days). § §Able to work autonomously, you're reliable and just a decent person to work with. We have an awesome crew, and we're picky about who joins. § §Essential qualifications:§ § §Minimum Certificate IV in Fitness§ §Current Personal Public Liability Insurance§ §Senior First Aid§ §Desirable qualifications:§ § §Diploma in Fitness§ §Human Movement, Sports Science, Exercise Science or Equivalent Degree§ §Any other relevant tertiary qualification§ §Keen to Apply? We'd love to meet you!§ §Send us through:§ § §Current Resume§ §Cover Letter§ §Create a 1-2 minute video telling us "Why you're a good fit for PPT?" and send it to mary@performance-pt.com.au§ §APPLICATIONS CLOSE - Tuesday 27th October 2020§ §NOTE: You must be an Australian Resident to be considered for the role.§§§§

jobTitle: Personal Trainer Required for One-on-One Training - Tonic PT Carlton Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50649897.txt	§Personal Trainer Required for One-on-One Training - Tonic PT Carlton§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Personal Trainer Required for One-on-One Training - Tonic PT Carlton§§Advertiser: §HealthyPeople§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§About us:§  §At §Tonic Personal Training§ our aim is to provide a unique service to all our clients, enabling them to achieve and maintain optimum personal health and fitness. Our core business is primarily focused on private personal training in both one-on-one and two-on-one sessions.§  §About the role:§  §Tonic Personal Training has an opportunity for a suitably qualified Personal Trainer/Strength and Conditioning Coach to join our small team in Carlton. We are looking for someone who is a great communicator, knowledgeable and shows keen interest to learn and develop their skills as a personal trainer/coach.§  §This role will provide the successful applicant with an opportunity to build a client base, and work in collaboration with other trainers on client programs within our business. We encourage our trainers to be innovative and engaged in the business development process and involved in day-to-day operations. We work predominantly in a one-on-one and two-on-one format with our clients. §  §Hours of work are flexible, but the successful applicant is expected to be available for a mix of mornings and evenings.§  §As an integral part of a proven client service process, you will receive training and support in establishing and maintaining your client base by tapping into our experience in developing strong, long-term client relationships.§  §Job Type:§ Casual Employment§  §Requirements:§ § §One year minimum experience as a Personal Trainer§ §Certificate IV in Fitness or higher§ §Senior First Aid / CPR§ §Professional indemnity and public liability insurance§ §Working with Tonic PT will provide you with a great opportunity to build your business, increase your skills and work in a passionate, experienced and close-knit team.§  §To apply:§  §Please send a cover letter and CV to Travis via the link below.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50593341.txt	§Operations Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Operations Assistant§§Advertiser: §Virgin Active§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Operations Assistant §      §        §We are a globally recognised brand with over 233 clubs in 8 countries and more than 1 million members. As part of the Virgin Group founded by Sir Richard Branson, we opened our first club in Australia in 2008 and are building an unparalleled collection of iconic locations in Sydney and Melbourne. We continue to innovate by developing a more personalised gym, multi-boutique experience and mission to provide irresistible exercise experiences.§        §The gig:§        §You’ll ensure the studios are sparkling before each class by cleaning all equipment and wiping the mirrors and floor so they’re flawless. You’ll clean and prepare the equipment required by each member and help to create an environment where members love spending time. You’ll be super conscious about everyone‘s safety and take enormous pride in producing the shiniest changerooms ever. You’ll be empowered to find ways to give our members that little bit extra... especially when it’s unexpected.§        §All about you:§        §You’re warm, honest and genuine with relevant experience and a neat-freak reputation. You love to create a glistening clean environment for all. Whatever a member needs, whatever a member is looking for, you help them find it. You get a kick out of creating beautifully fresh and spotless spaces which make people go wow! You‘re comfortable communicating at all levels and can be counted on to maintain a sparkling environment for all. You have the flexibility to work a non-traditional schedule and may also have some hospitality sector experience. A+ for you. §        §What we offer you:§        §          §One of the world’s most recognised and exciting brands§          §A culture that’s all about making exercise irresistible§          §A free membership for you to workout at our clubs (and one for your buddy after 12 months)§          §Discounted personal training§          §Special deals with our retail and service partners§          §Paid parental leave to spend time with your new little human§          §Paid training and regular personal and professional development§          §Confidential 24-hour support via our employee assistance program§          §Uniforms designed in partnership with lululemon athletica§          §Fun. It’s part of our success. We prefer smiles to graphs. We like to be human rather than corporate.§        §        §These opportunities don’t come up often… especially with Virgin. jobTitle: Lifeguard Job in ACT - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50659419.txt	§Lifeguard§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lifeguard§§Advertiser: §YMCA§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§ §Casual roles available§ §If you're not qualified, we can assist you in organising your course!§ §Located at Canberra Olympic Pool§ § §As a Lifeguard at Canberra Olympic Pool, you understand that safety and fun go hand-in-hand. Our pools and recreation facilities are invaluable, inclusive, exciting spaces for sporty types – especially young people. But, they can’t exist if they aren’t safe. Which is exactly where you come in. You’ll join a team of responsible, approachable, confident swimmers in supervising our pools and surrounding areas. Together, you’ll uphold the highest standards of care and safety to make sure our swimmers have fun, stay active and gain confidence in the water.§ §If you’re a people person with a keen eye for detail and who thrives under pressure, you could be our next Lifeguard. If so, expect perks like flexible hours and free facility membership, and the support to build valuable people, leadership and life skills – all while you make a difference to your community.§ §Qualifications§ § §Current Lifeguard Qualification (if you haven't got this qualification, we can assist in organising your course)§ §Working with Children Check§ §Police Check (paid for by the Y)§ §CPR Certificate§ § §Y work with us?§ § §Work within a supportive team environment§ §Room to learn and develop within the organisation§ §Flexible hours and arrangements, for a work-life balance that works for you§ §Awesome discounts on The Y services and products§ §Corporate health insurance cover to keep you healthy§ §§Who What Y?§The Y NSW is a profit-for-purpose organisation focused on healthy living, social impact and empowering young people. We operate 22 recreation centres, 63 out-of-school-hours care services, and two camping locations which employ 1,800 staff across NSW –  and fund our diverse range of enriching community programs.§We believe in building a diverse, inclusive workforce that reflects the communities we serve. We encourage people of all genders, ages, religions, disability, sexual orientation, family and caring responsibilities and cultures, including people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander heritage, to apply.§Commitment to Safeguarding§The Y, including Boards of Directors, is committed to the safety and wellbeing of children and young people in accordance with our Safeguarding Children and Young People framework. The Y requires that all applicants undergo satisfactory screening prior to commencement, including but not limited to:§ §a national criminal history check;§ §an international criminal history check where applicants have worked overseas;§ §holding or obtaining a Working with Children Clearance/equivalent in accordance with state/ territory laws;§ §two reference checks.§ § §Please note, the results of any National and International Police Check will only be used to assess your suitability to perform the role.§ §Any successfully appointed applicant will be required to adhere to the Safeguarding Children and Young People framework, which includes a thorough safeguarding children and young people induction and committing to upholding the safety and wellbeing of children and young people throughout their engagement with YMCA.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50636953.txt	§Gym & Pool Attendant (Lifeguard)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Gym & Pool Attendant (Lifeguard)§§Advertiser: §Ventia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §Fremantle & Southern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Gym & Pool Attendant (Lifeguard) §      §        §The Company§Ventia’s acquisition of Broadspectrum, completed in June 2020, brings together two highly complementary businesses, each with a proud heritage of providing essential infrastructure services in Australia and New Zealand. We are one of the largest suppliers of essential services in the region, and are proud to provide the expertise to keep infrastructure working for our communities. No one else does exactly what we do in the way we do it.§        §The Role§Ventia are currently looking to engage Casual Gym & Pool Attendants in preparation for our summer season.§As the Gym/Pool Attendant, you’ll be responsible for ensuring the safe delivery of our gym practices, as well as pool activities within the allocated ADF facilities. jobText: TXT/50668061.txt	§Aqua Fitness Instructors§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Aqua Fitness Instructors§§Advertiser: §Lake Macquarie City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Newcastle, Maitland & Hunter§§Salary§§$32.89-$35.41 ph +25% casual loading +12% Super§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§Casual§ §Come and join our enthusiastic and supportive team this summer season at Lake Macquarie City Council Swim Centres! Contribute to the health and fitness of the Community by leading your own classes packed with fun and motivating aquatic activities.§ §LET’S EXPLORE THE JOB§ §We are seeking qualified Aqua Fitness Instructors on a casual basis over the summer season to lead contemporary customer-focused aquaerobics programs to a wide range of ages. With a focus on delivering fun, safe and educational programs, our Aqua Fitness Instructors consistently motivate, engage and create a sense of community for our customers, whilst ensuring a diverse range of contemporary classes are regularly offered.§ §The position services our network of Swim Centres, with shifts being rostered across Swansea, West Wallsend, Charlestown and Speers Point Swim Centres.§ §Key areas of responsibility include (but not limited to):§ § §Provide professional instruction and supervision to participants of Lake Mac Swim Centres Aqua Fit programs, enabling participants to develop and improve their fitness level.§ §Develop supportive and encouraging relationships with class participants through high-quality customer service.§ §Work cohesively with the team in class planning and preparation activities, offer insights and suggestions to improve our programs and ensure classes operate efficiently.§ §Assist with the development and promotion of Aqua Fit programs and activities to ensure Council offerings are contemporary and meet the needs of a broad demographic.§ §Participate in WHS programs and report any WHS issues to Management.§ §Please note: A full list of accountabilities is located within the attached Position Statement.§ §Conditions of Employment include:§ § §shift work / weekend work§ §On call work§ §travel and work across multiple sites§ §LET’S DESCRIBE YOU§ §Our ideal instructors are enthusiastic professionals with a focus on developing contemporary, encouraging and safe aqua fitness programs for our Community to enjoy. You will be adaptable to working with diverse groups, have an eagerness to share insights for process improvements and highly value quality customer service delivered with enthusiasm.§ §Candidates will be able to meet the following criteria§ § §AUSTSWIM WETS Aqua Instructor Certificate or equivalent with experience in Aquatic based recreation programs.§ §Current CPR Certificate.§ §Knowledge of contemporary Aqua activities and experience in delivering safe, fun and encouraging fitness classes to diverse groups.§ §Clear and adaptive communication and interpersonal style§ §Desirable - Current Bronze Coaching qualification issued by Australian Swimming Coaches and Teachers Association§ §LET’S REVEAL THE PERKS§ § §$32.89 to $35.41§ §per hour plus 25% casual loading plus 12% superannuation§ §long service leave after 5 years§ §education assistance§ §training and development opportunities§ §free parking within walking distance of work site§ §corporate fitness program§ §equipment supplied§ §LET’S TALK ABOUT US§ §When you join us, you are not part of an organisation; you are part of a future that more than 205,000 Lake Macquarie residents depend on every day. To work here is to be connected. To be part of a true community who value creativity and collaboration, wellbeing and sustainability, opportunity and diversity. Together, we believe in shaping our own future - not waiting for it.§ §Lake Mac strives to be an inclusive workplace for all people. We recognise that we operate in a diverse community and welcome and encourage applications from all ages and genders, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people from culturally diverse backgrounds, the LGBTIQ+ community, refugees and people with disability. We understand the skills and attributes veterans can bring to our Council.§ §LET’S START§ §Position Statement – § Aqua Fitness Instructor§ § §Applications close midnight, Sunday 18th October 2020.§ §For enquiries related to the duties of the role, please contact Callie Spurr, Team Leader West Swim Centers, on §02 4069 0033§ or via email §cspurr@lakemac.nsw.gov.au§.§ §If you need assistance with submitting your application, please contact Catherine Khalil, Talent Acquisition Advisor, on §02 4069 0042§ or via email §ckhalil@lakemac.nsw.gov.au§.§ §To view the capability Framework – Role Profile relevant to this role, please click § here§.§ §Please note that as part of Lake Macquarie City Council’s recruitment process, prior to an offer of employment being made, recommended candidates may be subject to a medical assessment.§ §After the close date, a panel will assess all applications for suitability against the essential criteria for each of the positions. Once completed, an interview, skills assessment or task and reference checks may be undertaken. All candidates will be notified of the outcome via the email address you supply as part of your application.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50622245.txt	§Superintendent - Hurstville Golf Course§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Superintendent - Hurstville Golf Course§§Advertiser: §Georges River Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §Southern Suburbs & Sutherland Shire§§Salary§§Base salary of up to $81,275.48pa plus super§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§Hurstville Golf Course is a public course owned and maintained by Georges River Council. Situated in the leafy suburb of Peakhurst in Sydney's south, the course boasts§ 18 holes with a great variety of gentle rolling hills, plenty of natural hazards and smooth, quick greens. During 2013 - 14 major sections of the course were redesigned with new turf and irrigation systems.§  §Charged with leading our team of Sports Turf Managers, you will be responsible for:§ § §Supervising and maintaining all aspects of the golf course and its surrounding gardens§ §Training, supervising and scheduling your team to maintain the course to the highest standards§ §Management of course irrigation, renovations and pest / disease management§ §Ensuring all equipment is properly maintained and that the highest of WHS standards are adhered to§ §You will possess:§ § §Sports Turf Management trade qualifications§ §Greenkeeping experience of at least 10 years with a specialization in Golf Courses of at least two years§ §Outstanding leadership skills including the proven ability to motivate, coach and supervise team members§ §Exceptional organizational skills with demonstrated attention to detail§ §White card, Chemcert and minimum class C drivers licence§ §In return you will enjoy:§ § §The security of a full time permanent role working 76 hours over a nine day fortnight§ §A base salary of up to $81,275.48pa plus superannuation and opportunities to work overtime/ weekends§ §Operational leaseback vehicle§ §All uniforms, equipment and training you need to present a pristine and functional venue to our community§ §To apply for this role please ensure that you provide responses and examples (where appropriate) to all required questions on the application. For more information on this role please see our §position description§.§  §If you would like further information on this role, please contact Stuart Collins, Head of Sports Turf Management on §0409869718§.§  §Applications must be completed and submitted via our website. Closing Date: Friday 9 October 2020.§  §Georges River Council aims to be a leading, people-focused organisation delivering outstanding results for our community and city. We foster our values of Accountability, Professionalism, Unity and Honesty and take pride in promoting the image of Council in the community.§  §Georges River Council is committed to building a workplace culture that values diversity and inclusion.§  §We welcome applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, workers of all ages, people with disabilities, people who identify as LGBTIQ and those from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.§  §Please note you must be an Australian or New Zealand citizen or a permanent resident or have unlimited working rights (with no Visa restrictions) in Australia to apply for this position.§  § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50535035.txt	§Exercise Physiologist/ Strength and Conditioning Coach§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Exercise Physiologist/ Strength and Conditioning Coach§§Advertiser: §Third Space Health§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§$40 - $59.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§Third Space Health is a strength and rehabilitation facility located in bondi beach. We are looking for the right coach to join our team of movement mechanics. We are looking for a self-motivated coach, that’s fun with lots of personality to inspire others. You must be good with small groups, one on one clients and have a drive for personal growth for yourself and your clients.§ §As we are a Strength studio experience under the bar is a MUST. We are all about the intelligent pursuit of strength. We believe that strength is the best form of injury prevention as well as the best path to a long active life.§ §If you are looking to expand yourself and your experiences- you will be able to work with our physiotherapist, rehabilitation specialist, nutritionist, and other S&C coaches. This is a great opportunity to learn from and teach other professionals within the allied health community.§ §Also did I mention we are a 5 minute walk to the Beach =)§ §Duties will include:§ §New member orientations and current client care- member bookings and service calls.§ §Group Exercise Classes and member activities.§ §1 on 1 training.§ §Customer Service, daily operations and some administration duties.§ §Working with our Physiotherapist to help clients get and stay out of pain.§ §Lead-Generation and Club Culture activities.§ §We are looking for a coach that is hoping to grow not just their business but also their knowledge and skill set in a supportive professional environment, expand their own client base at our facility and work with Third Space Health clients to achieve their goals in a fun timely manner. Third Space Health is a boutique studio in Bondi beach, we provide extensive training and support for our Trainers.§ §Essentials (must be attained prior to starting):§ §- Degree in Exercise Science, Exercise Physiology, Physiotherapy or Human Movement.§ §- Professional indemnity and Public liability insurances must be valid§ §- Current First Aid and CPR Certificate§ §- Minimum of 2 years experience required§ §- Knowledge and experience in Strength Principles and Training.§ §Desired:§ §- Experience in Weightlifting, Powerlifting, Body building, Strength and Conditioning, and/or Crossfit (Just weight training in general)§ §Experience and skills:§ §- We are looking for a fit and healthy individual, for whom health and fitness is a long term passion§ §- Outstanding interpersonal skills§ §- Positive attitude and strong work ethic§ §-Solid reputation, with outstanding references and a vision of working with us long-term.§ §-Excellent Customer Service Skills. This includes good telephone manner, verbal communication and appropriately groomed.§ §-Experience and desire to work with a wide range of clients.§ §-General Administration skills a plus.§ §-You must be able to "Walk your Talk" and deliver on your promises to our clients.§ §What to Expect§We look for applicants who see the big picture and are not afraid of hard work. If you make the cut, you will start a journey that will be fulfilling and rewarding. We recruit Coaches who are looking for a long term career, growth and development with our studio, and beyond.§ § § §To apply please send your resume to §reagan@thirdspacehealth.com.au§§§§

With highly trained fitness professionals and state-of-the-art equipment members enjoy being part of an exclusive community.§  §About the Role§ §This key role is accountable for the day to day operations of the facility while maintaining the overall experience for our clients. The facility manager will supervise the team ensuring everything runs smoothly. The facility manager will work closely with the Head Strength & Conditioning Coach to ensure our programs are delivered to the highest standard while assisting as one of our expert coaches. §  §You will work closely with the management team to ensure consistency while meeting key performance indicators and will drive our local community marketing.§  §Key Responsibilities & Duties§ §This role will have a key focus on the day to day operations. This will include, but not limited to;§ § §Driving pre-launch and general sales for memberships in club & within the local area§ §Provide exceptional customer service and deliver the best possible experience for all members.§ §Employee Management including rostering, training, and performance reviews.§ §Local Marketing and lead management - generating community marketing efforts to inform people about the facility and our community with a key focus of lead generation.§ §Assist in social media management § §Build and support community partnership activities and identify key partnership to establish Edge Training as a premium training facility.§ §Complete administration associated with memberships, general enquiries, daily petty cash flow and other studio needs. § §Lead and assist in the delivery of group strength & conditioning classes§ §Flexibility to work evenings, weekends, and holidays§ §Academic or Trade Qualifications§ §Certificate 4 in Fitness (Degree in Sports Science/Human Movements preferred)§ §Suitable/Relevant certification (ASCA, NSCA, UKSCA, etc).§ §Valid Provide First Aid and CPR Certificate§ §Work Experience and Skills§ §To be considered, you will have a strong track record of the following:§ § §5+ years’ experience in a similar leadership/management role in the fitness industry§ §Extensive sales experience and lead generation§ §Experience in consistent KPI achievement§ §Experience in delivering strength & conditioning programs to groups and individuals within a fitness facility.§ §Experience across CRM and Booking Platforms (Mind Body/Glow Fox/One Fit Stop) as well as Microsoft suite and online training platforms (Team Buildr/Train Heroic/Wodify etc)§ §Strong interest in strength & conditioning, fitness, and professional development§ §Excellent organisational skills with a high attention to detail§ §Great communicator and an amazing ability to build rapport and relationships§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have experience in a sales role?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§Have you completed a qualification in fitness?§How many years' experience do you have in the sports & fitness industry?§How many years of business management experience do you have?§§§

We are looking for someone who is flexible and reliable and can work a 7 day roster.§The Role:§The primary purpose of a Pool Lifeguard at CB City is to provide a safe and enjoyable experience to Aquatics clientele through effective and diligent supervision. Pool Lifeguards will do this in line with Council’s Code of Conduct, Organisational Values, Aquatics Unit Customer Service Charter, Site Specific Supervision Plans, Safe Work Procedure (SWP) 15 for Pool Supervision and the Guidelines for Safe Pool Operations.§Main Duties will include:§•Carry out your role as a Lifeguard in line with Council’s Aquatics Unit Customer Service Charter and Council’s organisational Vision and Values§•Effectively Supervise customers by adhering to SWP #15 “Pool Supervision” and the Site Specific Supervision Plans for the Birrong, Canterbury, Max Parker, Roselands and Wran Leisure & Aquatic Centres and never leaving any occupied body of water unattended under any circumstance§•Adhere to the CB City Aquatics Operations, Emergency and Lifeguard Manuals and to all Safe Work and Standard Operating Procedures relevant to the Pool Lifeguard position.§•Adhere to the Guidelines for Safe Pool Operations and Practice Note 15 for Water Safety.§•Know, actively enforce and educate customers on the Royal Lifesaving “Keep Watch @ Public Pools Program” and the Aquatics Terms and Conditions of Entry.§*For a full list of duties, refer to the Position Description attached.§To be successful in this position you will have: (Essential Criteria)§•RLSSA Pool Lifeguard Certificate.§•Apply First Aid Certificate.§•Working with Children Check Clearance.§•Experience in a Customer Service related role§•The ability to identify, address and respond to safety hazards.§•Experience working within a team environment§•The ability to follow instructions and procedures.§•Willingness to work across a 7 day roster§•The ability to swim 200m continuously within 6 minutes as per the Guidelines for Safe Pool Operations.§How to apply:§Applications must be submitted online by clicking the 'Apply' button below and creating a login using your email address. Please provide a current CV and a covering letter addressing each of the Essential Criteria listed above.§Please also attach a copy of your Lifeguard Certificate, First Aid Certificate and a copy of your Working With Children clearance. You can attach this to your resume or Cover Letter. Please note, candidates who do not provide these details may not be considered for the role.§Applications close at §11.59pm, Friday 9 October 2020.§For more information, please contact Brent Grant (Team Leader Leisure and Aquatic Centres) on §0418 370 486§Please note: Successful applicants may be required to undertake a Criminal History Check, Medical and/or Working with Children check in accordance with the position.§Canterbury Bankstown Council prides itself on being a workplace that actively seeks to include, welcome and value unique contributions of all people. jobText: TXT/50580979.txt	§Personal Trainer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Personal Trainer§§Advertiser: §Chodat Fitness Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wollongong, Illawarra & South Coast§§Salary§§$35 - $44.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§About the business§ § §We are a Personal Training company with over 12 years in business, team of diverse trainers. Servicing appointment only clients, contracts and groups. There is no gym floor time required, you manage your schedule along side the needs of the business and team. Family owned and run we enjoy the diverse and flexible work life balance. As a team we work closely together to ensure all clients are always covered in times of leave etc. We require flexibility and transparency to function well as a team. Based in North Wollongong.§ § §About the role§ § §This role is a casual or permanent part time role depending on your availability and the contract agreement we (you and us) create, if you are successful. It is the nature of the PT business that hours are determined on your personal success and how you are 'liked' with clients. Hours could grow fast or slow depending on your approach, availability and success!§ §You need to be able to be:§ §Represent our health & fitness brand; online and in person, be in line with our core values consistently § Available for as early as 5am start and 8pm finish (local living helps this)§Maintain and help build your client base§Have experience in conducting, build and maintain a professional relationship with your PT clients, including NDIS, athletes, rehabilitation and general population clientele§Conducting out door group classes§Taking children's classes§Contribute and participate in company activities and campaigns§Managing your administration tasks, note taking, time sheets, client testing§Be comfortable being in an active job and working on your feet § § §Benefits and perks§ §Located at Innovation Campus Central Building North Wollongong, there is cafes and you will  have free access to train in the gym for your self. §You manage your work schedule so work life balance is flexible.§Not a desk job.§We seek someone who might want more hours to grow and develop with our team.§Company vehicles to drive to some appointments and classes.§No gym floor time expected, 'by appointment hours' only.§ § §Skills and experience§ § §REQUIRED:§ §Certificate III & IV in Fitness or higher qualifications§Level 2 Sprints Coach (not necessary for immediate start)§Current First Aid & CPR Workplace Certificate§WWC Working with Children's Check required§National Police Check required§Fitness Australia Registration (or relevant)§ § PREFERRED: § §Experience in managing chronic disease and rehabilitation clientele- preferred§Experience in teaching group classes – strength and conditioning, boot camp, circuits§Outstanding customer service and people skills§A positive, fun and friendly attitude with clear communication§Able to work well in a team§Initiative to grow your client base and take direction§Experience in a sporting field is beneficial§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Have you completed a qualification in fitness?§How many years' experience do you have in the sports & fitness industry?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§§§

jobText: TXT/50614495.txt	§Cricket Coach§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Cricket Coach§§Advertiser: §Saint Ignatius' College§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Cricket Coach §      §        §Saint Ignatius' College, Adelaide is a leading Catholic, co-educational, day school conducted by the Jesuits and inspired by the Ignatian charism.  The College caters for more than 1,400 students across an Early Years (3-5 year olds), Junior School (R-6), and a Senior School (7-12).§        §Established in 1951, the mission of the College is to provide a premium education that encourages students to a life-long development of their faith and service.  It aims to produce people of §human excellence §– with the ability and desire to make the world a better place.  The College has a proud record of excellent results and supporting all students to reach their potential.§        §The College is seeking to appoint an experienced Cricket Coach for the Senior School’s First XI team for Term 4 2020 and Term 1 2021.§        §The successful applicant will be required for training on Tuesdays and Thursdays from 3:30pm to 5:15pm. Additionally, games for Term 4 are held on Fridays (T20) between 3:30-7:00pm and Saturdays between 11:00am to 6:00pm for approximately six weeks. The Saturday competition will continue in Term 1. There may be an additional inter-school carnival during the school holiday period.§        §The rate of pay is dependant upon experience and qualifications.§        §A full position description is available on the College website: §https://ignatius.sa.edu.au§        §Applications should be submitted in PDF format with a completed Applicant Declaration form for the attention of Jacquie Dealtry, People and Culture Manager and emailed to §employment@ignatius.sa.edu.au§§        §The closing date for applications will be 4:00pm Tuesday, 29 September 2020.§        §Late applications cannot be accepted. Saint Ignatius' College is committed to protecting children and young people from harm. We require all applicants to undergo an extensive screening process prior to appointment.§        §Saint Ignatius’ College is an equal opportunity employer and embraces diversity in its community.§      §      §      §    §    §ignatius.sa.edu.au§  §§§Saint Ignatius' College, Adelaide is a leading Catholic, co-educational, day school conducted by the Jesuits and inspired by the Ignatian charism.  The College caters for more than 1,400 students across an Early Years (3-5 year olds), Junior School (R-6), and a Senior School (7-12).§ §Established in 1951, the mission of the College is to provide a premium education that encourages students to a life-long development of their faith and service.  It aims to produce people of §human excellence §– with the ability and desire to make the world a better place.  The College has a proud record of excellent results and supporting all students to reach their potential.§ §The College is seeking to appoint an experienced Cricket Coach for the Senior School’s First XI team for Term 4 2020 and Term 1 2021.§ §The successful applicant will be required for training on Tuesdays and Thursdays from 3:30pm to 5:15pm. Additionally, games for Term 4 are held on Fridays (T20) between 3:30-7:00pm and Saturdays between 11:00am to 6:00pm for approximately six weeks. The Saturday competition will continue in Term 1. There may be an additional inter-school carnival during the school holiday period.§ §The rate of pay is dependant upon experience and qualifications.§ §A full position description is available on the College website: §https://ignatius.sa.edu.au§ §Applications should be submitted in PDF format with a completed Applicant Declaration form for the attention of Jacquie Dealtry, People and Culture Manager and emailed to §employment@ignatius.sa.edu.au§ §The closing date for applications will be 4:00pm Tuesday, 29 September 2020.§ §Late applications cannot be accepted. jobText: TXT/50676731.txt	§1st XI CRICKET SENIOR COACH§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§1st XI CRICKET SENIOR COACH§§Advertiser: §Trinity Grammar School§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§Casual Coaching Position§We are seeking an experienced Senior Cricket Coach to join our cocurricular program.§Cricket is an integral part of our school's rich cocurricular program, providing every student who elects to play with the opportunity to learn about the sport and become the best player they can be. The school's cricket program is an extremely successful one, with over 140 boys participating each year across thirteen teams in the Associated Grammar Schools of Victoria (AGSV) competition each Saturday during Terms One and Four.§The senior component (Year 11 & 12 students) of the program has three teams which play during the season and also completes a pre-season training program between August-September. The 1st XI has won 16 AGSV premierships, the most recent of which was in 2018/19 season, when the team was undefeated.§*Please note - confirmed commencement date is subject to Victorian state-wide restrictions that will allow the Cricket season to commence.§All sporting coaches are required to be registered through the Melbourne Sports Institute (MSI).§The wellbeing and safety of children is of paramount importance at Trinity Grammar School, Kew. As part of its commitment to child safety, Trinity requires all employees to have a §Working with Children Check,§ to comply with its Code of Conduct, and to complete regular training in child protection matters.§About Trinity Grammar School§One of Australia's leading independent schools for boys, Trinity Grammar School, Kew is renowned for its innovation in pedagogy, exceptional teaching and facilities.  We offer a broad cocurricular program and are committed to the highest levels of student wellbeing so that each boy develops to his full potential. §How to Apply §Click §Apply Now§ and upload your cover letter and CV addressed to: §Mr Brendan Mahony, Director of Sport.§Please send enquiries only to: §employment@trinity.vic.edu.au§Applications Close:  Wednesday 14 October 2020 §§Position Description 1st XI CRICKET SENIOR COACH§§§§

jobText: TXT/50662512.txt	§Army Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Army Officer§§Advertiser: §Defence Force Recruiting Northern Region§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§$55,000 - $69,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Army Officer §      §        §§        §Are you considering a career change, seeking long-term job security or looking for a role that can provide a sense of accomplishment?§        §If you're the kind of person who likes working in a team environment and taking charge in challenging situations, you may have the traits to become an Officer in the Australian Army.§        §Whether you’re finishing year 12 later this year, graduating from tertiary studies, or you’re already in the workforce, you’ll be trained from the ground up to unlock your full potential and turn into an effective leader.§        §The role:§Army General Service Officers on graduation will lead a team of up to 30 personnel across a variety of combat and combat support roles. In a combat leadership role, you could be an Armoured Officer who takes command of a team operating large tanks, or an Infantry Officer who directs soldiers in security operations, humanitarian missions and disaster relief efforts. In a combat support leadership role, you could be an Ordinance Officer managing the supply and distribution network, or you could be a Transport Officer responsible for the coordination of the Army’s land, sea and air transport. And they’re just a few of the roles available.§        §The responsibility entrusted to Army Officer graduates is greater than other careers, however the training ensures you’re prepared for the responsibility that comes with your role. The journey may be challenging, but the personal satisfaction and reward that comes with the achievements makes it worthwhile.§        §Training:§You’ll receive world-class training at the Royal Military College (RMC) in Canberra, and get paid whilst studying. With two intakes per year, Officer training will teach you techniques for problem solving, decision making and performing under pressure.§        §Upon completion, you’ll be an Army Officer capable of taking command, inspiring and mentoring others, and managing complex scenarios. Plus, you’re guaranteed a role within one of the thirteen specialisations, based on preferences and performance.§        §No matter your specialisation, the invaluable leadership and management skills you’ll learn at RMC will enable you to succeed in the Army, whilst being highly sought-after in the private sector too.§        §Salary: §In the Army you'll get paid a competitive salary from day one regardless of your age, experience or qualifications. Upon commencing training at RMC, your starting salary will be between $56,000 - $63,000 depending on your credentials and your pay will increase as you progress through training.§        §On completion of your initial military training and initial employment training, you are guaranteed a role and could earn $79,380 per annum plus generous superannuation. You’ll also receive salary increments based on career progression.§        §Life in the Army: §Action, adventure, exciting career opportunities and amazing mateship—there’s so much to love about life in the Army. Not to mention the sense of accomplishment and pride that comes from serving your country and providing support to communities in need, both here and overseas.§        §This is no ordinary job—but that’s exactly what you’re looking for. Enjoy a rewarding career, opportunities to travel, excellent fitness facilities, and free medical and dental; all in a supportive and fulfilling work environment.§        §Location:§Following your initial military training in Canberra, you could be posted to one of the many Army bases and units across Australia, depending on your specialisation.§        §Apply now: §For this role, you must be an Australian Citizen and have completed an Australian Year 12 education (or equivalent) with passes in four tertiary accredited subjects including English. You must also be able to successfully obtain a security clearance and meet the minimum medical and fitness requirements (further details can be accessed via the link below).§        §Applications are now open for the 2021 intake opportunities. Click the APPLY button to start your journey to becoming an Army Officer and we’ll get in contact with you shortly.§        §You can also visit the link below to view the full position description and learn more about life in the Army: §https://army.defencejobs.gov.au/jobs/army-officer§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Are you considering a career change, seeking long-term job security or looking for a role that can provide a sense of accomplishment?§ §If you're the kind of person who likes working in a team environment and taking charge in challenging situations, you may have the traits to become an Officer in the Australian Army.§ §Whether you’re finishing year 12 later this year, graduating from tertiary studies, or you’re already in the workforce, you’ll be trained from the ground up to unlock your full potential and turn into an effective leader.§ §The role:§Army General Service Officers on graduation will lead a team of up to 30 personnel across a variety of combat and combat support roles. In a combat support leadership role, you could be an Ordinance Officer managing the supply and distribution network, or you could be a Transport Officer responsible for the coordination of the Army’s land, sea and air transport. And they’re just a few of the roles available.§ §The responsibility entrusted to Army Officer graduates is greater than other careers, however the training ensures you’re prepared for the responsibility that comes with your role. The journey may be challenging, but the personal satisfaction and reward that comes with the achievements makes it worthwhile.§ §Training:§You’ll receive world-class training at the Royal Military College (RMC) in Canberra, and get paid whilst studying. With two intakes per year, Officer training will teach you techniques for problem solving, decision making and performing under pressure.§ §Upon completion, you’ll be an Army Officer capable of taking command, inspiring and mentoring others, and managing complex scenarios. Plus, you’re guaranteed a role within one of the thirteen specialisations, based on preferences and performance.§ §No matter your specialisation, the invaluable leadership and management skills you’ll learn at RMC will enable you to succeed in the Army, whilst being highly sought-after in the private sector too.§ §Salary: §In the Army you'll get paid a competitive salary from day one regardless of your age, experience or qualifications. Upon commencing training at RMC, your starting salary will be between $56,000 - $63,000 depending on your credentials and your pay will increase as you progress through training.§ §On completion of your initial military training and initial employment training, you are guaranteed a role and could earn $79,380 per annum plus generous superannuation. You’ll also receive salary increments based on career progression.§ §Life in the Army: §Action, adventure, exciting career opportunities and amazing mateship—there’s so much to love about life in the Army. Not to mention the sense of accomplishment and pride that comes from serving your country and providing support to communities in need, both here and overseas.§ §This is no ordinary job—but that’s exactly what you’re looking for. Enjoy a rewarding career, opportunities to travel, excellent fitness facilities, and free medical and dental; all in a supportive and fulfilling work environment.§ §Location:§Following your initial military training in Canberra, you could be posted to one of the many Army bases and units across Australia, depending on your specialisation.§ §Apply now: §For this role, you must be an Australian Citizen and have completed an Australian Year 12 education (or equivalent) with passes in four tertiary accredited subjects including English. As a result this role will, as necessary, liaise directly with PAHL team members on common objectives and program goals as well as deliverables and role outcomes, including those specific to funding required from the Healthway Grant #3301.§  §About You§  §You will be someone who is personable, has strong people management capabilities and experience in relevant sporting league, event and program delivery including a working knowledge of schedules, fixtures, results and other competition management areas.§  §We are looking for someone who thrives in a busy role and has the ability to manage business requirements and customers. If you have any support requirements, we encourage you to advise us through the application process.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§§§

F45 places a huge emphasis on the three key factors of motivation, innovation and results. Our classes are unique, fun and highly addictive which is why F45 Training is currently the fastest growing network of fitness studios in the world.§This role will be suitable for a self-motivated trainer who loves to inspire others to lead a fit and healthy lifestyle. We want someone with 'personality plus' and a 'can-do attitude' who is comfortable leading large group sessions, strives to be the best and wants to help promote and grow our F45 Training studios.§You will work closely with our studio managers and other trainers to ensure our F45 studios are the premium training studios around. A role with us will also have an emphasis on membership sales and retention.§Key Responsibilities:§Conduct and instruct motivational, high-quality F45 group fitness classes§Build strong rapport with clients§Provide excellent customer service at all times§Assist with the day to day operations of studio program offerings, F45 Challenges and events§Assist with membership sales in the studio and member retention§Key Requirements:§Certificate III in Fitness (& Cert IV in Fitness desirable)§First Aid & CPR§Energetic, strong, passionate and supportive attitude§Excellent customer service skills§Great communication skills§Flexible and adaptable§Self-motivated and goal oriented§Excellent attention to detail§A willingness to work flexible hours early mornings, evenings and weekends.§Eager to be actively involved in growing the business§Passionate about the health and well being of members§Team player and eager to grow and develop as a Trainer§Culture & Benefits:§Opportunity for future growth within our studios§Ongoing mentoring opportunities§Opportunity to move towards a Head Trainer role§Commitment to work life balance§Training provided on F45 product and technology§Small, motivated team to work with great support network within the F45 Group§Enjoy complimentary F45 Training access to our 3 Studios§APPLY TODAY!§All applicants please include a short cover letter explaining what you love about the role and CV via the 'apply' button.§Applicants shortlisted will be contacted for an interview.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following First Aid accreditations do you currently hold?§Have you completed a qualification in fitness?§§§
