jobText: TXT/50619348.txt	§Fitness Trainer and Social Media Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Fitness Trainer and Social Media Coordinator§§Advertiser: §5th Element Fitness§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §Fremantle & Southern Suburbs§§Salary§§Bonus for classes & PT + $ incentives and training§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§We are looking for an energetic and fun person who has a passion for health and fitness and loves functional training to join our small and dynamic team. The person must be a qualified fitness instructor with a minimum Certificate 3 in Fitness. The person should enjoy creating social media content and have experience in Facebook and Instagram marketing.§  §5th Element Fitness is a boutique functional training studio located in North Fremantle overlooking the ocean. We have been operating for 7 years and specialise in functional training, high intensity training, boxing and personal training. We offer 3 signature classes; FHIT (functional high intensity interval training), Boxing and Lift. §  §The position we are offering as a fitness instructor will include personal training and class instruction. As social media coordinator you will be responsible for managing our Facebook, Instagram, Mailchimp and collaborating on the marketing strategy for the business. The role will be approximately 15-20 hours per week and has the potential to quickly become a permanent part-time or full-time position.§  §MAIN DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES: § § §Delivering group exercise classes§ §Maintaining a safe and tidy workplace§ §Ensure the safety and wellbeing of all in the facility§ §Provide Personal Training services to our members§ §Creation and management of social media content§ §Basic videography and photography for content creation§ §Engaging and growing online community§ §Uphold company professional standards§ §Perform minor equipment maintenance and log activity§ §Perform general administrative duties§ §Perform opening/closing duties, following the opening/closing procedure § §Attend staff meetings and trainings§ §SKILLS & EXPERIENCE§  §Qualifications:  § § §Certificate III in Fitness or higher§ §Senior first aid certificate§ §Current CPR certificate§ §Skills: § § § §Intermediate to advanced Microsoft Office skills (Word, Excel and Outlook)§ §Knowledge of Instagram and Facebook adverts§ §Excellent verbal and written communication § §Organised and able to meet deadlines § §Excellent customer relation skills§ §Able to communicate effectively§ §Knowledge of all fitness systems and proper techniques§ §Enforcing operating policies and procedures in an effective and courteous manner§ §Have the ability to establish and maintain courteous and effective working relationships with coworkers and clients. § §Basic understanding of Mailchimp or email marketing§ §Applicants must provide:§ § §Cover Letter§ §CV § §Qualifications§ §Certifications§ §Working with Children Check§ §Police Clearance § §First Aid Certificate with CPR§ §The successful applicant must be a real people person! We enjoy talking to people and we try and make every interaction with our customers an experience. We have a wide variety of clients from kids to the elderly, those with special needs, mums, dads and those starting out on their fitness journey. We cater for everyone and applicants must be understanding of the complete beginner but comfortable with the elite athlete. §5th Element Fitness will provide on the job training and we understand some applicants may not possess all the skills but if you are willing to learn, we can teach you. 5th Element will also provide funding towards external training courses. Our team members are paid a base rate with bonuses and incentives. §  §Our mantra is to provide a fun and friendly environment, achieve effective results and provide personalised experiences for our clients. If you love fitness, if you are a team player, if you believe in functional training and love your job... .please apply for this position and join us at 5th Element Fitness! §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§Which of the following First Aid accreditations do you currently hold?§Have you completed a qualification in fitness?§How many years' experience do you have as a personal trainer?§§§

Will you be a part of it?§ § §Join a business that's striving to make a difference, not just a living§ §NO SALES § §Earn $45-$65 per session§ §NO RENT § §CLIENTS WAITING FOR YOU§ §The industry is changing and we're leading the way. Keen to actually make a difference? Join an organisation dedicated to sustainably changing the lives of our clients and our TRAINERS.§ §If you're just starting out as a PT and looking for a great place to learn and grow, come join our proud team at Get Going Personal Training! If you've been in the industry for a while, stop stressing about maintaining leads and clients and join a professional team.§ §Get out of the cutthroat environment of lead generation.§ §We'll provide you with the tools you need to build your client books to 30+ clients comfortably and quickly.§ §We Offer:§ § §4-Week training and mentoring program§ §Ongoing support and learning§ §Regular meetings§ §We build your clientele as quickly as your potential allows§ §Earn $45-$65 per session OR own your own Get Going.§ §Opportunities to grow into higher positions within the organisation (Team Leader Role)§ §The chance for you to build and own your own business! § §Your Role:§ §As a Mobile (Home) Personal Trainer, you will be one of our home training specialists, providing training programming, implementation and advice!§ § §Look after your own clientele § §Manage your own database and accounts§ §Continuous learning and development§ §Benefits & Culture§ §We have developed, and continue to develop, an extremely motivating and fun environment for all of our talent to learn and grow. We believe that in order to inspire your clients the way that you've always desired, you need a supportive group of individuals around you!§ §Do I need to be based in the location advertised to apply for this role?§ §Absolutely not! We pride ourselves on our team values, constant development and ability to produce sustainable results in our entire clientele. If you'd rather fight for every lead, be a lone wolf (or sheep) and become a generic 'PT' then Get Going ISN'T the place for you.§ §Requirements:§ § §Certificate IV in Health & Fitness (Personal Training)§ §Reliable car§ §First Aid and CPR§ §Generous availability§ §Positive attitude§ §Enthusiasm & self-motivation§ §Apply Now!§ §Send us your resume, cover letter and a bit about yourself via the APPLY button.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Have you completed a qualification in fitness?§Which of the following First Aid accreditations do you currently hold?§§§

jobText: TXT/50639695.txt	§Personal Trainer - Business Opportunity§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Personal Trainer - Business Opportunity§§Advertiser: §City of Adelaide§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§A great Business Opportunity for an experienced Personal Trainer§ §Run your own business out of our major metropolitan swimming centre§ §Attractive sub-letting agreements§ § § §About the Aquatic Centre§Adelaide Aquatic Centre, operated by City of Adelaide, offers a wide range of facilities for the community including a fitness centre, recreational and dive pools, spa, sauna, steam room, swim shop and a café. § §About the Opportunity§ As a Personal Trainer at Adelaide Aquatic Centre you can develop and run your own business, using the facilities within our major metropolitan centre. There is the opportunity to relocate and train your client base in a major Aquatic Centre facility which is surrounded by the Adelaide Park Lands giving you the option to combine indoor and outdoor training.§Skills & Experience§ We are seeking a qualified Personal Trainer with strong skills providing exceptional customer service and who can create a friendly environment for clients. The successful incumbent will bring with them a:§ §Certificate 4 in Fitness (minimum)§ §Fitness Australia Registration§ §Senior First Aid and CPR§ §Public Liability Insurance§ §A current Working with Children Check§ §Ideally at least 1 years’ experience of managing a client base.§ §Please note: A current ABN will be required.  § §Benefits§ §Some of the benefits we can offer to enable your business to thrive and to help your clients reach their fitness goals are:§ §Attractive sub-letting agreements with rent free and discounted rent periods§ §State of the art gym facilities, wet area training zones and surrounding Park Lands§ §Ongoing support to build a profitable and sustainable client base with lead generation§ §Enquiries & How to apply§Please direct enquiries to Paul Brown, Team Leader Health & Fitness Program at the Aquatic Centre on §8203 7738§.§ § § §Please submit an application expressing the skills, experience and qualities you can bring to this position, including your experience in managing a client base addressed to Paul Brown. You can do this by clicking apply and following the prompts, or by emailing §recruitment@cityofadelaide.com.au§. § § § §For further information about Adelaide Aquatic Centre please visit §www.adelaideaquaticcentre.com.au§ § § §Applications close midnight Sunday 4 October 2020.§ § § §Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander People are encouraged to apply.§ §§§§§

(Resume + Cover Letter). Interviews will commence prior to the advertisement ending.§ § § §Check out our video for an insight into our Snap Fitness Annual Business Summit!§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have experience in a sales role?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§How many years of business management experience do you have?§Do you have experience working towards targets and KPIs?§§§

This is a casual opportunity of up to 14 hours per week from January – October – working 3 afternoons per week (Monday-Thursday) plus one game on the weekend.§ §Western Pride FC is based in Ipswich, with fields in Ipswich and Springfield. We provide football development pathways for children and young adults throughout the Western corridor of Brisbane and Ipswich. Our aim is to compete at the highest level of football in Brisbane and Queensland, becoming the club of choice for aspiring footballers. We need the highest quality coaches to achieve this aim.§ §The primary purpose of these positions is to cater for Western Pride FC’s Academy Program. As such, the successful candidate will plan and implement high quality coaching, training and mentoring for identified 9-16 year old male and female players.§ §The successful candidate’s duties and responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:§ §·       Design, deliver and regularly evaluate a training program aligned to the club’s curriculum, with weekly sessions§ §·       Conduct competitive trial process, managed at a club level§ §·       Maintain regular and effective communication with players, including detailed records and assessments of player performance both in training and at matches§ §·       Maintain strong relationships with Technical  Director, Football Operations Manager and SAP Coordinator§ §·       Support relationships with schools and school sports associations§ §·       Adhere to delivering excellent customer service in a family friendly environment§ §·       Attend any club based Events and support the planning/preparation of these events§ sporting achievement and a personal commitment to excellence§ §·       A commitment to contribute to the development of the Western Pride family culture§ §·       An ability to work collaboratively with other coaches and support staff to ensure sustainable capability development§ §Key Relationships§ §·       Western Pride FC Technical Director§ §·       Western Pride FC Football Operations Manager§ §·       Host Club/Venue Management§ §·       Western Pride FC Admin Staff/Volunteers§ §Remuneration§ §Remuneration will be discussed with successful applicant at the time of employment. The remuneration will consider travel time, time spent on administrative tasks and set up time.§ §How to Apply§ §Please provide:§ §·       A detailed professional CV outlining experience and skills, including 3 referees§ §·       A cover letter detailing suitability for the position§ §Applications can be sent directly to Western Pride Football Operations Manager via §footballops@westernpridefc.com.au§ §Applications close Monday 28 September 2020§ § § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§§§

Our classes are unique, fun and highly addictive which is why F45 Training is the most popular fitness studio in Australia.§ §Right now we are §seeking talented Group Trainer / Personal Trainers §to join the team! Part time (contract) OR casual hours are on offer - between 10-25 hours per week, including weekends.§Who we are:§We are a dynamic company of 4 F45 Studios, that focuses on member and team culture. Our priority is to ensure that our team has the opportunity for growth across our studios. As a collective, we work together to provide the best training experience in our areas.§ § §Who you are:§ § §You are a team player§ §You are in the fitness industry for your desire to help people§ §You have initiative and can think on your feet§ §You take pride in your work and have an exceptional work ethic§ §You are energetic, have a vibrant personality and can command an audience§ §You thrive in a group environment, are friendly and are not afraid to talk to anyone and everyone§ §You have a thorough knowledge of exercise physiology and how to coach exercises with progressions and regressions§ §You are confident in your abilities as a trainer and can accept constructive criticism with an open attitude to up-skilling and progressing as a trainer and an individual§ §You have professional conduct 100% of the time and can leave your personal life at the door§ §Proficient in and can undertake outdoor group classes and bootcamps; in addition to F45 classes§ §You are willing to assist with selling membership on the floor / back end§ §You are willing to lead other trainers § §This role will be suitable for a self-motivated trainer who loves to inspire others to lead a fit and healthy lifestyle. We want someone with 'personality plus' and a 'can-do attitude' who strives to be the best and wants to help promote and grow our F45 training studio. You will work closely with other trainers and staff to ensure F45 is the premium training studio around. § §Key Responsibilities: § § § §Deliver high quality, results-focused F45 group fitness classes and drive results for members. § § § §Ensure the studio is impeccably maintained.§ § § §Develop and help foster a positive, motivational and community-based team training environment.§ § § §A willingness to work flexible hours (split shifts and/ or Saturday/Sundays) and eager to be actively involved in growing the business. § § § §Support the manager with on the studio floor sales to triallers / members.§  § § §Experience and Qualifications:  § § § §Certificate III (min.)§ § § §Registration with Fitness Australia or Physical Activity Australia (desirable)§ § § §Current First Aid and CPR § § § § §Applicants shortlisted will be contacted to schedule a face to face interview.  The selected applicants will have to undertake training to determine if they are successful. § §Please include a cover letter that has a brief description about yourself and why you would be perfect for this position. Please also include the studio you are applying for. More information on F45 Training can be found at www.f45training.com.au. § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Have you completed a qualification in fitness?§How many years' experience do you have in the sports & fitness industry?§Do you have customer service experience?§How would you rate your English language skills?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

member experience.§Studio Operations – day to day operations, staff training & skill uplift, staff rosters, system management, email/phone enquiries and follow up of trial members.  Ensure studio cleaning and presentation is maintained to the highest standard.§Sales Management - establish and maintain a strong client database, working with clients to establish the best membership for their members, be active on the studios social media accounts and assist with content creation §Community engagement - Develop and build relationships within the community§GROUP FITNESS TRAINERS jobTitle: Head Trainer & Trainers  Job in Perth - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50590535.txt	§Head Trainer & Trainers §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Head Trainer & Trainers §§Advertiser: §BodyFit Training West Perth§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§BFT Trainers are the face of our business. They are an integral part of each and everything we do and are critical to the growth of our member base. From making members feel welcome the moment they step in our studio, to motivating, inspiring and guiding them through our 50-minute workouts, to playing an active role in recruiting new members and retaining our existing ones. §BFT Trainers will use their knowledge, skills and ability to teach safe and effective exercise at all times and will use their charismatic personalities to make §BFT West Perth§ the best Training experience in WA.§Head Trainer:§As the Head Trainer, you will oversee other studio trainers, own all aspects of the member training experience including in house challenges, events and functions, and work closely with the owner/franchisee to deliver the studio’s member growth and profitability aspirations. You will be first point of call for all member inquiries and will lead from the front with your actions, knowledge and fitness!§Trainer:§As a trainer at BFT West Perth your main role will be the steering our member base through our 12 progressive training sessions with an upbeat, can-do attitude! You will also have the ability to complete other roles through paid admin hours and practice valuable sales skills whilst working alongside the Head Trainer and Franchisee. You will play a valuable role in coaching teams during our in studio challenges and will actively support our members wherever possible!§About Us§Bodyfit Training is Australia’s newest and most advanced group training methodology. We’ve incorporated scientifically proven training techniques aimed at reducing fat and creating lean muscle into a variety of 50minute training sessions that are overseen by accredited coaches in a dynamic group environment§High levels of visual content showcasing our programs are shown on multiple digital displays throughout the studio which allow our trainers to spend more time concentrating on our members, while the screens direct the traffic! Our cutting edge, globally superior technology together with our 4-6-week progressive training blocks, including unique strength and conditioning elements to complement our extensive cardio workouts, makes us both §Better§ and §Different§.§ §ABOUT YOU§Do you have the following experience and qualities?§Previous experience in personal training, preferably group training§Strength and Conditioning Certificate (Head Trainer)§Cert 3 and 4 in Personal Training (Trainer)§CPR & First Aid§Insurance§Working With Children Check§Proven success in building and sustaining a client base§Ability to build an awesome member community§Highly motivated and have a passion to succeed§Have exceptional customer service and sales skills§Work well as part of a team§Flexibility and willingness to step outside the bounds of the role§Passion for the health and fitness industry and want to change people's lives§Creativity, drive and initiative§High level of integrity§Can-do attitude§ §About the benefits§We want you to be happy and love coming to work at BFT West Perth, so you will be supported with ongoing training and workplace flexibility, together with career progression opportunities including increased responsibilities and the potential to oversee multiple studios§How to Apply§Send cover letter, together with your up to date resume to Bodyfit Training West Perth at §westperth@bodyfittraining.com§instagram: @bodyfit_westperth§Facebook: Body Fit Training West Perth §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following First Aid accreditations do you currently hold?§Do you have experience in a sales role?§How many years' experience do you have in the sports & fitness industry?§Have you completed a qualification in fitness?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§§§

We know that by working together as a unified team, we will continue to experience exceptional and rapid growth both personally and professionally.§ §Our heart beat is to deliver a one-of-a-kind experience for every single person who engages with Orangetheory Fitness, and we are committed to seeing you thrive and succeed in your new career with us as an Orangetheory Fitness Studio Manager.§ §Orangetheory Fitness has a vision to remain the trusted global leader of innovative heart rate based interval training. To make this vision a reality, we live and breathe our values of integrity, passion, accountability, innovation and community.§ § § §What's in it for you?§ §At Orangetheory Fitness, we work collaboratively as an organisation to encourage goal setting and excellence in both our personal and professional lives – maintaining a culture of integrity, and inspiring people to live longer, healthier and more fulfilling lives. This is a great opportunity for the right candidate to be absorbed in a culture of empowerment and growth.§ § § §The role?§ §We are seeking an enthusiastic and skilled Fitness Coach to join our driven and hardworking team. This position will involve the exciting task of running group training in a very dynamic, fast paced, well equipped premium fitness studio. It will be your responsibility to energize and motivate our clients throughout the session, and encourage them to become an engaged and active part of our growing fitness community.   § §As a key brand ambassador, you will also play an important role in maintaining our suburb level of safety in regards to our heart rate and exercise technique. It will be your responsibility to modify specific exercises to accommodate various skill levels where necessary – to ensure that all our clients are safe, motivated, and appropriately challenged.§ §Beyond this, you may also be required to:§ § §Attend monthly fitness staff meetings and required educational presentations§ §Handle member concerns when applicable§ §Assist sales associates, when needed, with OTF studio tours and sales§ §About you:§ § §Passion for health and fitness§ §Must hold a current fitness certification§ §Knowledge of physiology, exercise technique, and body mechanics§ §Ability to multi-task and stay organized§ §Positive, motivating, and effective communication skills§ §Ability and desire to train all fitness levels§ §1 year experience in teaching group fitness classes, or personal training is desired§ §Customer centric attitude§ §If this sounds like the ideal position for you, please apply now by submitting your up-to-date resume, along with a cover letter that highlights how your passion, and previous skills/experience align with what we are looking for in the ideal candidate.§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Have you completed a qualification in fitness?§Do you have experience working towards targets and KPIs?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Army Officer Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50664470.txt	§Army Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Army Officer§§Advertiser: §Defence Force Recruiting Southern Region§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§$55,000 - $69,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Army Officer §      §        §§        §Are you considering a career change, seeking long-term job security or looking for a role that can provide a sense of accomplishment?§        §If you're the kind of person who likes working in a team environment and taking charge in challenging situations, you may have the traits to become an Officer in the Australian Army.§        §Whether you’re finishing year 12 later this year, graduating from tertiary studies, or you’re already in the workforce, you’ll be trained from the ground up to unlock your full potential and turn into an effective leader.§        §The role:§Army General Service Officers on graduation will lead a team of up to 30 personnel across a variety of combat and combat support roles. In a combat leadership role, you could be an Armoured Officer who takes command of a team operating large tanks, or an Infantry Officer who directs soldiers in security operations, humanitarian missions and disaster relief efforts. In a combat support leadership role, you could be an Ordinance Officer managing the supply and distribution network, or you could be a Transport Officer responsible for the coordination of the Army’s land, sea and air transport. And they’re just a few of the roles available.§        §The responsibility entrusted to Army Officer graduates is greater than other careers, however the training ensures you’re prepared for the responsibility that comes with your role. The journey may be challenging, but the personal satisfaction and reward that comes with the achievements makes it worthwhile.§        §Training:§You’ll receive world-class training at the Royal Military College (RMC) in Canberra, and get paid whilst studying. With two intakes per year, Officer training will teach you techniques for problem solving, decision making and performing under pressure.§        §Upon completion, you’ll be an Army Officer capable of taking command, inspiring and mentoring others, and managing complex scenarios. Plus, you’re guaranteed a role within one of the thirteen specialisations, based on preferences and performance.§        §No matter your specialisation, the invaluable leadership and management skills you’ll learn at RMC will enable you to succeed in the Army, whilst being highly sought-after in the private sector too.§        §Salary: §In the Army you'll get paid a competitive salary from day one regardless of your age, experience or qualifications; and your pay increases as you progress through training.§        §On completion of your initial military training and initial employment training, you are guaranteed a role and could earn $77,838 per annum plus generous superannuation. You’ll also receive salary increments based on career progression.§        §Life in the Army: §Action, adventure, exciting career opportunities and amazing mateship—there’s so much to love about life in the Army. Not to mention the sense of accomplishment and pride that comes from serving your country and providing support to communities in need, both here and overseas.§        §This is no ordinary job—but that’s exactly what you’re looking for. Enjoy a rewarding career, opportunities to travel, excellent fitness facilities, and free medical and dental; all in a supportive and fulfilling work environment.§        §Location:§Following your initial military training in Canberra, you could be posted to one of the many Army bases and units across Australia, depending on your specialisation.§        §Apply now: §For this role, you must be an Australian Citizen and have completed an Australian Year 12 education (or equivalent) with passes in four tertiary accredited subjects including English.§        §Applications are now open for the 2021 intake opportunities. Click the APPLY button to start your journey to becoming an Army Officer and we’ll get in contact with you shortly.§        §You can also visit the link below to view the full position description and learn more about life in the Army: §https://www.defencejobs.gov.au/jobs/army/army-officer§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Are you considering a career change, seeking long-term job security or looking for a role that can provide a sense of accomplishment?§ §If you're the kind of person who likes working in a team environment and taking charge in challenging situations, you may have the traits to become an Officer in the Australian Army.§ §Whether you’re finishing year 12 later this year, graduating from tertiary studies, or you’re already in the workforce, you’ll be trained from the ground up to unlock your full potential and turn into an effective leader.§ §The role:§Army General Service Officers on graduation will lead a team of up to 30 personnel across a variety of combat and combat support roles. In a combat leadership role, you could be an Armoured Officer who takes command of a team operating large tanks, or an Infantry Officer who directs soldiers in security operations, humanitarian missions and disaster relief efforts. In a combat support leadership role, you could be an Ordinance Officer managing the supply and distribution network, or you could be a Transport Officer responsible for the coordination of the Army’s land, sea and air transport. And they’re just a few of the roles available.§ §The responsibility entrusted to Army Officer graduates is greater than other careers, however the training ensures you’re prepared for the responsibility that comes with your role. The journey may be challenging, but the personal satisfaction and reward that comes with the achievements makes it worthwhile.§ §Training:§You’ll receive world-class training at the Royal Military College (RMC) in Canberra, and get paid whilst studying. With two intakes per year, Officer training will teach you techniques for problem solving, decision making and performing under pressure.§ §Upon completion, you’ll be an Army Officer capable of taking command, inspiring and mentoring others, and managing complex scenarios. Plus, you’re guaranteed a role within one of the thirteen specialisations, based on preferences and performance.§ §No matter your specialisation, the invaluable leadership and management skills you’ll learn at RMC will enable you to succeed in the Army, whilst being highly sought-after in the private sector too.§ §Salary: §In the Army you'll get paid a competitive salary from day one regardless of your age, experience or qualifications; and your pay increases as you progress through training.§ §On completion of your initial military training and initial employment training, you are guaranteed a role and could earn $77,838 per annum plus generous superannuation. You’ll also receive salary increments based on career progression.§ §Life in the Army: §Action, adventure, exciting career opportunities and amazing mateship—there’s so much to love about life in the Army. Not to mention the sense of accomplishment and pride that comes from serving your country and providing support to communities in need, both here and overseas.§ §This is no ordinary job—but that’s exactly what you’re looking for. Enjoy a rewarding career, opportunities to travel, excellent fitness facilities, and free medical and dental; all in a supportive and fulfilling work environment.§ §Location:§Following your initial military training in Canberra, you could be posted to one of the many Army bases and units across Australia, depending on your specialisation.§ §Apply now: §For this role, you must be an Australian Citizen and have completed an Australian Year 12 education (or equivalent) with passes in four tertiary accredited subjects including English.§ §Applications are now open for the 2021 intake opportunities. Click the APPLY button to start your journey to becoming an Army Officer and we’ll get in contact with you shortly.§ §You can also visit the link below to view the full position description and learn more about life in the Army: §https://www.defencejobs.gov.au/jobs/army/army-officer§§§§

jobText: TXT/50607908.txt	§Activity officer x3 - Southern Highlands§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Activity officer x3 - Southern Highlands§§Advertiser: §Police Citizens Youth Clubs NSW Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Tamworth & North West NSW§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §        §Activity officer x3 - Southern Highlands §        §          §PCYC NSW is a charity empowering young people to reach their potential through Police and community partnerships. For more than 83 years, PCYC has building capacity in the communities we serve across regional and metropolitan NSW. PCYC is an inclusive organisation, striving to service the broad sport and recreational needs of all community members in the 65 locations in which we operate.§Working closely with Police and volunteers, our staff contribute to the positive development of over 70,000 youth members through mainstream sport, recreation, education, leadership and cultural activities. PCYC provides pathways to for athletes to participate in elite competition and opportunities for leadership, development, employment and coaching opportunities for young people. location: Sydney, CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs
jobText: TXT/50618084.txt	§Sydney's Best Fitness Coach / Group Fitness Trainer - Own it Fit§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Sydney's Best Fitness Coach / Group Fitness Trainer - Own it Fit§§Advertiser: §HealthyPeople§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§Salaried role inclusive of annual leave & super.§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§If you consider yourself one of the best fitness coaches in Sydney and are looking for a new and exciting opportunity then we want to hear from you. §  §This will be the most challenging and rewarding position you've ever had.§  §What you're signing up for.§  §The opportunity to genuinely make a difference to the lives of ladies who struggle with motivation and consistency to exercise consistently and eat the foods that matter.§  §Your primary focus will be coaching current clients, keeping them accountable and successfully liaise with new prospective clients from enquiry to arranging a time for them to meet one of the team.§  §If you want to be the secret weapon of a fast-growing, industry-leading business, this is your chance.§  §If you want to be involved in the business at a level that most never do - you’re in the right place.§  §INCREDIBLE coaching and communication skills, intellect, honesty, highly motivated, a motivator and being tech-savvy are imperative.§  §The right person will have the opportunity to uplift themselves and the business to new levels; personally and professionally - and gain an unparalleled education while doing so.§  §Are you ready to take your career (and life) to the next level?§  §If it looks like you’ll be a good fit, your role will include (but is not limited to):§ § §Group coaching at our outdoor locations of approx 20 sessions a week§ §Motivating clients both internally and new clients also§ §Focus heavily on current client satisfaction levels and holding them accountable§ §Manage inbound requests and ensuring they're followed up to swiftly schedule an appointment§ §Create internal video and written content for our current clients§ §Organize and prioritize to-dos§ §Social media proficiency across Instagram and Facebook - monitoring, administering and engagement§ §What's in it for you:§  §This is a salaried full-time role - inclusive of annual leave - yes paid holidays and superannuation in a fitness business!§ § §Ongoing training to upskill and also professionally new skill acquisition§ §Opportunity to progress to sales§ §Opportunity to progress to management§ §Incentives available§ §Strong base with achievable incentives§ §Transport can be provided as part of the position if you don’t have your own. If you do have your own transport an allowance will be provided. A full driver’s license is essential.§ §About us:§  §We are an outdoor fitness business with a growing and strong online community also. We have already established a strong name in Sydney and are looking to expand our team here.§  §We have a positive environment free from the fads and misconceptions not to mention the egos and posers so no need to apply if you are any of these.§  §Here at §Own it Fit§, our clients are not just here for a workout, we want to educate them in a strong community setting on how to train and eat smarter for long-term sustainable habitual results!§  §What we are looking for:§ § §Positive motivator§ §Amazing personality§ §Independent thinker§ §6 months experience minimum coaching§ §A proven background in personal training and coaching training§ §Fully qualified - Certificates 3 & 4 in Fitness at least§ §Current First Aid & CPR§ §Full driver license§ §Emphatic and firm simultaneously§ §A positive motivator who builds people up and doesn't knock them down§ §An absolute people person§ §Knowledgeable (but don't feel the need to go around proving it)§ §Results and service focused§ §Willing and able to complete client engagement and accountability work ongoing.§ §Excited at the prospect of following up new client inquiries and setting up phone calls for the business owner.§ §Looking for opportunities at career progression§ §You must be an Australian resident or have an unrestricted work rights visa§ §Package includes base plus generous incentives.§  §To apply:§  §Submit your CV and cover letter via the 'Apply' button.§§§§

jobTitle: Head Swim Coach - St Peter's Aquatic Centre, CABOOLTURE Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50687362.txt	§Head Swim Coach - St Peter's Aquatic Centre, CABOOLTURE§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Head Swim Coach - St Peter's Aquatic Centre, CABOOLTURE§§Advertiser: §Brisbane Catholic Education§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §Northern Suburbs§§Salary§§As School Officer Level 4 pay scale§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§St Peter's is a Catholic primary school, situated in central Caboolture, with a student population of 676 and a staff of 72.§  St Peter’s Aquatic Centre has two heated pools (a 25 metre 7 lane pool and a 15 metre learn to swim pool), modern change facilities and offers a range of swim programs and services on admission and session fees. It operates 6.00 am to 6.00 pm Monday to Friday. § In this role under the supervision of the Aquatic Centre Coordinator you will assist in the preparation, coordination and delivery of swimming programs offered by the Aquatic Centre, providing a source of program support to swim instructors and participants.§ Typical duties include, but are not limited to:§ - Encourage and foster participation in swimming across all age groups and abilities;§ - Collaborate with Aquatic Centre Coordinator on the ongoing implementation and modification of centre swimming programs;§ - Coordinate conduct and review swimming training programs; § - Provide a source of aquatic education program support to a broad range of swim learners; and their swim instructors; § - Promote a positive swimming environment with centre;§ - Undertake opening and closing procedures as required;§ - Organise and undertake pool and lane set-ups to meet swim program requirements;§ - Ensure that workplace health and safety standards are met, and self-compliance with BCE and Principal approved workplace health and safety policies, procedures and requirements and report any risks and hazards to the Aquatic Centre Coordinator;§ - Keep the Aquatic Centre Coordinator informed of pool activities, facility repairs and needs; and § - Maintain appropriate documentation and record keeping required by the Aquatic Centre Coordinator.§ To be successful in this role you will be experienced an Swim Coach and hold current:§ - ASCTA coaching licence with a minimum standard of Bronze level accreditation;§ - Experience in coordination and delivery of a suite of swimming programs;§ - Senior First Aid and CPR Certificate;§ - Blue Card (or be eligible to apply for a Blue Card); and§ - A flexible and cooperative approach to working varying hours within the spread of operating hours of the Aquatic Centre.§ It is desirable, but not essential, to hold a Pool Lifeguard Certificate and be proficient in the Microsoft Office suite of programs. § You must have a commitment to and understanding of the ethos and traditions of Catholic Education, be eligible to work in Australia for the duration of the appointment.§Click on Apply to view a copy of the role description and for details on How to Apply.§  §St Peter's is a Catholic primary school, situated in central Caboolture (opposite the railway station) with a student population of 676 and a staff of 72. St Peter’s is proud of its Josephite tradition. We endeavour to live the message promoted by St Mary MacKillop – ‘Never see a need without doing something about it’. Our students are proud and supportive of their school. They show respect to teachers, adults and fellow students. Students know what is expected of them and strive to meet these high standards.§ At St Peter’s we educate for 21st Century learners who are successful, creative, confident, active, informed and empowered to shape and enrich our world. 21st Century learning at St Peter’s is underpinned by effective pedagogy and spaces that are engaging, motivational and relevant for the learning taking place. Our classrooms are flexible learning environments designed to be configured in a variety of ways. At St Peter’s we believe that every child is capable of success which is reflected in our high expectations to maximise the learning progress and achievement of every student. § § Visit our school website  §here§   §§ To be successful in this role you will:§§have a commitment to and understanding of the ethos and traditions of Catholic Education;§§hold a Paid Employee Positive Notice Blue Card prior to commencement; and§§be eligible to work in Australia for the duration of the appointment.§§ § Estimated Start Date: §   Commencing 7 October 2020§ § Position Tenure: §   Fixed Term§ § Weeks Worked:  § Up to 52 weeks per year including school holidays§ § Tenure Duration (If Fixed Term):  § Until 26 February 2021 - with possibility of extension§ § Total Paid Hours (per wk) & Days Required:  § Part-time - 24 hours / Week§ § Salary Level, Range or Hourly Rate:  § School Officer Level 4 $31.44 to $32.43 per hour§ § Employment Conditions:§    Diocesan Catholic Education Employing Authorities in Queensland Single Interest Agreement§ § § This position involves working with children.  The appointment of successful applicants will be subject to satisfactory employment screening for child related employment in accordance with the law.§Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.§ § § Contact Person:§   Jade Gray§ § Contact Telephone Number:§    §07 5495 7725§ § Contact Email:§   §jade.gray@bne.catholic.edu.au§Closing Date:  §27-Sep-2020§ §§§§

jobTitle: Full-Time Personal-Trainer/Strength-Coach Job in Perth - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50567531.txt	§Full-Time Personal-Trainer/Strength-Coach§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Full-Time Personal-Trainer/Strength-Coach§§Advertiser: §Physique Performance Specialists§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§§About the business§ § § §At PPS we help people boost their self-confidence and build self-belief using Strength-Training.§We are known for helping the everyday §'non-gym'§ person, achieve amazing results, in our private community-based facilities.§We're also passionate about helping personal-trainers build professional, and sustainable careers in the fitness industry.§We don't believe in the rent-based model; and offer secure employment, with the opportunity to continue to grow within our team - where culture is king.§ § § §About the role§ § § §We're seeking a growth-minded Coach to join our team at PPS South-Perth.§This person will report directly to the facility manager and be responsible for:§ §Running 1-1 & Small-Group Training Sessions§Client Check-ins & Accountability§Day to Day Operations§Client Relationships & Retention§Programming & Nutrition§ §The ideal candidate will:§ §Have sound Body Composition & Nutritional knowledge§Be confident in Coaching the 'Big 3'§Practice what they Preach§Be a Team Player§Be Personable & Approachable§Be Willing to Learn§ §Your performance will be measured on our 3 x Coaches KPI's:§ §Retention§Referrals§Results§ § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §Our Coaches are the heart of our Community.§We provide a secure weekly wage and help to build a career out of helping people.§No Rent, and not §'Pay-Per-Session'.§Paid per hour, including all sessions, operations, programming, nutrition & accountability, etc.§ §We will also provide full mentoring from our very experienced head-coaches, as well as paid education from the world's top fitness courses.§ §The role can be part-time or full-time depending on the applicant and has the opportunity to develop into a Head-Coaching or Facility Manager role.§ § § §Skills and experience§ § § §A min Cert 4 is required.§ §However, we are always open to nurturing freshly qualified candidates who have the right attitude & mindset.§ §Ideally, you would also have Powerlifting or Bodybuilding experience.§To reduce the risk of fatigue or burn-out, you would live within 10km of our facility and have your own transport.§If you think you are a good fit to work with PPS, please apply with a Cover-Letter & Resume.§ §In your Cover-Letter, answers these 3 x Questions:§ §Why do you want a career with PPS?§What value do you feel you bring to PPS?§If accepted, when can you start your induction with PPS?§ §Applications without Cover-Letter's won't be accepted.§ § §§§§

Our teams are very loyal, professional, super friendly and exceptionally hard working.  You will be working at THE BEST training facility in the area!§  §We§ offer:§ § §PT Mentoring, development, ongoing training and support§ §one on ones and staff sessions§ §Dynamic, professional and educated team§ §Group fitness opportunities§ §Small group training opportunities§ §Separate Group fitness and Functional Training zone in most clubs§ §Uncapped earning potential§ §Generous Rent free period and start-up costs§ §We develop our PT's professionally and provide ongoing skills training, business mentoring, and highly skilled staff to ensure your success and happiness.§  §Your success = member success = the club's success! We work with you to make you successful.§  §The successful applicants will be enthusiastic and highly motivated towards developing and growing their business, as well as having a great attitude and genuine willingness to help others. The ability to work with others and be a part of a strong team is a must.§  §If you are qualified and know being a Personal Trainer or Group Fitness Instructor is the ONLY career for you, truly love fitness, people and the fitness industry, as well as the idea of putting in the hours at the start to build up a HUGE client base excites you, then you may just be the one we want to work with - SO APPLY NOW!!§  §OUR§ COMMITMENT TO OUR TEAM§  §Ongoing business mentoring and support by the Club Manager Technical skill development by Management§  §Loads of weekly in-club and online marketing tools to help you grow a sustainable business§  §Generous rent-free period to ensure a highly sustainable business§  §Want§ to§ be part of our successful team?§  §If you feel you possess these attributes and wish to join the team then please call us on §0428 192 123§ §or email us at§ §indooroopilly@snapfitness.com.au§  §www.snapfitness.com/au/gyms/indooroopilly§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a personal trainer?§Have you completed a qualification in fitness?§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§§§

jobTitle: Duty Manager Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50568065.txt	§Duty Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Duty Manager§§Advertiser: §YMCA§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §South West & M5 Corridor§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Other§§§§§§ §3 casual positions available§ §Work across 2 sites (Mt Annan & Camden)§ §Kick start your career with the Y§ §Our Duty Managers are the friendly faces keeping our Recreation Centres running – and our guests in top form. We’re looking for strong, independent and responsible multitaskers to manage the day-to-day of our centres and facilities. Think everything from opening and closing, regular water testing, responding to visitor queries and filling gaps in the roster. You’ll also lead a dynamic team of lifeguards, providing support and guidance as they look out for the safety of our guests, while you cultivate an enriching and fun experience for everyone.§If you’re an active person with a fun-loving personality who thrives under pressure, you could be our next Duty Manager. If so, expect perks like flexible hours and free facility membership, and the support to build valuable people, leadership and life skills – all while you make a difference to your community.§ §This is a casual position which requires the successful candidate to work across a rotating roster. The earliest shift can start at 5:30AM with the latest shift finishing at 9:00PM. This role will require the successful candidate to work weekends and public holidays. This role will be based at Mt Annan Leisure Centre, but will also support Camden War Memorial Pool.§ §Qualifications§ § §Lifeguard Qualification§ §Aquatic Technical Operations Certificate (Pool Ops/Plant Room experience preferred)§ §Current Senior First Aid and CPR (Must have prior to commencement)§ §Working with Children Check§ § §Y work with us?§ § §Work within a supportive team environment§ §Room to learn and develop within the organisation§ §Flexible hours and arrangements, for a work-life balance that works for you§ §Awesome discounts on The Y services and products§ §Corporate health insurance cover to keep you healthy§ §§Who What Y?§YMCA NSW is a profit-for-purpose organisation focused on healthy living, social impact and empowering young people. We operate 23 recreation centres, 57 Out of School Hours Care services and two camping locations which fund our diverse range of youth and community programs, employing 1800 staff across NSW.§Our goal is for our workforce to reflect the diverse community we serve. We encourage people of all genders, ages, religions, disability, sexual orientation, family and caring responsibilities and cultures, including people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander heritage to apply.§Commitment to Safeguarding§The Y, including Boards of Directors, is committed to the safety and wellbeing of children and young people in accordance with our Safeguarding Children and Young People framework. The Y requires that all applicants undergo satisfactory screening prior to commencement, including but not limited to:§ §a national criminal history check;§ §an international criminal history check where applicants have worked overseas;§ §holding or obtaining a Working with Children Clearance/equivalent in accordance with state/ territory laws;§ §two reference checks.§ § §Please note, the results of any National and International Police Check will only be used to assess your suitability to perform the role.§ §Any successfully appointed applicant will be required to adhere to the Safeguarding Children and Young People framework, which includes a thorough safeguarding children and young people induction and committing to upholding the safety and wellbeing of children and young people throughout their engagement with YMCA.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Full Time Manager - Body Fit Training Group Fitness Coach Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50586953.txt	§Full Time Manager - Body Fit Training Group Fitness Coach§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Full Time Manager - Body Fit Training Group Fitness Coach§§Advertiser: §Body Fit Training§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§$60,000 base plus incentives and bonuses§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§§ABOUT THE ROLE:§ §Body Fit Trainers are the face of our business.  They are an integral part of each and every thing we do and are critical to the growth of our member base – from making members feel welcome the moment they step in our studios, to motivating, inspiring and guiding them through our 50 minute workouts, to playing an active role in recruiting new members and retaining our existing ones.  BFT trainers use their knowledge, skills and abilities to teach safe and effective exercise at all times… and use their great personalities to make BFT the best training experience anywhere!§ §As part of our team you will work alongside the studio owners and other trainers within the team . As a team we all work together to help achieve the studio's member growth and profitability aspirations.§ §ABOUT YOU:§ §You'll have the following experience and qualities...§ § §Previous experience in personal training, preferably group training (ideally minimum 2 years experience)§ §Cert 3 and 4 in Fitness§ §Team sport orientated background§ §Willingness to learn and up-skill§ §Ability to build an awesome member community§ §Highly motivated and have a passion to succeed§ §Have exceptional customer service and sales skills§ §Work well as part of a team§ §Flexibility and willingness to step outside the bounds of the role§ §Passion for the health and fitness industry and want to change people's lives§ §Creativity, drive and initiative§ §High level of integrity§ §ABOUT US:§ §Body Fit Training is Australia's newest and most advanced group training methodology.  We've sold over 150 franchises across the world, so we're a brand on the move.  We've incorporated scientifically proven training techniques aimed at reducing fat and creating lean muscle into a variety of 55 minute training sessions that are overseen by accredited coaches in a dynamic group environment.§ §High levels of visual content showcasing our programs are shown on multiple digital displays throughout the studio and allow our trainers to spend more time concentrating on our members, while the screens direct the traffic!  Our cutting edge, globally superior technology together with our 4-6 week progressive training blocks with unique strength and conditioning elements to complement our extensive cardio workouts makes us both different, and better.§ §Body Fit Training Milton was the first studio to open outside of Melbourne where Body Fit Training Originated, and it works closely with Body Fit Training Noosa (Aug 2020) Body Fit Training Albion (Jan 2019), Body Fit South Brisbane (June 2018), and Body Fit Training Milton (Jan 2018) which means there is always work for the right candidates, with opportunities to manage current or future sites.§ §ABOUT THE BENEFITS:§ §We want you to be happy and love coming to work at BFT, so you'll be supported with an attractive remuneration package that will be tailored to experience and will include ongoing training and workplace flexibility, together with career progression opportunities including increased responsibilities and the potential to move into a more senior role. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Have you completed a qualification in fitness?§Do you have customer service experience?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§Do you have experience working towards targets and KPIs?§How many years' experience do you have as a personal trainer?§§§

jobTitle: Junior soccer coaches Job in Perth - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50585680.txt	§Junior soccer coaches§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Junior soccer coaches§§Advertiser: §Nick Corrigans Soccer Schools§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §Northern Suburbs & Joondalup§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§Fun, outgoing Junior Soccer Coaches required to coach children in age groups 3 to 13 years.§ §Permanent and part time positions available in all parts of the Perth metropolitan areas.§ §Training sessions throughout the week vary from venue to venue, From 3pm onwards every afternoon and 8am every Saturday.§ §Sessions are on average 3 hours per afternoon and up to 5 hours on Saturdays. Minimum rate of pay $20 per hour. There's room for increase if coaches can prove there ability to work autonomously .§ § Must have good verbal skills and be proficient in spoken English§ §The position would suit students studying sports science/medicine/primary school courses. jobTitle: Maintenance Fitter Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50563784.txt	§Maintenance Fitter§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Maintenance Fitter§§Advertiser: §Iceworld Olympic Ice Rinks§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Other§§§§§§ § §Maintenance Fitter, § §Iceworld™ Olympic Ice Rinks § § § §Sports/Entertainment Industry§ §Brisbane Based§ §Maintenance Fitter,§ §Iceworld™ Olympic Ice Rinks§ §Maintenance Fitter,§ §Iceworld™ Olympic Ice Rinks§ §Sports/Entertainment Industry§ §Brisbane Based§ §Salary Award Based, Commensurate with qualifications, skills, experience and ability.§ § We operate the two major Ice Skating Facilities in Brisbane and are seeking an experienced maintenance fitter to assist with the accomplishment of the Iceworld™ Facility Maintenance Program.§ § The rinks operate from early morning through to late evening, 362 days per year, with diverse maintenance and repair requirements. The job is usually 5 days per week with the incumbent expected to be available for emergency repairs from time to time within their capabilities.§ § You will be an experienced energetic maintenance fitter; great people skills are a mandatory requirement with an ability to accomplish daily priorities in conjunction with the maintenance programs set by the Project and Maintenance Manager.§ § You will be an intelligent operator who can quickly identify repair necessities and balance multiple priorities, an understanding of the practical engineering & maintenance aspects of ice rink facilities & their equipment would be a major advantage, although not mandatory.§ § Qualifications: Formal trade qualifications in Fitting Machining, Mechanical electrical trades or similar, with some experience in petrol/LPG engine repairs and maintenance, some auto electrical experience, fitting, welding and or bodywork and painting repairs are preferred. Experienced, unqualified people may be considered.  The position also takes care of gardens, lawns, carparks and minor building maintenance and anything else that arises. Some computer experience is a necessity as we will operate a computer based Maintenance system.§ §Our refrigeration systems are maintained by a subcontractor; however, our maintenance fitters attend to minor maintenance of the equipment on a day to day basis. Experience in or the understanding of refrigeration systems is an advantage.§ §A current Queensland Driver Licence is mandatory and the incumbent is expected to learn to drive the Zamboni ice resurfacing machine and operate it when required following training and operate a scissor lift, following training and certification.§ § Under recent changes to regulations, the incumbent must obtain (or already possess) a current Positive Notice/Qld Working with Children Blue Card before commencing work.§ § As a Qld child and young people regulated sporting entity, we operate a totally smoke free business.§ § This is a hands-on role requiring a “can do, self-starting” attitude and you must be available on call to assist with issues that arise at the facilities.§ § The position will commence as a Casual based appointment, located at Boondall but the appointment operates at both facilities from time to time.§ § Iceworld™ is an equal opportunity employer and career development is available to the right person.§ §Applicants must have a legal right to reside and work in Australia.§ § Please provide two referees who are not relatives? We will tell you if we are going to call them.§ § Applications & CV in §Word format§ only and copy of current clean Qld driver licence back and front via Seek. We will not respond to applications received via other avenues.§ § § §The application form will include these questions:§ § §Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§ §How many years' experience do you have as a maintenance fitter?§ §Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§ §How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§ §Are you willing to undergo a pre-employment medical check?§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a maintenance fitter?§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Are you willing to undergo a pre-employment medical check?§§§

jobTitle: Swim School Centre Manager | $30 - $40ph plus Super Job in Wollongong, Illawarra & South Coast - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50577873.txt	§Swim School Centre Manager | $30 - $40ph plus Super§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Swim School Centre Manager | $30 - $40ph plus Super§§Advertiser: §Crawchy Swim School§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wollongong, Illawarra & South Coast§§Salary§§$30 - $39.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§Opportunity §  §What we are looking for, is an experienced centre manager to take over the running of the day to day requirement of the centre. §  §With the owner now looking to take a step back, this would give the incoming manager the autonomy to make the role their own. §  §The hours may suit a return to work mum, as centre hours are from 8-3:00pm. With hours ranging from 15-35 hours per week (dependant on term time). Outside of term time, hours can be flexible and worked from home - fitting in with school holidays etc.§  §The role duties will include but not limited to:§ § §Day to day running of the centre;§ §Organisation of new bookings and renewals for all programmes available - these include LTS, Squad and Aqua Aerobics;§ §Completion of staff rosters;§ §On-boarding and off-boarding of staff;§ §Management of enquiries via email, phone and social media, including any complaint handling;§ §Liaise with our local council pool for term 1 & 4 regarding squad;§ §Ordering of any stock as and when required;§ §Ensuring all employee qualifications are keep up to date;§ §Basic pool operations and maintenance;§ §Ensuring centre is maintained and kept tidy (including basic cleaning)§ §Delegate tasks as and when needed.§ §What we are looking to ensure success in this position is:§ § §Problem solving skills;§ §Excellent customer service;§ §Patient, professional and friendly demenour;§ §Someone who is proactive and can work off their own initiative, actioning points as they arise;§ §Good work ethic;§ §Experience within a management position, within a swimming centre preferred, but not essential;§ §Ability to work flexible working hours generally 8am-3pm weekdays, 15 hours during term time, more at the beginning and end of each term (circa 35 hours);§ §Up to date First Aid, CPR and WWC certification is a must.§ §Contact Info§  §If you would like to hear more about this opportunity please email Mel at §crawchymel@gmail.com§ or press Apply to send through an application.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§Do you have customer service experience?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§How many years' experience do you have in the sports & fitness industry?§§§

Plus Fitness Leichhardt is a 6 year old club, with 1200+ members!§ § §About the role§ § §Position Mission§ §As a personal trainer with Plus Fitness, it is your responsibility to provide a comprehensive one-on-one educational fitness program that promotes a health and fitness program through realistic goal setting and education. Produce independent exercisers by providing them in-depth information on equipment usage, lifestyle management, and ultimately, how to design their own personal fitness program.§ §Personal Attributes§ §Outgoing, friendly and confident demeanour§Able to maintain a balance between the growing individual client base, whilst also contributing towards building a positive club environment and retaining members§Have an attitude of mutual cooperation amongst all the staff, fostering a positive teamwork approach.§Patient, courteous listener, willing to spend time and show a genuine interest in all clients, members and prospective members and clients.§Polite and respectful attitude towards clients and staff§ §Duties/Accountabilities:§ §Conduct all Personal Training Sessions at the Facility and maintain regular and professional client contact and at all times and in accordance with the Plus Fitness Systems.§Maintain and provide evidence of Public Liability and Professional Indemnity Insurance.§Responsible for all paperwork required to set up personal training and for cancellation of all payments once required.§Provide the highest value of service to each and every client.§Write individualised programs consistent with clients needs and goals.§Conduct complimentary fitness assessments when required.§Attend staff/training meetings when required.§Maintain a high level of personal presentation and professional standards.§Adhere to all company policies and procedures provided to you.§ §Apply: §leichhardtm@plusfitness.com.au§ § §Benefits and perks§ § §About the position:§ §Rental model only - not a paid salary. Rent starting from $100 per week, and up to   $220 per week depending on your level of commitment towards gym floors shifts (1 x 30min class during 2hr gym floor shift)§A low competitive Personal Training environment.§On-going support from management to help build your success.§ § §Skills and experience§ § §Looking for a trainer with minimum 2 years of § §industry experience.§ §Skills required§ §Cert III & IV in Fitness§First Aid & CPR§Exercise instruction, program writing, client fitness and body composition testing§A broad understanding of the human body, anatomy and physiology§Outstanding Customer Service skills§Sales experience§Ability to work in a team environment.§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a personal trainer?§Have you completed a qualification in fitness?§Which of the following First Aid accreditations do you currently hold?§How many years' experience do you have in the sports & fitness industry?§§§

jobText: TXT/50636307.txt	§Group Fitness Personal Trainer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Group Fitness Personal Trainer§§Advertiser: §F45 Training Forestville§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §North Shore & Northern Beaches§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§ § §About us:§ §F45 Training is a team-based functional training facility that is taking the world by storm. F45 places a huge emphasis on the 'three key factors' of motivation, innovation and results. Our classes are unique, fun and highly addictive which is why F45 Training is currently the fastest growing network of fitness studios in the world.§ §We are located in a busy local shopping centre in the heart of Forestville, with plenty of cafes, grocery stores and fitness facilities.§ §We always have extra shifts available, and flexibility to swap shifts with other staff if required. § §About the role:§ §F45 Training Forestville and Killarney Heights is seeking a talented Trainer to join our team to assist in our classes, you must be outgoing, have strong communication skills to motivate and correct our members technique to avoid injury during class and help them reach their fitness goals.§ §You will also be expected to perform cleaning duties to abide by our COVID-19 safety plan that is in place to eep our studio as safe as possible for staff and clients.§ §We are a strong community based studio and we expect our members to feel amazing after each and every class they attend.§ §We are seeking a high-quality experienced Group Fitness Instructor or Personal Trainer for part-time and casual employment that is available to work on Thursday, Saturday & Sunday mornings.§ §You will be an integral part of the growth of our studio and have the ability to progress into a permanent staff member if desired.§ §All staff contacts include a free F45 membership, uniform and ongoing training to keep you up to date with the ever changing Fitness Industry!§ §We strongly recommend serious applicants undertake an F45 Training class prior to applying and be very familiar with the F45 model. Please visit the F45 Training site for a complimentary pass visit to an F45 studio near you (www.f45training.com.au).§ §Role and Responsibilities:§ § §Deliver high quality, results-focused F45 group fitness classes§ §Drive results for members§ §Set up the studio before and after training sessions§ §Ensure studio cleanliness and high standard of operation§ §Motivate studio members during and after training§ §Assist with membership sales and retention§ §Help foster a positive community-based team-training environment§ §Help the Manager ensure the business operates at the highest level§ §We are searching for Trainers who are:§ § §Passionate about motivating our members to push their limits§ §Able to deliver high-level customer service every single day§ §Have the ability to coach and cue strength and fitness movements correctly§ §Willing to work flexible hours§ §Eager to be actively involved in retaining members.§ §Self-motivated, driven and willing to learn and work as part of our team§ §Able to provide a very high standard of training and customer service§ §Full of energy and confident, generating a motivating training environment§ §Have a 'can do' attitude§ §Key Attributes:§ § §Exceptional verbal and communication skills§ §Excellent attention to detail§ §Ability to develop strong relationships with clients§ §Outstanding time management and organisational skills§ §Experience and Qualifications:§ § §Experience delivering Group Fitness sessions§ §Cert III and IV in Fitness§ §Current Senior First Aid & CPR§ §Current Fitness registration will be highly regarded§ §To apply:§ §If you're ready to take your career to the next level and are passionate about supporting and inspiring our members then please apply now and send your resume with a cover letter to §forestvilleandkillarneyheights@f45training.com.au§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Which of the following First Aid accreditations do you currently hold?§Have you completed a qualification in fitness?§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§How many years' experience do you have as a personal trainer?§§§
