jobText: TXT/50596890.txt	§Personal Trainer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Personal Trainer§§Advertiser: §Fitness Enhancement Woolloongabba§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§A Personal Training career with no rent and guaranteed clients!§Fitness Enhancement Mitchelton and Woolloongabba are looking for motivated mobile Personal Trainers to join our awesome team for clients located in and around Brisbane City and surroundings.§Established in 1999, we are one of the largest Personal Training companies in Australia with Trainers and franchises in Brisbane, Sunshine Coast, Sydney, Melbourne and on the Gold Coast.  Find out more about us at  §www.fitnessenhancement.com§.§This is your opportunity to make a start with a company that is as dedicated to your success as you are. We want career orientated Trainers who are friendly, down to earth and can work as a team and uphold our high standards.§Our extensive advertising means we will provide you with the bulk of your clients. As a Mobile Personal Trainer we are able to ensure most of your clients are around your home suburb and neighboring suburbs.§This is a Personal Training career where you can manage your own Fitness Enhancement client base, and have opportunities to advance your career either within the company or with your own franchise. It is NOT a sales job or rental bill like so many others. We even pay you for free sessions we give clients! §Unlike most Gyms we're in the business of getting and keeping PT clients, not selling rent.  So your success is our success: Lots of clients!§If you're qualified with certificate 3 & 4 in Fitness, professional, as dedicated to success as we are and have a reliable car find out more at:§www.fitnessenhancement.com/careers§ §Submit your resume and cover letter via Seek and ensure you state which suburb you are in. If you're not in or around the these areas feel free to enquire about any other positions around Australia.   § §§§§

jobTitle: Swim Instructor/ Teacher - St Peter's Aquatics Centre, CABOOLTURE Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50687361.txt	§Swim Instructor/ Teacher - St Peter's Aquatics Centre, CABOOLTURE§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Swim Instructor/ Teacher - St Peter's Aquatics Centre, CABOOLTURE§§Advertiser: §Brisbane Catholic Education§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §Northern Suburbs§§Salary§§School Officer Level 3 - $36.31 - $37.85 per hour§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§St Peters Aquatics Centre is looking for two Learn to Swim Instructors who are available for morning and afternoon learn to swim lessons. §  We are looking for Instructors with a can-do attitude and a passion for teaching children to swim. Here at St Peters Aquatics Centre, teamwork is crucial to the operation of our busy schedule. You will be a part of our come back and relaunch for our centre and will be supported every step of the way by an experienced team.§ You should possess the following attributes:§ - Approachable§ - A minimum of 2 years teaching experience§ - Excellent communication skills§ - A person who wants to assist in the growth of the business§ You will possess the following qualifications:§ - Teacher of water safety (ASCTA or Aust Swim)§ - Teacher of Infants (ASCTA or Aust Swim)§ - CPR§ - Paid Blue Card§ Qualifications desired but not required:§ - First Aid§ - Pool Lifeguard§ - Teach of Competitive Strokes (ASCTA or Aust Swim)§Click on Apply to view a copy of the Role Desription and for further details on How to Apply.§St Peter's is a Catholic primary school, situated in central Caboolture (opposite the railway station) with a student population of 676 and a staff of 72. St Peter’s is proud of its Josephite tradition. We endeavour to live the message promoted by St Mary MacKillop – ‘Never see a need without doing something about it’. Our students are proud and supportive of their school. They show respect to teachers, adults and fellow students. Students know what is expected of them and strive to meet these high standards.§ At St Peter’s we educate for 21st Century learners who are successful, creative, confident, active, informed and empowered to shape and enrich our world. 21st Century learning at St Peter’s is underpinned by effective pedagogy and spaces that are engaging, motivational and relevant for the learning taking place. Our classrooms are flexible learning environments designed to be configured in a variety of ways. At St Peter’s we believe that every child is capable of success which is reflected in our high expectations to maximise the learning progress and achievement of every student. § § Visit our school website  §here§   § To be successful in this role you will:§§have a commitment to and understanding of the ethos and traditions of Catholic Education;§§hold a Paid Employee Positive Notice Blue Card prior to commencement; and§§be eligible to work in Australia for the duration of the appointment.§§ § Estimated Start Date: §   Commencing 12 October, 2020§ § Position Tenure: §   Fixed Term§ § Weeks Worked:  § School term weeks only (holidays unpaid)§ § Tenure Duration (If Fixed Term):  § To end of Term 4 2020§ § Total Paid Hours (per wk) & Days Required:  § Casual hours to be negotiated (morning and afternoon availability required)§ § Salary Level, Range or Hourly Rate:  § School Officer Level 3 - $36.31 - $37.85 per hour§ § Employment Conditions:§    Diocesan Catholic Education Employing Authorities in Queensland Single Interest Agreement§ § § This position involves working with children.  The appointment of successful applicants will be subject to satisfactory employment screening for child related employment in accordance with the law.§Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.§ § § Contact Person:§    Jade Gray§ § Contact Telephone Number:§    §(07) 5495 7725§ § Contact Email:§    §jade.gray@bne.catholic.edu.au§Closing Date:  §02-Oct-2020§ §§§§

jobTitle: Personal Trainer / Boxing Coach - 12RND Fitness Ashburton & Malvern Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50659451.txt	§Personal Trainer / Boxing Coach - 12RND Fitness Ashburton & Malvern§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Personal Trainer / Boxing Coach - 12RND Fitness Ashburton & Malvern§§Advertiser: §HealthyPeople§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§The Company:§ §12RND Fitness§ offers the latest in High-Intensity Interval Training (HIIT) Boxing and functional strength. Workouts are designed around the format of a 12 Round boxing contest and are professionally designed to combine boxing skills and drills with functional strength training and sports-based cardio exercises with heart rate technology to maximise results FAST!§ §The Opportunity:§ §Working as part of a high-performance team across two 12RND clubs, a unique opportunity exists for a skilled Personal Trainer and Boxing Coach to become an integral part of the overall success of 12RND Fitness.§ §Hours required are 20-30 hours per week, min shifts are generally 3 hours up to 5 hours.§ §The role is offered on a Casual or Part-Time employment basis.§ §Start date would be November 2020 (date is COVID gym reopening dependent).§ §The role is very physical in nature, “hands-on” and lots of fun. You will be required to demonstrate exercises, get down, encourage and motivate clients. Another big aspect of the role is instructing boxing skills and pad-holding with clients.  § §Rate§: $30-$40p/h - Depending on skills and experience§ §Responsibilities:§ § §Run daily HIIT workouts§ §Ensure members get the workout of their lives§ §Maintain gym facilities as required§ §Ensure you know EVERY member's name§ §Contributing to our kick-ass culture§ §Provide pad work and coach members on boxing skills§ §Assist with social media posts and messages§ §Conduct free trials and assist in the sales process§ §Must have's:§ § §Be a FUN & engaging people person!§ §Boxing Certificate or Boxing Coach training, significant pad-holding skills§ §Functional strength training knowledge & skills§ §Ability to teach others effectively§ §Experience in conducting group fitness classes§ §Be fit, naturally outgoing, confident and energetic and have the ability to pad-hold and catch punches for 3-5 hour shifts.§ §Enjoy working with people and building meaningful relationships§ §Punctuality and flexibility with hours including some weekend shifts§ §Certificate 3 in Fitness ( Cert 4 desirable) § §Current First Aid & CPR§ §Be highly organised with a high level of attention to detail§ §Have outstanding customer service skills§ §Preference is to live close to the area, Car (& licence) is desirable as we need someone with the ability to get to the studio on time and early starts§ §If you think this is you, §APPLY NOW!§ §Submit your CV and cover letter via the 'Apply' button.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: AFLW Head Coach Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50635016.txt	§AFLW Head Coach§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§AFLW Head Coach§§Advertiser: §Richmond Football Club§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§ABOUT US:§ §Richmond Football Club is one of the largest clubs in the Australian Football League, with over 100,000 loyal and passionate members. The Club’s vision is to build a Strong & Bold future – both on and off the field– through living our purpose of Connecting to Thrive and Win.§ §We understand the power of sport to connect people, and at the heart of the Club’s purpose is being involved with our community. At Richmond, culture is paramount, and the Club is committed to developing its people in a supportive environment. Connecting to Thrive and Win is not just about connecting with fans and members, but about staff, players and coaches connecting with each other with humour and care, through storytelling and authenticity, to build genuine relationships. We are an Australia Business Awards 2019 winner in the Employer of Choice Category, and a Flexible Work Champion. #Flexibility is something we value. We recognise that this will mean different things to different people and are supportive of various flexible working arrangements, including the ability to work from home. We're committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace and strongly encourage applicants from all backgrounds to apply.§ §Our Commitment to the Safety and Wellbeing of Children and Young People§ §The Richmond Football Club is committed to providing an environment and culture that is caring and safe for all children and young people in our care through a wide variety of sporting, cultural and educational activities, events, services and programs.§ §In line with our purpose of Connecting to Thrive and Win, we want children and young people to feel safe, supported, respected and encouraged to reach their full potential, and only recruit people who, regardless of their role, will support such an environment.§ §This role will be subject to pre-employment checks, including a Working with Children Check.§ §ABOUT THE ROLE:§ §The AFLW Head Coach is responsible for the training and performance of the AFLW team. Working closely with Club AFLW Coaches and the Head of Women’s Football, the AFLW Head Coach implements best practice training programs and game plans consistent with the purpose of the Richmond Football Club: Connecting to Thrive and Win.§ §The AFLW Head Coach leads with a coaching strategy and philosophy that is focused on the on- and off-field development of our Women’s players. This person is also responsible for driving the continuous improvement of the Women’s program according to best practice and represents the Women’s program and the Club externally.§ §KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:          § § §Deliver and guide the use of best practice coaching and strategy to prepare both players and coaches for games.§ §Play a leading role in training, player meetings, Match Committee, game day, selection and game reviews.§ §Oversee continuous individual player development on and off the field.§ §Lead program and strategy development with a focus on excellence.§ §Represent the team and the Club as required.§ §WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR:§ § §Experience coaching football at an AFL or AFLW level§ §Demonstrated knowledge and skill in understanding and demonstrating the technical perspectives of football critical to success§ §Experience leading, motivating, and inspiring a team to achieve outcomes and achieve success§ §Demonstrated experience in facing challenges with composure and consistency§ §A relentless attitude to pursuing and achieving goals§ §An optimistic, positive nature with an ability to motivate and inspire§ §Skilled and willing to both give and receive feedback with a focus on continuous improvement and accountability§ §Strong empathy and respect for others§ §Resilience in the face of challenges§ §Well organised and prepared, reliable and dependable§ §CONTACT:§ For any further information or if you have any queries please contact the §Head of Women’s Football§ on §ksheahan@richmondfc.com.au§.§ §APPLICATIONS: §To apply for this position please forward a cover letter and resume to employment@richmondfc.com.au. Applications close §midnight Sunday  11 October, 2020§. § §Please note only those progressing to interview stage will be contacted.§ §§§§

Our core areas of business and facilities stewardship include health clubs, wellness and spa, golf, aquatic and sporting venues in 150 locations across Australia and New Zealand. § §We are in an exciting period of growth, and look to continue to diversify and deliver results while being a strong community citizen.  With an annual turnover in excess of $180m, the group are looking for the best and brightest to assist with taking the organisation into the future.§ §The Role§ §As a §Swimming Teacher§ you will teach effective Swimming and Water Safety to help grow our swim program. jobText: TXT/50583330.txt	§Reformer Pilates Instructor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Reformer Pilates Instructor§§Advertiser: §Bally Pilates§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wollongong, Illawarra & South Coast§§Salary§§$35-$50 per hour§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§ABOUT US§  §At Bally Pilates we believe movement, nutrition and mindset are key to living an empowered life. Our training philosophy combines focused time with expert practitioners and high level teaching, with the energy and community spirit of group classes. This unique approach inspires individualised and fun-laced workouts, specifically designed to challenge, connect and educate.§  §Our state-of-the-art, boutique studio offers an exclusive experience in Reformer & Mat Pilates, Barre, suspension training, nutrition coaching and Reiki healing.§  §Bally Pilates boasts an accredited and passionate team who utilise a comprehensive and holistic approach to empower, educate and inspire change. §  §OUR VISION:§ To empower all people to reach towards their highest health and performance potential.§  §OUR MISSION:§ To provide excellence in lifestyle, nutrition and movement medicine.§  §Bally Pilates’ core values milestone critical checkpoints that are represented and embodied by our team to keep us on track to achieving our vision, through mission.§  §Be Wow!§ – Exceed expectations in everything we do.§  §Become World's Best Practice§ – Understand and drive world class outcomes.§  §Make It Happen§ – Take responsibility and be outcome oriented.§  §Lead Innovation§ – Think creatively and develop new solutions.§  §Come From Heart§ – Be compassionate, respectful and humble.§  §Education Matters§ – Develop yourself and others.§  §Be Happy, Bring Quirk§ – Bring personality, skills and experiences to every encounter.§  §Experience our method. Improve your practice. Live in a body you love.§  §www.ballypilates.com§  § §  §ABOUT THE ROLE§  §Bally Pilates is looking to contract a value-aligned Pilates Instructor for immediate start to assist our team 8-20 hours a week (depending on your availability) in delivering client-centred programs across our Reformer Pilates schedule.§  §On joining the Bally Pilates team, you will be rewarded with an attractive hourly rate, negotiable with the skills and experience you are bringing to the role. §  §All experience levels welcome to apply, from new graduates to experienced practitioners. §  §Reporting to the owner, this role will see you delivering Reformer & Mat Pilates and suspension training sessions that are goal-oriented and outcome-focused.§  §This role presents you with an excellent opportunity to deliver Reformer & Mat Pilates sessions (4-5 people max per class) to our existing client base and further develop skills with internal development and training.§  §Some of your duties and responsibilities will include (but will not be limited to):§ § §Demonstrate alignment of core value in pursuit of achieving Bally Pilates vision and mission;§ §Work collaboratively with an experienced, dedicated team;§ §Tailor Pilates and movement prescription toward client-centred goals§ §Use clinical reasoning, evidence-based practice and best care practice to ensure clinical standards are met and maintained;§ §Deliver professional individual, semi-private and group class sessions § §Engage in structured, regular file reviews of varying complexity, including strategic and technical development;§ §Contribute to and participate in staff personal and professional development;§ §Demonstrate ability to work as part of a team, as well as independently and unsupervised;§ §Provide health education, advice and support to enhance health and well being.§ §Required Education & Accreditation:§ § §Certificate in Reformer Pilates § §Certificate in Mat Pilates § §Current CPR & First Aid§ §Public Liability & Professional Indemnity Insurance§ §Police Check and Working With Children's Check§ §Essentials for Success:§ § §Alignment with Bally Pilates’ Core Values§ §A fun and positive personality§ §Interpersonal skills§ §Genuine passion for helping people reach towards their highest health potential§ §Action-oriented with the ability to deliver and receive effective guidance and advice § §Keen interest in personal and professional growth§ §Community focused§ §As part of a growing company, ongoing opportunities will present in terms of professional development, leadership roles and forging relationships in new markets. If you are excited by new opportunities and love working in a team environment, this is a fantastic opportunity for you. §  §So what are you waiting for? If you are a passionate, results-driven Pilates Instructor who understands WHAT we do and WHY we do it, don't wait - Apply Now!§§§§

jobTitle: MyFirstGym Coach / Birthday Party Host Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50585575.txt	§MyFirstGym Coach / Birthday Party Host§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§MyFirstGym Coach / Birthday Party Host§§Advertiser: §MyFirstGym Enoggera§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§About the business§MyFirstGym is a one stop fitness shop for children from 7 months right through to 15 years. We deliver outcome based programs and inspire kids to fall in love with movement and fitness. §Our development programs are designed to improve children's physical literacy, while our specialty programs are designed to focus on specific sports. Our specialty programs include Martial Arts, Ninja Warrior, Yoga, Dance, Gymnastics, Cheer, Parkour, Boxing and MFG Fit.§MyFirstGym Coaches are not just coaches, they are mentors, friends and role models who are passionate about working with children. §About the Coaching Role§The role of a MyFirstGym Junior Coach is to inspire children to love movement and fitness, and help them to progress from class to class. We are looking for a coach for our §junior program (0 to 4 years)§ and we are also seeking an additional §ninja coach (5 years +)§ to add to our team.§We have classes across our timetable morning and afternoon, 7 days per week. Our coaches also assist with events, birthday parties and assist with admin duties.§About the Birthday Party Coach Role§At MFG we love celebrating birthday parties! We are looking to add another superstar to our party staff.  We will provide all the training to help you excel. Ideally you will have a background in early childhood education, sports coaching or fitness. §Birthday parties are held on a Saturday and Sunday afternoon.§Skills and experience§Experience working with children§Hold a current working with children's check§First Aid Certificate (ideal but not essential)§Current certification in Children's Services (ideal but not essential)§Fitness qualification (ideal but not essential) §Strong customer service skills§Ability to work well in a team environment§Ability to redirect and think quick on your toes§This role is all about inspiring the younger generation to grow up fit and healthy all while getting to do what you love.§We look forward to meeting you.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§Have you completed a qualification in fitness?§How many years' experience do you have in the sports & fitness industry?§§§

jobTitle: Swimming Instructor Job in ACT - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50705814.txt	§Swimming Instructor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Swimming Instructor§§Advertiser: §YMCA§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§ §Part time and casual roles available§ §Be a part of ACT history working at the state-of-the-art Stromlo Leisure Centre§ §Make an impact in your local community§ § §We are looking for energetic, passionate and driven Swimming Instructors to join the team at our newest recreation facility, Stromlo Leisure Centre. Stromlo Leisure Centre is the new pride and joy when it comes to recreation facilities in the ACT. Our goal in managing the Centre is to promote healthy living in the local community which will promote community involvement. § §Stromlo Leisure Centre has already seen an overwhelming number of membership sign ups before we have even opened the doors. The success of our "Foundation Membership" program has excited us and we are looking to continue to build our team of experienced instructors so that we can provide the best service possible to the Stromlo community.  § §Our Swimming Teaachers are the aquatic artistes training the next generation of swimming superstars. Every day, they lead safe, stimulating and always-fun lessons that build confidence and capability in developing young people. As a Swimming Instructor at The Y, you will be a strong communicator, and a dynamic leader – motivating and educating our guests to build strong, active and safe behaviours in the water. § §If you’re an safety-conscious ‘Aqua Expert’ with strong people skills and an infectious energy, you could be our next Swimming Instructor. If so, expect perks like flexible hours and free facility membership, and the support to build valuable people, leadership and life skills – all while you make a difference to your community.§ § §Qualifications§ § §CPR Certificate§ §Teacher of Swimming and Water Safety License§ §Teacher of Infant and Preschool Aquatics (desireable)§ §Working with Children Check§ §Police Check (paid for by the Y)§ § §Y work with us?§ § §Work within a supportive team environment§ §Room to learn and develop within the organisation§ §Flexible hours and arrangements, for a work-life balance that works for you§ §Awesome discounts on The Y services and products§ §Corporate health insurance cover to keep you healthy§ §§Who What Y?§YMCA NSW is a profit-for-purpose organisation focused on healthy living, social impact and empowering young people. We operate 23 recreation centres, 57 Out of School Hours Care services and two camping locations which fund our diverse range of youth and community programs, employing 1800 staff across NSW.§ §Our goal is for our workforce to reflect the diverse community we serve. We encourage people of all genders, ages, religions, disability, sexual orientation, family and caring responsibilities and cultures, including people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander heritage to apply.§ §Commitment to Safeguarding§The Y, including Boards of Directors, is committed to the safety and wellbeing of children and young people in accordance with our Safeguarding Children and Young People framework. The Y requires that all applicants undergo satisfactory screening prior to commencement, including but not limited to:§ § §a national criminal history check;§ §an international criminal history check where applicants have worked overseas;§ §holding or obtaining a Working with Children Clearance/equivalent in accordance with state/ territory laws;§ §two reference checks.§ § § § §Please note, the results of any National and International Police Check will only be used to assess your suitability to perform the role.§ § § §Any successfully appointed applicant will be required to adhere to the Safeguarding Children and Young People framework, which includes a thorough safeguarding children and young people induction and committing to upholding the safety and wellbeing of children and young people throughout their engagement with YMCA.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Swimming teacher and Administrator Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50662341.txt	§Swimming teacher and Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Swimming teacher and Administrator§§Advertiser: §Shapland Swim Schools Pty. Ltd.§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§About the business and the role§  § §  §WE WANT YOU TO APPLY§ because Shaplands' know Swimming Teachers play a vital role in a child's life by helping them overcome the fears that water holds for most children. As a committed swimming teacher/administrator you have the ability to not only give a child a life long life saving skill you also have the ability to raise their overall confidence levels which spill over into their everyday activities and life.§  §Experienced swimming teachers/administrators such as yourself know how important being able to swim is for a child and we are looking for you to apply for this position because of the body friendly mineral pool you will get to work in. Gone are the skin issues and brittle hair. Come and join our team.§  §If you do not have any or a lot of experience in administration but understand how important a role a swimming teacher plays in a child overall development as a young person than this is the job for you and we will train you in your role as an administrator.§  §It is time for a change of environment and for an introduction into a great teaching program based on over seven decades of experience.§  §We are looking forward to hearing from you.§  § §  §Job tasks and responsibilities§ § §Happy, friendly personality.§ §Long term commitment.§ §Be your own person.§ §Teach swimming in a purpose built, body friendly heated mineral pool.§ §Impart to your pupils the joy of being confident in the water.§ §Job satisfaction knowing you make a difference in a child's life.§ §In your role as an administrator you would work closely with the teachers and upper management to ensure the smooth running of the program.§ §Build a bond with your pupils.§ §Opportunity to add new administration and teaching ideas to your resume.§ §Work closely with upper Management to ensure the smooth running of the swim school§ §Be self motivated and able to lead a team.§ §Opportunity to add new teaching ideas to your teaching skills.§ §Committed to making a difference in a child's life.§ §Above award rates of pay.§ § §  §Skills and experience§ § §Industry qualifications AUSTSWIM, ASCTA essential.§ §An open mind and commitment to making a difference in a child's life.§ §Previous Teaching experience is desirable§ §Be able to relate to children and parents.§ §Open to new ideas and understanding of Shaplands' tried and proven teaching method.§ §Work with our managers and existing teaching staff to deliver a semi-private high quality swimming lesson to all ages - babies to adults.§ §Be bright and bubbly and know how important this is to helping children and parents enjoy their experience at the swim school.§ § §  §Job benefits and perks§ § §MagnaPool mineral water gentle on your skin.§ §Incredible job satisfaction because of our personalised approach to teaching swimming.§ §Unique opportunity to join a really committed team.§ §Mature stable program.§ §Work in a unique teaching pool with 11 different water depths that add lots of variety to your lessons.§ §Plenty of on the job training.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§Which of the following AUSTSWIM training courses have you completed?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Do you own or have regular access to a car?§§§

jobText: TXT/50524663.txt	§Swim Teacher§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Swim Teacher§§Advertiser: §JSA Gym and Swim School§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§$25 - $34.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§JSA Swim School is a privately owned Swim School located in Rivervale, Western Australia, between Burswood and Belmont. We are very focused on providing new, exciting and fun ways to learn swimming, with a very strong belief in being family friendly, and in delivering results in babies and children learning to swim.§  §JSA Swim School is part of JSA Swim and Fitness Centre with our own indoor basketball courts, weights room, training area, and swimming pool! All staff have access to use our facility for their own health and wellbeing, and we encourage our staff to do so!§  §JSA's pool is used exclusively for swim teaching, or physiotherapy sessions. A maximum of 3 classes is run at each time, so teachers will not have to worry about large and distracting crowds. Each class is capped at a maximum of 4 children, so swim teachers are assured the comfort of small classes.§  § §  §The Role: JSA is currently searching for a new Swim Teacher, to join our dedicated team of swim school teachers!§ § §  §As summer rolls around, we have plenty of availabilities across the week for swim teaching. A minimum of one weekend availability is a must for all JSA Swim School teachers. §  §We value baby swim teachers, therefore if you have an Infant Swim qualification, or an AUSTSWIM Teacher of Infant Swim qualification equivalent, we will consider your application, above all others.§  §Therefore all applicants must have:§  §1. Valid WWCC, and§  §2. Valid AUSTSWIM license or equivalent, and§  §3. Valid First Aid§  § §  §JSA Swim School is privately owned and operated by dedicated directors and managers, and all staff (new or current) are well supported in their learning and skills training.§  §We are looking for new swim teachers who possess a strong history of teaching swimming, have excellent communication skills, have a love for working with children, and have the experience in structuring programs in skill development.§  §Unfortunately we are not in the position to offer supervision for trainees, so will not be accepting trainee applications at this point.§  § §  §Skills & Attributes:§Have a passion for swim teaching §Have strong customer service skills§Previous experience in a similar position§Excellent communication skills, takes initiative to seek out new ways for the business to grow§  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as a teacher?§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§Which of the following First Aid accreditations do you currently hold?§Which of the following AUSTSWIM training courses have you completed?§Do you have experience working with children?§§§

jobTitle: Personal Trainer Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50612311.txt	§Personal Trainer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Personal Trainer§§Advertiser: §Anytime Fitness§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §North West & Hills District§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§A rare opportunity has arisen for a collective of personal trainers to join our high-performance unit to work at our community-focused clubs on a NONE rental fee split model in our Sydney based locations.§  §Anytime Fitness Epping§  § §  §TIME FOR A CHANGE§  § §  §As our personal training sector expands, we wanted to do things differently from what we currently see in the Fitness industry.  Personal trainers have to become start-up entrepreneurs and business experts almost immediately. With absolutely no business skills, all the while trying to hold onto their fitness dream of helping people change their lives in a positive way.§  §What this results in, is the majority of coaches don’t ever reach their full potential, they are stricken for time and work ridiculous hours, they feel anxious and are highly stressed from continuous financial insecurity & they are left scorned and dejected by the fitness industry.§  § §  §OUR FOCUS§  § §  §With our change in mind, we provide our coaches with the utmost advantage in not only improving their personal training skill set but also their business skillset as well. We provide all of our coaches with extensive tutelage & mentoring on business strategy, marketing, sales, financial planning, budgeting, brand development, and self-development along with Advanced program design  ensuring all of our coaches have successful longevity within the industry and continuously fulfill their goals.§  § §  §CRITERIA§  § §  §Our selection criteria does not require you to have an extensive background in Personal training. What we do require is our candidates have an altruistic focus towards members and staff, enthusiastic attitude, a strong work-ethic, growth mindset and a willingness to continuously acquire new skills through our coaching.§  § §  §We live by the values and philosophy of People, Purpose, Profits & Play. §Amazing People, Strong Purpose, Profiting from our hard work (both financially and emotionally). With this in mind, we want you to have a significant role in maintaining our exceptional club culture. Our clubs are always highly engaging and interactive, and we pride ourselves on providing a fulfilling customer experience to all of our members.§  § §  §BENEFITS OF THE ROLE:§  § §  §·      Pay no rent. Split fee model for financial freedom§  §·      Pre-qualified leads from our on-boarding member program§  §·      Internal training certifications§  §·      Attractive split fee options for long tenure personal trainers  §  §·      Learn how to run and operate a successful sustainable personal training business§  §·      Be a part of an infectious high performing team culture§  §·      Succession planning for positions in management or mentoring§  §·      Enjoy coming to work§  §·      Master effective training and nutritional methodologies for regular transformations§  §·      Learn how to master your sales funnel to improve referral generation, quality leads and sales close ratios§  §·      Gain comprehensive knowledge on business strategy, marketing, social media strategy, financial planning, brand design. Which is essential for a successful PT career§  §·      Extensive mentoring, coaching & guidance§  §·      Utilise our tech-savvy approach with Apps to optimise the professionalism of your business§  §·      Weekly check-ins and monthly Performance meet with your PTM§  § §  §ABOUT THE ROLE§  § §  §·      One on one personal training sessions§  §·      Goal setting consults§  §·      Small group training sessions§  §·      CRM utilisation§  §·      Assisting with onboarding§  §·      Management of session planning§  § §  §CANDIDATES WILL NEED THE FOLLOWING QUALIFICATIONS§  § § § §Certificate 3 & 4 in Fitness (minimum)§ §Public Liability Insurance§ §Senior First Aid & CPR§ §Police Record Check§ §Working with Children’s Check§ §ABN Number§ § §  §If you love helping people,believe you are the right fit for our team and your goal is to develop into this type of personal trainer, then please take action and apply now. §  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Which of the following First Aid accreditations do you currently hold?§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§§§

jobTitle: Trackrider/Horse rider Job in Bendigo, Goldfields & Macedon Ranges - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50579985.txt	§Trackrider/Horse rider§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Trackrider/Horse rider§§Advertiser: §stable staff solutions§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bendigo, Goldfields & Macedon Ranges§§Salary§§$60,000 - $79,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Other§§§§§§An exciting opportunity has opened up to join our passionate thoroughbred racing team at Kilmore, without the typical early trackwork starts! §  §The ideal candidate will have have previous riding experience, preferably in show-jumping/eventing or other competition riding. If you have a passion for horses and racing, then this role is perfect for you! You will begin riding slow work on our professional home track, and incorporate travelling with the racehorses to the Kilmore racecourse to learn to ride timed gallops and possibly barrier work. We are looking for someone that can work on a full-time basis of:§  §Monday-Saturday 7am - 12pm. §  §Hours may be slightly negotiable to the right candidate. §  §We also offer the opportunity to increase your skillset in horse handling/husbandry on the ground, offering available hours within our large broodmare/foal team.§  §We understand a good team member should be valued and are looking to reward the right candidate excellent working/wage conditions (60-80k) to have an enthusiastic individual join our team.§  §Excellent accomodation is available to the right candidate and sponsorship may be available.§  §To apply, or for any questions regarding the position email;§  §stablestaff@yahoo.com§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§How would you rate your English language skills?§Are you available to work public holidays?§§§

We are inspired by lifestyle and driven by opportunity.§        §Here at City of Gold Coast, our commitment to a shared set of values shapes our decisions, actions and behaviours towards achieving the City Vision and our many city priorities.§        §          §We aim high –§ we are passionate about delivering the best for our city§          §We add value –§ we are innovative and make the most of every opportunity§          §We work as a team –§ our people are great individually, but unstoppable together§          §We take responsibility –§ we are committed to working safely, being trustworthy and owning our actions§        §        §About the Position§        §We are currently putting together a talent pool for people who would like to be considered for any potential upcoming Lifeguard vacancies at our various Aquatic Centres.§        §Pool Lifeguards assist with the supervision of aquatic centre patrons to ensure a safe and friendly recreational environment. They're also responsible for carrying out cleaning and maintenance requirements as required.§        §To assist us with processing your application, please scan §all§ required licences and qualifications together with your resume and upload as §one§ §attachment under 'Resume'.§        §You may be required to work up to 38 hours per week, and will be expected to have maximum availability, allowing you to be rostered across our venue's operating hours, which are from 4:45am to 8.00pm, 7 days a week. §        §As a Pool Lifeguard you will be responsible for:§        §          §Assisting with the supervision of the public in the use of aquatic facilities, ensuring that swimming pools and surrounds are under constant surveillance and that patrons conduct themselves in accordance with the conditions of entry.§          §Provide a high level of customer service to patrons and at the same time facilitate a safe and enjoyable aquatic experience.§          §Communicate with and educate pool patrons on water safety and appropriate behaviour.§          §Carry out operational procedures as required, including opening and closing of venue, application and removal of pool blankets, setting up for pool programs and events, maintenance and storage of equipment and reporting of any security or maintenance issues.§          §Undertake cleaning to meet COVID Workplace Health and Safety plans§          §Undertake maintenance and other operational duties as required.§        §        §About You§        §You're passionate about water safety and enjoy providing a high level customer service and facilitating a safe and enjoyable aquatic experience.  You maintain a sound knowledge of current legislation, standards, policies and guidelines and ensure all your qualifications are current.§        §You're flexible with work hours, and understand that weekend work, early mornings and late evenings, are all part of the service we provide to the community.§ You have the ability to work productively in a team environment, and can plan and organise yourself and others to ensure the timely completion of tasks. You are proactive and take initiative when working autonomously.§        §What We Offer§        §Working for the City of Gold Coast is both challenging and rewarding. You will enjoy:§        §          §working within a culture that promotes a healthy work life balance and flexible working arrangements;§          §a friendly and supportive team where you will be recognised and rewarded;§          §a competitive hourly rate plus up to 12% employer superannuation contribution and options to salary sacrifice;§        §        §The Selection Process§        §As part of our selection process, you may be required to undertake a one way video interview via SparkHire, and a face to face interview or virtual interview via Microsoft Teams or Skype. You may also be required to undertake police checks, employment history checks, qualification checks, pre-employment medical and drug and alcohol testing in accordance with Australian Standards and Council's procedures.§        §How to Apply§        §If you think you have what it takes select “Apply Now” and follow the on-screen prompts to complete and submit your application.§        §To assist us with processing your application, please scan §all§ required licences and qualifications together with your resume and upload as §one§ §attachment under 'Resume'.§        §Please note applications for this position will close at 10.30pm on the listed closing date.§        §You can now stay up to date with all of our advertised vacancies by joining our recruitment Facebook page: §https://www.facebook.com/COGCRecruitment§§Enquiries:§ Lynda Keys§Ph:§ §07 55816648§Applications Close:§ §      §      §Council is an EEO employer and welcomes diversity in the workplace.§    §    §  §§§The Gold Coast is an outstanding global city proudly looking towards its future. You may also be required to undertake police checks, employment history checks, qualification checks, pre-employment medical and drug and alcohol testing in accordance with Australian Standards and Council's procedures.§How to Apply§If you think you have what it takes select “Apply Now” and follow the on-screen prompts to complete and submit your application.§To assist us with processing your application, please scan §all§ required licences and qualifications together with your resume and upload as §one§ §attachment under 'Resume'.§Please note applications for this position will close at 10.30pm on the listed closing date.§You can now stay up to date with all of our advertised vacancies by joining our recruitment Facebook page: §https://www.facebook.com/COGCRecruitment§§Enquiries:§ Lynda Keys§Ph:§ §07 55816648§Applications Close:§ §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: State Coordinator Job in Perth - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50684417.txt	§State Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§State Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Fitness Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§Fitness Australia is the peak health and fitness industry association providing a range of support services and solutions to over 30,000 Registered Personal Trainers, registered fitness instructors, fitness businesses, accredited businesses and suppliers Australia-wide. As the peak industry association with a highly credible national profile, we recognise the growing importance of the fitness industry to the Australian economy and to maintaining the health and well-being of the Australian community.§  §We're committed to leading, supporting and growing an innovative fitness industry that embraces knowledge sharing, professionalism and high standards of customer care and service.§  § §  §This part-time role of State Coordinator with Fitness Australia is an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic organisation making a difference in the fitness industry.§  § §  §Role Overview§  §Join a great culture as our representative in Perth as a member of the state’s operations team. The key elements of this role are:§ § § Drive and secure new business membership and partnerships in Western Australia.§ §Establish and maintain relationships with RTO’s and Universities§ §Engage with government and local councils on behalf of the fitness industry.§ § §  §This role also entails liaising with other Fitness Australia staff including those in Industry Service, Business Development, Communications & Marketing teams.§  § §  §Essential Requirements§  §Experience§ § §Minimum 2 years of management or education experience in the fitness/health sector.§ §Experience developing and maintaining positive and effective relationships with partners and industry.§ §Demonstrated ability to work independently under broad direction, being able to demonstrate a high level of initiative and planning/organisational skills.§ § §  §Skills & Knowledge§ § §Excellent verbal and written communication skills§ §Project management skills and ability to multitask§ §Understanding of contemporary Australian fitness industry§ §Sound IT literacy skills, including proficiency in the use of word, processing, excel, email and internet software.§ §Passion for fitness and health§ § §  §Desirable Requirements§  §Education§ § §Tertiary Qualification in Exercise Science, Health Sciences, Business, or similar.§ §Experience working with a professional/industry association, or servicing industry in a territory management role.§ §Experience in dealing with government health departments, health NGOs, and health sector networks§ § §  §Job benefits and perks§  §Fitness Australia has a team around Australia. We are an energetic and innovative team working for a fitter, healthier Australia.§  §You will receive full training in your role, with opportunities for career advancement for high achieving candidates.§  §Perks include time allocated to physical activity and flexible working arrangements where suitable.§  § §  §Applicants must have a full driver's license and access to a car.§  §For further information, please contact Steve Grace at Steve.grace@fitness.org.au§  §To apply, click ‘Apply for this job’ and upload a cover letter and CV.§§§§

jobTitle: Fitness Professional / Exercise Scientist Job in ACT - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50712401.txt	§Fitness Professional / Exercise Scientist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Fitness Professional / Exercise Scientist§§Advertiser: §Corporate Health Management§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§Exercise Professionals for Recreation, Fitness and Wellbeing Program§Alexander Maconochie Centre ACT§ §An exciting opportunity exists for permanent part time and casual exercise professionals to join §Corporate Health Management§ and play a key role in the development and implementation of a new Fitness, Recreation and Wellbeing Program at the Alexander Maconochie Centre. The positions are available with an immediate start subject to security clearance.§ §Skills & Experience§Reporting to the Program Manager, you will be responsible for assisting with planning, coordination and implementation of a structured program of cultural, sporting, fitness, recreational and leisure time activities for detainees.§The right candidate will hold a relevant tertiary qualification in Exercise Science (graduates welcome), Outdoor Education and Recreation or similar, and/or a Certificate 4 in fitness. You will have experience in conducting fitness assessments/programming, group exercise training, one on one fitness consultations. You will also have a keen interest in a variety of sports and be confident in your ability to lead sporting for fitness, group program’s including supervising and umpiring a variety of sports with a focus on sport for fitness and participation. Your education combined with experience will strongly position you to succeed in this flexible and dynamic role.§ §Experience in the delivery of female only fitness and wellness programs will position you favourably for some of our programs. § §Due to the nature of the role, candidates will need to have the ability to operate in a correctional setting; working directly with detainees and complying with the Centre's security procedures. There will be additional training provided prior to commencement.§ §The key responsibilities can include§Assist with the coordination, planning and implementation of a wide variety of recreational and sporting activities.§Take responsibility for the women programs. §Leading fitness training group activities with men and women§Assist with the coordination and planning of recreation programs.§Ensure that proper equipment is available and in safe, good repair.§Encourage detainees to be involved in fitness, cultural and recreational activities; and§Assist detainees to understand and experience the benefits of exercise and healthy habits.§Key Selection Criteria§Relevant tertiary Qualification in Exercise Science, Fitness or Outdoor Education and Recreation and Registration with a recognised fitness industry peak body at Cert 4 and further experience with sports, sports conditioning and/or recreation.§Demonstrated skills, experience and competence in leading and managing groups and individuals in recreational/fitness programs;§Essential level of physical fitness and ability to lead and participate in outdoor activities, and assist others;§Well-developed interpersonal, communication, assertiveness and negotiation skills; and§Ability to work as a member of a multi-disciplinary team which involves direct contact with detainees;§Hold a current First Aid & C.P.R certificate;§Willing to participate in the necessary training and required security clearances§§§§

jobTitle: Indigenous Program Manager Job in Darwin - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50707870.txt	§Indigenous Program Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Indigenous Program Manager§§Advertiser: §Tennis Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Darwin§§Salary§§Annual Salary & Great Employee Benefits§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Indigenous Program Manager §        §          §Partner with key stakeholders to help grow the game of tennis in the NT §          §Join a passionate team and deliver high quality tennis participation programs §          §Flexible work practices, ensuring a positive work-life balance §        §        §          § §          §It's an exciting time for tennis in Australia and we have ambitious plans to continue to grow the game from grassroots through to high performance. We are transforming how we deliver tennis, with the aim of making it more accessible, to more people, more often. To help us achieve our plan we are looking for an §Indigenous Program Manager§ to join our team at §Tennis NT§ and contribute to the growth of tennis across the territory.§          § §About the role§ §Reporting into the §General Manager - NT§, in this role you will:§          §            §Build trusting and collaborative relationships with local communities and other organisations to assist in the delivery of tennis programs and participation opportunities to Indigenous Australians§            §Create substantial participation programs, providing pathways leading to participation§            §Develop and implement programs in schools, and work with tennis clubs to ensure that participation opportunities are available throughout the community§            §Provide program delivery training to key stakeholders and community members to ensure independent ongoing program delivery§            §Develop and deliver marketing and communication strategies with key stakeholders throughout the Northern Territory§          §          §About you§ §What you will bring to the role:§          §            §A proven ability to work with Indigenous communities and an understanding of cultural Tenpin bowling is a sport for all, with no age, size, speed, or strength limitations. §Our Vision§ – Is to create a thriving tenpin industry that engages and connects communities through play and skill.§Reports to the General Manager, Activity TBA.§Role Purpose§The State Development Manager is primarily responsible for growing participation in the sport of tenpin bowling in NSW. The role will collaborate and work with all State and National stakeholders to develop, refine, continually improve, and implement participation offers and programs in conjunction with TBA staff and the bowling center operators. A critical initial responsibility is to establish a new NSW State Committee with the primary aims of (1) responsibility for running events (2) establish coaching networks.§Tenpin Bowling Strategic Priorities§Link to Strategic Pillars§ – §A recent refresh of our new strategic outlook through our one management process delivered the following 4 strategic pillars. §The Business of Bowling - Responsibilities§Participation§Manage all aspects of TBA’s participation program including Sporting Schools and Bowl Patrol (primary school aged programs) and BowlAbilities (for people with a delivery§Identify new opportunities and partnerships across NSW to promote participation programs including but not limited to councils, disability service providers, publications, and targeted groups §Achieve participation targets and other milestones on time and within budget §Engage with the volunteer networks aligned with the participation goals §Development§Build and develop relationships with key stakeholder groups including but not limited to bowling centres, schools, disability service providers and other organisations and groups §Ensure the sport is implementing initiatives to drive in centre activity§Actively promote these programs across NSW through schools, disability service providers, bowling centres and other networks or groups§Explore opportunities to engage new coaches or program deliverers from within and outside the sport §Coordinate deliverer training sessions for coaches§ Governance§Establish in conjunction with the GM Activity and TBA CEO a new NSW State committee. §Establish a robust control and reporting process for TBA and the NSWTBA Committee which provides key indicators of performance vs milestones. §Visit all NSW registered centres at least once per year to discuss all aspects of the sport with a focus on promoting TBA’s participation programs and coaching opportunities §Actively contribute and support the implementation of our new strategy in conjunction with the GM Activity. §Work closely with the GM Activity to ensure connection and integration of programs across the state§Establish and manage the overall participation area costs within budgets.§Develop and nurture stakeholder relationships and community engagement influencers §Key Position Requirements§Essential§Strategic Influencing skills and stakeholder management experience§Community Engagement and Volunteer knowledge and expertise§Ability and willingness to ‘roll the sleeves up’§The ability to think strategically with local delivery§Project management expertise and experience in driving and managing change§Strong influencing, and relationship building skills§Personal qualities aligned with the values of our organisation §Create and drive training requirements aligned to participation and bowling activity across state delivery resources §Understand and have worked with the various external sport and Government bodies within the sport and participation pathways.§Understand private sector delivery of a sport/offer§Desirable§High emotional intelligence§Excellent verbal and written communication skills§Demonstrated understanding of the structure of sport at all levels, specifically state sports associations and working with volunteers§An analytical mind§Qualifications§Experience in managing, developing, and or refreshing participation in a sport (or similar sector)§Desirable Tertiary qualifications in relevant field§Post graduate studies (if available)§Key Stakeholders§State and Territory jobText: TXT/50716455.txt	§Executive Director - Triathlon ACT§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Executive Director - Triathlon ACT§§Advertiser: §Sportspeople Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Salary§§$80K + super§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Executive Director - Triathlon ACT §    §      §        §          §Lead and grow a healthy and growing sport organisation§          §‘Hands-on’ business operations and event management position§          §$80,000 pa + superannuation§          §Deakin, ACT location§        § Triathlon ACT (TACT) is the peak sporting organisation responsible for the development, promotion and governance of the sport of triathlon, duathlon, aquathon and multisport in the ACT. TACT is a not for profit organisation which is governed by the TACT Board and is a member of the national body, Triathlon Australia (TA). Supporting 13 clubs, TACT provides participation, sport development, education and performance programs and events, with a family focused, community driven and inclusive environment.§        § The Executive Director is accountable to the TACT Board through the President; however is responsive to the TA CEO and National Leadership Team.§        § The primary purpose of the Executive Director is to, through leadership excellence:§          §Advance the strategic direction of TACT§          §Manage the day-to-day operations of TACT efficiently and effectively in conjunction with the TACT Board and in line with agreed policies and directions§        § Key aspects of the role are:§          §ensuring the effective relationships with key stakeholders and the management of resources to achieve the objectives of TACT§          §high operational capabilities, with a focus on growth and sustainability of triathlon within ACT§          §an ability to balance working autonomously with leading, contributing to and being part of the team both locally and nationally§        § This ‘hands-on’ role requires an energetic and innovative leader with strong communication skills who is able to engage and work collaboratively with a diverse stakeholder group and develop and nurture key relationships within the triathlon community, including volunteers.§        § The successful candidate will be tertiary qualified, with senior experience within the sporting or event management industry, and the ability to strategically navigate the complexities of the local and national sporting landscape. The person must be decisive and tenacious with a demonstrated commitment to delivering both growth and a member service support focus which is built on inclusivity and camaraderie. Experience within not for profit and/or membership based organisations would be an advantage.§        § This is a unique opportunity to lead and grow a healthy and evolving sport organisation and would suit a candidate who has previous business leadership experience or a senior manager ready for the next step into this ‘hands-on’ leadership role. If you are looking for an exciting new challenge in your career then apply now!§        § Candidates wishing to be considered for this role should first read the position description and selection criteria and complete the §compulsory Sportspeople Recruitment Application Form§ at §sportspeoplerecruitment.com/jobs§ prior to applying.§        § Please apply via the Sportspeople Recruitment website.§      §    §    §    §sportspeoplerecruitment.com/jobs§      §Sportspeople Recruitment is a specialist division of People Recruitment Group§    §  §§§Lead and grow a healthy and growing sport organisation§‘Hands-on’ business operations and event management position§$80,000 pa + superannuation§Deakin, ACT location§§Triathlon ACT (TACT) is the peak sporting organisation responsible for the development, promotion and governance of the sport of triathlon, duathlon, aquathon and multisport in the ACT. TACT is a not for profit organisation which is governed by the TACT Board and is a member of the national body, Triathlon Australia (TA). Supporting 13 clubs, TACT provides participation, sport development, education and performance programs and events, with a family focused, community driven and inclusive environment.§The Executive Director is accountable to the TACT Board through the President; however is responsive to the TA CEO and National Leadership Team.§The primary purpose of the Executive Director is to, through leadership excellence:§Advance the strategic direction of TACT§Manage the day-to-day operations of TACT efficiently and effectively in conjunction with the TACT Board and in line with agreed policies and directions§Key aspects of the role are:§ensuring the effective relationships with key stakeholders and the management of resources to achieve the objectives of TACT§high operational capabilities, with a focus on growth and sustainability of triathlon within ACT§an ability to balance working autonomously with leading, contributing to and being part of the team both locally and nationally§This ‘hands-on’ role requires an energetic and innovative leader with strong communication skills who is able to engage and work collaboratively with a diverse stakeholder group and develop and nurture key relationships within the triathlon community, including volunteers.§The successful candidate will be tertiary qualified, with senior experience within the sporting or event management industry, and the ability to strategically navigate the complexities of the local and national sporting landscape. The person must be decisive and tenacious with a demonstrated commitment to delivering both growth and a member service support focus which is built on inclusivity and camaraderie. Experience within not for profit and/or membership based organisations would be an advantage.§This is a unique opportunity to lead and grow a healthy and evolving sport organisation and would suit a candidate who has previous business leadership experience or a senior manager ready for the next step into this ‘hands-on’ leadership role. If you are looking for an exciting new challenge in your career then apply now!§Candidates wishing to be considered for this role should first read the position description and selection criteria and complete the §compulsory Sportspeople Recruitment Application Form§ at §sportspeoplerecruitment.com/jobs§ prior to applying.§Please apply via the Sportspeople Recruitment website.§§§§

jobTitle: Physical Training Instructor Job in Perth - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50663507.txt	§Physical Training Instructor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Physical Training Instructor§§Advertiser: §Defence Force Recruiting Western Region§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Salary§§$65,000 - $69,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Physical Training Instructor §      §        §Your role: §        §We’re on the lookout for people who are at the peak of their physical fitness—those who want to have a positive influence on Air Force personnel to ensure they are  physically and mentally prepared at all times  in the defence of our country. PTIs are the Air Force's specialists when it comes to exploiting the full human potential of its workforce. If you have a degree qualification, industry experience and a passion for developing higher level human performance, then the Physical Training Instructor role might be for you.§        § §        §Being a PTI is one of the more physically demanding and rewarding roles of the military—ideal for those who are already involved in high performance strength and  conditioning training, elite sports, or high level human performance coaching.§        § §        §An Air Force PTI is more than just a job, it’s a vocation and a way of life. Some typical tasks you can expect as part of your PTI duties include:§        § §        §•           Rehabilitation and injury prevention programs§        §•           High-performance physical strength, conditioning and fitness assessments§        §•           Physical wellness, mental wellness and resilience education§        §•           Development and delivery of physical training, recreational and sporting activities§        §•           Adventurous training (abseiling, climbing etc) activities§        §•           Delivery of non-lethal use of force training (unarmed combat)§        § §        §Life in the Air Force: §        §There’s no career that compares to one in the Air Force. Become a part of a world-class military force that operates some of the most advanced aircraft and defence technology in the world. You can expect to work in a uniquely challenging yet highly rewarding working environment that comes with good work/life balance, competitive salary and skills for life. There’s also a sense of accomplishment and pride from serving your country and helping to keep our airspace safe.§        § §        §Life in the Air Force is anything but mundane. You’ll enjoy an exciting lifestyle, rewarding career, opportunities to travel, excellent social and fitness facilities, and free medical and dental; all in a dynamic and fulfilling working environment.§        § §        §Salary: §        §Get paid while you contextualise and further develop your current knowledge, skills and experiences in becoming a fully qualified Physical Training Instructor. Upon completion of a workplace training and assessment journal, you’ll enjoy a competitive starting salary package of: $68,626 plus generous super (salaries correct as of 01/08/2019).§        § §        §Apply Now: §        §For this role, you must be over 17 at time of enlistment, an Australian Citizen and have passed Year 10 English and Maths You must also have completed a Bachelor’s Degree in Health Science (Fitness or Exercise), Sport Science/Coaching (Strength and Conditioning) or similar. Refer to the link below for more information on accepted degrees. You will also need two years relevant industry experience within the last five years.§        § §        §Click the APPLY button if you think you have what it takes to become an Air Force Physical Training Instructor and we’ll get in contact with you shortly.§        §You can also visit the link below to view the full position description and learn more about life in the Air Force.§        §https://www.defencejobs.gov.au/jobs/air-force/physical-training-instructor§        § §      §    §    §  §§§Your role: § §We’re on the lookout for people who are at the peak of their physical fitness—those who want to have a positive influence on Air Force personnel to ensure they are  physically and mentally prepared at all times  in the defence of our country. PTIs are the Air Force's specialists when it comes to exploiting the full human potential of its workforce. If you have a degree qualification, industry experience and a passion for developing higher level human performance, then the Physical Training Instructor role might be for you.§ § § §Being a PTI is one of the more physically demanding and rewarding roles of the military—ideal for those who are already involved in high performance strength and  conditioning training, elite sports, or high level human performance coaching.§ § § §An Air Force PTI is more than just a job, it’s a vocation and a way of life. Some typical tasks you can expect as part of your PTI duties include:§ § § §•           Rehabilitation and injury prevention programs§ §•           High-performance physical strength, conditioning and fitness assessments§ §•           Physical wellness, mental wellness and resilience education§ §•           Development and delivery of physical training, recreational and sporting activities§ §•           Adventurous training (abseiling, climbing etc) activities§ §•           Delivery of non-lethal use of force training (unarmed combat)§ § § §Life in the Air Force: § §There’s no career that compares to one in the Air Force. Become a part of a world-class military force that operates some of the most advanced aircraft and defence technology in the world. You can expect to work in a uniquely challenging yet highly rewarding working environment that comes with good work/life balance, competitive salary and skills for life. There’s also a sense of accomplishment and pride from serving your country and helping to keep our airspace safe.§ § § §Life in the Air Force is anything but mundane. You’ll enjoy an exciting lifestyle, rewarding career, opportunities to travel, excellent social and fitness facilities, and free medical and dental; all in a dynamic and fulfilling working environment.§ § § §Salary: § §Get paid while you contextualise and further develop your current knowledge, skills and experiences in becoming a fully qualified Physical Training Instructor. Upon completion of a workplace training and assessment journal, you’ll enjoy a competitive starting salary package of: $68,626 plus generous super (salaries correct as of 01/08/2019).§ § § §Apply Now: § §For this role, you must be over 17 at time of enlistment, an Australian Citizen and have passed Year 10 English and Maths You must also have completed a Bachelor’s Degree in Health Science (Fitness or Exercise), Sport Science/Coaching (Strength and Conditioning) or similar. Refer to the link below for more information on accepted degrees. You will also need two years relevant industry experience within the last five years.§ § § §Click the APPLY button if you think you have what it takes to become an Air Force Physical Training Instructor and we’ll get in contact with you shortly.§ §You can also visit the link below to view the full position description and learn more about life in the Air Force.§ §https://www.defencejobs.gov.au/jobs/air-force/physical-training-instructor§ § §§§§

jobTitle: Surf Academy Manager Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50709815.txt	§Surf Academy Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Surf Academy Manager§§Advertiser: §URBNSURF§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §Northern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§About the business§The URBNSURF Mission is to build and operate world-class surf parks in Australia that deliver high quality man-made waves and authentic surfing experiences to new and existing surfers of all ages, experience and ability.§Our strategic intent is for the Surf Academy to be commercially successful and be seen as the market leader in the creation of authentic surf experiences.§ §About the role§Within this context, the §Surf School Academy §will contribute to the strategic intent by focusing on §sourcing and developing talent to deliver fun and interactive surf lessons, ensuring Guests continuously improve their surfing abilities.  §Within this context, the §Surf School Academy §will contribute to the strategic intent by focusing on §sourcing and developing talent to deliver fun and interactive surf lessons, ensuring Guests continuously improve their surfing abilities.  §Some of the accountabilities include; §Design custom URBNSURF lesson programs and packages that encompass all facets of surf progression from beginner to advanced.§Leading a team to deliver a range of surf programs and lessons from beginner to advanced.§Recruit, train and roster staff. Undertake basic payroll and roster management meeting variable demands. Provide regular training sessions to ensure all surf coaches continuously improve their training methods.§Provide advice, coaching, feedback and support to Surf Coaches to effectively manage the performance and development needs of the URBNSURF Surf Academy. This may include providing advice or attendance in performance management meetings with team members and/or paired with appropriate performance and development plans.§Set guest services standards, measure guest service perception monthly and create staff training programs to proactively improve any deficiencies.§Work Duty Manager shifts where the applicant will be responsible for all incidents and operational efficiencies within URBNSURF Melbourne. The Duty Manager shifts will be rotated between all URBNSURF Melbourne managers.§ §Benefits and perks§URBNSURF Melbourne is Australia's first surf park§URBNSURF has projects in Melbourne and Sydney with plans to develop further locations across Australia in the next few years.§Extensive opportunities to #surfmore§ §Skills and experience§Experience with managing and developing team members§Customer-centric§Safety focused§Leadership skills§Adaptable§Organised/structured§Ability to motivate a team§Accountable§Critical Thinker§Committed§Proficient in Microsoft products§Superior fluency in spoken and written English, particularly with respect to business report writing.§Successful applicants will be required to (if you do not hold it already) a:§Working with Children Check§Surfing Victoria level 1 coach certification§This is a full-time role and permanent residency is essential.§ §How to apply§Please click apply and upload your resume and qualifications with your application. §Only successful candidates will be contacted. Applications close Sunday 18th October. §For further information on URBNSURF or any other job opportunities please visit our website §www.urbnsurf.com.§ §URBNSURF has developed a COVIDSafe plan in collaboration with external government agencies to ensure we cover OHS/WHS regulations to provide a safe environment for guests and staff. § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have customer service experience?§Do you have experience in a sales role?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§
