You would be required to work across a 7 day roster and be available for weekend shifts.§The starting salary for this role is $66,660 (Grade E, Step 1) p/a plus 9.5% Super.§Key responsibilities of this position include but are not limited to:§•Promote teamwork and communication through the management of day-to-day and ongoing staffing levels, allocation of duties and breaks, etc.§•Supervise and train Leisure & Aquatic staff§•Ensure consistent high levels of cleanliness, hygiene, safety, maintenance and security within the Centres and their surrounds§•Deliver high levels of customer service to all customers, including effectively dealing with customer suggestions and/or complaints§•Manage any emergency situations.§This position requires an individual who possesses:§•TAFE Statement of Attainment Pool Operations and Supervision (or equivalent from Royal Life Saving)§•Current RLSSA Pool Lifeguard Award/Certificate§•Current Senior First Aid Certificate§•Experience in the effective operation of Leisure & Aquatic Centres and associated facilities§•Demonstrated knowledge of pool plant and equipment use and maintenance§•Demonstrated knowledge of aquatic industry standards, especially regarding pool supervision, water quality and the safe handling and storage of chemicals.§What’s in for you?§• 12 month contract role until September 2021§• Flexible work practices§• Attractive Remuneration Package on offer§• Access to health and wellbeing programs§How to apply:§Applications must be submitted online by clicking the 'Apply' button below and creating a login using your email address. CBCity currently has a vacancy for an experienced Duty Manager within our growing team.§This is a temporary full time contract for up to 12 months. (September 2021)§The primary role of the Duty Manager is to contribute to the safe, efficient and effective management and operations of Council’s Leisure and Aquatic Centres in accordance with Council’s policies, the requirements of the public, and industry standards.§We currently have a vacancy at the Birrong Leisure and Aquatic Centre. You would be required to work across a 7 day roster and be available for weekend shifts.§The starting salary for this role is $66,660 (Grade E, Step 1) p/a plus 9.5% Super.§Key responsibilities of this position include but are not limited to:§•Promote teamwork and communication through the management of day-to-day and ongoing staffing levels, allocation of duties and breaks, etc.§•Supervise and train Leisure & Aquatic staff§•Ensure consistent high levels of cleanliness, hygiene, safety, maintenance and security within the Centres and their surrounds§•Deliver high levels of customer service to all customers, including effectively dealing with customer suggestions and/or complaints§•Manage any emergency situations.§This position requires an individual who possesses:§•TAFE Statement of Attainment Pool Operations and Supervision (or equivalent from Royal Life Saving)§•Current RLSSA Pool Lifeguard Award/Certificate§•Current Senior First Aid Certificate§•Experience in the effective operation of Leisure & Aquatic Centres and associated facilities§•Demonstrated knowledge of pool plant and equipment use and maintenance§•Demonstrated knowledge of aquatic industry standards, especially regarding pool supervision, water quality and the safe handling and storage of chemicals.§What’s in for you?§• 12 month contract role until September 2021§• Flexible work practices§• Attractive Remuneration Package on offer§• Access to health and wellbeing programs§How to apply:§Applications must be submitted online by clicking the 'Apply' button below and creating a login using your email address. When submitting your application, make sure to address the Essential Criteria mentioned in the below Position Description in your covering letter. To apply you must address the Essential and Desirable criteria in the position description§Applications close at §11:59pm, Friday 25 September 2020.§Successful applicants may be required to undertake a Criminal History Check, Medical and/or Working with Children check in accordance with the position.§For more information, please contact §Ellisa Mamas§ (Team Leader Swim School & Birrong Leisure Centre) on §02 9707 9296§.§Canterbury Bankstown Council prides itself on being a workplace that actively seeks to include, welcome and value unique contributions of all people. We encourage people with a disability or culturally diverse backgrounds to apply.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Gymnastics Coach Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50694876.txt	§Gymnastics Coach§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Gymnastics Coach§§Advertiser: §YMCA of Brisbane§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §Bayside & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Gymnastics Coach §      § The YMCA is one of Brisbane's most recognisable customer-focused community organisations, providing opportunities for all people to grow in body, mind and spirit. The organisation operates a number of services including child care, health and fitness, hospitality and a hotel, education and training, outdoor education and camping, accommodation and benevolent activities including the YMCA Vocational School and the Schools' Breakfast program. §      §        §The YMCA operates a number of services including Child Care, health and fitness, education and training, outdoor education and camping, accommodation and hospitality along with benevolent activities including the YMCA Vocational School and the Schools' Breakfast program.§        § §        §ABOUT US§        §The YMCA§ is one of the largest providers of sport and recreation in Queensland. jobText: TXT/50599160.txt	§ATTN Personal Trainers - CLIENTS WAITING FOR YOU§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§ATTN Personal Trainers - CLIENTS WAITING FOR YOU§§Advertiser: §HealthyPeople§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§The days of paying rent, having no career growth and even less career support ARE OVER!§ § §NO SALES REQUIRED§ §Clients waiting for you§ §Earn $40.50-$67.50 per session§ §Your own dedicated mentor§ §The industry is changing and we're leading from the front. §  §Keen to actually make a difference? Join an organisation dedicated to sustainably changing the lives of our clients and our TRAINERS.§  §At §Get Going§ we are on the same team, no rental contracts and no sales. What do we ask? For you to focus on what you actually got into the industry for. TO HELP PEOPLE!§  §If you're just starting out as a PT and looking for a great place to learn and grow, come join our proud team at Get Going Personal Training! If you've been in the industry for a while, stop stressing about maintaining leads and clients and join a professional team.§  §Get out of the cutthroat environment of lead generation.§  §We'll provide you with the tools you need to build your client books to 30+ clients comfortably and quickly.§  §We Offer:§ § §4-Weeks training and mentoring.§ §Ongoing support and learning through individualized business coaching§ §Weekly meetings with your team.§ §Help to build clientele as quickly as YOUR POTENTIAL ALLOWS.§ §Opportunities to grow into higher positions within the organisation§ §An environment where you work together with your peers, not against. § §Your Role:§  §As a Mobile (Home) Personal Trainer, you will be one of our home training specialists, providing training programming, implementation and advice!§ § §Look after your own clientele § §Manage your own database and accounts§ §Continuous learning and development§ §Do I need to be based in the location advertised to apply for this role?§  §Absolutely not! You can be located anywhere in AUSTRALIA§  §Is there room to progress with Get Going? §  §Of course! We are a rapidly expanding young business, growing 200% in the last 12 months! With this growth, comes more responsibility - therefore opportunity!§  §I know there are no rental charges, but are there any upfront costs with Get Going? §  §No. Get Going is paving a new path for trainers looking to break into this competitive industry. We believe that providing the right environment starts with education, support and practice!§  §What makes Get Going a better place to work than its competitors? §  §We aren't your average gym, we aren't your average studio and we sure as F*&! aren't your average mobile PT company! §  §You'll have to find out for yourself.§  §Requirements:§ § §Certificate IV in Health & Fitness (Personal Training)§ §Reliable car§ §First Aid and CPR§ §Generous availability§ §Positive attitude§ §Enthusiasm & self-motivation§ §Apply Now!§  §Send us your resume, cover letter and a bit about yourself via the APPLY button.§  §Or email Info@getgoingpt.com.au§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Exercise Physiologist Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50543619.txt	§Exercise Physiologist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Exercise Physiologist§§Advertiser: §Belgravia Health & Leisure Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§NSW, Ian Thorpe Aquatic Centre - Sydney 2007§ §Are you a people-person with a strong background in patient care?§Can you help people understand how exercise assists their health?§Do you have experience in gyms, medical centres, hospitals, sports medicine research or professional sport?§Are you an allied health professional, who is able to build strong §professional relationships with clients§, §GPs, nurses, and other specialists?§Do you love finding workable solutions for a range of people across the community including those on the National Insurance Disability Scheme?§§ §About the role§ §We are looking for a part time Exercise Physiologist to offer members with a range of clinical exercise interventions including health and physical activity education, advice and lifestyle modification. Located at the Ian Thorpe Aquatic Centre in Ultimo, the role calls for liaising with a diverse community including school and university students, inner city dwellers, people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, and those aged over 55. We also work in partnership with a range of community organisations intent on helping people see exercise and leisure as a means of restorative physical and mental health.§ §If you are able to develop safe, effective and individualised exercise programs based on a patient’s medical history, and work across a range age groups, fitness levels, and needs we’d love to hear from you. Key to the role is also the ability to visit other allied health professionals to promote the Centre’s programs, and prepare and distribute weekly reports to government bodies and insurance agencies.§ § §What we are looking for in our ideal candidates:§Sound experience in patient care and ideally in gyms, medical centres, hospitals, sports medicine research or professional sport§2 years of clinical experience§Bachelor of Science, Bachelor of Exercise and Sports Science, or Bachelor of Applied Science§Exercise & Sports Science Australia (ESSA) Accreditation§Current First Aid & CPR Certificate, Working with Children Check, and National Police Check.§Understanding of how exercise assists the musculoskeletal, cardiovascular and endrocrine systems§Knowledge of biomechanics, physiology, psychology and nutrition§Ability to conduct and develop health and physical assessments, programs and treatment plans including exercise prescription and patient reviews / follow-ups§Excellent communication and interpersonal skills§Ability to build professional relationships with clients, GPs, nurses, specialists and other allied health professionals§Ability to act with courtesy, professionalism and across the community§Flexibility, adaptability and skill in relating to customer concerns§Reliability, punctuality and excellent standards of personal grooming§Proven track record of sustaining busy caseloads.§ § §This is a permanent part-time role that is guaranteed for 10 hours a week, and additional remuneration for sessions beyond this.  There is also the potential for these minimum weekly hours to increase over time.§ §If this position is of interest to you, click on the "Apply" button to submit your application.§Ultimo 2007 NSW§§§§

jobText: TXT/50539474.txt	§Club Manager Anytime Fitness Wentworthville§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Club Manager Anytime Fitness Wentworthville§§Advertiser: §Anytime Fitness§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §Parramatta & Western Suburbs§§Salary§§$70,000 - $84,999 base plus commission§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§Anytime Fitness is Australia's fastest growing 24/7 fitness club network; with over 500 clubs in Australia and over 4500 worldwide.§  §The successful applicant must be passionate about the health and fitness industry, highly motivated and driven to excel, be enthusiastic with lots of energy, be able to manage a team, take control of the clubs day to day operations, be able to prioritise and multi-task, have excellent time management and organisational skills, prior experience in sales, customer service and complaints handling. We are searching for an experienced Club Manager who is willing to grow with our team and continue the amazing growth of the Anytime Fitness Wentworthville club.§  §Your talent will shine, driving membership sales, club culture and personal training, whilst enhancing the community atmosphere and member experience. § §If you want to learn about cutting edge business practices and develop your business and management skills further, then we are the right place for you!§  §The role requires the successful applicant to be available for shifts Monday to Thursday 10.00 am - 7.00pm and Fridays 9.00am - 4.00pm.§ §As the Club Manager you'll be required to:§ § §Meet and greet potential and existing members;§ §Managing everyday club operations;§ §Achieve KPIs and sales targets;§ §Manage and motivate your team;§ §Create a great club culture;§ §Maintain the cleanliness of the club;§ §Create Anytime Fitness brand awareness within the local community;§ §Develop and implement marketing and sales plans.§ § §To succeed in the role you will need to be:§ § §Results-driven, a problem solver and confident to work autonomously;§ §Well presented, enthusiastic and self-motivated;§ §Passionate about health and fitness;§ §Exceptional at communicating both written and verbal;§ §Great with people and have exceptional customer service skills;§ §Highly organised and have a high level of attention to detail;§ §Excellent with computer-related and administrative tasks;§ §Professional in your approach to work and the ability to be self-driven;§ §Experienced in a management and/or sales role within the fitness industry (preferred but not essential).§ § §What's in it for you?§An attractive remuneration package, including a base + commissions, will be offered to the successful applicant and ongoing support and training will be provided as well as great opportunities to work in a growing organisation.  § §To apply:§Please apply online only, outlining your availability to start as well as your current resume. Please do not contact the club directly, we will only be reviewing applications online.§  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have experience in a sales role?§Do you have customer service experience?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§Do you have experience working towards targets and KPIs?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Lifeguard Job in Far West & North Central NSW - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50592952.txt	§Lifeguard§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lifeguard§§Advertiser: §YMCA§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Far West & North Central NSW§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Other§§§§§§ §Fun working environment§ §Make an impact in your local community§ §Kick start your career with the Y§ § §Our Recreation Team is a close-knit community of energetic people-people, with a passion for staying active and helping others. From our Duty Managers and Customer Service Officers, to our Instructors and Coordinators, the team are responsible for transforming our 22 Recreation Centres into warm, inclusive and safe spaces – providing access to health, fitness and recreation opportunities for those who need it most. As part of The Y family, you’ll be responsible for the care and wellbeing of vulnerable and underprivileged young people, always acting with integrity and respect to provide fun and meaningful experiences, safely. We’ll reward you with perks like flexible hours and free facility membership, and support you to build valuable people, leadership and life skills – all while you make a difference to your community.§ §Guard the livelihood of strong communities.§ §As a Lifeguard with The Y, you understand that safety and fun go hand-in-hand. Our pools and recreation facilities are invaluable, inclusive, exciting spaces for sporty types – especially young people. But, they can’t exist if they aren’t safe. Which is exactly where you come in. You’ll join a team of responsible, approachable, confident swimmers in supervising our pools and surrounding areas. Together, you’ll uphold the highest standards of care and safety to make sure our swimmers have fun, stay active and gain confidence in the water.§ §If you’re a people person with a keen eye for detail and who thrives under pressure, you could be our next Lifeguard. If so, expect perks like flexible hours and free facility membership, and the support to build valuable people, leadership and life skills – all while you make a difference to your community.§ § §Qualifications*§ § §Current Lifeguard Qualification§ §Working with Children Check§ §Police Check§ §First Aid Certificate§ §CPR Certificate§ § §*Qualifications up for renewal? Let us know, we could help.§ §Y work with us?§ § §Work within a supportive team environment§ §Room to learn and develop within the organisation§ §Flexible hours and arrangements, for a work-life balance that works for you§ §Awesome discounts on The Y services and products§ §Corporate health insurance cover to keep you healthy§ §§Who What Y?§The Y NSW is a profit-for-purpose organisation focused on healthy living, social impact and empowering young people. We operate 22 recreation centres, 63 out-of-school-hours care services, and two camping locations which employ 1,800 staff across NSW –  and fund our diverse range of enriching community programs.§We believe in building a diverse, inclusive workforce that reflects the communities we serve. We encourage people of all genders, ages, religions, disability, sexual orientation, family and caring responsibilities and cultures, including people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander heritage, to apply.§Commitment to Safeguarding§The Y, including Boards of Directors, is committed to the safety and wellbeing of children and young people in accordance with our Safeguarding Children and Young People framework. The Y requires that all applicants undergo satisfactory screening prior to commencement, including but not limited to:§ §a national criminal history check;§ §an international criminal history check where applicants have worked overseas;§ §holding or obtaining a Working with Children Clearance/equivalent in accordance with state/ territory laws;§ §two reference checks.§ § §Please note, the results of any National and International Police Check will only be used to assess your suitability to perform the role.§ §Any successfully appointed applicant will be required to adhere to the Safeguarding Children and Young People framework, which includes a thorough safeguarding children and young people induction and committing to upholding the safety and wellbeing of children and young people throughout their engagement with YMCA.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Knox offers excellent professional development opportunities and benefits to its passionate team of teachers and support staff.§  §ABOUT THE ROLE§  §An opportunity has arisen at Knox Grammar School for an experienced qualified Dance Coach to instruct Year 7-12 students in a dance sport program with focus on skill and technique progression across the range of dance forms, including Classical Ballet, Contemporary, Jazz, Tap and Hip Hop.§  §The Dance Coach will also assist with the choreography of all School musical theatre productions for Years K–12 and associated dance ensembles. §  §The successful candidate will be required to work afternoons, some evenings and weekends for sports training, rehearsals and performances.§  § §  §HOW TO APPLY§  §Before applying, please read the comprehensive role description found on website §www.knox.nsw.edu.au/employment§.§  §Please apply via SEEK by clicking the ‘Apply for this Job’ button and attaching a current CV and covering letter outlining your suitability for the role.§  § §  §CLOSING DATE FOR APPLICATIONS§4.00pm, Monday 12 October, 2020§  § §  §Successful applicants will be required to provide the School with a current NSW Working with Children Check number and comply with the requirements of the NSW Institute of Teachers Act.§  §www.knox.nsw.edu.au/employment§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§§§

jobText: TXT/50551818.txt	§BJJ trainer wanted (St George area)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§BJJ trainer wanted (St George area)§§Advertiser: §HealthyPeople§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §Southern Suburbs & Sutherland Shire§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§About Kaizen Gym§ §We are a boutique training centre located in the St George area. We strive to bring the most effective and innovative fitness and martial arts programming available to deliver our members results. The Gym is equipped with a fully matted upstairs grappling room, boxing ring and designated fitness area with the latest equipment. We currently offer programs in self-defence, Muay thai and functional fitness. We are now looking to add Brazilian Jiu Jitsu as a core offering. § §Find out more about us:§ §Website - www.kaizengym.com.au§ §Instagram - @kaizengymsydney§ §Facebook - www.facebook.com/kaizen.gym.sydney§ §The Opportunity§ §Your role will be run and manage the adults training program and assist the kids class. You will work to set an example in the school in terms of attitude, behaviour and will act as a role model for all students. Your role will also be responsible to develop a team (kids, adults and athletes) with a view of making the club a leading team competitor across NSW, Australia and the global stage. § §Your Role§ § §BJJ experience essential (purple belt or higher)§ §First aid course completed and up to date§ §Working with children check§ §To assist in creating a unique BJJ program§ §Healthy, fit and the ability to work in a high-paced fitness environment § §Experience / ability to work with a range of students from adults, kids, juniors through to competitors / fighters§ §Excellent communication, relationship development and administration skills§ §Dependable, reliable, approachable and able to multi-task§ §The Rewards§ §This is a contract role so remuneration will be an hourly rate with uniform allowance and free access to other programs and facilities. You will get further opportunities to generate extra income through private training as well as seminars and workshops and competition training. As the role develops there is also the possibility of the role expanding.§§§§

jobTitle: Centre Manager - Gymnastics & Swim Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50600034.txt	§Centre Manager - Gymnastics & Swim§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Centre Manager - Gymnastics & Swim§§Advertiser: §Belgravia Health & Leisure Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §Bayside & South Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§ §The Company§ §BK Gym§ is the latest venture for the Belgravia Group and the realisation of a clear goal from Belgravia founder, CEO and Chair, Geoff Lord:§ §"§To positively impact the lives of a million Australian Children§§each year through physical activity". § § §Over recent years, a more sedentary lifestyle and significant population growth in our major cities have led to a rise in obesity and a worrying lack of basic physical skills. The result is that today’s kids may be the first generation with a shorter life expectancy than their parents.§ §BK facilities and programs will be tailored to the needs of the communities in which they are located and will include gymnastics facilities for ‘Learn to Move’ programs and swim centres for ‘Learn to Swim’ programs. They will focus particularly on programs for children aged between 1 and 12 years old, but can be expanded to encompass a wide range of other activities, depending on the specific community needs.§ §The Gymnastics programs will provide the foundation of this physical literacy and, with a customised facility model and authentic gymnastics programs including Kinder Gym, Gym Fun, Gym Skills and FreeG Kids, and Australian Levels Programs for Men’s and Women’s Artistic Gymnastics.§  §The Centres§ §While we have established BK Gyms and BK Gym & Swims in Hoppers Crossing, §Noble Park§, Craigieburn and Cheltenham, we geared up to grow even more nationally. At our BK centres, customers will experience a friendly and warm atmosphere with coaches that will guide and encourage them.§ §Centre Manager§ §The §Centre Manager§ will play a key leadership role within the §BK Gym & Swim Noble Park§ team, with key accountabilities attributed to the two key areas of the facility; gymnastics and swimming lessons. The role will primarily revolve around the acquisition of new enrolments into the aforementioned programs and secondly retention via the customer experience pathway.§ §The Centre Manager will need to achieve membership sales targets and to meet the financial requirements of the business. Maintain and track daily and weekly sales activity through the recording of stats in line with the KPIs. Implement and maintain facility administration including point of sales, weekly banking, reconciliation reporting and accounts payable & receivable for financial reporting to the Head Office.§ §The role will also include administration of the Gymnastics program through the support of its program leaders, as well as the customer service team.§ §The role will provide leadership to the Aquatic Program Manager.§ §Key accountabilities§Provide leadership and support to the Customer Service, Aquatics  & Gymnastics teams§Work closely with the state marketing team and where required, develop and administrate facility marketing and communications strategies (including social media, eDM & website platforms)§Achieve sales targets and ensure reporting is completed accurately§Grow the membership base levels by agreed growth target through implementation of effective sales systems and strategies§Achieve trackable increase in sales through effective marketing campaigns via web social media, local print media, outreach and internal advertising§Ensure that operations under the position’s control are conducted in a safe  manner within legislative guideline§ §ESSENTIAL:§Current First Aid (Level 2)§Current CPR Certificate§Working With Children Check (or equivalent)§National Police Check§Ability to interpret and report on numerical data§Previous sales and marketing experience§Leadership skills§DESIRABLE:§Previous experience in a sales-based position§Previous experience in a similar position within the health & fitness industry§Previous experience in programs such as gymnastics or swimming lessons§Previous experience leading teams§ §Simply complete the application process by clicking the Apply Now button and we’ll be in touch.§Noble Park 3174 VIC§§§§

jobTitle: Dance Studio Concierge Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50572761.txt	§Dance Studio Concierge§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Dance Studio Concierge§§Advertiser: §Base181 Studios§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §North West & Hills District§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§At Base181 Studios it's our mission for each student to "Believe in their flyness and conquer their shyness.”§ § § §Purpose of Base181 Studios§ §We seek to inspire individuals to raise up in bravery, boldness and brilliance. Bringing creatives together who uplift and support eachother to recognise their greatness within. § §It's our understanding that each dancer is different and we set out to nurture each students journey striving for growth and empowerment in both team and personal fulfilment. § §We strive to create a positive and safe place for connection and creativity producing excellence in professional dance education with a focus on the social aspect as our vessel in assisting confident ambitious leaders into our community. § §At Base181 Studios we see the value in everyone, it is always child before dancer and confidence before choreography. § §It's more than dance - it's a tribe, it's a culture. § § § §Purpose of the Studio Concierge§ §We are looking for an exceptional and committed Studio Concierge who is passionate about building relationships and positively affecting people’s lives. Someone who is responsible, extremely reliable and organised, has good leadership skills and experience, is self motivated, an outstanding communicator and a dedicated team player.§ §You will support the Director’s vision for the Company by ensuring the day to day running of the studio is on track and running smoothly by providing excellent customer experience, ensuring projects are running efficiently and on time, and communicate with the whole team to ensure cohesive full team buy in on all projects.§ § § §Main areas of Responsibility § § §Operate & manage the email inbox and respond in a friendly & appropriately timed manner, communicating with a positive warmth. § §Delight our families & exceed expectations with above & beyond service & communication. Your warm, relaxed inviting tone makes everyone immediately feel calm & at ease. § §Leading and managing our culture committee, including innovatively improving systems & procedures, managing schedules and collecting resources while delivering clear and concise directions to lead the team in successful completion of projects. § §Liaise with the Chief of Operations & Systems & the Enrolment Guidance Guru to ensure all onboarding of students is seamless and up to date. Maintenance and overseeing implementation of current and new onboarding strategies as well as monitoring both enrolments and retention and developing systems to improve both. This may include regular meetings. § §Oversee the day to day running of the studio and ensure there are no loose ends assisting the Directors with new and current projects.§ §Liaise with the Directors and team to ensure the company moves as a whole towards goals and targets. § §Update & maintain the company handbook & training manuals including ethos, values and procedures.§ §Ensure the full team understands what their part is and has access to the information they need. § §Assist during student promotional intakes.§ §Manage business social media accounts. § §Keep the studio calendar up to date & accurate on a daily basis. § §Product research, new product introduction and roll out.§ § § §Outcomes and how your success will be measured: §  § § §In this role you will report directly to the Chief of Systems & Operations and work closely with the Enrolment Guidance Guru and Culture Committee to ensure all internal operations run smoothly and to schedule. This includes; § §Attending regular in person or online meetings to pass on key messaging and maintain momentum and detailed precision across all Company projects.§ §Embodiment of our values with a strong desire to push our studio mission daily. § §Surprise our clients and exceed their expectations with above and beyond service and communication.§ §Nurture and encourage our team and promote growth and consistent inclusive teamwork.§ §Work with Marketing to ensure internal & external messaging is backed up with internal organisation.§ §General Studio Management with a positive and energetic disposition achieving on time results and innovation across main areas of responsibility above.§ § § §Attributes to Success§ §We are seeking a leader who thrives on seeing their whole team succeed, who will roll up their sleeves and jump in wholeheartedly always striving for excellence. To be successful in this role you must demonstrate that you have:§ § § §A true desire to serve. § §​Supporting our purpose and helping people feel better about themselves through more confidence and a sense of belonging. Your role is an essential part of the experience as you will ensure all systems and procedures keep this at their core as well as making this experience a priority on every client's visit§ § § §You understand that service, clients and their care are of highest priority.§ §You always want people no matter who they are  to have the best experience and to feel welcomed and included. This includes anticipating their needs and bringing loads of magical wow moments to each client’s experience both directly with you and with each team member. We aim to have our clients leave with their head held higher, their hearts fuller and a big smile on their face.§ § § §A great team player. § §I​t is of utmost importance to us that our team thrives as a whole. We strongly believe that "Alone we can do so little, together we can so much - and have more fun! § §It is essential that our team members work well autonomously and as a cohesive team with a great understanding of the overall why and purpose behind everything we do. Working as a team to us means being transparent, supportive, inclusive, positive, and acting with integrity to put the good of the company and whole team at the centre of all conversations with a focus on resolutions not problems. Respectful heated discussions are common and expected as our team of passionate people strive for excellence.§ § § §Fantastic communication skills. ​§ §You hold maintaining relationships and keeping in contact with people as a high priority. You have a focus on clear, transparent communication with an outlook always to find a positive solution for any issues in a timely manner. You take personal responsibility for your actions and pride yourself on your integrity. You are kind, enthusiastic and inclusive, exuding warmth and enjoy connecting with people. Our greatest measure of success is attracting the right kind of people and retaining them and you understand that preserving and cherishing the relationships we have with our clients and team is top priority.§ § § §Initiative. § §Y​ou have a great ability to think outside the box and figure things out to creatively solve problems independently. In a small business, we must act swiftly and address challenges head on. Your ability to think and act quickly to get back on track, or better still onto an improved track, is essential.§ § § §Good tech skills. § §Y​ou will need to be able to get across a variety of platforms quickly including organisational app’s ASANA, CRM Dance software, Mailchimp email marketing software and Google Drive. We are always looking at improving how we use these platforms and to find options which may work better for us.§ § § §An eye for detail and a love of organisation. § §Y​ou will be responsible for developing and maintaining company handbooks, procedures and systems to ensure every detail of the company runs seamlessly. You will create and replicate daily, weekly, monthly and termly procedures to keep the team on track with the bigger picture goals. You will need to be able to change course and work quickly when curveballs are thrown your way to ensure the company is consistent in delivering. § § § §A passion for excellence. § §Y​ou go above and beyond on tasks and hold yourself to a high standard of excellence. You are able to identify gaps and act quickly to resolve them.§ § § §Adaptable. You're a unicorn§ §Ability to prioritise and get things done. W​hen running a small business priorities change all the time. We need someone who is able to keep an eye on the big picture while creating order from chaos to ensure that we deliver consistency and excellence. You are a powerful planner and super productive. § § § §Genuine drive & Dedication to growth§ §Fast on the job learner. A​s things can quickly change in a small business and it’s often all hands on deck, it’s important that you are able to learn new skills on the go to help fill gaps as needed. We hold attributes like initiative, planning, punctuality, being a team player, passion, self motivation, genuine warmth and care for people and a sense of responsibility above knowing every piece of information or skill you might need, these can be learned.§ § § §A passion for the arts and people. § §A​s we are a dance school a passion for the arts, culture and most importantly people is essential.§ § § §Details § § § §Start date: October§ § § §Location: Rouse Hill§ § § §Rate: Dependent on experience § § § §Type of Employment: Casual § § § §Weekdays: 3.00 PM - 8.00 PM § §Saturday 9.00 AM - 12.00 PM§ § § §Essentials § §Current working with Children's Check or willing to gain one. § §Current Drivers License and access to a car. § § § § § §Base181 Studios have been empowering students through dance to "Believe in their flyness and conquer their shyness."§ §We’re looking for a long term team member to grow with us and create growth within the company. The role is a casual position but can move to more hours with the right person. Opportunities for growth are available depending on performance and results. § § § §To be a successful applicant experience in leading a team and management is essential. This role includes some on the floor admin/reception/sales work at the front desk. An Arts Management degree would be a plus but not essential. If this feels like an opportunity that would bring you happiness, fulfillment and growth, please complete the following steps.§ § § §To apply for this role, complete the application found at this link, § §https://forms.gle/mR78asxnFzfSefwJ9§ § § §Record a two-minute video introducing yourself and sharing what most excites you about this role. Insert the link as per instructions into the Google Forms Application. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§§§

§Swimming Teachers §      §        §ABOUT THE Y§        §YMCA is a community not-for-profit like no other.§        §The Y creates opportunities for people and communities to connect with a better jobTitle: Swim Coach! Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50526986.txt	§Swim Coach!§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Swim Coach!§§Advertiser: §Hampton Swim School Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§Hampton Swim School is a permanent establishment in Morningside, catering for hundreds of students per week, our workplace is a vibrant and energetic atmosphere, and our philosophy is §NURTURE ACHIEVE§ and §CELEBRATE§ with our swimmers.  Our program is all about §FUN, FITNESS§ and §RECREATION§, with a little friendly competition.§ §An exciting new opportunity now exists for an experienced and qualified coach to take the lead of our squad program TEAM ACCELERATE.  We are seeking enthusiastic mature applicants for this role, and have a year round long term position in our heated facility available for a committed and dedicated candidate. § §TEAM ACCELERATE is the swim squad program designed to keep kids swimming after learn to swim because swimming is FUN.  They may swim for the FUN only, or for the FITNESS to compliment their other sport or they may swim to be FAST and win races!  Our program welcomes and caters to all swimmers, whether they wish to compete or not, and requires a Coach who is:§ §* Prepared to set achievable enjoyable swim sets including fun skills and drills activities based sets combined with endurance based lap sets, developing a reusable program along the way. § §* Able and willing to work with our young squad swimmers who range in age mostly from 6 - 12 years, including from in water with the first 2 levels, and out of water with the last 2 levels.  We also have opportunity for you to take learn to swim classes.§ §*  A positive behaviour management based leader who comes with personality plus, as much about the fun as you are about swimming technique, and with a relationship building approach.§ §If you currently hold nationally recognised Learn to Swim and Coaching Qualifications, Blue Card & CPR, combined with relevant experience, we have this immediate opportunity available for you to join our teaching and coaching team, where you will receive attractive above award wages and benefits, and ongoing training and support for your development.§ §Make an exciting change for your future and apply now!§ §Send your resume and cover letter directly to our Learning and Development Manager Jen Sadler at §jen@hamptonswimschool.com.au§ §NB* Selection may take place before the closing date.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§Which of the following First Aid accreditations do you currently hold?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§Do you own or have regular access to a car?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Our core areas of business and facilities stewardship include health clubs, wellness and spa, golf, aquatic and sporting venues in 150 locations across Australia and New Zealand. § §We are in an exciting period of growth, and look to continue to diversify and deliver results while being a strong community citizen.  With an annual turnover in excess of $180m, the group are looking for the best and brightest to assist with taking the organisation into the future.§ §The Role§ §We are currently looking for enthusiastic, reliable and friendly §lifeguards§ to join the team. Our lifeguards will be responsible for the Day to Day Pool Operations within our facility and ensure that all areas both in and surrounding our pools is a safe and enjoyable environment for all patrons.§ §You will have a passion for safety around the water. You should be energetic, dynamic, outgoing and fun. You will need outstanding communication skills and a commitment to customer service excellence to ensure our patrons safely enjoy their visit every time.§ §Successful applicants will demonstrate the ability to communicate and interact effectively with students that have a diverse range of ages, abilities, cultures and needs. § §We have multiple §part-time§ positions available with the option to transfer a full time position for the right employees. You commitment and flexibility to weekend, public holidays and increased hours during our peak operating seasons will be rewarded and recognised. § §Skills & Attributes:§§Excellent verbal communication skills§An understanding of OHS and public safety applications within your facility§Ability to work mornings, evenings and weekends§Ability to work effectively both independently and as a strong and valuable part of the team§Current First Aid (Level 2) & Current CPR Certificate§National Police Check§Current Pool Lifeguard Certificate§Previous experience and success in a comparable role is not essential but highly regarded§Current Pool Operations Certificate is not essential but highly regarded§ § If you are a passionate person who realises the tremendous opportunity that this role offers and want to utilise your skills and passion in a health, wellness and aquatic environment, §we want to hear from you!§ § Simply complete the application process by clicking the 'Interested' button, and we’ll be in touch.§Bendigo 3550 VIC§§§§

We love to exceed expectations and create cherished memories for every family and team member in our studio through personally crafted and energetic lessons, trainings and events. We are fresh dance that’s all about FUN!§We are seeking experienced, energetic, creative educators for our regional dance and cheer school in the Mid-North, SA. In this role you will work in a dedicated team of performing arts educators to deliver our programs to students aged 2 to adult. §Hip Hop Bounce are looking for someone who in their heart loves dance and teaches to give this joy to their students. If you nurture your students with kindness, respect and encouragement, if you are a teacher who values teaching excellence and continued personal learning, if you cherish giving the gift of opportunity to regional students, if you know that creativity and artistry provide untold rewards… Then we would like to hear from you.§In this role you will§Inspire students aged 2 to adult by teaching weekly dance, singing or cheer classes.§Direct class performances each semester.§Prepare class lessons and materials, following our exclusive syllabus.§Contribute passionately to fortnightly team catch-ups (online options available).§Attend and engage fully in our annual Team Retreat.§Contribute regularly to our Teacher Trello Board used for team communication.§ §Attributes for Success§We are seeking a team member who wholeheartedly believes that artistic expression and physical literacy can change people’s lives.§To be successful in this role you must demonstrate that you: §Cherish above all, that you are a teacher and able to positively impact so many students by nurturing their artistry and gifting them with skills for expression, communication, self-love and resilience for life.§Embrace our mission, ‘propelling potential’ and have a passion for bringing out the best in every single student. Each student is unique so you understand the importance of individual attention and getting to know your students personally.§Embody a confident and nurturing leader to inspire respect and role model success for your students.§Connect with all members of our community. You enjoy a natural and welcoming approach to forming relationships with parents, caregivers, team and members of our greater community.§Celebrate an efficient and organised work ethic. You love nothing more than to be well-prepared and organised for your classes. You understand that excellent preparation opens the door for creativity and spontaneity in the moment and that accurate communication of administrative affairs prepares your classroom and students for the best possible learning experience. § §The Essentials§The ability to teach dance classes and choreograph routines. Versatility to teach a range of genres, ages and abilities is advantageous.§18+ years of age.§Current driver's license and access to a car.§Current Working with Children Check/Police Check, First Aid and COVIDSafe Marshall qualifications or be willing to gain these.§Dance teaching experience with preference given to dance or teaching qualifications (Bachelor of Dance/Education, Cert 4 in dance teaching, any syllabus association such as RAD, ISTD or similar).§ §Working with Hip Hop Bounce, you enjoy§Our exclusive and progressive syllabus outline, with paid subscription to supplementary syllabus and full training to enhance your delivery thereof.§Monthly access to our personal teacher-training course if seeking further support or education, plus regular 1:1 mentorship.§All production materials and costs are covered by Hip Hop Bounce.§Head office manages all enrolments, accounts and marketing.§Payment is transferred weekly.§A graduated teaching position program with potential for promotion, career growth and increased renumeration.§ §The Position§1-2 days per week (Monday through Thursday), teaching a full after school/evening program of approximately 5 hours at one of our regional campuses in Port Pirie, Jamestown, Clare, Crystal Brook or Port Broughton. Future growth potential for additional days/hours. §We offer hip hop, jazz, ballet, contemporary, tap, pom and singing in our dance stream as well as All Star cheer (stunt), tumble and acro in our cheer stream. Your timetable will be tailored to your teaching strengths, with core competency in teaching a range of styles. §Payment§ $35 - $45 per hour, depending on the individual, with growth potential above this rate with tenure. Worthwhile teaching blocks of approximately 5 hours and additional travel allowances available to those based outside of the Mid-North. §Job Commencement §January 2021, with the possibility of additional cover work in the remainder of 2020.§TO APPLY§If this feels like an opportunity that would bring joy to your life, please complete the application found at this link:§https://forms.gle/VSnWS9ZkhsW9nzcK7 [link removed]§Applications Close (round one): Friday 13th November§ §§§§

jobTitle: Personal Trainer Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50543371.txt	§Personal Trainer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Personal Trainer§§Advertiser: §The Fit Shop Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §Bayside & South Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§$30 - $44.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§About The Fit Shop§ § § §There is no denying the fitness industry throughout Melbourne has been hit hard by COVID and the statewide lockdowns. However, in uncertain times there are always opportunities to be found. § §So if you are one of those trainers who just love what you do and couldn't picture yourself doing anything else, we'd love to hear from you.§ §The Fit Shop Bayside is excited to announce that we have multiple positions available for experienced personal trainers to join our growing studio in Cheltenham.§ §The current position available would be on a casual basis with the potential to grow into a part-time/full-time roll in 2021.§ §We specialise in helping our members prioritise their health and wellbeing, as the foundation for success in all areas of life. Building their strength and confidence to ensure they can get the most out of every day.§ §Put simply, we hire for attitude.§ §We believe for our community to have the best experience possible and for our studio to grow we need a team who value putting in the work and working together.§We value your input and believe great coaches should be rewarded generously.§ §"If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, go together.§ §Please include a cover letter with your resume §telling us a bit more about you and how you see yourself being a key part of our team, including what you would like to bring to our Fit Shop community.§ § § §About the role§ § § §Provide a welcoming and all-encompassing environment, welcome members by name§Engage, educate and encourage members before, during and after sessions§Deliver a high-quality experience in line with The Fit Shop values and training methods§Inspire and promote an energetic environment.§Ensure members use the correct technique at all times§Conduct consultations for new people into our club and advise on the best options for their specific needs. §Assist in the sale of memberships and Fit Shop store products.§Ensure accurate record-keeping of sessions and member details are up to date.§You will ensure the studio is of the highest standard of cleanliness and organisation.§Continue to build the community culture of the studio§Initial responsibilities will include supporting our members via virtual personal training and boot camps§ § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §Be part of an incredible fitness community, it really is like no other.§Endless opportunities to grow and become a leader within our organisation.§Generous salary and bonuses § § § §Skills and experience§ § § §Cert III & IV Fitness§Current Senior First Aid and CPR§Fitness Registration §Must be punctual & reliable§Outstanding time management and organisational skills§Team player§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a personal trainer?§Have you completed a qualification in fitness?§Are you currently registered with any of the following fitness boards?§§§

jobTitle: SpeedFit Personal Trainers & Studio Manager - Bella Vista Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50573998.txt	§SpeedFit Personal Trainers & Studio Manager - Bella Vista§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§SpeedFit Personal Trainers & Studio Manager - Bella Vista§§Advertiser: §HealthyPeople§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §North West & Hills District§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§BELLA VISTA, GLADESVILLE & NORTH SYDNEY§ §We want §all-star performers§ destined to §be part of something GREAT! § §Join our fitness revolution§ and help us to grow our amazing brand to more and more people.§ §We are currently §seeking both Managers & Trainers §for our established as well as new locations immediately (§Bella Vista§, North Sydney, Gladesville & Sydney CBD, plus a new location is planned in the Northern beaches area).§ §Who are we?§ §SpeedFit§ has currently 20 studios across 3 states. Operates in Sydney, Newcastle, Perth and Melbourne, up to 16 hours a day, six days a week and seeks to provide all members with a positive, memorable experience through a fitness program that fits into their lifestyle without taking it over, however busy they are. § §SpeedFit combines personal training with EMS technology for an exceptionally effective workout in just 20 minutes per week. Our EMS training is effective, fun and low impact on the skeletal system (joints, tendons & ligaments). We cater for a wide variety of clients and their needs.§ §We are a team of 50+ fitness professionals, with backgrounds from various areas, including Exercise Sports Scientists, Exercise Physiologists, Nutritionists, Yoga and Pilates Instructors, Strength Coaches and Personal Trainers...§ §About the role:§ §Our Manager's§ own the success of their business and are responsible for local area marketing, sales and retention. They also champion team development, studio culture, and high member satisfaction while maintaining a high-end facility. They work hands-on with their team who they lead and inspire to be the ultimate healthy lifestyle support for our current and future members on their journey to their fitter & healthier versions.§ §Our trainers§ are responsible for building rapport with a client and deliver great & intense sessions every time. They motivate and guide our clients on their journey to get their results! They also champion team members with 5-star customer service while maintaining a high-end and professional facility.§ §Tips on getting the job:§ § §Have a passion for health and wellness.§ §Be proactive to achieve goals. § §Desire to deliver excellent customer service.§ §Experience in sales§ §Know how to get the best out of people.§ §Be hungry to up-skill, grow and develop yourself.§ §Be the life of the party.§ § §If we've just described you, we'd love to:§ § §Mentor you, set you challenges and watch you grow.§ §Reward your success and attitude.§ §Help drive and deliver on innervation!§ §Work hard, be a team player and join us!§ §If you've made it this far, there is only one thing left to do...§APPLY NOW§ §After a successful interview, you need to go through two weeks of full-time training with our head coach. § §To apply:§ §Please provide a strong §COVER LETTER§ outlining your reason for applying, your current employment status and availability to start, plus a detailed §RESUME§.§ §Contact: Roland§§§§

World Gym Marconi is a large (2,500+) member based fitness facility which thrive on having a great relationship with all our members. Our spacious training facility is packed with a wide variety of equipment for any style of training including an outdoor field.§ §If you are knowledgeable, dynamic, and have an outstanding work ethic you may be someone we are interested in talking to. As a personal trainer at World Gym Marconi you will set the standard and be willing to show compassion, patience & the motivation to people desperate for change.§ §Do you have an established PT name/brand that represents your values?§ §In turn, you will have a solid knowledge in both fitness and nutrition. You must also have a satisfactory knowledge and experience in running your business.§ §If this sounds like you and you want to work in an environment that is supportive of your growth to a high standard as both trainer & business owner, then apply now.§ §About the role§ §This is a self-employed position suitable for an experienced Personal Trainer. Your earning potential is unlimited & we will support you to grow your business.§ § §Providing Personal Training services to our members§ §Delivering Fitness Consultations & sessions to new members§ §Ensuring the safety & wellbeing of all in the facility§ §Delivering results for your clients§ §Maintaining a tidy & safe workplace§ §What we offer:§ § §Great fitness facility (including body composition scanner, supplement shop, physio service, ample parking & more)§ §A competitive rental build-up phase to help you transition your business§ §Opportunities to coach classes - get in front of hundreds of members§ §Be your own boss with benefits of working with a team, including role support, collaboration & social events§ §PT team bonding events§ §Large & diverse clientele§ §Additional business support & coaching when needed§ §COVID safe compliant§ §Qualifications required:§ § §Cert III and Cert IV in Fitness§ §Current First Aid & CPR Certificate§ §Valid Insurance cover§ §ABN§§§§

jobText: TXT/50555088.txt	§Group Fitness Instructors | Clarkson | Wanneroo | Perth§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Group Fitness Instructors | Clarkson | Wanneroo | Perth§§Advertiser: §Surge Health & Fitness§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Sept 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§Surge Fitness are now accepting applications for highly skilled and successful GFIs to join our team across the following locations:§ §-Clarkson § §-Wanneroo§ §-Perth CBD § §We promise our members a safe, caring and engaging environment to achieve their health and fitness goals. That is why we recruit fitness professionals who have the skills, qualifications and experience to guide them on their journey.§ §Our timetables feature a combination of §Les Mills§, §Surge Balance§ programs such as §Yoga, Pilates, Barre, Reformer Pilates, freestyle Cycle with Stages Bikes and Power Meters (the official bike of Team Sky/USA. § §Our studios and §functional training zones§ have been configured to provide the ultimate boutique and immersive Group Training experience. Our intimate and deeply engaging, group training spaces are the home of our all LIVE & Virtual Cycle classes and host some of our new §Surge Connect§ team functional training.§ §Our GFIs team benefit from:§ § §Initial and continued training and support.§ §Mentoring available for junior instructors of GFI in training. § §Opportunities to help out in our community.§ §Monthly/Quarterly workshops to enhance team building & member experience.§ §Access to gain on-going qualifications and further education through our network of affiliates.§ §Complimentary gym membership*§ §Access to club creche when available*§ §Access to industry partner discounts and staff benefits.§ §As an industry leader, Surge Fitness is a proud affiliate and host of several recognised industry partners including Mike Boyle Strength and Conditioning, Studio Pilates, FTI, TRX, Mike Finch Animal Flow, Les Mills, Jill Miller, Yoga Training Australia, Martin Rooney Training for Warriors and many more.§ §We have some regular formats & timetable slots availible straight away, however, we are also hoping to §grow our instuctor covers team§ to assist with holidays/casual covers/corporate events and to be ready for future oppertunties as our club portfolio expands. § §If you teach the any of the following programs and hold the relevant certifications, we want to hear from you!§ §Les Mills§ §Boxing§ §Simulated Altitude § §Training for Warriors L1/2§ §Freestyle Cycle§ §Yoga§ §Barre§ §Mat and Reformer Pilates§ §Animal Flow§ §Master Functional Training§ §Kettlebells  § §Mike Boyle CFSC§ §Myzone or LHRM Instructing § §Something fun/new, we have not heard of yet? Happy to hear from you too!§ §If you think you could 'make a difference' to improve our members lives in our studios - then you could be the next peron to join our team!§ §Responsibilities:§ § §Plan and instruct classes.§ §Set up and tidy away equipment.  Report any equipment problems.§ §Follow club COVID 19 safety policies, procedures and guidelines to keep our members And team safe at all times. § §Attend staff meetings and approved training as required.  § §Develop rapport with members and respond to feedback and questions.§ §Drive member experience and engagement by interacting with members before/after each class.§ §Promote and build class numbers through enegament strategies. § §Responsible for keeping members safe while in class. § §Respond to, and report, accident and incidents.§ §Discuss and promote Surge Fitness Programs and member events.§ §Motivate members to commit to long term participation for better results.§ §Follow all Surge Fitness policies and procedures.§ §Display our company values and guiding behaviours at all times.§ §Any additional duties as assigned. § §Requirements:§ § §Must have Cert III/IV and/or GEL. § §Must have the ability to lead a fitness class and to motivate and educate members.§ §Must be able to respond to safety and emergency situations.§ §First Aid & CPR.§ §Fitness Registration.§ §Certification for chosen programs. § §Must complete an interview, audition and club induction prior to appointment. § §PLEASE DO NOT APPLY IF YOU DO NOT HOLD THE NESSESARY REGITRATION, QUALIFICATION OR FIRST AID CERTIFICATION. THANK YOU.§ §Surge Fitness lives by its values of changing peoples lives and building healthy communities and we are looking for  like-minded individuals who want to motivate our members!§ §So if you want to be part of an innovative, fun and exciting brand leader that is more than just fitness, then please submit your resume and cover letter and we will be in touch! § § §We welcome enquires! Please direct your questions to:§ § § §Clarkson:§ §Christine §gfm.clarkson@surgefitness.com.au§ §Wanneroo: § §Sophie §gfm.drovers@surgefitness.com.au§ §Perth CBD:§ §Antonio §gfm.ks3@surgefitness.com.au§ § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Which of the following First Aid accreditations do you currently hold?§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§Have you completed a qualification in fitness?§How many years' experience do you have as a personal trainer?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Reformer Pilates Instructor Job in Sydney - SEEK

jobText: TXT/50699736.txt	§Reformer Pilates Instructor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Reformer Pilates Instructor§§Advertiser: §Virgin Active§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Reformer Pilates Instructor §      §        §We are a globally recognised brand with over 233 clubs in 8 countries and more than 1 million members. As part of the Virgin Group founded by Sir Richard Branson, we opened our first club in Australia in 2008 and are building an unparalleled collection of iconic locations in Sydney and Melbourne. We continue to innovate by developing a more personalised gym, multi-boutique experience and mission to provide irresistible exercise experiences.§        §The gig:§        §Appreciated by everyone from beginners to elite athletes, it’s a method that offers toning, strength, postural alignment, flexibility, balance, endurance and mindful focus. Whether overcoming physical vulnerability or sculpting a dream body, it’s about improving holistic health and engaging the mind, body and breath.§You’ll deliver classes with the uniqueness that’s given you a rock star following and leverage your personality to help members experience physical, mental and emotional breakthrough moments in class. You’ll be empowered to perform on the stage and create a culture where the community become raving fans.§        §All about you:§        §You’re a raw and magnetic personality with a rock star group ex reputation. You’re an athlete and performer. Both equally. Inspiring the community to push themselves to new heights (one class at a time) makes you feel warm and fuzzy inside. You get a kick out of getting people to those I did it! moments. In this role, you  will provide a consistent and high level delivery of coaching across the range of programs and sessions we have available.§  §As a Tennis Coach, you will see yourself delivering fun and interactive coaching sessions (private and group) to players of all ages and abilities, kids through to adults.§  §ABOUT YOU§  §To be considered for this role, you will need:§ § §Minimum Community Coaching qualification§ §Familiarity with the different ‘colour’ stages within Tennis Australia’s Hot Shots Program.§ §Experience in Cardio Tennis is a plus§ §Current First Aid and CPR certification§ §Valid Blue Card § §You will need to be confident, reliable and enthusiastic with all-star communication skills. jobTitle: Personal Trainer - Genesis Fitness Kelmscott - Qualified/Non-qualified Job in Perth - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50560216.txt	§Personal Trainer - Genesis Fitness Kelmscott - Qualified/Non-qualified§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Personal Trainer - Genesis Fitness Kelmscott - Qualified/Non-qualified§§Advertiser: §HealthyPeople§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §Fremantle & Southern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§Genesis Fitness§ is a state of the art 24-hour gym facility with over 5 locations in Perth and over 40+ clubs nationwide. We have the latest range of strength, cardio and freestyle equipment to cater to all member requirements and needs.§  §The Genesis Fitness Personal Training Or Coaching Program Experience§  §This could be your chance to have the autonomy of being your own boss, whilst having a network of support, behind the scenes, to ensure your success. As part of the team here at Genesis Fitness Kelmscott, our primary focus is to create a comfortable working environment and an enjoyable atmosphere all whilst giving you hands-on experience in the industry. We will also cover ongoing, extensive business & practical coaching, a mentor, internal monthly workshops, a cap on trainers in a club with a §HIGH§ trainer to member ratio as well as a Genesis Fitness membership.§  §For the right person there is also paid coaching work in our coaching zone, are you someone who loves driving groups to succeed?§  §The Steps required becoming our next star Personal trainer:§ § §Apply with a cover letter that describes yourself and what unique benefits you can offer our members & your future clients. Please attach your CV.§ §Receive an invitation to a §ZOOM INTERVIEW!§ §If you progress to the next stage after attending our Group Interview and you're already qualified as a PT, we will prepare you to begin your new career with Genesis Fitness immediately.§ §Not Qualified as a Personal Trainer? § §For unqualified professionals, opportunities exist in sales, reception, and management (experience required).§  §Not yet qualified and looking to study to become a Personal Trainer? §We encourage all aspiring Personal Trainers to apply!§  §Submit your application via the APPLY button.§§§§
