jobTitle: Swim Instructor Job in Perth - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50669064.txt	§Swim Instructor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Swim Instructor§§Advertiser: §All Saints' College§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §Fremantle & Southern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Swim Instructor §      §        §(Casual position) §        § §        §About us§        §All Saints' College (ASC), one of Australia’s leading independent, coeducational Anglican day-schools, is situated approximately 15 minutes south of the CBD on a beautifully landscaped 19 hectare property in Bull Creek. Surrounded by ovals, paths, lawns and gardens, the campus caters for approximately 1 350 students from Pre-Kindergarten through to Year 12. Facilities include a state of the art theatre, heated 25 metre indoor swimming pool on campus, a fully equipped gymnasium, rock climbing wall and an indoor sports centre. Our staff are welcome to use our facilities, enjoy the grounds or perhaps attend an evening show in our world-class theatre. In the mornings staff often drop by §Wanju§, our College café for a coffee and a chat with other members of our All Saints’ community.§        §We understand that balancing work and family commitments can sometimes be challenging, and so we have implemented a number of strategies to support our staff as they manage their work / life balance. Staff with school-aged children are offered free before - and after- school care, and vacation care is provided during periods of school holidays, also free of charge, for the children of staff members who are required to work at these times. We also understand that members of our staff may need to attend to matters of a private nature, from time to time, so our ‘Temporary Absence Policy’ enables staff to be absent from the workplace for up to two hours (without any deductions from leave accruals) during the working day to attend to such matters. We offer a broad range of other benefits to attract and retain outstanding staff, including:§        §          §Salary packaging§          §Deferred salary scheme (work 4 years and take the 5th year as leave)§          §Generous paid parental leave§          §Generous long service leave entitlements§          §Generous discount on school tuition fees§          §Free onsite parking§          §Discounted tickets for events held in the Centre for Performing Arts§          §Discounted flu vaccinations§          §An active Staff Association that provides regular social activities§          §Notebook computers (and iPads, depending on your role) for relevant staff§          §Access to high level professional development (PD), including attendance at interstate and international events§          §Financial support to undertake academic studies§        §        §All our staff - teaching, administration and support staff - are committed to the welfare of our students, and to providing a warm, supportive, caring and challenging environment that encourages creative and critical thinking.§        §About the position§        §We are currently seeking dynamic and enthusiastic individuals to join our Learn to Swim Program. The Program runs in the afternoons from 3.35pm to 5.35pm on weekdays and from 8.00am to 10.00am on Saturday mornings during the school term. The positions are on a casual basis and the hourly rate is $28.00 per hour.§        §The Learn to Swim (LTS) instructor provides a safe, effective and fun delivery of lessons. As well as developing swimming techniques and skills for students of all ages.§        §Ongoing staff training will be provided, as well as on-deck support throughout the lessons.§        §Key responsibilities include§:§        §          §Learn to swim teaching based on the AUSTSWIM Curriculum.§          §Plan and deliver lessons.§          §Teach and demonstrate correct swimming techniques.§          §Provide assessments for students.§          §Provide regular feedback to parents.§        §        §Minimum requirements§        §          §AUSTSWIM or Swim Australia Teacher of Swimming and Water Safety Certificate.§          §CPR / Resuscitation.§          §Working with Children Check.§          §Police Clearance.§        §        §How to apply§        §Your application should consist of a one page covering letter, addressed to the Principal, explaining the attributes, skills and experience you would bring to the College’s Aquatic Centre, and why you wish to work at ASC. Please also attach a Curriculum Vitae containing your employment history, qualifications and the contact details of two referees.§        §Applications are to be submitted via the SEEK website. Due to our recruitment processes we are not able to accept hard copy applications.§        §Should you have any queries, please do not hesitate to contact our Director of Swimming, Tom Stachewicz, on §(08) 9288 2486§.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§(Casual position) § § §  §About us§ §All Saints' College (ASC), one of Australia’s leading independent, coeducational Anglican day-schools, is situated approximately 15 minutes south of the CBD on a beautifully landscaped 19 hectare property in Bull Creek. Surrounded by ovals, paths, lawns and gardens, the campus caters for approximately 1 350 students from Pre-Kindergarten through to Year 12. Facilities include a state of the art theatre, heated 25 metre indoor swimming pool on campus, a fully equipped gymnasium, rock climbing wall and an indoor sports centre. Our staff are welcome to use our facilities, enjoy the grounds or perhaps attend an evening show in our world-class theatre. In the mornings staff often drop by §Wanju§, our College café for a coffee and a chat with other members of our All Saints’ community.§  §We understand that balancing work and family commitments can sometimes be challenging, and so we have implemented a number of strategies to support our staff as they manage their work / life balance. Staff with school-aged children are offered free before - and after- school care, and vacation care is provided during periods of school holidays, also free of charge, for the children of staff members who are required to work at these times. We also understand that members of our staff may need to attend to matters of a private nature, from time to time, so our ‘Temporary Absence Policy’ enables staff to be absent from the workplace for up to two hours (without any deductions from leave accruals) during the working day to attend to such matters. We offer a broad range of other benefits to attract and retain outstanding staff, including:§ § §Salary packaging§ §Deferred salary scheme (work 4 years and take the 5th year as leave)§ §Generous paid parental leave§ §Generous long service leave entitlements§ §Generous discount on school tuition fees§ §Free onsite parking§ §Discounted tickets for events held in the Centre for Performing Arts§ §Discounted flu vaccinations§ §An active Staff Association that provides regular social activities§ §Notebook computers (and iPads, depending on your role) for relevant staff§ §Access to high level professional development (PD), including attendance at interstate and international events§ §Financial support to undertake academic studies§ §All our staff - teaching, administration and support staff - are committed to the welfare of our students, and to providing a warm, supportive, caring and challenging environment that encourages creative and critical thinking.§  §About the position§ §We are currently seeking dynamic and enthusiastic individuals to join our Learn to Swim Program. The Program runs in the afternoons from 3.35pm to 5.35pm on weekdays and from 8.00am to 10.00am on Saturday mornings during the school term. The positions are on a casual basis and the hourly rate is $28.00 per hour.§  §The Learn to Swim (LTS) instructor provides a safe, effective and fun delivery of lessons. As well as developing swimming techniques and skills for students of all ages.§  §Ongoing staff training will be provided, as well as on-deck support throughout the lessons.§  §Key responsibilities include§:§ § §Learn to swim teaching based on the AUSTSWIM Curriculum.§ §Plan and deliver lessons.§ §Teach and demonstrate correct swimming techniques.§ §Provide assessments for students.§ §Provide regular feedback to parents.§ §Minimum requirements§ § §AUSTSWIM or Swim Australia Teacher of Swimming and Water Safety Certificate.§ §CPR / Resuscitation.§ §Working with Children Check.§ §Police Clearance.§ §How to apply§ §Your application should consist of a one page covering letter, addressed to the Principal, explaining the attributes, skills and experience you would bring to the College’s Aquatic Centre, and why you wish to work at ASC. Please also attach a Curriculum Vitae containing your employment history, qualifications and the contact details of two referees.§  §Applications are to be submitted via the SEEK website. Due to our recruitment processes we are not able to accept hard copy applications.§  §Should you have any queries, please do not hesitate to contact our Director of Swimming, Tom Stachewicz, on §(08) 9288 2486§.§§§§

jobTitle: Personal Trainer Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50588385.txt	§Personal Trainer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Personal Trainer§§Advertiser: §Barefoot Trainer Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§About us§ §Our mission is to create unrivaled experiences in inspiring facilities that empower each individual to reach their full potential. We strive to change minds, move bodies, and do things differently, and we achieve this by being an all-inclusive space that encourages balance in all aspects of life. With attention to detail and a desire to elevate the fitness experience a driving intention, each boutique space has been thoughtfully designed with lighting, heat controlled panels, diffusers and sound, to help our members get the most out of their body during each class. Our studios can be found across four central locations over Brisbane, each offering more than 150 group-based classes per week of yoga, functional, cycle, fusion, reformer pilates, and run club styles. As we constantly seek to innovate the health and fitness industry, our Morningside development will be our largest to date with the addition of a fully functional commercial gym space and dedicated Wellness Centre.§ §Qualifications & experience§ § § §Minimum Cert 4 in Fitness§ASCA Level 1, AWA Level 1, Functional Training would be an advantage§A good track record of achievement§Be able to demonstrate how you have worked as part of a team§You'll be a good communicator, equally good at listening and explaining§Have a unique ability to motivate, inspire and connect with others§Like us, you believe in putting people first and you'll know instinctively how to do that with awareness & sensitivity§ § § §Tasks & responsibilities§ § § §As a resident personal trainer, you will possess a particular drive and passion to constantly inspire clients to reach their full potential and achieve their fitness goals. You will have a strong work ethic and 'love what you do' attitude to achieve both personal targets and team KPIs.§With a love for fitness a driving intention, we're not interested in those looking to dip their feet into fitness, rather, serious candidates that desire ongoing training and development as they turn their passion into a career.§ § § §Benefits§ § § §Imagine working in a world where movement reigns, where the body and mind align and where stretch and strength are equal. This is our world, a TotalFusion of traditional and new movement styles, built to re-energize and re-define fitness as we know it.§We are uncompromised in our standards and only employ individuals that ooze the same lust for life as we do! As a member of the TotalFusion family, you'll spend every day surrounded by a passionate team or industry leader, as well as join a growing business with career progression.§Rent Free and No Bond to pay§Client management system provided§2 x weekly ongoing education and development§Quarterly specialised full-day workshops§Option to be part of our Small Group Training Team§Full support in building your PT business and signing new clients§Be part of an integrated team of Small Group Training, Group Fitness, Wellness, and everything else in between§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a personal trainer?§Have you completed a qualification in fitness?§Do you have customer service experience?§How many years' experience do you have in the sports & fitness industry?§§§

jobTitle: Lifeguard Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50557008.txt	§Lifeguard§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lifeguard§§Advertiser: §YMCA§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §South West & M5 Corridor§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§ §Work across 2 locations - Mt Annan & Camden§ §Fun working environment§ §YMCA staff benefits§ § §As a Lifeguard with The Y, you understand that safety and fun go hand-in-hand. Our pools and recreation facilities are invaluable, inclusive, exciting spaces for sporty types – especially young people. But, they can’t exist if they aren’t safe. Which is exactly where you come in. You’ll join a team of responsible, approachable, confident swimmers in supervising our pools and surrounding areas. Together, you’ll uphold the highest standards of care and safety to make sure our swimmers have fun, stay active and gain confidence in the water.§ §If you’re a people person with a keen eye for detail and who thrives under pressure, you could be our next Lifeguard. If so, expect perks like flexible hours and free facility membership, and the support to build valuable people, leadership and life skills – all while you make a difference to your community.§ §We have 5 casual positions available at Mt Annan Leisure Centre. You will also be required to work across Camden War Memorial Pool. The successful candidate will have a range of availability to work, including weekends and public holidays.§ §Qualifications§ § §Current Lifeguard Qualification§ §Working with Children Check§ §Police Check (paid for by the Y)§ §CPR Certificate§ § §Y work with us?§ § §Work within a supportive team environment§ §Room to learn and develop within the organisation§ §Flexible hours and arrangements, for a work-life balance that works for you§ §Awesome discounts on The Y services and products§ §Corporate health insurance cover to keep you healthy§ §§Who What Y?§The Y NSW is a profit-for-purpose organisation focused on healthy living, social impact and empowering young people. We operate 22 recreation centres, 63 out-of-school-hours care services, and two camping locations which employ 1,800 staff across NSW –  and fund our diverse range of enriching community programs.§We believe in building a diverse, inclusive workforce that reflects the communities we serve. We encourage people of all genders, ages, religions, disability, sexual orientation, family and caring responsibilities and cultures, including people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander heritage, to apply.§Commitment to Safeguarding§The Y, including Boards of Directors, is committed to the safety and wellbeing of children and young people in accordance with our Safeguarding Children and Young People framework. The Y requires that all applicants undergo satisfactory screening prior to commencement, including but not limited to:§ §a national criminal history check;§ §an international criminal history check where applicants have worked overseas;§ §holding or obtaining a Working with Children Clearance/equivalent in accordance with state/ territory laws;§ §two reference checks.§ § §Please note, the results of any National and International Police Check will only be used to assess your suitability to perform the role.§ §Any successfully appointed applicant will be required to adhere to the Safeguarding Children and Young People framework, which includes a thorough safeguarding children and young people induction and committing to upholding the safety and wellbeing of children and young people throughout their engagement with YMCA.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Personal Trainers - Crunch Fitness Hoxton Park Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50663900.txt	§Personal Trainers - Crunch Fitness Hoxton Park§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Personal Trainers - Crunch Fitness Hoxton Park§§Advertiser: §HealthyPeople§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §South West & M5 Corridor§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§Personal Trainer Crunch Fitness Hoxton Park.§Want to build your own successful fitness business in a place that supports your goals?§ §The explosive global brand §Crunch Fitness§ is now looking for passionate Personal Trainers who want to work for a global brand with great career potential!§ §About Crunch:§ §We are world-famous for fusing entertainment with fitness. We are all about FUN, and as a result, we provide an amazing work experience.§ §We are passionate about our purpose, we empower people to live out their dreams by helping them ‘perspire to greatness’.§ §Your role:§ §As a Crunch Personal Trainer, you’ll work under the rent-based model. That means you have the freedom to charge what you want for your sessions, and it’s all yours to keep!§ §If you are the right fit then we will provide you with the tools for success!§ §As one of our valued Trainers, you'll receive;§ § §Uncapped earning potential!§ §Access to an extensive client base to grow your business§ §State-of-the-art Equipment§ §PT Supervisor to mentor you through your journey at Crunch§ §Business Development and Training opportunities§ §Flexible working hours§ §The chance to work amongst a great team who love to have FUN!§ §What we're looking for:§ § §Cert IV in Fitness (minimum qualification)§ §A drive to grow your business and achieve goals§ §Passionate about helping people through their fitness journey§ §Strong customer service skills§ §Positive attitude§ §High sense of integrity and honesty§ §Effective time management§ §Values teamwork§ §Love having fun and trying new things!§ §If this sounds like you, APPLY NOW!§ §If you are what we are looking for we will contact you for an interview.§ §We look forward to hearing from you!§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

If you enjoy working in an environment that is fun, encouraging, have a passion to teach children a lifelong skill, hold AUST Swim credentials, CPR and blue card, then this job is for you! §   § This Casual Swim Teacher will report to the Program Leader Leased Council Facilities and is responsible for providing efficient and effective support to the Community Facilities team. Duties focus on planning and delivering quality swim lessons in a safe, fun and effective manner, to have a complete knowledge and understanding of all aspects of teaching swimming/water safety and ensuring the safety and enjoyment of participants in classes at all times.§   § §To be successful in this role, it is essential that you have the following: §        §          §Previous experience as a learn to swim teacher in an aquatic facility;§          §Knowledge of, or the ability to rapidly acquire knowledge of the effective operation of a pool complex;§          §The ability to provide adequate supervision of aquatic facilities to ensure safety of all facility users;§          §Willingness to be a positive role model, creating a positive and fun environment in which to motivate and encourage all participants.§          §Current certification in: §              §Teacher of Swimming;§              §Water Safety;§              §First Aid and CPR;§              §Lifeguard; and§              §Working with Children Blue Card.§            §          §          §Willingness to work flexible hours as required, incorporating weekends and public holidays.§        § §For this position we offer: §        §          §$33.46 per hour;§          §As required, as per roster;§          §Super in accordance with Council Policy;§          §Contracted until 4 September 2020§          §The location of this position is Moranbah.§        § §Prior to making the decision to apply, please note that accommodation is not offered for this position.§   § For more details on this position, please contact the Manager Community Facilities, Mr Bruce Wright, during business hours. Phone: §(07) 4846 3354§ or Email: §Bruce.Wright@isaac.qld.gov.au§.§   § To submit your application – Please click 'Apply Here' and follow the steps to submit your application. jobText: TXT/50626747.txt	§Casual Tennis Coach§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Casual Tennis Coach§§Advertiser: §Clublinks Management Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Casual Tennis Coach §      §        §The role§        §We are looking to appoint a Casual Tennis Coach to join our team and  continue to build and promote the Tennis business at Parklands Sports Centre. §        §Who are we?§        §At Clublinks, we’re bright, bold, nimble and we like to have fun!§        §Clublinks is a leisure and community management leader, holding contract rights with local government, private enterprise and tertiary institutions to manage and grow their facilities and communities. We are passionate and agile with an incredibly strong record of improving our clients’ financial results and achievements. Adopting company values of “Stand Out”, “Be Awesome”, “Speak Up” and “Get *#it Done” we are not afraid to be different and provide innovative solutions to deliver success. Our 250 plus team are based at our sites across VIC, NSW and WA.§        §Clublinks operates Moore Park Golf and Centennial Parklands Sports Centre within the Moore Park Precinct on behalf of the Centennial Parklands and Moore Park Trust (Trust). The Moore Park Precinct located in central Sydney and has thrived in recent times; growing substantially year on year and continuously enhancing its offer, customer experience and improving business performance.§        §Centennial Parklands Sports Centre has recently undergone substantial upgrades and presents 15 courts in the prime CBD / Eastern suburbs location of Centennial Parklands. We have also introduced a PlaySight Smart Court which is an all-in-one video and analytics solution for tennis. The system uses connected high-performance cameras and an on-court kiosk to provide shot tracking, line calling, multi-angle video, detailed analytics and more. All video and statistics are accessible to the user immediately while on court.§        §More details§        §You will hit the ground running and be happy to roll up your sleeves and throw yourself into whatever comes your way with responsibilities including;§        §          §Hands on Coaching - Social Tennis, private lessons, group lessons, holiday programs, hot shots, school programs, junior/adult squads§          §Providing exemplary customer service to both customers and other coaching professionals§          §be integrally involved in the planning and coordination of an outstanding calendar of opportunities for adults and juniors to play Tennis §        §        §Starting off with approx. 15 hours per week coaching with opportunity to build on this immediately for the right candidate.§        §About you:§        §          §Tennis Australia Coaching qualifications or equivalent§          §Minimum 3 years coaching experience§          §A positive attitude, exceptional communication and rapport building skills§          §Self-driven with excellent time management and organisational skills§          §Work well autonomously and in a team environment§          §A current Working with Children Check, Police check and First aid qualifications§        §        §This is a fantastic opportunity for a coach seeking continued growth with a strong work ethic and would like to be a part of one of Sydney biggest tennis venues.§        §Apply/Contact§        §Please do not delay in sending through your application as applications will be reviewed as they are received with the role to commence ASAP.§        § §      §      §      §    §  §§§The role§  §We are looking to appoint a Casual Tennis Coach to join our team and  continue to build and promote the Tennis business at Parklands Sports Centre. §  §Who are we?§  §At Clublinks, we’re bright, bold, nimble and we like to have fun!§  §Clublinks is a leisure and community management leader, holding contract rights with local government, private enterprise and tertiary institutions to manage and grow their facilities and communities. We are passionate and agile with an incredibly strong record of improving our clients’ financial results and achievements. Adopting company values of “Stand Out”, “Be Awesome”, “Speak Up” and “Get *#it Done” we are not afraid to be different and provide innovative solutions to deliver success. Our 250 plus team are based at our sites across VIC, NSW and WA.§  §Clublinks operates Moore Park Golf and Centennial Parklands Sports Centre within the Moore Park Precinct on behalf of the Centennial Parklands and Moore Park Trust (Trust). The Moore Park Precinct located in central Sydney and has thrived in recent times; growing substantially year on year and continuously enhancing its offer, customer experience and improving business performance.§  §Centennial Parklands Sports Centre has recently undergone substantial upgrades and presents 15 courts in the prime CBD / Eastern suburbs location of Centennial Parklands. We have also introduced a PlaySight Smart Court which is an all-in-one video and analytics solution for tennis. The system uses connected high-performance cameras and an on-court kiosk to provide shot tracking, line calling, multi-angle video, detailed analytics and more. All video and statistics are accessible to the user immediately while on court.§  §More details§  §You will hit the ground running and be happy to roll up your sleeves and throw yourself into whatever comes your way with responsibilities including;§ § §Hands on Coaching - Social Tennis, private lessons, group lessons, holiday programs, hot shots, school programs, junior/adult squads§ §Providing exemplary customer service to both customers and other coaching professionals§ §be integrally involved in the planning and coordination of an outstanding calendar of opportunities for adults and juniors to play Tennis § §Starting off with approx. 15 hours per week coaching with opportunity to build on this immediately for the right candidate.§  §About you:§ § §Tennis Australia Coaching qualifications or equivalent§ §Minimum 3 years coaching experience§ §A positive attitude, exceptional communication and rapport building skills§ §Self-driven with excellent time management and organisational skills§ §Work well autonomously and in a team environment§ §A current Working with Children Check, Police check and First aid qualifications§ §This is a fantastic opportunity for a coach seeking continued growth with a strong work ethic and would like to be a part of one of Sydney biggest tennis venues.§  §Apply/Contact§  §Please do not delay in sending through your application as applications will be reviewed as they are received with the role to commence ASAP.§  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§Which of the following First Aid accreditations do you currently hold?§Do you have a current Police Check (National Police Certificate) for employment?§§§

jobText: TXT/50640916.txt	§Youth, Sports and Recreation Coordinator - Ramingining§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Youth, Sports and Recreation Coordinator - Ramingining§§Advertiser: §East Arnhem Regional Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Katherine & Northern Australia§§Salary§§$67,463.08§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §        §Youth, Sports and Recreation Coordinator - Ramingining §        §          §About the role:§          §The Youth, Sport & Recreation Coordinator will contribute to the overall Youth, Sport and Recreation Program by providing leadership and assistance through administration, planning and delivery of sport and recreation activities to support the strategic direction of East Arnhem Regional Council.§          §Key Responsibilities§: §          §            §Develop, coordinate and deliver the ongoing operation of Youth, Sport and Recreation (YSR) programs.§            §Facilitate the effective delivery of services and programs that address the specific needs of the target groups and offer new opportunities and experiences within the community.§            §Where relevant, actively mentor and support the YSR team through identification and delivery of accredited and non-accredited training.§            §Assist in the identification and effective case management of Indigenous youth at risk of self harm.§            §Assist the overall YSR program by working collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders.§            §Assist in building the capacity of the community to support Indigenous youth through consultation with community stakeholders.§            §Ensure all KPI’s are progressively worked towards, providing feedback to the YSR Regional Manager.§            §Display a positive influence in the community and maintain a safe working environment through adherence to all health and safety policies and relevant legislation and guidelines.§            §Assist with the management of council assets and equipment and report any damages or faults immediately via the correct EARC processes§            §Ensure all YSR facilities are regularly cleaned and maintenance issues are reported in a timely matter§          §          §To be successful in this role, you will possess the following:§          §            §Demonstrated previous experience in youth, sport and recreation, or a related field.§            §Demonstrated capacity to assess programs and work towards continuous improvement.§            §Have a knowledge of, and commitment to, the application of a community development approach.§            §Proven skills in managing change and fostering a positive workplace.§            §Strong organisational skills including ability to plan and implement events, as well as demonstrated experience in mentoring and reporting. §            §Demonstrated interpersonal skills, including high level written and oral communication, mediation and negotiation skills.§            §Demonstrated ability to operate effectively in a cross cultural environment and ability to train a youth team, including Indigenous staff wherever practical.§            §Current Australian driver’s licence.§          §          §It would be desirable if you also possessed:§          §            §Four wheel drive training§            §Previous experience working or living within an Indigenous setting and ability to demonstrate a high level of cross cultural awareness in the workplace.§            §Awareness of issues affecting Indigenous people to ensure effective participation in a cross-cultural environment.§          §          §What you'll get in return:§          §A full time permanent role receiving a salary of $67,463.08 gross pa before superannuation contributions of 9.5%. You will benefit from 6 weeks annual leave entitlements with 17.5% leave loading. Subsidised accommodation will be provided in Ramingining Community to the successful candidate, where you will pay $75 per week rent + utilities. Relocation and Repatriation assistance is also available.  §          §Want to join our team?§          §Please forward a cover letter addressing the above criteria and your CV to §hr@eastarnhem.nt.gov.au§. A full Position Description may be obtained by visiting our website - www.eastarnhem.nt.gov.au/positions-vacant. For further information regarding the role, please contact Peter Dunkley(Regional Manager - Youth Sport and Recreation) on §Peter.Dunkley@eastarnhem.nt.gov.au§. §          §Applications Closes: COB 16th October 2020 §          §Thank you for your application for a position with East Arnhem Regional Council. Please note that only short-listed candidates who move to the next stage in the selection process will be contacted. Please note your personal information will only be used for recruitment purposes. Personal information of the candidate can be accessed by contacting §hr@eastarnhem.nt.gov.au§.§          §East Arnhem Regional Council is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EEO).§          § §        §        §        §      §    §  §§§About the role:§ §The Youth, Sport & Recreation Coordinator will contribute to the overall Youth, Sport and Recreation Program by providing leadership and assistance through administration, planning and delivery of sport and recreation activities to support the strategic direction of East Arnhem Regional Council.§ §Key Responsibilities§: § § §Develop, coordinate and deliver the ongoing operation of Youth, Sport and Recreation (YSR) programs.§ §Facilitate the effective delivery of services and programs that address the specific needs of the target groups and offer new opportunities and experiences within the community.§ §Where relevant, actively mentor and support the YSR team through identification and delivery of accredited and non-accredited training.§ §Assist in the identification and effective case management of Indigenous youth at risk of self harm.§ §Assist the overall YSR program by working collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders.§ §Assist in building the capacity of the community to support Indigenous youth through consultation with community stakeholders.§ §Ensure all KPI’s are progressively worked towards, providing feedback to the YSR Regional Manager.§ §Display a positive influence in the community and maintain a safe working environment through adherence to all health and safety policies and relevant legislation and guidelines.§ §Assist with the management of council assets and equipment and report any damages or faults immediately via the correct EARC processes§ §Ensure all YSR facilities are regularly cleaned and maintenance issues are reported in a timely matter§ §To be successful in this role, you will possess the following:§ § §Demonstrated previous experience in youth, sport and recreation, or a related field.§ §Demonstrated capacity to assess programs and work towards continuous improvement.§ §Have a knowledge of, and commitment to, the application of a community development approach.§ §Proven skills in managing change and fostering a positive workplace.§ §Strong organisational skills including ability to plan and implement events, as well as demonstrated experience in mentoring and reporting. § §Demonstrated interpersonal skills, including high level written and oral communication, mediation and negotiation skills.§ §Demonstrated ability to operate effectively in a cross cultural environment and ability to train a youth team, including Indigenous staff wherever practical.§ §Current Australian driver’s licence.§ §It would be desirable if you also possessed:§ § §Four wheel drive training§ §Previous experience working or living within an Indigenous setting and ability to demonstrate a high level of cross cultural awareness in the workplace.§ §Awareness of issues affecting Indigenous people to ensure effective participation in a cross-cultural environment.§ §What you'll get in return:§ §A full time permanent role receiving a salary of $67,463.08 gross pa before superannuation contributions of 9.5%. You will benefit from 6 weeks annual leave entitlements with 17.5% leave loading. Subsidised accommodation will be provided in Ramingining Community to the successful candidate, where you will pay $75 per week rent + utilities. Relocation and Repatriation assistance is also available.  § §Want to join our team?§ §Please forward a cover letter addressing the above criteria and your CV to §hr@eastarnhem.nt.gov.au§. A full Position Description may be obtained by visiting our website - www.eastarnhem.nt.gov.au/positions-vacant. For further information regarding the role, please contact Peter Dunkley(Regional Manager - Youth Sport and Recreation) on §Peter.Dunkley@eastarnhem.nt.gov.au§. § §Applications Closes: COB 16th October 2020 § §Thank you for your application for a position with East Arnhem Regional Council. Please note that only short-listed candidates who move to the next stage in the selection process will be contacted. Please note your personal information will only be used for recruitment purposes. Personal information of the candidate can be accessed by contacting §hr@eastarnhem.nt.gov.au§.§ §East Arnhem Regional Council is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EEO).§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§Are you willing to relocate for this role?§§§

jobText: TXT/50705176.txt	§General Manager - North Bondi Surf Life Saving Club§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§General Manager - North Bondi Surf Life Saving Club§§Advertiser: §North Bondi Surf Life Saving Club§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§How your role makes a difference§Reporting to the Club President you will play a major role in ensuring that North Bondi Surf Life Saving Club continues to offer a first class service to all stakeholders including its members, sponsors, and the local community as well as businesses who use the function area. You will also operate as a key interface with the various Surf Life Saving bodies, Waverley Council and State Government.n Overview§Role Responsibilities§Oversee the office and administration of the Club.§Set budgets and oversee the financial operation of the Club.§Oversee the functions business and upkeep of club facilities.§Supervise the Functions Manager and Caretaker.§Give effect to the Board’s strategic directions.§Provide a first instance business level interface with stakeholders &§members.§Manage/ensure delivery of major projects.§Assume responsibility for key compliance requirements such as the§liquor licence, insurances, financial audit, SLS compliance and any ad hoc administrative and legal matters that may arise.§Key People you will be working with§The President of North Bondi SLSC§The Finance Director & other members of the Board of North Bondi SLSC§The full time, part time staff and contractors (including the external accounts§person) of North Bondi SLSC§Various Club Committees and section heads§Salary level§A Salary commensurate with the responsibility and seniority but noting the ‘not for profit’ nature of the Surf Club – minimum $100,000 pa plus Super. will be offered.§What it means to work at North Bondi SLSC§North Bondi SLSC is a volunteer organisation. Surf Lifesaving is part of the core fabric of Australian society. North Bondi is one of the oldest surf clubs in Australia and has a long and proud history dating back over 100 years. The club has over 2,000 members from a diverse range of backgrounds and levels of involvement in the Club.§The GM should be able to work with the Board and the staff at the club ensuring that the tasks required are completed on time and to the appropriate level of quality. At the same time the GM needs to ensure that the Club’s key outcomes, goals and strategic direction is achieved.§Experience and skills, you must have§• Have strong organisational skills§• Be able to manage cash flows and prepare budgets§• Be able to multi- task§• Be able to deal with different people from varied backgrounds§• Be able to demonstrate that you are able to manage a team of people§• Be able to communicate effectively§• Be able to determine and prioritise key tasks§• Manage a number of stakeholders’ expectations§• Be numerate and have an eye for detail§• A high level of intuition, common sense and curiosity§• Be technology oriented & have an advanced understanding of excel & word§• Have a very good understanding of systems & processes & be able to identify improvements to be made§• Be self-sufficient and be able to problem solve§• Be able to delegate§• A people’s person§• Professional ‘can do’ attitude§ §Experience and skills we would prefer you have§• Have managed successful and harmonious teams§• Be able to ensure accountability and ownership§• Familiarity with SLS processes§• Be skilled in having run your own business or having that ‘entrepreneurial spirit’ /sense of ownership - be able to treat the Club as your own.§sense of ownership – be able to treat the Club as your own.§§§§

This is an exciting opportunity and key leadership position within the Melbourne Football Club Women’s Program. This position extends to include overseeing and liaising between different departments within the AFLW and VFLW programs, reporting into the Manager – Football Operations.§ §This position will lead the Women’s Program, and ensure the program performs in line with Club expectations and our Club values of TRUE (Trust, Respect, Unity, Excellence).§ §This position will also be responsible for the management and the day to day operational requirements of the Women’s Football Program. This includes, but is not limited to, internal communication, logistics, travel bookings, scheduling, apparel ordering and stock control, AFL compliance, match day management, facilities bookings, and other operational matters in relation to the AFLW program.§ § § §KEY AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY § §AFLW Program Management§ § §Chair weekly Manager’s Meeting (Manager – Football Operations, AFLW Senior Coach, AFLW List Manager in attendance)§ §Attend weekly medical and player welfare meetings.§ §Be the conduit between high performance/medical/welfare and the coaching group.§ §Oversee and drive the off-field personal development plans, with the AFLW Player Development Manager.§ §VFLW Program Management§ § §Chair weekly Manager’s Meeting (VFLW Senior Coach, VFLW Operations Manager in attendance)§ §Be the conduit between the coaches and high performance/medical team.§ §AFLW Football Operations§ § §Oversee the coordination of the weekly training schedule, including liaising with MOPT regarding facilities bookings, ground bookings, parking availability.§ §Provide communication to other departments of the Club regarding the AFLW schedule when required, and availability of players/staff for appearances.§ §Manage apparel, equipment, and signage.§ §Coordinate AFLW camps and in-season interstate travel including flights, accommodation, bus transfers, airport parking and meal requirements.§ §Liaise with AFLW Player Development Manager to facilitate new player induction, where required.§ §Complete AFLW compliance requirements.§ §Weekly AFLW ticketing, match-day parking and match-day accreditation.§ §Manage AFLW player appearances, including availability, communication, and recording of hours.§ §Develop and strengthen stakeholder relationships (e.g. AFL, sponsors, suppliers)§ §Assist in coordination of media, coterie groups and events, where required.§ §Key §Competencies, Qualifications, Experience and Attributes§ § §Relevant tertiary degree in Business or Commerce is preferred.§ §Proven experience in a similar role.§ §Ability to build rapport and trust with senior AFL and MFC management, external stakeholders, and sponsors.§ §Demonstrated ability to handle multiple projects, plan effectively, prioritise and follow through.§ §Self-motivated with a commitment to achieving results.§ §Good influencing and problem-solving skills, including the ability to ‘think on your feet’§ §Excellent attention to detail with outstanding written and verbal communications skills.§ §Ability to be flexible and adaptable in a changing environment.§ §Passion for continuous improvement, with a focus on procedure and policy improvements.§ § § §AN OFFER TO YOU § §This position presents the opportunity to work in a unique environment at the home of sport within the Melbourne and Olympic Park Sporting Precinct. We provide a welcoming, safe, and flexible approach to work and provide an environment that benefits from and enables the best from everyone.§ §To be considered, please submit a cover letter and CV outlining your suitability for the role.§ Applications close Monday 12th October. § § § §The Melbourne Football Club is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from suitably qualified and diverse candidates. §As an organisation we are committed to protecting children and young people from harm. It is essential that anyone involved with the  Club understands their responsibility in relation to child safety. Our organisation requires all applicants to obtain a ‘Working with Children Check’ prior to appointment. §§§§

jobText: TXT/50658077.txt	§Physical Training Instructor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Physical Training Instructor§§Advertiser: §Defence Force Recruiting Western Region§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Salary§§$65,000 - $69,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Physical Training Instructor §      §        §Your role: §        §We’re on the lookout for people who are at the peak of their physical fitness—those who want to have a positive influence on Air Force personnel to ensure they are  physically and mentally prepared at all times  in the defence of our country. PTIs are the Air Force's specialists when it comes to exploiting the full human potential of its workforce. If you have a degree qualification, industry experience and a passion for developing higher level human performance, then the Physical Training Instructor role might be for you.§        §Being a PTI is one of the more physically demanding and rewarding roles of the military—ideal for those who are already involved in high performance strength and  conditioning training, elite sports, or high level human performance coaching.§        §An Air Force PTI is more than just a job, it’s a vocation and a way of life. Some typical tasks you can expect as part of your PTI duties include:§        § §        §•           Rehabilitation and injury prevention programs§        §•           High-performance physical strength, conditioning and fitness assessments§        §•           Physical wellness, mental wellness and resilience education§        §•           Development and delivery of physical training, recreational and sporting activities§        §•           Adventurous training (abseiling, climbing etc) activities§        §•           Delivery of non-lethal use of force training (unarmed combat)§        § §        §Life in the Air Force: §        §There’s no career that compares to one in the Air Force. Become a part of a world-class military force that operates some of the most advanced aircraft and defence technology in the world. You can expect to work in a uniquely challenging yet highly rewarding working environment that comes with good work/life balance, competitive salary and skills for life. There’s also a sense of accomplishment and pride from serving your country and helping to keep our airspace safe.§        §Life in the Air Force is anything but mundane. You’ll enjoy an exciting lifestyle, rewarding career, opportunities to travel, excellent social and fitness facilities, and free medical and dental; all in a dynamic and fulfilling working environment.§        § §        §Salary: §        §Get paid while you contextualise and further develop your current knowledge, skills and experiences in becoming a fully qualified Physical Training Instructor. Upon completion of a workplace training and assessment journal, you’ll enjoy a competitive starting salary package of: $68,626 plus generous super (salaries correct as of 01/08/2019).§        § §        §Apply Now: §        §For this role, you must be over 17 at time of enlistment, an Australian Citizen and have passed Year 10 English and Maths You must also have completed a Bachelor’s Degree in Health Science (Fitness or Exercise), Sport Science/Coaching (Strength and Conditioning) or similar. Refer to the link below for more information on accepted degrees. Some typical tasks you can expect as part of your PTI duties include:§ § § §•           Rehabilitation and injury prevention programs§ §•           High-performance physical strength, conditioning and fitness assessments§ §•           Physical wellness, mental wellness and resilience education§ §•           Development and delivery of physical training, recreational and sporting activities§ §•           Adventurous training (abseiling, climbing etc) activities§ §•           Delivery of non-lethal use of force training (unarmed combat)§ § § §Life in the Air Force: § §There’s no career that compares to one in the Air Force. Become a part of a world-class military force that operates some of the most advanced aircraft and defence technology in the world. You can expect to work in a uniquely challenging yet highly rewarding working environment that comes with good work/life balance, competitive salary and skills for life. There’s also a sense of accomplishment and pride from serving your country and helping to keep our airspace safe.§ §Life in the Air Force is anything but mundane. You’ll enjoy an exciting lifestyle, rewarding career, opportunities to travel, excellent social and fitness facilities, and free medical and dental; all in a dynamic and fulfilling working environment.§ § § §Salary: § §Get paid while you contextualise and further develop your current knowledge, skills and experiences in becoming a fully qualified Physical Training Instructor. Refer to the link below for more information on accepted degrees. jobTitle: Sport & Recreation Team Leader Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50597782.txt	§Sport & Recreation Team Leader§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Sport & Recreation Team Leader§§Advertiser: §Employment Office§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§$74,611-$83,385 + super, relocation & more§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Sport & Recreation Team Leader §      §        §          §Are you a leader in the health and fitness industry?§          §Exciting and rewarding opportunity to enrich the lives of Aboriginal people within Tennant Creek and the Barkly region!§          §Attractive remuneration package circa $74,611-$83,385 plus super,§ §relocation assistance, 6 weeks annual leave, subsidised accommodation & more!§        §        §About the Organisation§        §Anyinginyi Health Aboriginal Corporation§ (AHAC) is a multi-disciplinary organisation which provides primary health care services to the Aboriginal people of Tennant Creek and the surrounding Barkly region.§Anyinginyi §consists of five different sections (Health Centre, Corporate Services, Public Health Unit, Sports and Recreation, and Piliyintinji-Ki Stronger Families) which allows them to have an holistic approach to health ensuring that clients' physical and emotional health and wellbeing is given the utmost priority.§        §Anyinginyi§'s mission is to be a provider of high quality holistic primary health care services focusing on prevention and treatment in a culturally responsive way that empowers Aboriginal people to take more responsibility for their own health.§        §About the Opportunity §        §Anyinginyi§ has an exciting opportunity for an enthusiastic and community-minded §Sport & Recreation Team Leader§ to join the team in Tennant Creek, NT on a full-time ongoing basis.§        §Reporting to the Sport & Recreation Section Manager, you will §primarily be responsible for providing an efficient and effective Community Sports and Recreation Program to Aboriginal people and to the general community.§        §More specifically, some of your key duties will include (but will not be limited to):§        §          §Ensuring appropriate policies and procedures are implemented to ensure the protection, safety and welfare of all visitors with a particular emphasis on young people.§          §Managing, organising, training and supervising community sports & recreation staff;§          §Organising community sporting events, maintaining sports/recreation equipment, and keeping records/reports of sporting events and recreational activities;§          §Liaising with other sporting bodies and organisations;§          §Writing funding submissions to government and non-government agencies, and representing §Anyinginyi §at various sporting functions.§        §        §About the Benefits§        §This is a fantastic opportunity to enhance sport and recreational activity engagement and motivate the local community to remain socially and physically active.  §        §In return for your hard work and dedication, you will be rewarded with a highly §attractive remuneration package circa $74,611 - $83,385 plus super, negotiable with skills and experience.§        §Anyinginyi§ also offers a host of additional benefits to further increase your take-home pay, including:§        §          §6 weeks annual leave with 17.5% leave loading;§          §Salary sacrificing up to $15,899.94 p/a;§          §Subsidised furnished rental accommodation is available for candidates who are relocating;§          §Relocation assistance (up to $5,000);§          §One paid RDO monthly;§          §Free general medical;§          §Free general dentistry (excluding laboratory work);§          §Free gym membership;§          §Free medical prescriptions.§        §        §You will be joining a §friendly and professional team§, where you will also receive §personal and professional development opportunities.§        §About the Tennant Creek Region§        §Year round blue skies, stunning landscapes and vibrant, diverse and warm communities - that's life in the Northern Territory! Only a short flight from most Australian cities, Tennant Creek is not just a must-see destination renowned for its individual identity and rich cultural heritage, but is a remarkable community to set up home in!§        §500km north of Alice Springs, Tennant Creek was once a rough and tumble droving town, but is now a modern town and one of the Territory's most populated areas. It is home to a major regional hospital, a CDU campus, schools, shops and a supermarket, accommodation, bars, clubs and restaurants, banking facilities, sporting clubs and an airport - everything you need to set up a relaxing new lifestyle! People from all walks of life find themselves calling Tennant Creek home.§        § §        §Make a genuine difference in the Aboriginal community and instil variety into peoples lives - §Apply Now!§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ §Are you a leader in the health and fitness industry?§ §Exciting and rewarding opportunity to enrich the lives of Aboriginal people within Tennant Creek and the Barkly region!§ §Attractive remuneration package circa $74,611-$83,385 plus super,§ §relocation assistance, 6 weeks annual leave, subsidised accommodation & more!§ §About the Organisation§ §Anyinginyi Health Aboriginal Corporation§ (AHAC) is a multi-disciplinary organisation which provides primary health care services to the Aboriginal people of Tennant Creek and the surrounding Barkly region.§Anyinginyi §consists of five different sections (Health Centre, Corporate Services, Public Health Unit, Sports and Recreation, and Piliyintinji-Ki Stronger Families) which allows them to have an holistic approach to health ensuring that clients' physical and emotional health and wellbeing is given the utmost priority.§ §Anyinginyi§'s mission is to be a provider of high quality holistic primary health care services focusing on prevention and treatment in a culturally responsive way that empowers Aboriginal people to take more responsibility for their own health.§ §About the Opportunity § §Anyinginyi§ has an exciting opportunity for an enthusiastic and community-minded §Sport & Recreation Team Leader§ to join the team in Tennant Creek, NT on a full-time ongoing basis.§ §Reporting to the Sport & Recreation Section Manager, you will §primarily be responsible for providing an efficient and effective Community Sports and Recreation Program to Aboriginal people and to the general community.§ §More specifically, some of your key duties will include (but will not be limited to):§ § §Ensuring appropriate policies and procedures are implemented to ensure the protection, safety and welfare of all visitors with a particular emphasis on young people.§ §Managing, organising, training and supervising community sports & recreation staff;§ §Organising community sporting events, maintaining sports/recreation equipment, and keeping records/reports of sporting events and recreational activities;§ §Liaising with other sporting bodies and organisations;§ §Writing funding submissions to government and non-government agencies, and representing §Anyinginyi §at various sporting functions.§ §About the Benefits§ §This is a fantastic opportunity to enhance sport and recreational activity engagement and motivate the local community to remain socially and physically active.  § §In return for your hard work and dedication, you will be rewarded with a highly §attractive remuneration package circa $74,611 - $83,385 plus super, negotiable with skills and experience.§ §Anyinginyi§ also offers a host of additional benefits to further increase your take-home pay, including:§ § §6 weeks annual leave with 17.5% leave loading;§ §Salary sacrificing up to $15,899.94 p/a;§ §Subsidised furnished rental accommodation is available for candidates who are relocating;§ §Relocation assistance (up to $5,000);§ §One paid RDO monthly;§ §Free general medical;§ §Free general dentistry (excluding laboratory work);§ §Free gym membership;§ §Free medical prescriptions.§ §You will be joining a §friendly and professional team§, where you will also receive §personal and professional development opportunities.§ §About the Tennant Creek Region§ §Year round blue skies, stunning landscapes and vibrant, diverse and warm communities - that's life in the Northern Territory! Only a short flight from most Australian cities, Tennant Creek is not just a must-see destination renowned for its individual identity and rich cultural heritage, but is a remarkable community to set up home in!§ §500km north of Alice Springs, Tennant Creek was once a rough and tumble droving town, but is now a modern town and one of the Territory's most populated areas. jobText: TXT/50693656.txt	§F45 Berwick : Assistant Studio Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§F45 Berwick : Assistant Studio Manager§§Advertiser: §F45 Training St Kilda East§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §Bayside & South Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§F45 is a team-based functional training facility that is taking the world by storm. F45 places a huge emphasis on the three key factors of motivation, innovation, and results. Our classes are unique, fun and highly addictive which is why F45 Training is the most popular network of fitness studios in Australia.§  §We are on the hunt for a passionate and d§edicated Assistant Studio Manager §to help lead our team. §This role is on a Part Time salary and will consist of between 25-30 hours per week. You may be required to work weekends (mornings) and/or split shifts. §* Role to start once studio is permitted to open over next 2-6 weeks - dependant on government restrictions easing.§Who we are:§  §We are a dynamic company that focuses on member and team culture. Our priority is to ensure that our team has the opportunity for growth across all of our studios. §  §Who you are:§ § §You LOVE F45 Training! § §You are passionate about fitness§ §You are a team player§ §You love team training and group fitness§ §You love working and training in a fun team§ §You love the fitness industry because it allows you to help people be the best version of themselves.§ §You are organised, punctual and self-motivated.§ §You have initiative and can think on your feet§ §You take pride in your work and have an exceptional work ethic§ §You are energetic, have a vibrant personality and can command an audience§ §You thrive in a group environment, are friendly and are not afraid to talk to anyone and everyone§ §You have a thorough knowledge of exercise physiology and how to coach exercises with progressions and regressions§ §You are confident in your abilities as a trainer and can accept constructive criticism with an open attitude to up-skilling and progressing as a trainer and an individual§ §You have professional conduct 100% of the time and can leave your personal life at the door§ §You can run outdoor bootcamps§ §As the assistant manager you will be the role model and lead our committed, enthusiastic and experienced group of trainers. You will need passion and dedication for F45 and for helping people to excel in this permanent full-time role.  You will be working closely with and supporting the Studio Manager.§  §We want someone with 'personality plus' and a 'can-do attitude' who strives to be the best and wants to help promote and grow our F45 training studio. §  §This is an exciting opportunity for the right person to accelerate their aspirations. §  §Key Responsibilities: § § § §Deliver high quality, results-focused F45 group fitness classes and drive results for members§  § §Manage the studio team and create an exciting/motivating team dynamic§  § §Assist with membership acquisition and meeting monthly KPIs§  § §Boost membership retention and studio culture§  § §Membership induction and goal setting§  § §Be comfortable in creating content, and being in front of a camera for social media purposes.§  § §Coordinating 8 Week Challenges§ § §Ensure the studio is impeccably maintained.§  § § §Develop and help foster a positive, motivational and community-based team training environment.§  § § §Sales of F45 memberships internally and externally§  § §Experience and Qualifications:  § § § §Certificate III (min) and IV in fitness§  § § §Current First Aid and CPR §  § § §2+ year experience in the fitness industry is desirable§  § § §1+ year experience in F45 is preferable§  § § §Proven results in meeting KPIs and working with targets.§ § Applicants shortlisted will be contacted to schedule an interview. Please let us know what studio you are applying for in your resume, please.§ § Please include a cover letter that has a brief description about yourself and why you would be perfect for this position. Please also include the studio you are applying for. § More information on F45 Training can be found at www.f45training.com.au. §  § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Have you completed a qualification in fitness?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§How many years' experience do you have as a personal trainer?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

A positive demeanour and industry experience or relevant transferable skills and/or experience will be highly regarded. Current First Aid and Working With Children will be required.§For further information please contact Kylie Blair at Eaton Recreation Centre §9724 0409§.§How to apply :-§Please email your current Resume and cover letter stating why you would be a good fit for the role with reference to the above responsibilities to §hr@dardanup.wa.gov.au§.§The Shire of Dardanup is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer, where all applicants are treated with fairness and respect, and have equal access to all opportunities available.§      §    §    § §  §§§At Eaton Recreation Centre, we’re all about providing the best opportunities for our community and this drives our culture of constant-improvement and excellence in customer service.§Our 24-hour gym includes the latest in cutting-edge equipment, expert trainers, innovative group fitness classes, elite sporting competitions, tailor made children’s, adult and seniors programs and a bustling community hub promoting a Think Active lifestyle for all ages making this an exciting and dynamic place to work.§Work Type§ : 12 hours per week – 6 months fixed term§Includes weekends and after hours§Applications close§ : 9.00am Monday 12 October 2020§Level§ : Local Government Industry Award 2010§Level 4 – from $28.7930 per hour depending upon qualifications and experience.§We are seeking an energetic and organised individual Centre Supervisor to join our team.§The successful candidate will be responsible for:§ § §Overseeing the programs, services and hire groups that operate within the Centre§ §Routine set up and venue presentation/cleaning responsibilities§ §Assisting in all areas as required in the smooth and safe operation of the Centre§ §Supervision of staff and undertaking the responsibilities of the emergency warden for the venue while on duty.§ §This position would suit a confident individual who is happy working in a busy facility. A positive demeanour and industry experience or relevant transferable skills and/or experience will be highly regarded. Current First Aid and Working With Children will be required.§For further information please contact Kylie Blair at Eaton Recreation Centre §9724 0409§.§How to apply :-§Please email your current Resume and cover letter stating why you would be a good fit for the role with reference to the above responsibilities to §hr@dardanup.wa.gov.au§.§The Shire of Dardanup is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer, where all applicants are treated with fairness and respect, and have equal access to all opportunities available.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50532404.txt	§Personal Trainers Wanted§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Personal Trainers Wanted§§Advertiser: §Personal Best§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§Are You Passionate about Personal Training?§ § §No rent to pay, long-term security§ §Experienced, dynamic leadership team§ §Trainers required at Toowong now.§ §If this is you, ensure you complete your information at the link at the bottom of this ad.§ §Having over 20 years of history in the fitness sector, Personal Best is recognised as a growing leader in providing weight loss and fitness solutions for their clients! With a leadership team that are experts in their field, Personal Best has created a culture that is supportive, team orientated and relaxed.  We have a unique approach to providing cutting-edge fitness solutions.  At Personal Best we encourage you to show your individuality through your own set of skills, exercise prescription and personality.§ §All Personal Best trainers are employees so not only will you benefit from ongoing training and development, but there is no rent to pay and no clients to source. § §As a part of the Personal Best team, you will have the opportunity to provide:§ § §1 on 1 fitness training§ §Small group fitness training§ §Goal setting, fitness assessments, periodisation plans, exercise prescription and nutritional guidance for your clients§ §To become a personal trainer with Personal Best, it is necessary that you have:§ § §An exceptional service mindset§ §A drive to be successful in the fitness industry§ §A genuine love of helping people and a desire to help them become their personal best§ §A willingness to go 'Above and Beyond' in your duty and care for your clients§ §Great communication skills and can interact with different personality styles§ §A minimum of a Certificate 4 in Fitness§ §Registration with Fitness Australia§ §Up to date CPR and First aid qualifications§ §Transport (or live close to Personal Best-Toowong)§ §If you want a fantastic opportunity to be a part of an organisation who is a progressive leader within the fitness industry, please phone §0419 665 046§ for details of the application process.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50678955.txt	§Dance Teacher/Studio Owner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Dance Teacher/Studio Owner§§Advertiser: §Just Dancing§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§3 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§Doncaster East location, on-site parking§Niche dance school with potential for future growth§Great community of parents and students§Just Dancing Dance School was established in 2014 and offers dance tuition in classical, contemporary, jazz, tap, hip hop and character for students aged from 3 to 15.  The school promotes an open and friendly relationship with parents and students. Our classes include a variety of dance styles in the same class to reduce the cost and time for parents. All students participate in a mid-year classical ballet exam to focus on developing their classical technique and perform on our annual dance concert. §We are seeking an experienced, energetic, driven and friendly Dance Teacher who is interested in joining our dance school in late November 2020.  Initially you will be teaching alongside the current principal in November and December 2020 (your probationary period) on Saturdays and Monday afternoons. From February 2021, you will be solely teaching the grade 4 & 5 Saturday classes and the Monday classical & contemporary senior class (apart from a select number of dances).  After the annual performance, you will purchase and take full ownership of the dance school from mid August 2021. §The ideal candidate must have a minimum of 5 years dance teaching experience and preferably a dance teaching qualification.  You will possess the ability to teach classical, contemporary, jazz and tap (at all levels) and possibly other styles such as hip hop and character. §The key responsibilities include:§Dance teaching and choreography in the above dance styles;§Responsibility for all your own music for classes;§Assisting with costume fittings and other duties for the annual performance;§Other responsibilities as directed by the Principal.   §The following personal attributes are required:§Friendly, professional and approachable demeanour;§A proactive and energetic attitude towards your teaching role;§Excellent verbal communication skills;§Highly organised.§The ideal candidate would be someone who is very ambitious and career driven with the goal to become a Principal/Owner of a Dance School next year.§This is a casual role, approximately 6 hours per week over the school term.  Applications for this role should be marked attention to Rowena Kiely, Principal, Just Dancing Dance School and include a cover letter and an up to date resume.  Applications will close on Friday 23rd October 2020.  For further enquiries, please contact Rowena on §0413 183 457§.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a teacher?§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§§§

The role requires the creation of your own class plans and sets, in line with our general teaching philosophies and requirements.§  §ABOUT YOU§You will have a Bronze Coaching license or a Teacher of Competitive Strokes qualification with at least 2 years of coaching experience. jobTitle: Martial Arts Instructor Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50560116.txt	§Martial Arts Instructor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Martial Arts Instructor§§Advertiser: §Matt Fiddes Martial Arts Moreton§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §Northern Suburbs§§Salary§§$20 - $24.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§DO YOU HAVE A PASSION FOR MARTIAL ARTS & TEACHING?§If you can honestly answer §YES§, would you like to be part of one of the worlds most popular and fast growing activities on the planet, we may have the dream position for you.§THE OPPORTUNITY:§The §Matt Fiddes Martial Arts§ franchise is one of the largest and most successful brands of its type of in the world. §Since it’s launch in Australia, the brand has seen the successful opening of 42 locations and our fast growing franchise owners in the suburbs of North Brisbane are looking for new team members to help in their schools expansion. We have a great opportunity for the right person, with award pay, flexible hours and additional income streams including commissions for the right candidate with both casual and part time positions on offer with a longer term opportunity of management and even school ownership.§THE RIGHT FIT:§        ⁃       We are looking for a FUN, ENERGETIC AND APPROACHABLE MARTIAL ARTS INSTRUCTOR in our new school locations based in::§        ⁃       Although martial arts experience is required, instructing experience, although preferred, is not essential as we provide training in our award winning systems and syllabus.§        ⁃       A current blue card and first aid certificate must be held by the applicant as well as a current drivers license and transport.§        ⁃       You must have great communication skills and have a passion for working with children. Our instructors are an inspiration to their students and are leaders inside and out of their communities.§        ⁃       We are looking for casual or part-time Assistant Instructors, which can lead to full time positions even up to management and part ownership§        ⁃       Must be able to work from 3:30pm some afternoons including weekends if available.§        ⁃      § Dependable and reliable with an optimistic “Can Do” attitude!§ We are in the business of developing big thinking, positive human beings are who will become the leaders of tomorrow.§REWARDS:§Your remuneration will include a hourly rate, commissions. You will get further opportunities to generate extra income through the provision of personal / private tuition (when qualified and appropriate) as well as from extra programs the school provides such as belt gradings, kid’s parties, holiday camps and school programs. §For those who apply themselves, there will be management and even part ownership opportunities as the position develops.§INTERESTED ?§Email your resume  with a covering letter letting me know how you have previously mentored or inspired children to us at §mrmarshall@mattfiddes.com.au§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§§§
