jobTitle: Beginner Gymnastics Coach Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50629777.txt	§Beginner Gymnastics Coach§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Beginner Gymnastics Coach§§Advertiser: §YMCA§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §Parramatta & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§ §Located at Penrith YMCA§ §Make an impact in your community§ §Casual role§ § §Our Gymnastics Instructors are the agile athletes bringing fitness and fun to a new generation. Every day they lead incredible lessons jam-packed with the training to build confidence and healthy behaviours in developing young people. As a Gymnastics Instructor at The Y, you’ll be a strong communicator and a dynamic leader – drawing on your experience and background in gymnastics to motivate and engage our young community. You’ll also monitor industry and educational trends to improve and refine our Gymnastics Programs.§ §If you’re a motivated, proactive leader with strong people skills and energy for days, you could be our next Gymnastics Instructor. If so, expect perks like flexible hours and free facility membership, and the support to build valuable people, leadership and life skills – all while helping us inspire a healthy future for growing young children.§ § §Qualifications§ § §First Aid Certificate§ §CPR Certificate§ §Intermediate Gymnastics Coach Accreditation (Cert II)§ §Coach Affiliation/Technical Membership§ §Working with Children Check§ §Police Check§ § §Y work with us?§ § §Work within a supportive team environment§ §Room to learn and develop within the organisation§ §Flexible hours and arrangements, for a work-life balance that works for you§ §Awesome discounts on The Y services and products§ §Corporate health insurance cover to keep you healthy§ §§Who What Y?§YMCA NSW is a profit-for-purpose organisation focused on healthy living, social impact and empowering young people. We operate 23 recreation centres, 57 Out of School Hours Care services and two camping locations which fund our diverse range of youth and community programs, employing 1800 staff across NSW.§Our goal is for our workforce to reflect the diverse community we serve. We encourage people of all genders, ages, religions, disability, sexual orientation, family and caring responsibilities and cultures, including people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander heritage to apply.§Commitment to Safeguarding§The Y, including Boards of Directors, is committed to the safety and wellbeing of children and young people in accordance with our Safeguarding Children and Young People framework. The Y requires that all applicants undergo satisfactory screening prior to commencement, including but not limited to:§ §a national criminal history check;§ §an international criminal history check where applicants have worked overseas;§ §holding or obtaining a Working with Children Clearance/equivalent in accordance with state/ territory laws;§ §two reference checks.§ § §Please note, the results of any National and International Police Check will only be used to assess your suitability to perform the role.§ §Any successfully appointed applicant will be required to adhere to the Safeguarding Children and Young People framework, which includes a thorough safeguarding children and young people induction and committing to upholding the safety and wellbeing of children and young people throughout their engagement with YMCA.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

A community not-for-profit organisation with 17 million participations annually across Australia. 8,000 staff and volunteers serve at more than 150 locations every day. knowledge and understanding of all aspects of aquatic programs, educational trends and industry policy.§        §The Teachers of Swimming and Water Safety is responsible and commit to the YMCA Victoria including:§        §          §The philosophies of Aquatic Programs and Services§          §The delivery of safe, effective and professional lessons in a safe environment.§        §          §Display interest, enthusiasm, patience, respect and innovation to students and peers.§          §Construct and implement lesson plans that promote group teaching methods, combining stroke development with water safety and enhancing the developmental assets aspect of programs.§          §Structures and designs lessons with appropriate activities that enhance student interaction and collaboration§          §Challenges and develops student's values and attitudes§        §        §2.§      §Communication §        §          §Listens and is objective and non - judgemental always ensuring respectful language§          §Exhibits concern and interest for the feelings and experiences of others§          §Exhibits personal values and behaviour that instils trust§          §Initiates and nurtures group interaction§          §Teaches and models effective problem solving and conflict negotiation§        §        §3.§      §Administration §        §          §Work within a team environment to ensure safe, timely and effective set up / lesson delivery & pack up§          §Construct and submit for archiving, appropriate lesson plans§          §Ensure appropriate attendance and competency records are completed, collated and submitted of archiving§          §Comply with legislative and organisational requirements relating to:§          §Current water restrictions§          §Occupational health and safety§          §Guidelines for safe pool operation§          §Perform other duties as required and comply with reasonable directions' as last deliverable / accountability§        §        §Selection Criteria§        §Capabilities and Behaviours§        §          §Demonstrates YMCA Victoria values, §Honesty, Caring, Respect and We partner with government and private capital to deliver programs and services that include community recreation, adventure and stadium sports, camping, learn to swim, children's programs, early learning, youth services, retirement living, disability services and social enterprises.§ §About the Centre§ §​​The SA Aquatic & Leisure Centre; a state-of-the-art indoor aquatic and gym facility, providing in excess of 1,000 square metres of water space, together with full gym facilities to meet varied elite and community needs. The facility provides opportunities for all South Australian's to 'be active'.​§ §Key Elements of the Role§ §​Teachers of Swimming and Water Safety are required to maintain thorough knowledge and understanding of all aspects of aquatic programs, educational trends and industry policy.§ §The Teachers of Swimming and Water Safety is responsible and commit to the YMCA Victoria including:§ § §The peers.§ §Construct and implement lesson plans that promote group teaching methods, combining stroke development with water safety and enhancing the developmental assets aspect of programs.§ that instils trust§ §Initiates and nurtures group interaction§ §Teaches and models effective problem solving and conflict negotiation§ §3.§      §Administration § § §Work within a team environment to ensure safe, timely and effective set up / lesson delivery & pack up§ §Construct and submit for archiving, appropriate lesson plans§ §Ensure appropriate attendance and competency records are completed, collated and submitted of archiving§ §Comply with legislative and organisational requirements relating to:§ §Current water restrictions§ §Occupational health and safety§ §Guidelines for safe pool operation§ §Perform other duties as required and comply with reasonable directions' as last deliverable / accountability§ §Selection Criteria§ §Capabilities and Behaviours§ § §Demonstrates YMCA Victoria values, §Honesty, Caring, Respect and Responsibility§ §Demonstrates motivation and commitment to perform to their best§ §Accepts personal accountability for workplace actions and abilities and faith§ §Builds on diversity to strengthen YMCA aquatic programs and services§ §Performs other duties as required§ §Knowledge and Experience§ § §Dealing with difficult customers§ §Being jobText: TXT/50534961.txt	§Personal Trainer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Personal Trainer§§Advertiser: §Vision Personal Training Gymea§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §Southern Suburbs & Sutherland Shire§§Salary§§$30 - $39.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§About us§We're looking for a Fitness Professional with personality who plans on living the life they want and not stuck in a "job" for the rest of their life. Vision Personal Training Gymea's goal is to change YOUR life by helping you change as many client's lives as possible along the way. We are a family at Gymea and always put our people first. We strive to hit big personal and team goals. When we win, we party to celebrate. §What you will need§* Certificate IV in Fitness§* Current First Aid certificate and CPR/AED certification§* A passion for helping clients achieve amazing results §* A genuine interest in understanding nutrition and macronutrients§* Love keeping their own body healthy and training regularly§* NO EXPERIENCE IN FITNESS INDUSTRY NECESSARY§Our Franchise owners Darren and Matt are committed to growing trainers through the career path. Darren and Matt have gone from Personal Trainer to Manager to Franchise Owner of some of the most successful Personal Training Studios in Australia.§We have also mentored some of the best personal trainers in the industry. We will work to build your appointment book around it§§§§

jobText: TXT/50542331.txt	§Swim Instructor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Swim Instructor§§Advertiser: §Imagine your career with Churchesof Christ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sunshine Coast§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Swim Instructor §      §        §Churches of Christ in Queensland, Little Mountain Integrated Campus - Aquatic Centre§        §Casual opportunities§        §About the role§        §An exciting opportunity exists for a self-motivated, experienced individual, who enjoys variety within a challenging role, to join our team at our Little Mountain Campus. We are an active part of the Sunshine Coast community and will continue to expand our services in the Sunshine Coast region, utilising our integrated community model.§        §The Little Mountain Aquatic Centre as part of our community hub, boasts the following state-of-the-art swim facilities:§        §          §25m heated lap pool§          §7.5m undercover heated learn-to-swim pool§          §Ample amenities, seating and storage§        §        §You will facilitate swim programs to suit various skill levels that will provide positive benefits to the health, fitness and well-being of the clients of our Aquatic Centre. Your responsibilities will include but are not limited to:§        §          §Assessing and grading swimmer ability;§          §Conducting learn to swim lessons according to the set program;§          §Setting up, packing up and maintain swimming equipment required for lessons;§          §Conducting regular assessments of the pool and pool surrounds to ensure a safe environment;§          §Maintaining attendance records and monitor student progress to evaluate the program;§          §Liaising with other instructors, parents and students to improve service delivery;§          §Assisting to develop new and maintain existing aquatic programs;§          §General cleaning and maintenance of facilities and equipment.§        §        §In this casual position, you will be covering staffing requirements during planned or unplanned leave times. This role will be will commence at the beginning of October.§        §About you§        §You are a highly motivated and confident swim instructor with extensive experience in the aquatics industry. Due to your excellent communication and customer service skills you have the capacity to work effectively with numerous competing priorities. Your can do attitude and pro-active approach enable you to be efficient and reliable, with a passion to help your clients achieve positive health, fitness and well-being outcomes.§        §Your experience and qualifications for this role include:§        §          §Strong communication skills with an ability to inspire others;§          §Minimum one year of experience in 'Learn to Swim' programs;§          §Current First Aid and CPR Certificate;§          §Current AUSTSWIM (or equivalent) Teacher of Swimming and Water Safety qualification (additional accreditations desirable);§          §Current working with children (blue) card or ability to obtain.§        §        §Importantly, you will be someone who closely aligns with our organisational values of: §Unconditional Love, Continual Innovation, Mutual Trust and Wise Stewardship.§        §Who we are§        §We offer over 200 services in more than 100 communities positively impacting around 45,000 lives each year. Our care services range from children, youth and family services, early intervention and protection, affordable housing, and seniors and support living, making us one of Australia's largest, most diverse not-for-profit organisations.§        §Imagine working for us§        §Our values encourage us to be accepting of differences and embrace all. Our size and variety offers you real choice and opportunities to grow your career. You'll also find we offer a family friendly work culture.§        §Remuneration packages come complete with salary-packaging benefits that can increase your take-home pay along with a generous five weeks of annual leave and the ability to purchase more (for eligible employees). To ensure your career can grow, we are constantly exploring innovative training and development programs. Most importantly, you will help us touch the lives of thousands of vulnerable Australians. Just imagine that.  §        §To apply§        §To apply for this position please click the Apply button. For further information, please contact Renee Waldron on §0437 807 948§.§        §We actively encourage and invite applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people for all our positions.§                                      §        §Applications close:§ Applications will be reviewed as received.§      §      §      §    §    §imagineyourcareer.com.au§  §§§Churches of Christ in Queensland, Little Mountain Integrated Campus - Aquatic Centre§Casual opportunities§About the role§An exciting opportunity exists for a self-motivated, experienced individual, who enjoys variety within a challenging role, to join our team at our Little Mountain Campus. This role will be will commence at the beginning of October.§About you§You are a highly motivated and confident swim instructor with extensive experience in the aquatics industry. Due to your excellent communication and customer service skills you have the capacity to work effectively with numerous competing priorities. Your can do attitude and pro-active approach enable you to be efficient and reliable, with a passion to help your clients achieve positive health, fitness and well-being outcomes.§Your experience and qualifications for this role include:§Strong communication skills with an ability to inspire others;§Minimum one year of experience in 'Learn to Swim' programs;§Current First Aid and CPR Certificate;§Current AUSTSWIM (or equivalent) Teacher of Swimming and Water Safety qualification (additional accreditations desirable);§Current working with children (blue) card or ability to obtain.§Importantly, you will be someone who closely aligns with our organisational values of: §Unconditional Love, Continual Innovation, Mutual Trust and Wise Stewardship.§Who we are§We offer over 200 services in more than 100 communities positively impacting around 45,000 lives each year. Our care services range from children, youth and family services, early intervention and protection, affordable housing, and seniors and support living, making us one of Australia's largest, most diverse not-for-profit organisations.§Imagine working for us§Our values encourage us to be accepting of differences and embrace all. jobTitle: Swimming - Head Coach Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50535060.txt	§Swimming - Head Coach§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Swimming - Head Coach§§Advertiser: §Mount Alvernia College§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§Mount Alvernia is a Catholic Girls’ College which strives for excellence in all aspects of the education of young women.  Our College is based on the tradition of St Francis and St Clare and employees are expected to support Catholic and Franciscan values.§ §The College is seeking a suitably qualified swim coach to lead its College Swimming Programme.§ §The Role§ §Mount Alvernia College Swimming Program operates in Term 4 and Term 1 in our 25m 8 lane pool, providing aquatic coaching services to Mount Alvernia College students of all levels. The College also participates in a joint swimming club with Padua College (United Swimming Club). This link to the club helps provide a development pathway for all athletes to progress from school swimming to club swimming.§ §Mount Alvernia College is currently seeking a qualified coach to operate this program on a casual employment basis. The role will commence in Term 4, 2020. Continuation of the role season to season is preferential, further work in other sport areas may also be available.  § §The Successful Candidate§ §You will be an experienced swim coach who is capable of stroke correction in all areas of swimming.  You will have high interpersonal skills and be a confident communicator to groups of students.  An understanding of interschool swimming competitions would be beneficial.§ §The following criteria must be addressed to demonstrate your suitability for the role:§ § §Appropriate/ relevant coaching accreditations and experience§ §Current First Aid/ CPR Certificate§ §Excellent communication skills§ §Willingness to work with other coaches and staff§ §Enthusiasm§ §Love of sport and a desire to work with young people§ §Punctuality§ §Reliability§ §Excellent organisational abilities§ §Enthusiastic team member§ §Good IT skills§ §Attention to detail§ §Blue Card§ §Coaches must hold a current paid Blue Card (for working with children) prior to commencing in this role.§ §Pay Rates§Excellent pay rates are negotiated dependent on qualifications and experience.§ §Hours§ §Approximately 10 hours per week, outside of school hours§ §Application Process§ §Shortlisted applicants will be invited to a short interview with the Director of Sport. Terms and conditions of employment will be discussed during the interview.§ §Applications close 5.00pm, Friday 2 October 2020§.§ §Please forward applications (CV and cover letter) to the Director of Sport at §sport@mta.qld.edu.au§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§Which of the following First Aid accreditations do you currently hold?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Personal Trainer - Snap Fitness South Brisbane Clubs Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50547340.txt	§Personal Trainer - Snap Fitness South Brisbane Clubs§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Personal Trainer - Snap Fitness South Brisbane Clubs§§Advertiser: §TBH Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §Southern Suburbs & Logan§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§§WHAT QUALIFICATIONS WILL I NEED?§ §To successfully apply for this role, you will need to obtain the following credentials;§ § § § § §     Cert IV in Fitness§ § § §     Current First Aid and CPR§ § § §     ABN & Public liability/professional indemnity insurance§ § § § §WHAT DOES THE CLUB OFFER?§ §You will be provided with quality leads and support for your business no matter what level of experience you have in the fitness industry, in a fair environment and supportive team.§ § § §Business Planning and Mentorship§ §Let us start your career by assigning you your own PT mentor to deliver an initial 1 week Business Development induction, 12 Week Training & Development program, and ongoing weekly Strategy Meetings. Trainers are also equipped with access to our Online Portal containing ready to use client and business management software, along with templates and resources to download for your PT business.§ § § §Affordable Business Model§ §We offer an initial build up phase to assist you in the early stages of growing your clientbase, along with a competitive rent rate making us one of the lowest cost contractor models in the industry. We also have career progression opportunities for PT’s looking to advance into paid management roles within our group locally or even nationally.§ § § §Fair Member Ratio§ §We operate in a small box community based gym, meaning we only hire trainers to meet our qualified lead demands. We provide a member to trainer ratio of 300: 1 giving our team equal share to build long term client bases. We also assist our trainers with getting clients by selling new member PT introduction packs, providing access to our member database, and including our PT’s into club social media campaigns.§ § § §WHAT CAN YOU EARN?§ §As a business owner you will have the freedom to charge your own rates and set your own training packages with the minimum session rate starting at $1/min.§ §Earning capacity in this role is unlimited as the more sessions you service the more money you will make, with the average trainer’s income around $50-80K per annum.§ § § §WHAT IS THE CLUB LOOKING FOR?§ §Our team is seeking a fitness professional who is ready to commence a long-term career in our club. To be successful in this model you will need to be competent in the following areas;§ § § § § §     Open to providing new member orientations and training sessions§ § § §     Ability in running small group training sessions§ § § §     Open to contribute and participate in club activities and campaigns§ § § §     Passionate about health and fitness and workout regularly§ § § §     Enthusiastic and not afraid to approach people§ § § §     Exceptional customer service, communication and sales skills§ § § §     Ability to build and manage a business and be open to further learning§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Have you completed a qualification in fitness?§§§

We are very open to hiring several teachers to share this role. The primary duty of this position is to teach water safety, basic swimming skills and stroke correction to children aged from 4-12 years at the Oxley Otters Swim Club, based at Oxley State School. § §To be successful in the role you will have experience working with small groups of children and be able to transfer your enthusiasm for swimming to the children in your classes, with safety and organisation skills essential for this role. § §You will also need to have a Learn to Swim qualification, a working blue card, and Perform CPR certificate. We have Austswim assessors on hand ready to help you gain your final sign off if thats all you need. § §Our swim club is part of a wonderful school and community village and we will be sure to make you feel very welcome. Come and join us for swimming across the summer season, with possible extension past Easter next year. We are a seasonal swim club but willing to pay above award wages to attract and retain great staff. §Our outdoor 25 m pool has a solar heating system installed to help take the chill off the beginning and end of the season. §Please come and join us. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a teacher?§Which of the following First Aid accreditations do you currently hold?§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§Which of the following AUSTSWIM training courses have you completed?§§§

jobText: TXT/50573208.txt	§Amazing Personal Trainer at Vision Personal Training Mosman§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Amazing Personal Trainer at Vision Personal Training Mosman§§Advertiser: §HealthyPeople§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §North Shore & Northern Beaches§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§ABOUT THE ROLE§  §Be part of a great team and supportive culture your team of mentors have over 25 years of industry experience, all while enjoying flexible working hours and training from the industries best! Our development program and mentoring support will ensure you are the best you can be!§  §Vision Mosman's goal is to change YOUR life by helping you change as many client’s lives as possible along the way. We are a family at Vision Mosman and always put our people first.§  §Our trainers inspire their Clients through:§ § §One on One Personal Training and Group Training Sessions§ §Goal Setting and Nutrition Sessions§ §Seminar and Shopping Tours§ §We will take care of all the hard stuff so you can focus on getting clients great results.§ § §You won’t be required to pay rent.§ §Vision will look after all your tax obligations and insurances.§ §Vision will provide you with a full 2XU PT Uniform.§ §SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE§  §All applicants must have:§ § §Certificate IV in Fitness§ §Current Senior First Aid certificate and CPR/AED certification§ §A Valid Working with Children Check (WWC)§ §Boxing for Fitness Accreditation§ §A positive attitude and eagerness to grow and develop with us!§ §A genuine interest in understanding nutrition and macronutrients.§ §BUSINESS SUMMARY§  §Our members at Vision PT Mosman value their health and fitness and can afford to invest in getting great results, which may your job easier and more fulfilling. You will work and be mentored by a team Ten trainer with over 40 years of industry experience to help you become the absolute best you can be. jobTitle: Swim Teacher Job in Sydney - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50543926.txt	§Swim Teacher§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Swim Teacher§§Advertiser: §Belgravia Health & Leisure Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§NSW, Cook & Phillip Aquatic & Fitness Centre - Sydney 2000§ §Cook+Phillip Park Pool§Ian Thorpe Aquatic Centre§Victoria Park Pool§Andrew (Boy) Charlton Pool§Prince Alfred Park Pool§§Do you have energy, enthusiasm and a desire to help people?§Are you a people-person who can foster a safe but fun environment with swimming students, parents and carers?§Are you able to teach people of all ages and abilities about water safety and how to swim?§Would you like to work in some of Sydney’s most iconic locations?§ §We are looking for some new Learn to Swim (LTS) Instructors, able to provide exceptional swimming lessons to groups, schools and individuals. Working within swimming program guidelines, we need people who can create a safe, fun and educational environment, in which students progressively learn to swim, and are encouraged to move into competitive swimming as required.§ §About the roles§Conducting safe, positive and motivating swimming classes around a structured program, our LTS Instructors assess each student’s level of competency, and instruct them within a swimming program with structured pathways. As strong swimmers themselves with a passion for all things aquatic, they are able to demonstrate correct swimming techniques, provide explanations and improve swimmer performance with encouragement, positive reinforcement and feedback. We also invite our LTS Instructors to partner with us in developing ideas for new swimming programs and initiatives, including those for people with a disability, and aged over 55. § §What’s more, being in the City of Sydney’s local government area, our pools are located in some of Sydney’s most beautiful locations including the Royal Botanical Gardens, Prince Alfred Park and Victoria Park. Our participant mix is also very diverse and includes school and university students, inner city dwellers, people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, and those aged over 55. We also work in partnership with a range of community organisations intent on helping people see swimming as a means of restorative physical and mental health.§ §What we are looking for in our ideal candidates:§Sound knowledge of swimming industry practices, teaching and coaching principles§Ability to manage students of various ages and abilities in an aquatic learning environment§Proven interpersonal skills, and ability to act with courtesy and professionalism§Strong communication skills and ability to convey clear instructions and information§Reliability, punctuality and excellent standards of personal grooming§Ability to work a variety of shifts including weekdays, weekends and afternoons§Swimming qualifications e.g. Swim Australia or AUSTSWIM Teacher of Swimming and Water Safety§Current First Aid & CPR Certificate, Working with Children Check, and National Police Check.§ §If you are a parent with part-time availability, a person returning to the workforce and/or someone who is looking for a great role that helps people learn, and connects them to leisure, we’d love to hear from you.§ §Simply complete the application process by clicking the Apply Now button and we’ll be in touch.§ §Sydney 2000 NSW§§§§

jobTitle: Gymnastics Coach Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50594760.txt	§Gymnastics Coach§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Gymnastics Coach§§Advertiser: §YMCA of Brisbane§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§$26.93 p/hr - $30.96 p/hr + super§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Gymnastics Coach §      §The YMCA operates a number of services including Child Care, health and fitness, education and training, outdoor education and camping, accommodation and hospitality along with benevolent activities including the YMCA Vocational School and the Schools' Breakfast program. §      §        §The YMCA§ is one of the largest providers of sport and recreation in Queensland. We offer recreational and competitive classes weekly in Kindergym, Recreational through the Steps Program as well WAG, MAG and Gym Fit for teenagers.§        § §        §If you are passionate about gymnastics and making a difference in kids’ lives, engaging, and results orientated, then your YMCA career is about to take off.§        § §        §Come and join our fantastic team at §Bowen Hills§! We are currently looking for a new enthusiastic §qualified Gymnastics Coach §to join our existing team. §        § §        §ABOUT US§        §The YMCA §is one of the largest providers of sport and recreation in Queensland. We offer recreational and competitive classes weekly in Kindergym, Recreational through the Steps Program as well WAG, MAG and Gym Fit for teenagers. §        § §        §What traits do you need!§        §          §Our YMCA Values -  Respect, Caring, Honesty and Responsibility,§          §A love and passion for working with and helping kids become their best;§          §A positive attitude and conscientious approach to your work;§          §Attention to detail, engaging and enthusiastic about gymnastics;§          §Ability to work flexible work hours. §        §        § §        §The YMCA Way!§        §          §Creating a safe environment for all our children to learn, grow and develop;§          §Supporting our gymnasts to grow in body, mind and spirit;§          §Supporting our staff through training, mentoring, educational opportunities and the YMCA coaching congress.§        §        § §        §Gymnastics Coach Accreditation§        §Pre-requisites§        §Applicants must hold:§        §          §an intermediate Gymnastics Australia Coach Accreditation (intermediate WAG),§          §hold a current Blue Card;§          §First Aid and CPR; §          §National Police Check (or the ability to obtain) and be able to communicate fluently and effectively to parents.§        §        § §        §Kingergym qualifications are desired. §        § §        §Job Benefits§        §A coach is a role model, an inspiring person that can have a positive impact on a child’s life or chosen path.§        § §        § §        §Interested? Apply now!§        §To find out more about the YMCA please visit our website www.ymcabrisbane.org§        § §        § §        §To apply§, please upload a covering letter outlining your experience and qualifications against the selection criteria outlined above and your resume by clicking the 'Apply' button below.§        § §        §Applications close on Friday, 9th October 2020. §        § §        §You must have working rights in Australia to be able to apply for this position.§        § §        §YMCA, including Boards of Directors, is committed to the safety and wellbeing of children and young people in accordance with our Safeguarding Children and Young People framework. YMCA requires that all applicants undergo satisfactory screening prior to commencement, including but not limited to:§        § §        §          §a national criminal history check;§          §an international criminal history check where applicants have worked overseas;§          §holding or obtaining a Working with Children Clearance/ equivalent in accordance with state/ territory laws.§        §        § §        §Any successfully appointed applicant will be required to adhere to the Safeguarding Children and Young People framework, which includes a thorough safeguarding children and young people induction and committing to upholding the safety and wellbeing of children and young people throughout their engagement with YMCA.§      §      §The YMCA is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to safeguarding children and young people. §    §    §  §§§The YMCA§ is one of the largest providers of sport and recreation in Queensland. Our progressive learn-to-swim program delivers proven results for our students in a fun, structured environment with a focus on water safety.§  §Learn to Swim Instructors§  §With 5 great locations across Brisbane, (Everton Hills, Sunnybank Hills, Manly West, Forest Lake & Springwood) - we are currently looking for new, enthusiastic team members to join us on our fast-growing journey.§  §Our Learn-to-swim and Infants Instructors are the core of our success, and enjoy great-hourly rates, ongoing support from our Training & Development Manager and a friendly, supportive team environment. Our motivated instructors teach levels from infants (6 Months) through to stroke development, all with the support of our experienced and professional management & operations team.§  §Shifts are available from Monday to Sunday; morning shifts are approx. 8.30am to 11.00am and afternoon shifts are from 3.30pm to 6.00pm. jobTitle: Regional Track Co-ordinator Job in Coffs Harbour & North Coast - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50703803.txt	§Regional Track Co-ordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Regional Track Co-ordinator§§Advertiser: §Greyhound Racing NSW§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Coffs Harbour & North Coast§§Salary§§$65,000 - $74,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Other§§§§§§Greyhound Racing NSW (§GRNSW§) is a body corporate constituted by the Greyhound Racing Act 2017 charged with providing strategic direction and leadership in the development of greyhound racing in NSW. GRNSW is the peak body of the sport and is responsible for ensuring competitiveness and long-term commercial viability of greyhound for the benefit of participants, business partners and the community.§GRNSW is seeking a passionate and professional person to fill the role of Regional Track Co-Ordinator for the Northern NSW/New England and Mid North Coast region.§The role reports to the GRNSW General Manager of Tracks & Infrastructure. §Persons with previous experience in related fields will be regarded favorably.§The successful candidate will be able to demonstrate the following:§Key accountabilities§:§Day to day oversight of track maintenance and curation within their region§Coordinate all curation services, audits and maintenance in accordance with agreed schedules§Compliance of tracks to defined standards§Identify and rectify minor issues or works.§Guide, coach and support to race track curators and track staff§Establish and maintain effective relationships with internal and external stakeholders to ensure expectations are met§Provide regular reports to the General Manager Tracks & Infrastructure on issues, maintenance and compliance§Key challenges§Carrying out track curation and maintenance in a way that minimises impact on the race day operations§Incorporating animal welfare and safety into good practice track curation and maintenance§Skills and Experience§Proved experience in track curation or similar§Qualifications and/or extensive experience in Sports Turf Management, Construction, Horticulture or Racing Track Maintenance and Track preparation§Demonstrated leadership and people management skills including the ability to assist track staff and contractors as required.§Well-developed interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills to build and maintain collaborative relationships with a diverse range of stakeholders.§Demonstrated time management and problem solving skills necessary to work with limited supervision to prioritise tasks and achieve deadlines.§Demonstrated ability to work effectively as part of a team to achieve common organisational goals.§Capacity to use technology and applications such as Microsoft Office suite, work requisitions and databases.§Ability to operate a tractor and medium rigid machinery; capacity to obtain other licences and certifications if required (e.g. forklift, skid steer)§Current WHS qualifications (desirable)§In this role, you will require a current driver's licence and you will be supplied with a vehicle to enable travel around various venues throughout the state as required. The role also requires working on weekends and nights.§To apply, please forward cover letter addressing the above-mentioned selection criteria together with a copy of your resume to §recruitment@grnsw.com.au§ [link removed]§For further information about the position, please contact General Manager Tracks & Infrastructure Mr. David Aldred on §0418 252542§ or email §daldred@grnsw.com.au§.§Applications close 5:00pm Friday 30 October 2020§GRNSW is an EEO Employer. All offers of employment are subject to satisfactory police and reference check. All employees must have the right to work in Australia.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years of people management experience do you have?§How many years of asset management experience do you have?§Are you available to travel for this role when required?§§§

jobTitle: NETBALL PROGRAM COORDINATOR Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50712781.txt	§NETBALL PROGRAM COORDINATOR§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§NETBALL PROGRAM COORDINATOR§§Advertiser: §Camberwell Girls Grammar School§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §NETBALL PROGRAM COORDINATOR §      §        §Leading independent girls' school, Camberwell Girls Grammar presents an exciting opportunity for a passionate and experienced Netball Program Coordinator to join our PE Department.§        §This is a part-time ongoing position, commencing from Term 1, 2021.§        §The Netball Program Coordinator is responsible for the overall coordination of the School's Saturday Netball Program activities, training and all matches.  The CGGS Saturday Netball program is an independent netball program that is run in conjunction with the School. Players participate on either Friday or Saturday in the Boroondara Netball Association (BNA) competition.   §        §The successful candidate must have outstanding netball coaching and umpiring skills.  As well as a love for the game, excellent interpersonal skills, organisation and planning abilities are required.  §        §A position description and application requirements are available under the Employment section of the CGGS website at www.cggs.vic.edu.au.  §        §All applications must be submitted directly to the CGGS Director of HR via email at §employment@cggs.vic.edu.au§ § §CLOSING DATE: Any applications received after 5.00pm on Monday 19 October, 2020 will not be considered.§        § §        §CGGS is committed to a child safe and equal opportunity workplace§        § §      §      §      §    §    §      §        §          §            §Senior School/Administration§ 2 Torrington Street§ Canterbury VIC 3126§ T (§+613) 9813 1166§            §Junior School/Ormiston§ 4 Mont Albert Road§ Canterbury VIC 3126§ T (§+613) 9813 1965§            § §            §camgram@camgirls.vic.edu.au§ camberwellgirls.net§              § ABN 79 004 166 349     CRICOS 00141J§            §          §        §      §    §  §§§Leading independent girls' school, Camberwell Girls Grammar presents an exciting opportunity for a passionate and experienced Netball Program Coordinator to join our PE Department.§ §This is a part-time ongoing position, commencing from Term 1, 2021.§ §The Netball Program Coordinator is responsible for the overall coordination of the School's Saturday Netball Program activities, training and all matches.  The CGGS Saturday Netball program is an independent netball program that is run in conjunction with the School. Players participate on either Friday or Saturday in the Boroondara Netball Association (BNA) competition.   § §The successful candidate must have outstanding netball coaching and umpiring skills.  As well as a love for the game, excellent interpersonal skills, organisation and planning abilities are required.  § §A position description and application requirements are available under the Employment section of the CGGS website at www.cggs.vic.edu.au.  § §All applications must be submitted directly to the CGGS Director of HR via email at §employment@cggs.vic.edu.au§ § §CLOSING DATE: Any applications received after 5.00pm on Monday 19 October, 2020 will not be considered.§ § § §CGGS is committed to a child safe and equal opportunity workplace§ § §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Sports Educator - After School Club - Booragoon Area Job in Perth - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50668741.txt	§Sports Educator - After School Club - Booragoon Area§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Sports Educator - After School Club - Booragoon Area§§Advertiser: §Junior Adventures Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Salary§§For more info call Mayson on 0432 212 818§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Sports Educator - After School Club - Booragoon Area §      §        §§        § §        §Welcome to Junior Adventures Group. We are a multi-brand Education provider with leading Before and After School Care brands OSHClub, Helping Hands and Primary OSHCare. We understand the quality of our staff drives our success and live our company values, Considerate, Passionate, Courageous, every day, as we work collaboratively with schools and communities in building brighter futures together!§ § §WHY WORK WITH JUNIOR ADVENTURES GROUP (JAG)?§          §            §Join a highly recognised and reputable OSHC provider with National presence.§            §Fantastic career progression and professional development opportunities.§            §Paid training, free uniform, split shift allowance and leave loading§            §Permanent part-time roles - secure, reliable employment - great work/life balance!§            §Employee Assistance Program - we care about your welfare!§            §Range of discounted goods & services through our employee benefits program, including movie tickets, travel, and so much more.§          §WHAT TO EXPECT AS AN EDUCATOR:§ § Reporting to the Coordinator the essential purpose of this role is to assist and support the Coordinator in the delivery of the best in market Outside School Hours Care, promoting service excellence while supporting growth and maximising value. This will be achieved by providing an inclusive and fun environment in which children are safe, engaged and well supervised and by contributing to program planning and development through reflections and child observations.§ § The Educator may be asked to assume the responsibility for the supervision of staff, children and OSHC service in the absence of the Coordinator and the Assistant Coordinator.§ § §The successful applicant must be available to work a minimum of 18 hours per week across the following times:§          §            §Monday -* Friday; 2:30 pm - 6:00 pm§            §*Wednesday; 2:00 pm - 6:00 pm§            §The above hours will be workable across school terms, however, the total weekly hours are also guaranteed across School Holiday periods.§          §ABOUT THE PROGRAM§ § The program caters for Booragoon Primary students from Kindergarten to Year 6 and is located in the suburb of Booragoon, 13 kilometres south-west of the Perth CBD. We pride ourselves in providing children with a fun and enjoyable experience. From exciting activities and healthy, nutritious snacks to caring, motivated staff, the program meets all our children’s needs within a safe, fun and stimulating environment.§ § §ABOUT YOU§ § Play is vital to children's well-being and sense of belonging and forms the basis of who they become in the future. Our ideal team member strongly reflects these qualities.§ § §To be successful you will meet the following criteria:§          §            §Valid rights to work in Australia,§            §Hold a current Working with Children’s Check (WWCC),§            §Most importantly, a motivation to work with school-aged children and participate in fun and engaging ‘learn through play’ activities.§          §You will also hold a completed qualification from the below list of ACECQA approved qualifications for educators working with over preschool-age children:§          §            §Certificate IV in Outside School Hours Care§            §Certificate lV in Education Support§            §Diploma of Children's Services (Early Childhood Education and Care)§            §Diploma of School Age Education and Care§            §Degree or diploma in education, recreation, sport science, leisure studies, social and behavioural science or nursing§          § Apply now! In return, you will join an industry-leading provider with a great culture, as we continue §‘building brighter futures together’!§        §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ §Welcome to Junior Adventures Group. This will be achieved by providing an inclusive and fun environment in which children are safe, engaged and well supervised and by contributing to program planning and development through reflections and child observations.§ § The Educator may be asked to assume the responsibility for the supervision of staff, children and OSHC service in the absence of the Coordinator and the Assistant Coordinator.§ § §The successful applicant must be available to work a minimum of 18 hours per week across the following times:§Monday -* Friday; 2:30 pm - 6:00 pm§*Wednesday; 2:00 pm - 6:00 pm§The above hours will be workable across school terms, however, the total weekly hours are also guaranteed across School Holiday periods.§ABOUT THE PROGRAM§ § The program caters for Booragoon Primary students from Kindergarten to Year 6 and is located in the suburb of Booragoon, 13 kilometres south-west of the Perth CBD. We pride ourselves in providing children with a fun and enjoyable experience. From exciting activities and healthy, nutritious snacks to caring, motivated staff, the program meets all our children’s needs within a safe, fun and stimulating environment.§ § §ABOUT YOU§ § Play is vital to children's well-being and sense of belonging and forms the basis of who they become in the future. jobText: TXT/50643596.txt	§Full Time Sales Manager Kotara Anytime Fitness§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Full Time Sales Manager Kotara Anytime Fitness§§Advertiser: §Fitness Group Holdings§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Newcastle, Maitland & Hunter§§Salary§§$50,000 - $64,999 Plus commission§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§Anytime Fitness is the world leader in 24/7 Fitness.  To be a part of this incredible and fast-growing Fitness Leader, read on!§ §The purpose of your role§ as our Sales Manager will be to ensure the club hits it's monthly membership targets. You will be working closely with the Club Manager to develop and grow the Clubs member-base and revenue within the business.§ §Duties will include: § §Sales of new memberships§ §Planning Monthly Marketing activities§ §Reaching and exceeding Targets and KPI's§ §Outreach and Prospect/Lead-Generating§ §New member orientations, bookings of appointments and follow -up service calls§ §Desired criteria § §Previous experience in lead generation§ §Sales experience is a must§ §Solid understanding of Targets, KPI's and Lead generation§ §Desired criteria but not essential§ §Cert 3 and 4 Fitness § §Current First Aid and CPR§ §Skills must include:§ §Excellent Customer Service Skills. jobTitle: Casual Group Exercise Instructor Job in Wollongong, Illawarra & South Coast - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50692962.txt	§Casual Group Exercise Instructor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Casual Group Exercise Instructor§§Advertiser: §Wollongong City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wollongong, Illawarra & South Coast§§Salary§§.§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§Casual Group Exercise Instructors§Wollongong City Leisure Centres§Salary from $42.13 per hour inclusive of 25% casual loading§(Depending upon skills, qualifications and experience)§Recruitment No 20139§The Role§ We are seeking vibrant and energetic Group Exercise Instructors to join our team at Beaton Park and Lakeside Leisure Centre. Classes are operated from both leisure centres located in Gwynneville and Kanahooka, with over 100 classes timetabled every week.§ Your success in this role will be driven by your outstanding communication and customer service skills, ability to self-manage and ability to plan and deliver safe and fun group exercise classes.§ The ability to teach any of the following programs would be preferable:§Body Combat§Body Pump§Body Step§Body Balance§Body Tone§RPM§Aquarobics§Seniors or Kids Classes.§ What do you need to be successful in this role?§§Demonstrated ability to enthusiastically engage customers and positively communicate across a diverse range of people.§Experience or ability to develop and deliver high-quality exercise classes.§Hold a Current Certificate III in Fitness (Group Exercise Instruction) OR GEL (Group Exercise Leader by Les Mills)§Hold, or be willing to obtain:§Registration with Fitness Australia§First Aid Statement of Attainment (HLTAID003)§Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation Statement of Attainment (HLTAID001)§Paid NSW Working With Children Check§Freestyle, Aquarobics, Seniors and Les Mills trained instructors are strongly encouraged to apply. These are casual positions and availability at short-notice will be required. Hours and facilities will vary according to operational needs.§Benefits of working at Council§We have a culture based on values of Integrity, Respect, Sustainability, One Team and Courage§We support and encourage study and career development§We foster personal and professional growth§We understand the importance of work/life balance and offer flexible work arrangements§We recognise and reward performance and embrace change§We are committed to providing a safe working environment for all§We provide many mental, physical and social wellbeing programs to support our staff to be the best that they can be§ How to Apply§ For this role, you are required to address each question outlined in the §Selection Criteria Questionaire§ - Applicants who do not complete the template will not have their application assessed. To access the Selection Criteria Questionnaire, click §HERE§. Please note that hardcopy, faxed and emailed applications will not be accepted.§ Wollongong City Council uses a merit based recruitment process. It is essential to respond to each of the selection criteria, writing at least one to two paragraphs using specific and actual examples of how you have demonstrated the particular skill, qualification or experience. Provide relevant examples from your work, study or community roles. Be clear and to the point. Please use actual examples of what you have done, how well you did it, what you achieved, and how it relates to the requirements of the job. Applications that do not answer all the criteria will not be considered. Your CV alone will not be enough information for your application to be assessed.§ §For further information regarding this position contact Libbee Crisp, Health + Fitness Supervisor on §(02) 4227 7759§.§ Any questions regarding submitting the application online please contact the Recruitment team on §(02) 4227 7065§.§ §Applications close 12 midday Monday 19 October 2020.§ Applicants are required to undergo a rigorous employment screening process which will include Reference, Identity and Medical History Checks, and may also include a Criminal History and Working with Children Check. Employment is subject to clearance of all these checks.§§§§

jobTitle: Fitness Coach Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50699342.txt	§Fitness Coach§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Fitness Coach§§Advertiser: §12RND Oxley§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§The role is offered on a Casual or Part-Time employment basis.§10-30 hours per week, min shifts are generally 3 hours up to 5 hours.§Help deliver professionally designed HIIT workouts.§Leadership and coaching that believes in you.§Not just a gym but a community!§12RND Fitness is an industry revolution. Training sessions are modelled around a 12 round boxing contest and are professionally designed to combine functional strength and cardio exercises for all fitness levels. A unique opportunity exists for a motivated individual to assume the role as Personal Trainer and become an integral part of the overall success of this exciting venture. §THE OPPORTUNITY:§12RND Oxley has recently changed management and is looking for someone with a strong work ethic who genuinely cares about our members. The purpose of this role is to run the day-to-day workouts and to develop a gym culture where excellence and member appreciation are the focus and results are achieved.§You will be required to:§Run daily workouts.§Maintain gym facilities.§Be a valued member of a professional team of trainers.§Participate in technical and personal development activities.§ABOUT YOU:§To be successful in this role you must be able to demonstrate the following:§Possess Cert III or IV in Fitness , First Aid and Blue Card certificates.§Have boxing and functional strength training knowledge and skills and be able to teach others effectively.§Experience in instructing group fitness classes.§Be confident and passionate about health and fitness.§Have an energetic, positive attitude and enjoy working in a fast-paced team environment.§Meet minimum fitness level requirements.§Enjoy working with people and building meaningful relationships.§Extra points if you’re familiar with 12RND, have good availabilities, your own transport and can easily get to Oxley!§In return, what we offer for the right person:§Competitive pay rates including generous allowances for set up and cleaning.§Strong leadership and support on how you can be the best 12RND trainer there is around - you just need to be ready and willing to learn and hit the ground running.§Exposure to how the business actually works, growing your skills and knowledge on how to coach and work in a team§WE HIRE FOR THE RIGHT CHARACTER.§If all of this sounds like the right fit for you, then we'd love to hear from you. Submit your CV and cover letter to mark.davies@12rnd.com.au [link removed]§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Have you completed a qualification in fitness?§§§

Sunraysia football boasts big crowds and exciting atmospheres, which makes umpiring an awesome challenge. §AFL Sunraysia is seeking expressions of interest from enthusiastic individuals for field, goal and boundary umpires ahead of its 2021 competition season. §Our Umpires have the following responsibilities§Responsible for the game play and rulings of games within the Australian football environment. §Maintain updated knowledge of the current bylaws for the specific football competitions.§Complete match day paperwork requirements.§Report any unsportsmanlike conduct and assist the relevant league or commission body with any investigations into incidents.§The essential requirements for this position include:§Completion of the AFL Victoria Umpires training course§A current Working With Children's Card§Registration with the Sunraysia Football Umpires Association.§For more information, please contact Don Harley (§don.harley@afl.com.au§). §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you own or have regular access to a car?§Do you have experience working with children?§§§

jobTitle: Centre Manager Job in Newcastle, Maitland & Hunter - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50649293.txt	§Centre Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Centre Manager§§Advertiser: §Belgravia Health & Leisure Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Newcastle, Maitland & Hunter§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§NSW, Tomaree Aquatic Centre - Salamander Bay 2317§Lead a team§Make a real difference to the community §Great opportunity with a growing and entrepreneurial organisation §We are looking for an up and coming people leader to coach, inspire and lead the team!§ §The Company§ §Belgravia Leisure§ is part of the Belgravia Health and Leisure Group (BHLG) and is the fastest growing leisure organisation in Australia. Our core areas of business and facilities stewardship include health clubs, wellness and spa, golf, aquatic, sporting venues and caravan and camp grounds in over 180 locations across Australia and New Zealand. § §The Site§ §Tomaree Aquatic Centre,§ located in Salamander bay of the hunter region of New South Wales. The centre features a 50m outdoor heated pool with up to 8 swimming lanes, shaded heated program/kids pool, shaded wading pool, spiral waterslide, large open lawned areas, free BBQ's and volleyball greens.§ §The Role § §An exciting opportunity has arisen for a suitably qualified and experienced Centre Manager to lead the team to deliver exceptional customer experience on a full time fixed term basis. Responsible for the management of this fantastic facility, the team at the Centre and our local community, you are fully accountable for the Centre’s operational, financial and program deliverables.§ §You will develop and execute plans through engagement with the Centre’s leadership team, key stakeholders and the local Council. With an experience in leadership, financial and risk management, you will continue to drive the Centre’s overall success.§ §Key Accountabilities§Ensure the safety and well-being of visitors and employees through effective planning and oversight of polices, processes and procedures and asset management.§Coach and develop leaders to deliver on KPIs through engagement, performance planning and individual development plans.§Lead and drive a high-performance community minded culture through highly visible and hands-on leadership and team engagement.§Achievement of budgeted performance targets.§Maintain a high value relationship with local Council§Implement a high value customer service proposition that addresses the needs of the client base.§Recruitment of energetic, diverse and passionate employees as required to compliment the team and the vision for the Centre.§Train staff as required to ensure that knowledge and capability are at the required levels to enable staff to carry out their work and achieve their objectives.§Identify staff and develop career progression paths that lead to transparent and effective succession decisions when required.§Maintain facilities to approved standards in line with contract requirements.§About You§You will be a proven leader, who drives with vision and energy. You are passionate about leisure, wanting to join a growing organisation. You will be able to share insights into how you have successfully shaped high performance teams into business actions. You can easily articulate the link between employee engagement and exceptional business performance.§ §Essential Skills and Qualifications:§A minimum 2 years’ experience in managing a similar leisure or aquatic facility§Highly developed communication skills with a flair for positive influencing and negotiating win-win outcomes§Sound knowledge of health and safety legislation§Experience in planning and execution of operational, financial and people plans to successful outcomes§Knowledge of Pool and Plant Operations§Current Life Guard Qualification§Current CPR Certificate§Current First Aid Certificate (Level 2)§National Police Check§Legal working rights in Australia§Desirable:§Tertiary qualifications in a related field§Function or events experience§Pool Operators Certificate§Austswim/Swim Australia Qualification§Fitness Certificate§ If you are a person who is passionate about leisure and wants to utilise your skills and experience in the leisure industry, we want to hear from you!§ §To submit your application, click the Apply Now button!§Salamander Bay 2317 NSW§§§§

Our core areas of business and facilities stewardship include health clubs, wellness and spa, golf, aquatic and sporting venues in 150 locations across Australia and New Zealand. § §We are in an exciting period of growth, and look to continue to diversify and deliver results while being a strong community citizen.  With an annual turnover in excess of $180m, the group are looking for the best and brightest to assist with taking the organisation into the future.§ §The Role§ §The ideal candidate will be energetic, dynamic, outgoing and fun. You will need outstanding communication skills and a commitment to customer service excellence to ensure our swim school members, patrons and parents are gaining maximum benefit and enjoyment from the services provided. Successful applicants will demonstrate the ability to communicate and interact effectively with all members and guests of the facility. jobTitle: Senior Coach Job in Adelaide - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50654362.txt	§Senior Coach§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Coach§§Advertiser: §Sturt Football Club§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§Senior Coach§ §Sturt Football Club§ § § §Sturt Football Club Inc (“Club”) is affiliated with the South Australian National Football League (“SANFL”) and participates in all competitions within the SANFL.§ §Established in 1901 the Club has a proud and rich history. Having won 15 Men's League Premierships (the last in 2017) its women and junior programs also continue to support the SANFL developing talent through to the AFL system.§ §A vacancy exists for the position of full-time Senior Coach. The Senior Coach will be responsible for implementing a football program based on strong leadership, elite standards, individual player development, education, and a structured game style that will be applied to all the Club’s football programs§ §The successful candidate will undergo regular performance assessments with appropriate professional development measures subject to need, as well as being prepared to be part of a team that will be dedicated to promoting the Club’s brand and culture.§ §This role presents a unique opportunity to make a positive impact and continue the progressive momentum established through hard work and perseverance by the Club.§ §Candidates wishing to be considered for this role should contact the Club’s Football Manager Chris Trapp at§ §ctrapp@sturtfc.com.au§ §Formal applications close COB§ §Thursday 8 October 2020§§§§

jobText: TXT/50654453.txt	§Activities Officer - Tweed Heads§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Activities Officer - Tweed Heads§§Advertiser: §Police Citizens Youth Clubs NSW Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Lismore & Far North Coast§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §        §Activities Officer - Tweed Heads §        §          §PCYC NSW is a charity empowering young people to reach their potential through Police and community partnerships. For more than 83 years, PCYC has building capacity in the communities we serve across regional and metropolitan NSW. PCYC is an inclusive organisation, striving to service the broad sport and recreational needs of all community members in the 65 locations in which we operate.§Working closely with Police and volunteers, our staff contribute to the positive development of over 70,000 youth members through mainstream sport, recreation, education, leadership and cultural activities. PCYC provides pathways to for athletes to participate in elite competition and opportunities for leadership, development, employment and coaching opportunities for young people. PCYC also works with vulnerable youth with a specific focus on breaking the cycle of disadvantage through targeted crime prevention, vocational education, youth capacity building and social responsibility programs. Working at PCYC is an opportunity to contribute to the local community and improve outcomes for many people young people across NSW.§          §            §Casual§            §$23.78 per hour plus casual loading§            §Basketball§          §          §Do you enjoy variety, from reception and administration to sports activities with children and young people? This is just what you have been looking for. For more than 83 years, PCYC has building capacity in the communities we serve across regional and metropolitan NSW. PCYC is an inclusive organisation, striving to service the broad sport and recreational needs of all community members in the 65 locations in which we operate.§Working closely with Police and volunteers, our staff contribute to the positive development of over 70,000 youth members through mainstream sport, recreation, education, leadership and cultural activities. PCYC provides pathways to for athletes to participate in elite competition and opportunities for leadership, development, employment and coaching opportunities for young people. PCYC also works with vulnerable youth with a specific focus on breaking the cycle of disadvantage through targeted crime prevention, vocational education, youth capacity building and social responsibility programs. Working at PCYC is an opportunity to contribute to the local community and improve outcomes for many people young people across NSW.§ § §Casual§ §$23.78 per hour plus casual loading§ §Basketball§ §Do you enjoy variety, from reception and administration to sports activities with children and young people? This is just what you have been looking for. We are looking for staff who have flexibility and the ability to adapt and operate effectively in a demanding and changing environment and the capacity to operate as a collaborative and team orientated person in a professional work environment.§To be successful you will have: -§ § §Experience in delivering youth sporting activities§ §The ability to develop an effective working relationship and rapport with members§ §Undertake responsibility, as a Coach, for the care of young people§ §A strong interest in one or more sports with appropriate game and team building skills for coaching purposes.§ §Attainment or currently working towards an appropriate coaching accreditation.§ §Well-developed communication and interpersonal skills, with an emphasis on building and maintaining quality relationships with all members of the community.§ §How to apply§To become a member of staff, please go to our website to APPLY NOW §www.pcycnsw.org.au/careers§You will be required to provide a current Working with Children Check number and undertake a NSW Police Security Check.§Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders are encouraged to apply.§Why you should apply§If you have a passion for sport, recreation and youth engagement the PCYC, established in 1937, will provide a vibrant environment for you to challenge yourself with meaningful work.§Our staff benefit from affordable health insurance, uniforms and access to a wide range of training. jobText: TXT/50708152.txt	§FIFO Pool Operator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§FIFO Pool Operator§§Advertiser: §Sodexo§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §FIFO Pool Operator §      §        §We are seeking the expertise of an experienced FIFO Pool Operator on a 8:6 roster based in Pannwonica.§        §About the Role:§        §You will be accountable for Life Guard duties and monitoring usage of the Pool and facilities. You will ensure patrons are adhering to Covid and facility regulations and able to effectively communicate with patrons that are not adhering to regulations. §        §During your shift you will monitor usage of the facilities and conduct routine cleaning duties. You will also conduct pool cleaning duties including skimming and scooping of the pool surfaces,checking the pool systems, and routine checks such as chemical and water balances.§        §About You:§        §It is paramount you are vigilant and confident to effectively enforce regulations in a professional manner. You are someone who has excellent communication skills, takes initiative and can work autonomously. §        §Qualifications:§        §It is paramount you have previous experience in a Pool Operator / Attendant position and exposure to maintaining Pool Systems. §        §It is essential you hold the following qualification and are able to provide this documentation should you be shortlisted further:§        §          §Pool Operations Group 1 §          §Pool Life Guard Course, (including First Aid Cert) §        §        §How to apply?§        §If you are interested in a career with Sodexo, please apply with an updated resume, shortlisting may commence immediately.§        §Additional Information:§        §Sodexo provides a range of services at remote locations across Australia, servicing both on-shore and off-shore sites, in difficult and challenging environments.  §        §At Sodexo, our Energy & Resources segment serves four markets: Mining, Offshore & Marine, Onshore Energy, and Engineering & Construction Projects. Our growing team of employees is dedicated to improving productivity, building meaningful client relationships, reducing on-site problems and improving quality of life for the thousands of Australians who call our remote sites home.§      §      §      §      §Sodexo is an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourages cultural diversity, gender equality and nondiscrimination. To be eligible to apply for this role you must be legally permitted to work permanently in Australia. Please note that unsolicited applications from recruitment agencies will not be accepted.§    §  §§§We are seeking the expertise of an experienced FIFO Pool Operator on a 8:6 roster based in Pannwonica.§ §About the Role:§ §You will be accountable for Life Guard duties and monitoring usage of the Pool and facilities. You will ensure patrons are adhering to Covid and facility regulations and able to effectively communicate with patrons that are not adhering to regulations. § §During your shift you will monitor usage of the facilities and conduct routine cleaning duties. You will also conduct pool cleaning duties including skimming and scooping of the pool surfaces,checking the pool systems, and routine checks such as chemical and water balances.§ §About You:§ §It is paramount you are vigilant and confident to effectively enforce regulations in a professional manner. You are someone who has excellent communication skills, takes initiative and can work autonomously. § §Qualifications:§ §It is paramount you have previous experience in a Pool Operator / Attendant position and exposure to maintaining Pool Systems. § §It is essential you hold the following qualification and are able to provide this documentation should you be shortlisted further:§ § §Pool Operations Group 1 § §Pool Life Guard Course, (including First Aid Cert) § §How to apply?§ §If you are interested in a career with Sodexo, please apply with an updated resume, shortlisting may commence immediately.§ §Additional Information:§ §Sodexo provides a range of services at remote locations across Australia, servicing both on-shore and off-shore sites, in difficult and challenging environments.  § §At Sodexo, our Energy & Resources segment serves four markets: Mining, Offshore & Marine, Onshore Energy, and Engineering & Construction Projects. Our growing team of employees is dedicated to improving productivity, building meaningful client relationships, reducing on-site problems and improving quality of life for the thousands of Australians who call our remote sites home.§§§§

What started as a group of friends throwing axes together for fun has transformed into a rapidly growing and exciting business captivating new throwers everyday.§ §With a focus on culture, teamwork and individuality we remain grassroots in terms of our environment and the way we interact with each other and our guests.§ §Always seeking out the extrovert, challenging the boring status quo, pushing boundaries and striving to spread our passion  for throwing axes therefore building the Axe Throwing community in Australia.§ § §About the role§ § §WARNING this not a normal job. If you prefer sitting at a desk then please feel free to scroll past.  We are looking for a confident, hard working, responsible team player to join our Brisbane crew assisting to facilitate the daily running of the venue. Social. Fun! job (or side hustle) that doesn't feel like a job§ §Physical Demands§ §While performing the duties of this position, you will regularly be required to:§ §Be friendly and able to smile frequently§Work days, nights, and/or weekends as required§Work in a noisy, fast paced environment with distracting conditions§Read and write handwritten notes§Walk or stand 100% of shift§ § §Benefits and perks§ § §You get to spend you're days/nights showing people how to throw axes!!!! Are you serious right now?§ § §Skills and experience§ § §No Axe Throwing experience necessary full training provided however the following would be advantageous§ §A background in training §Strong communication skills§Previous experience in Hospitality§First Aid certified§RSA or willing to obtain§Blue card or willing to obtain§Experience at Public Speaking§A strong sense of humour§The ability to read people and adjust demeanour depending on the situation§Only successful candidates will be contacted§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Which of the following First Aid accreditations do you currently hold?§Do you have customer service experience?§§§
