jobText: TXT/50674408.txt	§Centre Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Centre Manager§§Advertiser: §Belgravia Health & Leisure Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Kalgoorlie, Goldfields & Esperance§§Salary§§$120k pa pro rota§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§WA, Wiluna Public Swimming Pool - Wiluna 6646§ §Seasonal Pool Manager§Experience a unique part of Australia§Salary circa $120k pa pro rota§Flights and accommodation provided§ §The Company§ §Belgravia Leisure§ is part of the Belgravia Health and Leisure Group (BHLG) and is the fastest growing leisure organisation in Australia. Our core areas of business and facilities stewardship include health clubs, wellness and spa, golf, aquatic and sporting venues in 150 locations across Australia and New Zealand. § §We are in an exciting period of growth and look to continue to diversify and deliver results while being a strong community citizen.  With an annual turnover in excess of $180m, the group are looking for the best and brightest to assist with taking the organisation into the future.§ §The Site§ §The town of Wiluna is 966 kilometres northeast of Perth and is situated on the edge of the desert at the gateway to the Canning Stock Route and Gunbarrel Highway.§ §Wiluna Public Swimming Pool in WA has a 25 metre swimming pool, toddlers pool and grassed area with a season running from late October to April.§ §The Role§ §An opportunity has arisen for a suitably qualified Centre Manager who is able to relocate to Wiluna for the 20/21 season.  Responsible for the management of this facility you will be accountable for the Centre’s operational, safety and customer service deliverables.§ §Key Accountabilities§Ensure the safety and well-being of visitors and employees through effective planning and oversight of polices, processes and procedures.§Provide supervision of the pools to ensure patron safety, compliance with pool rules and the Watch Around Water program.§Train staff as required to ensure that knowledge and capability are at the required levels to enable staff to carry out their work and achieve their objectives.§Maintain facilities to approved standards in line with contract requirements.§Coordinate aquatic programs to suit local community needs§Maintain the pools according to the WA Aquatic Code of Practice§ §About You§You will require strong work ethic and ability to work unsupervised to be successful in this role.  Cultural awareness of working in remote WA, strong problem solving, negotiation and communication skills will also be required.§ §Essential Skills and Qualifications:§Current Pool Lifeguard qualification§Pool Operations Certificate for Group 1 Pools§Working with Children Check§Current First Aid Certificate (Level 2)§Current CPR Certificate§Legal working rights in Australia§ §Desirable:§Experience managing remote swimming pools§Intermediate – Advanced skills in MS Office package for daily reporting§OH&S & Risk Certificate or experience§ §We will fund flights to Wiluna and provide free accommodation for the successful applicant. § §Wiluna 6646 WA§§§§

It is a city of ambition and excitement. With a total of 48 residential suburbs, and population of 395,000 coming from more than 180 different birthplaces, Blacktown City is one of the most diverse communities in Australia.§        §Working in Blacktown City provides a wealth of professional opportunities. Blacktown City Council is the largest Council in New South Wales, 4th largest in Australia and a leader in the development of the Western Sydney region. With almost unmatched growth expected over the next 25 years, we are on an exciting journey of transformation to prepare for a population of more than 550,000. There has never been a more exciting time to join one of Sydney’s most dynamic and high-performing Councils as we continue to deliver outstanding levels of service for our proud and diverse community and prepare our great city for the future.§        §About the opportunity§        §Key Venues consists of 11 of Council’s premier sport and leisure facilities. We deliver first class activity and program choice, we promote Blacktown City as the leader in sport, recreation and leisure and we give every visitor and customer a safe and memorable experience. Our values are team work, customer focus, innovation and commitment to safety.§        §Blacktown Leisure Centre Stanhope is an award winning multi- purpose facility that offers high quality programs and services. It includes an indoor aquatic centre with 25 metre 10 lane lap pool, wave pool, program pool, a 4 court stadium and 16 court tennis complex as well as a health and fitness centre, crèche and function room facilities.§        §Activity Officers are responsible for ensuring the day-to-day operations of the Centre using effective planning whilst adhering to policy and procedures.§        §If you have a Pool Lifeguard Certificate, aquatic and leisure industry experience as well as great time management and leadership skills then this is the role for you!§        § §Qualifications and experience§Essential:§        §          §Current Pool Lifeguard Certificate§          §Current First Aid Certificate§          §Current CPR Certificate and Oxygen Equipment§          §Experience in a similar environment§          §Current Class C Driver's Licence§          §Current Working With Children Check.§        §        §Desirable:§        §          §TAFE Certificate of Attainment (Pool Operations)§          §Experience in managing time effectively§          §Knowledge of applicable legislation/regulations§          §Experience and knowledge of the operation and aquatic plant and equipment and other resources associated with the provision of recreation facilities, programmes and events§          §Demonstrated commitment to customer service§          §Experience in the shift coordination of an aquatic/leisure centre§          §Experience in working within a team environment and as a ‘self-starter’§          §Computer literate.§        §        §Remuneration and benefits§        §The salary and conditions of employment are in accordance with Blacktown City Council’s Enterprise Agreement.§        §          §A competitive salary range of $1,186.40 - With almost unmatched growth expected over the next 25 years, we are on an exciting journey of transformation to prepare for a population of more than 550,000. development pathways program§Coach Education & Development§Lead coach development activities, fostering and maintaining effective relationships with coaches§Undertake coach mentoring, with a focus on communities§         Wolves School Holiday Camps:§Deliver a series of School Holiday Camps that cater for various levels of player development and that grow the Association’s position as a destination for inclusive, innovative basketball experiences§         School Development Sessions:§Deliver a series of Workshops/Clinics at schools within the northern region that cater for various levels of player development;§Deliver intensive Basketball programs within school curriculums§Development Programs§Deliver and coordinate all WBA player development programs:§Domestic Development (DDP)§Hoops Academy§Female Fundamentals§WABL Camps & Clinics§Futures Program§§In addition to the duties specified above, the Employer is entitled to request the Employee to perform such other duties as are within the Employee’s skill, competence or training and are reasonably requested in order to meet the requirements of the company.§Essential Experience & Qualifications:§Relevant Basketball Coaching Experience§Coaching experience at the State and or National level§Relevant program delivery experience§Relevant budget experience and financial control§Minimum Level 2 (Association) coaching qualification§Current “C” Class Driver’s License§Current Working with Children’s Check (WWC)§Senior coaching experience (SBL or state league level)§Desirable Experience & Qualifications:§Tertiary degree in Sports Management and or Coaching§Performance Level (Level 3) Coaching Accreditation§Elite level coaching experience (NBL, WNBL, College etc.)§Applications close 5pm on Monday October 26.§§Applicants are required to submit a current CV along with a cover letter which directly addresses the 'Essential Experience & Qualifications' for the role as outlined above. §If you have a passion for Basketball and possess a desire to work within a supportive, fast-paced and high-performing environment, this role is designed for you.§Due to the nature of the sport, weekend and out of hours’ work is a principal requirement and expectation of the role.§Wanneroo Basketball Association may seek to progress to interview following receipt of application - prospective applicants are encouraged to apply promptly.§Please send applications including cover letter and resume directly to recruitment@wolves.asn.au§§§§

jobText: TXT/50625590.txt	§Centre Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Centre Manager§§Advertiser: §Belgravia Health & Leisure Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§NSW, Auburn Ruth Everuss Aquatic Centre - Lidcombe NSW 2141§Lead a team passionate people §Great opportunity with a growing and entrepreneurial organisation §Free facility access and great benefits § §The Company§ §Belgravia Leisure§ is part of the Belgravia Health and Leisure Group (BHLG) and is the fastest growing leisure organisation in Australia. Our core areas of business and facilities stewardship include health clubs, wellness and spa, golf, aquatic and sporting venues in 150 locations across Australia and New Zealand. § §We are in an exciting period of growth and look to continue to diversify and deliver results while being a strong community citizen.  With an annual turnover in excess of $180m, the group are looking for the best and brightest to assist with taking the organisation into the future.§ §The Site§ §Belgravia Leisure operate §Auburn Ruth Everuss Aquatic Centre§ on behalf of Cumberland Council, and we are passionate in connecting the local community to leisure. The facility is a state of the art with 6 pools including an outdoor 50m and water polo, splash pad and indoor leisure, 25m and indoor pools. The facility also has a boutique health club.  § §The Role§ §An exciting opportunity has arisen for a suitably qualified, experienced and people-friendly  §Centre Manager§ to lead the team to deliver exceptional customer experience at this large facility. Responsible for the management of this fantastic facility, the team at the Centre and our local community, you are fully accountable for the Centre’s operational, financial and program deliverables.§ §Key Accountabilities§Ensure the safety and well-being of visitors and employees through effective planning and oversight of polices, processes and procedures.§Coach and develop leaders to deliver on KPIs through engagement, performance planning and individual development plans.§Lead and drive a high performance community minded culture through highly visible and hands-on leadership and team engagement.§Achievement of budgeted performance targets.§Maintain a high value relationship with our council partner. §Implement a high value customer service proposition that addresses the needs of the client base.§Recruitment of energetic, diverse and passionate employees as required to compliment the team and the vision for the Centre.§Train staff as required to ensure that knowledge and capability are at the required levels to enable staff to carry out their work and achieve their objectives.§Identify staff and develop career progression paths that lead to transparent and effective succession decisions when required.§Maintain facilities to approved standards in line with contract requirements.§ §Essential Skills and Qualifications:§A minimum 2 years’ experience in managing a similar leisure or aquatic facility§Highly developed communication skills with a flair for positive influencing and negotiating win-win outcomes.§Sound knowledge of health and safety legislation§Experience in planning and execution of operational, financial and people plans to successful outcomes.§National Police Check§Working with Children Check§Current CPR Certificate§Current First Aid Certificate (Level 2)§Legal working rights in Australia§Desirable:§Minimum 3 years experience in aquatic operations§Operational experience in Stadium facilities§Great understanding of local government and processes§Pool Lifeguard Certificate§Pool Operations Certificate§If you are a person who is passionate about leisure and want to utilise your skills and experience in the leisure industry, we want to hear from you!§Apply now !!§Lidcombe 2141 NSW§§§§

jobTitle: Sports Umpires - Casual Pool  Job in Perth - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50708346.txt	§Sports Umpires - Casual Pool §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Sports Umpires - Casual Pool §§Advertiser: §City of Cockburn§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §Fremantle & Southern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Sports Umpires - Casual Pool §      §        § §        §The City of Cockburn is establishing a pool of suitable applicants for Sports Umpires. Appointments will be made on a casual basis. Applicants assessed as suitable but not offered immediate work will be placed in a casual pool, which will operate for 3 months from the date of the initial placement in the pool, from which further employment opportunities may be offered.§        § §        §Cockburn ARC§        §Cockburn ARC is the City of Cockburn’s new Premier Regional Sports and Aquatic Centre located in Cockburn Central West with a vision of getting more people, more active, more often.§        §It is one of the largest facilities of its kind in Australia, providing leading edge facilities and services that the Cockburn community can be proud of and is the new home of the Fremantle Football Club.§        §The $109M facility along with the partnership with Fremantle Football Club and Curtin University has enabled the City to deliver a world class facility with overall footprint of 23,000m2.§        §The City of Cockburn§        §Cockburn is one of the major coastal cities found in the state of Western Australia. With a current population of over 115,000, the City is dynamic, rapidly growing and an exciting place to be.§        §Situated just 22km south of the Perth CBD, Cockburn boasts an amazing coastline, beautiful beaches and parks, and is supported by a rich mix of community facilities and diverse employment opportunities.§        §The Position§        §Team ARC is currently looking for experienced and motivated Netball, Basketball and Futsal (Soccer) Umpires to ensure our extensive sports program is of the highest standard and our members receive an exceptional customer experience at Cockburn ARC.§        §These positions are being offered on a casual basis and hours of work may include mornings, late evenings and weekends. jobText: TXT/50683042.txt	§Head-Coach/Studio Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Head-Coach/Studio Manager§§Advertiser: §Physique Performance Specialists§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Salary§§$55,000 - $64,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§§About the business§ § § §Physique Performance Specialists§ have established themselves as the leaders in Body Composition Coaching space in Perth over the past 4-years.§ §Specialising in Body Transformations & Strength-Training, we are known as the §'Gym for people, who aren't usually Gym people' §- helping the ordinary person, achieve extraordinary results.§ §There's no Gimmicks or BS* at PPS, just good old fashioned Strength-Training & Hard-Work.§PPS South-Perth is our 4th location and opened only 6-Weeks ago.§ §Due to exponential growth upon opening, we seek a Head-Coach/Studio Manager to learn directly from the business owner, to help to take over the reigns to continue to grow and nurture our family-like community.§ § § §About the role§ § § §You will report directly to the Business Director and be responsible for:§ §Running 1-1 and Semi-Private PT Sessions§Conducting Initial Consults & Inductions§Managing Client Programming & Nutrition§Performing Client Check-In's & Body Composition Assessments§Mentoring & Managing a Small-Team of Coaches§Driving Facility Growth & Retention§Basic Gym Maintenance§ § § § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §As a PPS Coach, you will become part of a family-like work environment. Our community is second-to-none; which helps to create an environment that could rarely be described as §'work'.§ §We provide ongoing development and mentoring to help you become the best Coach & Manager you can be. This includes both external courses and internal mentoring from our Education team.§ §Initially this role begins with split-shifts, but as the facility grows, the opportunity to have greater balance in hours can become available.§ §You will also be granted the opportunity to train any external 1-1 clients: rent free within the facility.§ § § §Skills and experience§ § § §The ideal candidate will hold a Min Cert 4 in Fitness.§ §An ASCA Strength & Conditioning L1, BSC in Sports Science and/or experience in a similar role could also be advantageous - but not essential.§Insurances and First-Aid etc will be covered by PPS.§ §Other attributes we would look for:§ §Excellent people skills§Punctual time-keeping§Hard-worker§Competent Computer skills§A Coach who practises what they preach§A sound knowledge of Strength-Training & Body Composition§Someone who wants to be challenged and wants to learn§And above all, a Team Player§ §Ideally you will live within 10km of our facility, have your own vehicle and laptop computer.§ §To apply please submit your application via Seek.§Outline your 'Why' as a Coach and what attracted you to enquire to work at PPS§ §(Applications without a Cover Letter will not be accepted)§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Have you completed a qualification in fitness?§§§

jobText: TXT/50650970.txt	§Exercise Physiologist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Exercise Physiologist§§Advertiser: §BlueFit Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§The BlueFit Group consists of a range of companies in the sport, recreation and leisure management industry. BlueFit, the core company prides itself in offering local councils a true partner in asset management, working closely with them and on their behalf to promote participation in leisure to all corners of their Local Government Area. § § § §About the role§ §We are a rapidly expanding business looking for an enthusiastic and motivated person to join our dynamic team as an Exercise Physiologist (EP). This is a great opportunity for a qualified EP looking to establish themselves in a growing business. § §This position is a casual position and based at the Playford Aquadome, Elizabeth § § § §Previous experience is required in:§ § § §Clinical Practice (Exercise Physiology)§ § § §Hydrotherapy § § § §Group Training § § § §Customer service and§ § § §Client retention § § § § §Skills Required:§ § § §Exceptional communication skills§ § § §Extensive knowledge in exercise programming and delivery§ § § §Ability to work autonomously and as part of a team§ § § § §Clientele you will be servicing includes:§ § § §Chronic disease management (Medicare) § § § §National Disability Insurance Scheme Clients (NDIS)  § § § §Department of Veteran Affairs clients (DVA)§ § § §Return to Work Clients (Workcover)§ § § §Compulsory Third Party Insurance clients (CTP)§ § § §General public (Private Patients) § § § §Strength For Life (COTA SA)§ § § § § Essential Qualifications/Registrations:§ § § §Bachelor Degree in Exercise Physiology § § § §Registration with Exercise Sports Science Australia or equivalent§ § § §Level 2 Senior/Apply First Aid§ § § §Working with Children Check§ § § § §Benefits § § § §Working for an employer of choice § § § §Access to state of the art facilities § § § §Being mentored by an established Exercise Physiologist § § § §Flexible working hours§ § § § §You will be asked the following questions when you apply:§ § § §Are you eligible to work in Australia?§ § § §How many years’ experience do you have in a similar role?§ § § §What days are you available to work?§ § § § §Please apply with your cover letter and resume to Joel Perricone at §joel.perricone@bluefit.com.au§§§§

one all Aussies can enjoy. §          §Our purpose is to unite and inspire communities through Cricket and this is an amazing opportunity for you to contribute to making a real difference in the lives of millions of Australians.§          §About the role§          §Your key responsibilities will include:§          §            §Ensuring successful implementation and continued adoption of the Cricket Blast Program§            §Ensuring robust plans are in place to achieve growth across the program§            §Working closely with State & Territory Associations, local associations and clubs to drive continuous improvement across the program§            §Co-designing new program initiatives and enhancements in conjunction with members of the Community Cricket team§            §Collaborating with the Commercial team to meet sponsorship requirements§            §Being the national program expert, advocating for the program across CA and State and Territory Associations§            §Collaborating with the Digital team to ensure digital enhancements and program improvements are part of the digital roadmap§            §Development of communication plans targeted at parents, kids and volunteers§          §          § §          §About you§          §You will have:§          §            §Qualifications in either Business, Commerce, Marketing or Product Management§            §Project Management experience§            §Strong stakeholder engagement and management skills§            §Ability and experience in managing budgets§            §Strong written and verbal communication skills§            §Excellent organisation skills§            §Strong attention to detail§            §A can do attitude with a customer centric focus§            §Proficient in Microsoft Office§          §          § §          §Sound like you? Let’s do this!§          §The work we do across Australian Cricket stretches across the sporting and entertainment industries - which means there are all kinds of opportunities for bright-minded, passionate and friendly people.§          §Cricket’s a sport for all Australians and our workplace reflects that. Let’s do this!§The work we do across Australian Cricket stretches across the sporting and entertainment industries - which means there are all kinds of opportunities for bright-minded, passionate and friendly people.§Cricket’s a sport for all Australians and our workplace reflects that. jobTitle: Aquatics Director Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50680390.txt	§Aquatics Director§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Aquatics Director§§Advertiser: §Hamilton City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§We’re looking for an inspirational leader to manage and develop our popular public aquatics facilities.§ §As Hamilton Pools Aquatics Director, you’ll head a dedicated lead team including an Operations Manager, Assets and Contract Manager and Customer Experience Manager who help to run Waterworld, our large, international-standard swimming and gym facility, and Gallagher Aquatic Centre, our smaller venue.§ §This is an exciting time to be joining our pools operation, as we’ve recently completed a significant $10.7M upgrade of Waterworld.§ §It’s important you’ve managed an aquatics operation of this size before. We are in a period of exciting change, so you’ll need to come with new ideas and the experience to deliver on them while bringing your people along with you.§ §You won’t be flying solo, though – you’ll be part of Hamilton City Council’s community services team with backing from senior management to make improvements and implement change.§ §You’ll also be leading a team of experienced aquatics sector professionals who know their business and customers well and have a strong sense of ownership towards the facilities they manage for the people of Hamilton.§ §We are passionate about providing affordable, accessible sports and leisure opportunities that support the health and wellbeing of our community.§ §Your ability to produce and provide strategic plans and growth for our aquatics operation is crucial to success in this position, as is identifying risks and opportunities.§ §Hamilton Pools welcomes 400,000 people every year and we need to ensure our processes and plant are compliant and meet regulatory requirements and our customers have a safe, enjoyable experience every time. You’ll be able to demonstrate a solid commitment to health and safety and risk management.§ §We are also looking for a change maker with strong commercial nous. You’ll be expected to develop the business through your relationships and networks in the leisure and sports industry. You will develop and lead the Hamilton Pools business plan.§ §While you’re building on new opportunities, you’ll also be keenly aware of what’s happening back at home base. You’ll have solid processes and procedures in place to keep things humming and you’ll be a great people manager, energetic, reliable and comfortable handling a varied and busy workload.§ §You will need to be able to work across the Council’s business support units, developing strong links with our Communication and Engagement, People, Safety and Wellness and Finance Units.§ §Hamilton City Council is committed to being a high-performance organisation with people who think differently, act with integrity, make it happen and work together.§ §This is your chance to join an organisation committed to building a stronger economy and a more attractive city for all Hamiltonians.§ §For a copy of the position description, please click § HERE§.§ §If this role sounds like it’s for you, we would love to hear from you. Make it happen and apply online today!§ §All candidates will be notified of the outcome on their application via email. This role is covered by the Children’s Act 2014, which means short-listed candidates will be required to undergo all safety checking requirements under the Act before commencing employment, as well as during employment. In addition, short-listed candidates may be required to complete an interview process, reference checks, credit check, pre-employment medical and drug assessments and Police vetting check.§ §Please note this role is being sourced directly and we are not accepting applications via external recruitment agencies.§§§§§

prevention and treatment in a culturally responsive way that empowers Aboriginal people to take more responsibility for their own health.§        §About the Opportunity §        §Anyinginyi§ has an exciting opportunity for an enthusiastic and community-minded §Sport & Recreation Team Leader§ to join the team in Tennant Creek, NT on a full-time ongoing basis.§        §Reporting to the Sport & Recreation Section Manager, you will §primarily be responsible for providing an efficient and effective Community Sports and Recreation Program to Aboriginal people and to the general community.§ safety and welfare of all visitors with a particular emphasis on young people.§          §Managing, organising, training and supervising community sports & recreation staff;§          §Organising community sporting events, maintaining sports/recreation equipment, and keeping records/reports of sporting events and recreational activities;§          §Liaising with other sporting bodies and organisations;§          §Writing funding submissions to government and non-government agencies, and representing §Anyinginyi §at various sporting functions.§        §        §About the Benefits§ host of additional benefits to further increase your take-home pay, including:§        §          §6 weeks annual leave with 17.5% leave loading;§          §Salary sacrificing up to $15,899.94 p/a;§ jobTitle: Aquatics Director Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50680377.txt	§Aquatics Director§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Aquatics Director§§Advertiser: §Hamilton City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§We’re looking for an inspirational leader to manage and develop our popular public aquatics facilities.§ §As Hamilton Pools Aquatics Director, you’ll head a dedicated lead team including an Operations Manager, Assets and Contract Manager and Customer Experience Manager who help to run Waterworld, our large, international-standard swimming and gym facility, and Gallagher Aquatic Centre, our smaller venue.§ §This is an exciting time to be joining our pools operation, as we’ve recently completed a significant $10.7M upgrade of Waterworld.§ §It’s important you’ve managed an aquatics operation of this size before. We are in a period of exciting change, so you’ll need to come with new ideas and the experience to deliver on them while bringing your people along with you.§ §You won’t be flying solo, though – you’ll be part of Hamilton City Council’s community services team with backing from senior management to make improvements and implement change.§ §You’ll also be leading a team of experienced aquatics sector professionals who know their business and customers well and have a strong sense of ownership towards the facilities they manage for the people of Hamilton.§ §We are passionate about providing affordable, accessible sports and leisure opportunities that support the health and wellbeing of our community.§ §Your ability to produce and provide strategic plans and growth for our aquatics operation is crucial to success in this position, as is identifying risks and opportunities.§ §Hamilton Pools welcomes 400,000 people every year and we need to ensure our processes and plant are compliant and meet regulatory requirements and our customers have a safe, enjoyable experience every time. You’ll be able to demonstrate a solid commitment to health and safety and risk management.§ §We are also looking for a change maker with strong commercial nous. You’ll be expected to develop the business through your relationships and networks in the leisure and sports industry. You will develop and lead the Hamilton Pools business plan.§ §While you’re building on new opportunities, you’ll also be keenly aware of what’s happening back at home base. You’ll have solid processes and procedures in place to keep things humming and you’ll be a great people manager, energetic, reliable and comfortable handling a varied and busy workload.§ §You will need to be able to work across the Council’s business support units, developing strong links with our Communication and Engagement, People, Safety and Wellness and Finance Units.§ §Hamilton City Council is committed to being a high-performance organisation with people who think differently, act with integrity, make it happen and work together.§ §This is your chance to join an organisation committed to building a stronger economy and a more attractive city for all Hamiltonians.§ §For a copy of the position description, please click § HERE§.§ §If this role sounds like it’s for you, we would love to hear from you. Make it happen and apply online today!§ §All candidates will be notified of the outcome on their application via email. This role is covered by the Children’s Act 2014, which means short-listed candidates will be required to undergo all safety checking requirements under the Act before commencing employment, as well as during employment. In addition, short-listed candidates may be required to complete an interview process, reference checks, credit check, pre-employment medical and drug assessments and Police vetting check.§ §Please note this role is being sourced directly and we are not accepting applications via external recruitment agencies.§§§§§

jobTitle: Centre Manager - Greensborough Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50649197.txt	§Centre Manager - Greensborough§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Centre Manager - Greensborough§§Advertiser: §Belgravia Health & Leisure Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §Northern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§VIC, WaterMarc Banyule - Greensborough 3088§Make a real difference to the community §Great opportunity with a growing and entrepreneurial organisation § §The Company§ §Belgravia Leisure§ is part of the Belgravia Health and Leisure Group (BHLG) and is the fastest growing leisure organisation in Australia. Our core areas of business and facilities stewardship include health clubs, wellness and spa, golf, aquatic and sporting venues in 150 locations across Australia and New Zealand. § §We are in an exciting period of growth, and look to continue to diversify and deliver results while being a strong community citizen.  With an annual turnover in excess of $180m, the group are looking for the best and brightest to assist with taking the organisation into the future.§ §The Site§ §WaterMarc Banyule§, the largest aquatic and leisure facility in Victoria's northern region. This multi-activity regional facility serves the Greensborough community and surrounding suburbs. Facilities include an indoor 50-metre Olympic swimming pool, Learn to Swim pool. spa, sauna and steam room facilities and waterslide. Additional facilities include personal training, pool parties, childcare and a Health Link Café.§ §The Role§ §An exciting opportunity has arisen for a suitably qualified and experienced Centre Manager to lead the team to deliver exceptional customer experience at this large facility. Responsible for the management of this fantastic facility, the team at the Centre and our local community, you are fully accountable for the Centre’s operational, financial and program deliverables.§ §As the Centre Manager for Watermarc Banyule, you will be required to identify, engage and collaborate with a network of key community members and groups that can assist in the implementation of aquatic programs that will enhance social capital.§ §You will identify local community needs  and deliver programs for those within the disability, diversity and disadvantaged space. You will also be required to deliver a fundraising strategy for the Belgravia Foundation, with all funds providing programs, services and education that promote access to leisure within the Banyule City Council.§ §Key Accountabilities§Ensure the safety and well-being of visitors and employees through effective planning and oversight of polices, processes and procedures§Coach and develop leaders to deliver on KPIs through engagement, performance planning and individual development plans§Lead and drive a high performance community minded culture through highly visible and hands-on leadership and team engagement§Achievement of budgeted performance targets§Maintain a high value relationship with our council partner§Implement a high value customer service proposition that addresses the needs of the client base§Liaise with community leaders and stakeholders to provide greater community awareness and offer programs to those within the disability, diversity and disadvantaged space§Recruitment of energetic, diverse and passionate employees as required to compliment the team and the vision for the Centre§Train staff as required to ensure that knowledge and capability are at the required levels to enable staff to carry out their work and achieve their objectives§Identify staff and develop career progression paths that lead to transparent and effective succession decisions when required§Maintain facilities to approved standards in line with contract requirements§ §Essential Skills and Qualifications:§A minimum 2 years’ experience in managing a similar leisure or aquatic facility§Sound knowledge of health and safety legislation§Experience in planning and execution of operational, financial and people plans to successful outcomes.§Legal working rights in Australia§Pool Life Guard Certificate§Pool Operations Certificate§National Police Check§Working with Children Check§Current CPR Certificate§Current First Aid Certificate (Level 2)§Willingness to travel interstate, attend various events and flexibility to accommodate early mornings, late evenings and weekend work will be advantageous§Desirable:§Minimum 3 years’ experience in aquatic operations§Great understanding of local government and processes§ § If you are a person who is passionate about leisure and wants to utilise your skills and experience in the leisure industry, we want to hear from you!§Greensborough 3088 VIC§§§§

jobText: TXT/50680434.txt	§Club Manager or Sales Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Club Manager or Sales Manager§§Advertiser: §South Pacific Health Club Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §Bayside & South Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Club Manager or Sales Manager §      §        §South Pacific Health Clubs is a Fitness Chain that has prided itself on being one of the leaders in the Health and Fitness Industry for over 2 decades. Now incorporating eight clubs scattered throughout the Bayside and surrounding suburbs, our vision has grown and continues to grow.     We are passionate about the Industry and the Community, always striving to improve our standards and be the best that we can be.§        §It is an exciting time for our Clubs, with upgrades and renovations happening on various scales with a number of our gyms.  New equipment, new facilities - we are introducing the future of Fitness NOW!!!§        §With that growth come's the need to ensure that we are leading our staff in the right direction, with the right attitude - all heading towards the same finish line, one vision throughout.  Club Managers are integral to the success of a Club.  The right leader not only creates a positive culture for our staff, but also for our members.  The most important element to a successful gym, are the Members.§        §This is why we are on the lookout for 'exceptional' Sales Managers or Club Managers. Yes it may be a clichéd word used over again, but with staff incorporating Sales, Admin, Customer Service and Personal Trainers - you will need to be able to communicate and motivate very different types of people. So 'exceptional' is the only word to use.§        §We are looking for that person that understands that we are a business, but also that our members are individuals.  Selling memberships is vital, but also ensuring that our members stay with us for years......that's the ultimate.§        §South Pacific Health Clubs are not just a gym - they are a Lifestyle, a community where your staff aim to know each and every member§        §A person that has attention to detail that is above par - as you will be setting the example for your staff. We are a world class facility, so we need to ensure that every element from the cleanliness of the gym to the communication between staff and members is excellent.§        §As we get better, our members and staff expect us to get even better! There's your challenge...§        §But you have a wonderful team to support you.§        §This is a full time position, with responsibilities including but not limited to:§        §To lead the sales team to achieve Club targets.§        §To recruit, set expectations for and manage all staff and department heads.§        §To attend, assist in and initiate training for all staff.§        §To ensure monthly targets are hit.§        §To ensure the Club remains presentable at all times.§        §To ensure all maintenance issues are addressed promptly.§        §To be known as a world class facility§        §Communication is open to staff and members§        §Marketing and promotions within the gym§        §Liaise with Director, Regional Manager and our other Managers§        §To be the face of the club§        §To turn any negative situation into a positive situation§        §All of this - but so much more!!§        §With your Managerial experience in the industry, great organisational and leadership skills, this is the ideal next step in your Management Career. A career that will see you achieve so much, and gain more.§        §Interested?§        §Attach a cover letter and your CV (remember to include references) and email them to Madeleine Pritchard, Regional Training & Development Manager§        §Join an exceptional, growing company and team where expectations are not only met....but exceeded.§        § §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§South Pacific Health Clubs is a Fitness Chain that has prided itself on being one of the leaders in the Health and Fitness Industry for over 2 decades. Now incorporating eight clubs scattered throughout the Bayside and surrounding suburbs, our vision has grown and continues to grow.     We are passionate about the Industry and the Community, always striving to improve our standards and be the best that we can be.§ §It is an exciting time for our Clubs, with upgrades and renovations happening on various scales with a number of our gyms.  New equipment, new facilities - we are introducing the future of Fitness NOW!!!§ §With that growth come's the need to ensure that we are leading our staff in the right direction, with the right attitude - all heading towards the same finish line, one vision throughout.  Club Managers are integral to the success of a Club.  The right leader not only creates a positive culture for our staff, but also for our members.  The most important element to a successful gym, are the Members.§ §This is why we are on the lookout for 'exceptional' Sales Managers or Club Managers. Yes it may be a clichéd word used over again, but with staff incorporating Sales, Admin, Customer Service and Personal Trainers - you will need to be able to communicate and motivate very different types of people. So 'exceptional' is the only word to use.§ §We are looking for that person that understands that we are a business, but also that our members are individuals.  Selling memberships is vital, but also ensuring that our members stay with us for years......that's the ultimate.§ §South Pacific Health Clubs are not just a gym - they are a Lifestyle, a community where your staff aim to know each and every member§ §A person that has attention to detail that is above par - as you will be setting the example for your staff. We are a world class facility, so we need to ensure that every element from the cleanliness of the gym to the communication between staff and members is excellent.§ §As we get better, our members and staff expect us to get even better! There's your challenge...§ §But you have a wonderful team to support you.§ §This is a full time position, with responsibilities including but not limited to:§ §To lead the sales team to achieve Club targets.§ §To recruit, set expectations for and manage all staff and department heads.§ §To attend, assist in and initiate training for all staff.§ §To ensure monthly targets are hit.§ §To ensure the Club remains presentable at all times.§ §To ensure all maintenance issues are addressed promptly.§ §To be known as a world class facility§ §Communication is open to staff and members§ §Marketing and promotions within the gym§ §Liaise with Director, Regional Manager and our other Managers§ §To be the face of the club§ §To turn any negative situation into a positive situation§ §All of this - but so much more!!§ §With your Managerial experience in the industry, great organisational and leadership skills, this is the ideal next step in your Management Career. A career that will see you achieve so much, and gain more.§ §Interested?§ §Attach a cover letter and your CV (remember to include references) and email them to Madeleine Pritchard, Regional Training & Development Manager§ §Join an exceptional, growing company and team where expectations are not only met....but exceeded.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a sales manager?§Do you have experience in a sales role?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

§Police Check§ and §Working with Children Check§          §          §What’s in it for you?§          §            §Career development with a range of formal education and on the job training It is essential everyone involved with delivering tennis in Australia understands their responsibility in relation to child-safety.§ § §At Tennis, we embrace differences in gender, age, ethnicity, race, cultural background, disability, religion and sexual orientation. Tennis encourages all suitable applicants to apply for this role§ §        §        §        §      §      §tennis.com.au§    §  §§§ §It’s an exciting time for tennis in Australia and we have ambitious plans to continue to grow the game from grassroots through to high performance. Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§Rewarding 3-Year Opportunity§Live Your Passion for Rugby§A Foundation Club with an Enviable Heritage and Culture §The Management Committee of Gold Coast Rugby Union Football Club Inc (Eagles Rugby) is inviting formal applications for Coaching and Team Manager positions within our Senior Squad structure for the 2021 season.§Being the Gold Coast’s foundation Rugby Club, Eagles Rugby enjoys a proud history of winning rugby since 1964. We thrive on our foundation formed by a welcoming, inclusive attitude from which character, determination, team spirit and long-lasting friendships develop.§We are looking for applicants with strong leadership and communication skills, high standards, a passion for Rugby, and those who share our values both on and off the field.§SENIOR SQUAD – HEAD COACH§We are seeking a suitably qualified and experienced Head Coach who can demonstrate a clear, communicable and structured plan to:§Commit to a 3-year term;§Take ownership of the Senior Squad across all areas;§Appoint the Seniors Assistant Coaching and Management Team;§Shape and implement a Rugby philosophy that can be consistently applied by all teams across the Senior Squad in pursuit of clearly defined competitive objectives;§Plan the coaching program for pre-season and in-season training to support the development of player skills at all levels of experience, providing for challenging, active and effective coaching sessions for the entire player base;§Support and direct the execution of the coaching program by the assistant coaching team at training sessions;§Evaluate match performances and training sessions with the assistant coaching team and players, evolve the coaching program and, where necessary, initiate and execute strategic recruitment;§Build and embed a process to identify and develop playing talent and regularly deliver clear, honest feedback to individual players on how they can improve;§Work closely and effectively with the Committee and Club Management as and when required.§To Apply:§Please submit your detailed application to: §secretary@eaglesrugby.com.au§ [link removed]§We will endeavour to respond to all applications.§SENIOR SQUAD – ASSISTANT COACHES & TEAM MANAGERS§With the understanding that a new Head Coach will be responsible for building their support team, we are calling for Expressions of Interest for the following positions within the SENIOR SQUAD for the 2021 season:§Assistant Coaches§Team Managers§To Apply:§Please submit your Expression of Interest, plus a general overview of your playing and/or coaching experience and qualifications to: §secretary@eaglesrugby.com.au§ [link removed]§We will endeavour to respond to all applications.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§Do you have a current Police Check (National Police Certificate) for employment?§§§

Attendant §      §        §          §Ongoing, full-time role§          §Based at Sydney Olympic Park§          §Salary from $49,492 + Superannuation + weekend penalty loading rates + annual leave loading§        §        §As Pool Attendant, you will be responsible for effective, safe supervision of all aquatic areas ensuring patron safety and efficient operation of the Aquatic Centre, as well as providing emergency incident response.§        §In addition, you will be acting in a front line position, which requires the delivery of high level customer service to assist in ensuring patrons comply with the Centre’s conditions of use and entry requirements.§        §For more information, please click §here§ to access the role description.§        §About you§        §To be successful in this role you will have:§        §          §A current approved NSW First Aid Qualification;§          §Experience in an aquatic environment;§          §A Pool Lifeguard Qualification recognised in NSW;§          §Effective interpersonal, communication and customer service skills for dealing directly with members of the public;§          §Awareness of WHS requirements and risk, particularly in an aquatic environment.§        §        §If successful, you must commit to maintaining, on an on-going basis, all pre-requisite qualifications.§        § §        §About DPIE§        §In July 2019,  government agencies merged together to form what is now known as the Department of Planning§,§ Industry and Environment, with the vision of creating thriving environments, communities and economies for the people of New South Wales.§        §We focus on some of the biggest issues facing our state. We deliver sustainable water resource and environment management, secure our energy supply, oversee our planning system, maximise community benefit from government land and property, and create the conditions for a prosperous state. We strive to be a high-performing, world-class public service organisation that celebrates and reflects the full diversity of the community we serve and seeks to embed Aboriginal cultural awareness and knowledge throughout the department.§        §About SOPA and the Aquatic Centre§        §Sydney Olympic Park Authority are custodians of the Park, with a strong commitment to creating a vibrant, sustainable community within an unequalled destination for sport, entertainment, recreation and business and one of Australia's largest and most diverse urban parklands.§        §The Aquatic Centre was the venue of swimming, diving, water polo and synchronised swimming competition during the Sydney 2000 Olympic and Paralympic Games, and today continues to host international, national, state and community competitions, making it one of the busiest sporting venues in Sydney. The venue boasts a variety of pools, hosting swimming lessons, lane swimming sessions and a diving springboard and platform area.§        §More information about the Sydney Olympic Park Aquatic Centre can be found at §www.aquaticcentre.com.au§        §If you are interested in joining one of Sydney’s premier sporting venues, get in touch today!§        § §        §Applying for the role §        §Apply by submitting a current resume and brief cover letter which outlines your skills and experience relevant to the role.§        §If you would like to hear more about this opportunity please contact Joachim Bardrum on §02 9714 7544§        §Closing Date: § 21st October 2020 at 11:55 PM AEST§        §A recruitment pool may be created for ongoing and temporary roles of the same role or role type that may become available for filling over the next eighteen months.§        §Our commitment to Diversity§        §The Planning, Industry and Environment Cluster strives to be an inclusive workplace for all people. We recognise that we operate in a diverse community and welcome and encourage applications from all ages and genders, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, culturally and linguistically diverse groups, the LGBTIQ+ community, veterans, refugees and people with disability.§        § §Our commitment to flexible working§        §The Department of Planning, Industry & Environment is committed to ensuring the sector reflects the NSW community it serves. We support an inclusive workplace where staff have access to opportunities and resources at all levels, enabling our team members to drive innovation, productivity and delivery of high-quality services. We are open to discussing flexible working arrangements and encourage our people to explore new ways of working - including part-time, job-share or working from different locations. Everyone can ask about it.§        §If you are viewing this advertisement on LinkedIn, please click ‘Apply’ to access more information about this role via the I Work for NSW website.§        § §        § §        § §      §    §  §§§Ongoing, full-time role§Based at Sydney Olympic Park§Salary from $49,492 + Superannuation + weekend penalty loading rates + annual leave loading§§As Pool Attendant, you will be responsible for effective, safe supervision of all aquatic areas ensuring patron safety and efficient operation of the Aquatic Centre, as well as providing emergency incident response.§In addition, you will be acting in a front line position, which requires the delivery of high level customer service to assist in ensuring patrons comply with the Centre’s conditions of use and entry requirements.§For more information, please click §here§ to access the role description.§About you§To be successful in this role you will have:§§A current approved NSW First Aid Qualification;§Experience in an aquatic environment;§A Pool Lifeguard Qualification recognised in NSW;§Effective interpersonal, communication and customer service skills for dealing directly with members of the public;§Awareness of WHS requirements and risk, particularly in an aquatic environment.§§If successful, you must commit to maintaining, on an on-going basis, all pre-requisite qualifications.§ §About DPIE§In July 2019,  government agencies merged together to form what is now known as the Department of Planning§,§ Industry and Environment, with the vision of creating thriving environments, communities and economies for the people of New South Wales.§We focus on some of the biggest issues facing our state. The venue boasts a variety of pools, hosting swimming lessons, lane swimming sessions and a diving springboard and platform area.§More information about the Sydney Olympic Park Aquatic Centre can be found at §www.aquaticcentre.com.au§If you are interested in joining one of Sydney’s premier sporting venues, get in touch today!§ §Applying for the role §Apply by submitting a current resume and brief cover letter which outlines your skills and experience relevant to the role.§If you would like to hear more about this opportunity please contact Joachim Bardrum on §02 9714 7544§§Closing Date: § 21st October 2020 at 11:55 PM AEST§A recruitment pool may be created for ongoing and temporary roles of the same role or role type that may become available for filling over the next eighteen months.§§Our commitment to Diversity§§The Planning, Industry and Environment Cluster strives to be an inclusive workplace for all people. jobText: TXT/50702922.txt	§Personal Trainer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Personal Trainer§§Advertiser: §The Bar Health and Fitness§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Toowoomba & Darling Downs§§Salary§§$50,000 - $54,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§We're looking for a Personal Trainer to join our team at The Bar. We help people change their lives through fitness, and have been now for almost 6 years. §The Bar is a Functional Training Gym, focusing on fitness, transformations and performance.§ §We're looking for a Personal Trainer with good people skills, energy and someone that would love to make a career in the Fitness Industry. § §This is a rare position - most gyms are after Rent Based PT's - at The Bar, there is no rent. We have you work with an existing client base, and you'll be helping new clients with finding their feet, getting great results, and training long term. §This is a Full Time Position for the right applicant - with an existing client base and an immediate start preferred. §If you have an existing client base at another location/facility, we even have a fantastic incentive program for you to bring and train your clients at The Bar. §The Position Involves: §> Working One on One and in Small Groups with Personal Training Clients delivering sessions§> Delivering Functional Group Training Sessions in larger groups (training is provided for these)§> Creating Personalised Training Programs for clients to help them get amazing results§> Tracking and Measuring Progress, keeping clients motivated and helping them develop great habits§ § §Here's the kind of person we need: § §- Someone who has a drive and passion for helping people, and has good people skills§ §- Someone who is organised, has a great personality and loves working with people§ §- Someone who wants is eager to learn, but confident in helping people§ §- Someone who knows they want to help people, and would love to have a career as part of a team that is working to Transform Toowoomba§ §- Attitude is more important than aptitude, so all experience levels will be considered§ §You will need: § §- Minimum Certificate IV in Fitness§ §- Your own transportation§ §- Current First Aid and CPR§ §If this sounds like you§, please apply with a brief Cover Letter telling us a little about yourself and why you'd be a good fit for the role, and your Resume. We are looking for someone for an immediate start where possible.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as a personal trainer?§Have you completed a qualification in fitness?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§§§

jobTitle: Personal Trainer Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50686343.txt	§Personal Trainer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Personal Trainer§§Advertiser: §Evolve Health and Movement§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§$30 - $39.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§About Us§Evolve is a fresh, bright, and inclusive health and fitness clinic in Bulimba, offering allied health services, personal training and group fitness programs. Our mission is to change the gym experience and make it a joy, not a chore.§We believe that by empowering people to take charge of their health and fitness we can make a real difference to their lives. It’s about progress, not perfection – a sustainable, client-centred, evidence-based approach that will supercharge their wellbeing throughout their lives.§We help our clients reach their health and fitness goals in a fun and friendly environment, and pride ourselves on creating a safe, positive and welcoming space for clients of all backgrounds, ages, and levels of exercise experience.§We believe §every§ human body is truly amazing, and everyone deserves the opportunity to seek out optimal health, fitness and wellbeing.§ §About You§We are looking to recruit incredible people, based on personality and culture fit over qualifications and experience. §Maybe you’re seeking your first role in a practice, or are unfulfilled in your current role?§You’re fun, friendly and down-to-Earth, work well with individuals and small groups, and form natural connections with your clients. You’re someone who is constantly looking for opportunities to grow, develop and perform beyond expectations.§You will need a strong understanding of fitness and a passion for motivating and helping people improve, rehabilitate and strengthen their functional movement. §Ultimately, you’ll enhance member experience by driving clients to improve their lives and reach their goals, through delivery of 1:1 personal training and small group classes. § §The Role§This is a part-time contractor role, with a view to progressing to full-time hours in the future. Business opportunities may be available for the right candidate. Early morning, evening and Saturday morning availability is required.§ §Key Responsibilities§ §Deliver high quality group training classes to Evolve clients;§Run innovative and creative personal training sessions;§Manage client memberships and group booking system;§Clean and maintain the Evolve environment;§Liaise with GPs, allied health professionals and the Evolve team to ensure optimal outcomes for clients.§ §Key Attributes§ §Flexibility in rostering hours;§Ready to grow with Evolve;§High level communication skills;§Enthusiastic and supportive attitude towards clients;§Proven personal training experience (desired but not essential);§Ability to develop strong relationships with clients and business partners;§Self-motivated, reliable and goal oriented;§Excellent attention to detail;§Common sense attitude to problem solving;§Ability to undertake business processes.§ §Qualifications§§           §§Cert III & IV in Fitness;§Own Insurance;§Current First Aid Certificate;§ABN;§Appropriate visa and the right to work unrestricted in Australia.§ §Are you our newest personal trainer? Send us an email, including a resume and short cover letter explaining why you’re right for the role, to daniel.cooper@evolvehealthandmovement.com.au§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Have you completed a qualification in fitness?§Do you own or have regular access to a car?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§§§

The role will initially involve significant organisation and set ups throughout all areas of the club with the support of board members.§  § The successful applicant will:§ § §Have extraordinary organisation, office and management skills§ §Have an attitude for success throughout all areas of the club across all age groups§ §Have exceptional social media and website experience and knowledge§ Sports Club operations§ §Point of contact for all areas of the club including for AFLQ, Local/State and Federal Governments, members and guests§ §Successfully management of game day operations§ §Build required areas§ §Support and complete grant applications for all areas of the club and clubhouse with the grants committee§ §Grow the business of the club through internal and external events and functions§ §Development of strong relationships with the community and other sporting groups§ §Co-ordinate, purchasing and support of bar, kitchen and canteen operations§ §Oversee banking, reconciliation, invoices, budgets and petty cash management§ §Support and improve club sponsorship§ §Co-ordinate club maintenance§ §Oversee registrations and transfers§ §Reviewing and recognising areas of improvements organisationally and financially§ §Overseeing additional staff including cleaners and maintenance§ § This role has potential for growth as the role develops and the club moves The hours of the role can be varied to suit the successful applicant should the need arise and hours per week can be negotiated with commencement of 30 hours per week.§  § We look forward to receiving applications through Seek and meeting our newest team member.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§§§

It is in everything we do. From delivering a premium service to our operators, to creating an entertaining experience for the end user; we are unwavering in our mission to create the worlds’ leading sports betting experience.§ § § §We are looking for highly motivated individual to join our Sydney team in helping to grow our live betting offer. jobText: TXT/50674017.txt	§Aquatics Duty Manager (Maitland Aquatic Centres)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Aquatics Duty Manager (Maitland Aquatic Centres)§§Advertiser: §Maitland City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Newcastle, Maitland & Hunter§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Aquatics Duty Manager (Maitland Aquatic Centres) §      §Keep our patrons safe §      §        §Maitland City Council's aquatic centres play an integral role in the LGA’s leisure and recreation service offering with over 185,000 visits to Council's centres each year. With two centres located in Maitland and East Maitland, the facilities offer a combination of indoor and outdoor pools, an aquatic playground and children wading pools, viewing grandstands and park areas, making the centres a popular leisure, play, education and fitness destination for the region.§        §About the role§        §We are currently looking for an experienced Aquatics Duty Manager to join our team. As Duty Manager (Maitland Aquatic Centres), you will be responsible for the day to day oversight of pool lifeguarding operations to ensure the proper coverage and supervision of the pool and pool area by Lifeguards on duty, ensuring a high standard of customer service and professional pool lifeguarding and safety for all patrons,§        §You will be confident in daily water quality management, lifeguard supervision, pro-active risk management and dealing with emergency situations, in addition to performing rescue and first aid procedures where required. You will work closely with the Aquatics leadership team to ensure the centres are kept to a high standard including plant management support, centre hygiene and cleanliness as well as maintaining a daily diary/running sheet of pool operations.§        §About you§        §You will hold a Certificate III in Aquatics and Community Recreation (or equivalent) or Aquatic Technical Operator, as well as any necessary lifeguard qualifications/certifications. Further, you will have demonstrated experience in a similar role providing supervision and learnings to other lifeguard and aquatics staff, available to work across a 7 day roster all year round, whilst bringing a positive attitude to work each day.  This is an excellent opportunity for a motivated individual to become part of our energetic team.§        §Benefits §        §This is a permanent full-time role working 38 hours per week across a 7 day roster period (Monday to Sunday and including public holidays) with a base salary range for this role being $61,024 up to $67,737 per annum based on demonstrated competencies + super. §        § Council also offers a range of other benefits for its employees, including:§        §          §Flexible work options§          §Ongoing training and development§          §Fitness Passport§          §Paid parental leave§          §Healthy Employee Program§          §Long service leave after 5 years§        §        §Questions?§        §If after reading the role charter you have further questions, please contact Suellen Goyne, Coordinator Aquatic Centres, on §02 4934 9807§ for further information.§        §Applications close: §Sunday 18 October 2020§        §Please note, prior to an offer of employment being made, recommended candidates will be required to undertake a medical assessment (including drug and alcohol testing). Council also completes a range of other pre-employment checks which may include reference checks, employment history checks (past 5 years), psychometric testing and criminal history check. For more information about the recruitment process, visit our website and search ‘work with us’.§        §Maitland City Council has deemed this position to be child-related. To apply for this position you must be issued with a Working with Children clearance number by the Office of the Children’s Guardian. A person that does not have a Working with Children Check and/or deemed barred from the Office of the Children’s Guardian are ineligible to apply.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Maitland City Council's aquatic centres play an integral role in the LGA’s leisure and recreation service offering with over 185,000 visits to Council's centres each year. With two centres located in Maitland and East Maitland, the facilities offer a combination of indoor and outdoor pools, an aquatic playground and children wading pools, viewing grandstands and park areas, making the centres a popular leisure, play, education and fitness destination for the region.§ §About the role§ §We are currently looking for an experienced Aquatics Duty Manager to join our team. As Duty Manager (Maitland Aquatic Centres), you will be responsible for the day to day oversight of pool lifeguarding operations to ensure the proper coverage and supervision of the pool and pool area by Lifeguards on duty, ensuring a high standard of customer service and professional pool lifeguarding and safety for all patrons,§ §You will be confident in daily water quality management, lifeguard supervision, pro-active risk management and dealing with emergency situations, in addition to performing rescue and first aid procedures where required. You will work closely with the Aquatics leadership team to ensure the centres are kept to a high standard including plant management support, centre hygiene and cleanliness as well as maintaining a daily diary/running sheet of pool operations.§ §About you§ §You will hold a Certificate III in Aquatics and Community Recreation (or equivalent) or Aquatic Technical Operator, as well as any necessary lifeguard qualifications/certifications. Further, you will have demonstrated experience in a similar role providing supervision and learnings to other lifeguard and aquatics staff, available to work across a 7 day roster all year round, whilst bringing a positive attitude to work each day.  This is an excellent opportunity for a motivated individual to become part of our energetic team.§ §Benefits § §This is a permanent full-time role working 38 hours per week across a 7 day roster period (Monday to Sunday and including public holidays) with a base salary range for this role being $61,024 up to $67,737 per annum based on demonstrated competencies + super. § § Council also offers a range of other benefits for its employees, including:§ § §Flexible work options§ §Ongoing training and development§ §Fitness Passport§ §Paid parental leave§ §Healthy Employee Program§ §Long service leave after 5 years§ §Questions?§ §If after reading the role charter you have further questions, please contact Suellen Goyne, Coordinator Aquatic Centres, on §02 4934 9807§ for further information.§ §Applications close: §Sunday 18 October 2020§ §Please note, prior to an offer of employment being made, recommended candidates will be required to undertake a medical assessment (including drug and alcohol testing). Council also completes a range of other pre-employment checks which may include reference checks, employment history checks (past 5 years), psychometric testing and criminal history check. jobTitle: Assistant Venue Manager Job in Perth - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50676116.txt	§Assistant Venue Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Assistant Venue Manager§§Advertiser: §Lumber Punks§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§§About the business§ § §Lumber Punks Axe Throwing is more than an activity, its a movement. We bring the Punk ethos to everything we do and make sure every guest who visits us leaves knowing why Lumber Punks are the best Axe Throwing Venues in Australia. What started as a group of friends throwing axes together for fun has transformed into a rapidly growing and exciting business captivating new throwers everyday.§ §With a focus on culture, teamwork and individuality we remain grassroots in terms of our environment and the way we interact with each other and our guests.§ §Always seeking out the extrovert, challenging the boring status quo, pushing boundaries and striving to spread our passion  for throwing axes therefore building the Axe Throwing community in Australia.§ § §About the role§ § §An exciting opportunity exists for a hard working, highly motivated and proactive Assistant Venue Manager to join the Lumberpunks team in Perth. As the Assistant Venue Manager you will be responsible to cover and work side by side with the Venue Manager to manage the needs of the Venue and Staff, you will have the opportunity and support to develop and grow the business to meet our unique Punk ethos. Availability day, night and weekends essential. Full training provided. You will be required to;§ §Demonstrate an understanding of running a venue§Be able to demonstrate proven success in small team management skills§Engage with external agencies and stakeholders for stock replenishment and venue repair§Ability to promote and grow the brand name by monitoring and engaging local area opportunities§Provide safety instruction to all guests and ensure equipment is in working condition prior to throwing sessions§Welcome guests with an enthusiastic, authentic greeting, including check-in, waiver sign-in etc§Provide captivating axe throwing instruction at the beginning of each session§Coach by offering guidance throughout axe throwing sessions§Effectively manage interactive tournaments/games§Entertain, energize and engage your groups by reading people and communicating accordingly§Promote provided marketing and promotional initiatives and solicit referrals as needed§Demonstrate strong computer skills§ §Job Requirements§ §Can operate autonomously§Creative thinker in a fast-paced environment§Energetic, outgoing and entertaining individual§Professional and well-spoken in front of large or small groups§Highly safety conscious with a strong attention to detail§Loves to entertain, put on a show and can engage with our guests§Rostering§Excellent time management skills§Great attitude and likes to learn§Can quickly interpret customers needs and handle complaints§Is very comfortable managing a team and making strong decisions.§Desires an Extreme. Social. Fun! job that doesn't feel like a job§ §Physical Demands§ §While performing the duties of this position, you will regularly be required to:§ §Be friendly and able to smile frequently§Work days, nights, and/or weekends as required§Work in a noisy, fast paced environment with distracting conditions§Read and write handwritten notes§Walk or stand 100% of shift§ § §Benefits and perks§ § §You get to spend you're days/nights showing people how to throw axes and help manage a team of axe throwers!!!! Are you serious right now?§ § §Skills and experience§ § §No Axe Throwing experience necessary full training provided however the following would be advantageous§ §A background in Management and training §Strong communication skills§Previous experience in Hospitality (Advantageous)§First Aid certified§RSA or willing to obtain§Blue card or willing to obtain§Strong Microsoft Office and computer skills§Experience at Public Speaking§A strong sense of humour§The ability to read people and adjust demeanour depending on the situation§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a venue manager?§Which of the following First Aid accreditations do you currently hold?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§Do you have customer service experience?§§§
